这本书由 Internet Archive 提供。

This book made available by the Internet Archive.

对于 Fevronia 和 Amelia

For Fevronia and Amelia

序幕

Prologue

“你可以抵抗入侵的军队；你无法抵抗时机成熟的想法。”

"You can resist an invading army; you cannot resist an idea whose time has come."

维克多·雨果

Victor Hugo

另一个巨大的大厅——这次是在南加州郊区； 身穿西装、手持电话的年轻人的先头部队； 出售 T 恤和保险杠贴纸的摊位； 迟到的候选人； 愤怒的新闻公车 在许多方面，它类似于任何其他总统竞选集会。 区别在于人群。 如果设置是民主党或共和党的集会，人们就会试图绕过障碍，争论哪个地区委员会应该获得哪个席位。 这一次，尽管明显缺乏方向，但观众却出奇地自律。 他们从旅行车和宝马车里爬出来，成群结队地走向圆形剧场，就好像它是一座教堂，甚至可能是一艘迷人的宇宙飞船，偶尔会受到媒体成员的骚扰。 只有一个问题会产生回应。

Yet another cavernous hall—this time in the Southern Californian suburban sprawl; an advance guard of blazered young men with portable telephones; a stand selling T-shirts and bumper stickers; a late candidate; an angry press bus. In many ways it resembles any other rally on the presidential campaign. The difference is the crowd. If the setting had been a Democratic or Republican rally, people would have been trying to squeeze around barriers, arguing about which regional committee deserved which seats. This time, despite a conspicuous lack of direction, the audience is eerily disciplined. They clamber out of their station wagons and BMWs, and troop toward the amphitheater as if it is a church or perhaps even a bewitching spacecraft, occasionally harassed by members of the media. Only one question produces a response.

“罗斯·佩罗不就是另一个政客吗？”

"Isn't Ross Perot just another politician?"

被问到的人是一位高个子秃顶的爱荷华州人，后来成为加利福尼亚人，是一家国防公司的主管，他非常生气，以至于他转过身来，不小心扯到了他儿子的手臂。 “你不明白，做

The man questioned—a tall balding Iowan-turned-Californian who is a supervisor at a defense company—is so angry that he spins around, accidentally yanking his son's arm. "You don't get it, do

序幕

PROLOGUE

你？”他问道。然后他笑得更自信了。“先生。 佩罗是一名经理。 他知道如何做事。”

you?" he asks. Then he smiles more confidently. "Mr. Perot is a manager. He knows how to do things."

加利福尼亚州长滩，1992 年

Long Beach, California, 1992

“只有偏执狂才能生存。”

"Only the paranoid survive."

Andy Grove，英特尔首席执行官

Andy Grove, chief executive officer, Intel

1993 年，大公司平均使用 25 种最常用的管理工具中的 12 种； 1994年他们使用了13个； 他们期望在 1995 年使用 14 种工具。72% 的管理者认为，使用正确工具的公司更有可能取得成功； 70% 的受访者表示，这些工具的承诺多于交付。

The average big company used 12 of the 25 most common management tools in 1993; in 1994 they used 13; they expect to use 14 tools in 1995. Seventy-two percent of managers believe that companies who use the right tools are more likely to succeed; 70 percent say that the tools promise more than they deliver.

贝恩公司对全球787家公司的调查，

A survey of 787 companies around the world by Bain & Company,

1995年4月

April 1995

“大师？你在这里或那里找到了一颗宝石。但大部分都是相当明显的，你知道的。你去 Doubleday 的商业部分，你会看到所有这些精彩的标题，你花了 300 美元，然后你把它们都扔掉了。”

"Guru? You find a gem here or there. But most of it's fairly obvious, you know. You go to Doubleday's business section and you see all these wonderful titles and you spend $300 and then you throw them all away."

鲁珀特·默多克 (Rupert Murdoch)，关于是否有任何他追随或钦佩的管理大师而被灰烬，1996 年 3 月

Rupert Murdoch, on being ashed whether there was any management guru he followed or admired, March 1996

“这些大胆的新想法使商界人士超越再造、超越全面质量管理、超越赋权，甚至超越变革，并朝着重塑和革命的方向前进。在提出企业运作方式的全新观点时，

"These bold new ideas vault business people beyond reengineering, beyond total quality management, beyond empowerment, and even beyond change and toward nothing less than reinvention and revolution In presenting a radical new view of how businesses can work,

彼得斯提出了以下挑战：“如果你在阅读的前 30 分钟内没有感到愤怒，如果你在第一个小时内没有至少一次把这本书扔在地上，如果你没有在两个小时后，我和这本书让你彻底失望了。’”

Peters offers the following challenge: 'If you're not irate in the first thirty minutes of reading, if you don't throw this book down at least once in the first hour, and if you don't reach for the Maalox by the two-hour mark, then I and this book have utterly failed you.'"

出版商的宣传语，汤姆彼得斯研讨会：疯狂时代呼吁

Publisher's blurb, The Tom Peters Seminar: Crazy Times Call for

疯狂的组织（1994）。 对于外行来说，这就是这本书

Crazy Organizations (1994). For the uninitiated, this is the book

彼得斯在封面上穿着他的平角短裤。

with Peters wearing his boxer shorts on the cover.

“中国最需要管理者。”

"China needs managers more than anything else."

中欧国际入学候选人

Candidate for admission at China Europe International

上海商学院。 学校录取64

Business School, Shanghai. The school admits 64

学生每年。 它有 4,000 名申请者。

students annually. It gets 4,000 applicants.

八

Vlll

序幕

Prologue

“新的权威将是：成员领导、官员驱动、以客户为中心；一个整体大于部分之和的团队环境；一个扁平化的管理结构，员工和经理得到充分授权，决策权下放给客户；学习而不是责备的文化；明确的方向感和目的。坚定地致力于通过直接提供和有效的伙伴关系相结合来提供高质量的公共服务。”

"The new authority will be: Member led, Officer driven, Customer focused; a team environment where the whole is greater than the sum of its parts; a flat management structure where employees and managers are fully empowered and decisions are devolved close to the customer; a culture of learning rather than blame; a clear sense of direction and purpose. A firm commitment to delivering high-quality public services through a combination of direct-provision and effective partnerships."

招聘广告，巴斯和东北

Recruitment advertisement, Bath and North East

萨默塞特区议会。 引用在“Birtspeak”一

Somerset District Council. Quoted in "Birtspeak," a

Private Eye 中的专栏专门讨论“管理胡言乱语”

olumn in Private Eye devoted to "management drivel

在所有领域，”1995 年 9 月 22 日

in all spheres," September 22,1995

“员工将有四种主要反应：否认、悲伤、愤怒、退缩。一定要承认并承认员工的感受。但是，您可能需要重申信息以确保员工知道决定是最终决定并且已经做出“在最高级别。如果您预计会有强烈反应，请通知您的人力资源专家。如有必要，他/她会提醒安全和医疗部门。”

"Employees will have four primary reactions: Denial, Sadness, Anger, Withdrawal. Be certain to recognize and acknowledge the employee's feelings. However, you may need to restate the message to ensure that the employee knows that the decision is final and has been made at the highest level. Notify your Human Resources Gen-eralist if you anticipate strong reactions. If necessary, he/she will alert Security and Medical."

《沟通指南，经理与员工会面》

"Communication Guidelines, Manager Meeting with Employees

未被新组织选中，”大通曼哈顿银行，

Not Selected for the New Organization," Chase Manhattan Bank,

与 Chemical Bank 合并后创造了 10,000 个工作岗位

following merger with Chemical Bank that resulted in 10,000 job

损失。 Chase 的所有董事都保住了工作，他们提到

losses. Chase's directors, all of whom kept their jobs, referred to

工作被删除为“保存”。

the jobs eliminated as "saves."

管理咨询业务在 1994 年产生了价值 114 亿美元的费用； 它有望在 1999 年带来 210 亿美元的收入。在最大的战略咨询公司麦肯锡，每个合伙人的收入为 468,000 美元。 当今领先的咨询公司有一半以上在五年前还不存在，而在五十年前仅存在 1%。

The management consultancy business generated $11.4 billion worth of fees in 1994; it is on course to bring in $21 billion in 1999. At McKinsey, the biggest strategic consultancy, each partner accounted for $468,000 of revenues. More than half of today's leading consulting firms did not exist five years ago, and only 1 percent existed fifty years ago.

Gartner 集团，国际管理顾问

The Gartner Group, Management Consultant International

即使在一个充满惊喜和无意讽刺的城市，广告牌的出现也令人震惊。 在那里，被熟悉的真主党黄色旗帜和布满麻点的机关枪包围着

Even in a city full of surprises and unintentional ironies, the billboard came as something of a shock. There, surrounded by the familiar yellow flags of the Hezbollah and the pockmarked machine-gunned

序幕

PROLOGUE

建筑物中，竖立着巨大的广告，号召贝鲁特的忠实信徒参加“全面质量管理”研讨会。

buildings, stood a huge advertisement summoning the faithful of Beirut to a "Total Quality Management" seminar.

我们的司机看到了我们的兴趣。

Our driver saw our interest.

“哦，是的，管理层。未来。但只有在我们摆脱这些叙利亚猪之后。”

"Oh yes, management. The future. But only once we get rid of these Syrian pigs."

黎巴嫩，1995 年 1 月

Lebanon, January 1995

“你知道你关于管理理论的书让我担心的是什么：你将与所有人交谈并阅读所有书籍；你将详细说明它所有令人难以置信的影响——失去的工作岗位数量、花费的数十亿美元，以及等等。而且你不会说明显的话：99% 都是胡说八道。每个人都知道这一点。”

"You know what worries me about your book about management theory: that you'll talk to all the people and read all the books; that you will detail all its incredible effects—the number of jobs lost, the billions of dollars spent, and so on. And you won't say the obvious thing: that it's 99 percent bullshit. And everybody knows that."

《经济学人》高级编辑，1995 年夏季

Senior editor, The Economist, Summer 1995

致谢

Acknowledgments

管理理论中有两个同样不光彩的悠久传统。 首先，书籍必须附有足够长的致谢名单，足以在任何其他类型的书中构成一章：每次会议的每个人、每个研究生、每个公司公共关系经理都以某种方式向作者提供了宝贵的见解. 第二个传统是不提任何人，因此大概是在重申等待读者的伟大思想只属于作者的信息。 接下来是一些妥协。

There are two long, equally inglorious traditions in management theory. The first is that books must come complete with a list of acknowledgments long enough to make a chapter in any other sort of book: every person at every conference, every research student, every corporate public relations manager has somehow delivered a valuable insight to the writer. The second tradition is to mention nobody, thereby presumably reiterating the message that the great ideas that await the reader are the author's alone. What follows is something of a compromise.

我们首先要感谢《经济学人》给我们时间来撰写《巫医》，并允许我们使用我们为其撰写的文章。 我们特别感谢《经济学人》主编 Bill Emmott 和商业事务主编 Peter David 的宽容和支持。 包括 Nick Wiseman、Barbara Beck、Matthew Bishop、Victor Earl、Carol Mawer 和 Nick Valery 在内的一小群同事友善地同意阅读本书的全部或部分内容； Victor 在检查事实方面特别有帮助，而 Carol 在阅读校样方面特别有帮助。 我们也感谢 Jenny Geddes 的宝贵帮助，感谢 Gideon Rachman 在最黑暗的时刻给予我们鼓励。

Our primary thanks go to The Economist for giving us the time to write The Witch Doctors and also for giving us permission to use articles that we have written for it. In particular, we thank Bill Emmott, the editor of The Economist, and Peter David, the business affairs editor, for their tolerance and support. A small squadron of colleagues that included Nick Wiseman, Barbara Beck, Matthew Bishop, Victor Earl, Carol Mawer, and Nick Valery kindly agreed to read all or parts of this book; Victor was particularly helpful in checking facts and Carol in reading proofs. We are also grateful to Jenny Geddes for her invaluable help and to Gideon Rachman for acting as a source of encouragement in the darkest hours.

三位非《经济学人》读者在本书准备过程中非常友好地提出了他们的评论：Partha Bose、Joel

Three non-Economist readers were kind enough to offer their comments when the book was in preparation: Partha Bose, Joel

致谢

ACKNOWLEDGMENTS

库兹曼和艾伦坎特罗。 他们都为我们在《巫医》中声称的相同“既得利益”而工作，使管理理论成为一种非自我批评的事业。 也许是为了证明我们错了，他们是非常客观的批评者，经常敦促我们更加严厉。

Kurtzman, and Alan Kantrow. They all work for the same "vested interests" that we claim in The Witch Doctors make management theory such an un-self-critical business. Perhaps seeking to prove us wrong, they were remarkably objective critics, often urging us to be harsher.

在写这本书时，我们首先得到了 Allegra Huston 的帮助，她说服了我们——也许是错误的——这不是一个疯狂的项目。 我们非常幸运有 Gillon Aitken 和 Andrew Wylie 作为我们的经纪人：我们非常感谢他们。 当我们最终聘请了两位出色的编辑时，我们的好运还在继续：Times Books 的 Peter Smith 和 Heinemann 的 Tom Weldon。 他们不仅帮助我们澄清了困惑并消除了废话，而且设法给我们留下这样的印象，即我们首先提出了改进。

When it came to writing the book, we were helped in the first instance by Allegra Huston, who convinced us—perhaps wrongly—that it was not an insane project. We have been enormously lucky to have Gillon Aitken and Andrew Wylie as our agents: we are extremely grateful to both. Our good fortune continued when we ended up with two excellent editors: Peter Smith at Times Books and Tom Weldon at Heinemann. They have not only helped us clarify confusions and cut out nonsense but also contrived to leave us with the impression that we had come up with the improvements in the first place.

最后，我们感谢我们的家人，尤其是我们的妻子 Fevronia 和 Amelia。 新婚之日，从他们身上逼出的各种承诺，却只字未提管理理论。 仅就那次可怕的背叛而言，这本书就是献给他们的。

Finally, we thank our families, particularly our wives, Fevronia and Amelia. Among the various promises extracted from them on their wedding days, there was no mention of management theory. For that hideous betrayal alone, this book is dedicated to them.

作者注

Authors' Note

本书中的某些段落以不同的形式出现在作者为《经济学人》撰写的文章中。 经经济学人报业有限公司许可转载。

Some passages in this book have appeared in different form in articles the authors have written for The Economist. They are reprinted by kind permission of the Economist Newspaper Ltd.

商业的一个问题是大多数既定词汇都是男性（从“商人”向上）。 这不再适合许多公司中女性人数多于男性的世界。 我们很清楚它引起的刺激。 但是，大多数男女皆宜的替代品，例如“商人”罐； 并且在每次提到“他”和“他的”时都必须添加“或她”和“或她的”可以使句子成为障碍课程。 大多数情况下，我们都试图逃避这个问题。 在面临选择时，我们通常会选择男性版本。 无意冒犯。

One problem with business is that most of the established vocabulary is male (from "businessman" upward). This no longer suits a world in which women outnumber men in many companies. We are well aware of the irritation it causes. However, most of the unisex alternatives, such as "businessperson," jar; and having to add "or she" and "or hers" at every mention of "he" and "his" can make a sentence into an obstacle course. For the most part, we have tried to run away from this problem. When confronted with a choice, we have often opted for the male version. No offense is intended.

许

xu

巫医

THE WITCH DOCTORS

简介：未被承认的立法者

Introduction: The Unacknowledged Legislators

雪莱曾声称诗人是“人类未被承认的立法者”。 今天，这一荣誉属于管理理论家。 德鲁克和彼得斯等名字可能与华兹华斯或济慈不同； 然而，无论在哪里，管理理论家都在制定法律、重塑机构、重塑语言，最重要的是，在重组人们的生活。 事实上，在最极端的边缘，管理理论与自助行业融合在一起，大师们实际上是在整理人们的思想，教他们如何思考从整理办公桌到重新评估爱情生活的一切事情。 1994 年底，戴安娜王妃向安东尼·罗宾斯寻求帮助的消息曝光，安东尼·罗宾斯是一位商业动机大师，他鼓励他的客户通过行走在炽热的煤块上来“释放内在的力量”， 几乎没有在舰队街引起一丝惊奇。在大西洋的另一边，众议院当选议长纽特·金里奇（Newt Gingrich）正在“通过阅读彼得·德鲁克”为他的新工作做准备的消息同时传来，人们如释重负。 在大西洋的另一边，众议院当选议长纽特·金里奇（Newt Gingrich）正在“通过阅读彼得·德鲁克”为他的新工作做准备的消息同时传来，人们如释重负。

Shelley once claimed that poets are "the unacknowledged legislators of mankind." Today that honor belongs to management theorists. Names such as Drucker and Peters may not have the same ring as Wordsworth or Keats; yet, wherever one looks, management theorists are laying down the law, reshaping institutions, refashioning the language and, above all, reorganizing people's lives. Indeed, at its most extreme fringe, where management theory merges with the self-help industry, gurus are actually ordering people's minds, teaching them how to think about everything from organizing their desk to reassessing their love life. In late 1994 the revelation that Princess Diana had sought help from Anthony Robbins, a business-motivation guru who encourages his clients to "unleash the power within" by walking on red hot coals, caused barely a flicker of surprise in Fleet Street. On the other side of the Atlantic, the simultaneous news that Newt Gingrich, the Speaker-elect of the House of Representatives, was preparing for his new job "by reading Peter Drucker" was greeted with relief.

在公主和议长寻求管理理论的同时，数以百万计的普通人正在接受管理理论。 1979-95 年美国减少了约 4300 万个工作岗位（尽管创造了更多工作岗位）。 在家长式德国，“裁员”将失业率推高至

At the same time as the princess and the Speaker were seeking out management theory, millions of more mundane human beings were having it done unto them. Some 43 million jobs were eliminated in America in 1979-95 (though many more were created). In paternalist Germany, "downsizing" had pushed up unemployment to

介绍

INTRODUCTION

到 1996 年初达到 400 万——这是二战以来的最高水平。 在日本这个终生雇佣制的发源地，临时工和兼职工人现在占劳动力的四分之一，企业忠诚度正在崩溃。 在英国，就业部于 1994 年 12 月泄露的数据显示，自 1990 年以来，有 660 万男性（占男性劳动力的 44%）失业； 390 万女性——约占女性劳动力的三分之一——遭受了同样的命运。 1个

4 million by early 1996—the highest level since the Second World War. In Japan, the home of lifetime employment, temporary and part-time workers now account for one in four of the workforce, and corporate loyalty is crumbling. In Britain, figures from the Department of Employment, leaked in December 1994, showed that 6.6 million men—or 44 percent of the male workforce—had been unemployed at some time since 1990; 3.9 million women—or roughly a third of the female workforce—had suffered the same fate. 1

各地的蓝领工人都习惯于在困难时期被解雇。 如今，受害者往往是管理者； 一家公司不一定非要陷入严重的财务困境才能开始瘦身。 在 1995 年 4 月由总部位于伦敦的咨询公司华信惠悦 (Watson Wyatt) 进行的一项调查中，四分之三的美国公司承认在过去两年中进行了重组。

Blue-collar workers everywhere are used to being laid off when times get tough. Nowadays, the victims are often managers; and a company does not have to be in dire financial trouble to start slimming. Three-quarters of the American companies in a survey carried out in April 1995 by Watson Wyatt, a London-based consultancy, admitted to restructuring in the past two years.

在美国，事情在 1996 年初达到了顶点，当时 AT&T（前身是可爱的老 Ma Bell）宣布裁员 40,000 人。 公司不仅在公告发布时获得了可观的利润，而且其股价随后飙升（使其老板鲍勃·艾伦（Bob Allen）暴富约 500 万美元）。 人们开玩笑说，这家公司一直是管理时尚的狂热追随者，在过去十年中已经解雇了 70,000 人，但有一天，它的缩写将代表 Allen & Two Temps。 随着各种总统候选人攻击美国企业的贪婪，商业周刊的封面担心“美国的经济焦虑”。 2 《纽约时报》刊登了一个由七部分组成的系列文章，标题为“美国的裁员”。 3 “在美国企业界，解雇人一定是一种时尚，”《新闻周刊》抱怨道， 在标题为“企业杀手”的封面故事中，将老板工资上涨与工资缩减形成对比。 “你几乎可以闻到美国白领的恐惧和愤怒，因为在 CEO 领域似乎没有人关心。” 4个

In America, things came to a head in early 1996 when AT&T, formerly cuddly old Ma Bell, announced 40,000 redundancies. Not only was the company making healthy profits at the time of the announcement, but its share price soared afterward (enriching its boss, Bob Allen, by some $5 million). People joked that the abbreviation of the company, which had been a passionate follower of management fads and had already laid off 70,000 people over the past decade, would one day stand for Allen & Two Temps. As various presidential candidates attacked the greed of corporate America, Business Week's cover worried about "America's Economic Anxiety." 2 The New York Times ran a seven-part series titled "The Downsizing of America." 3 "Firing people has got to be trendy in corporate America," moaned Newsweek, in a cover story headlined "Corporate Killers" contrasting the rising salaries of bosses with their shortening payrolls. "You can practically smell the fear and anger in white-collar America because nobody in CEO-land seems to care." 4

从俄亥俄州到奥斯陆和大阪，许多在 1990 年代上半叶被解雇的人，包括 AT&T 的很多人，都被“重新设计”了他们的工作岗位。 尽管丑陋的名字——“裁员”、“外包”等——一直被用来掩饰公司的例行放血行为，但“业务流程再造”似乎在过去几年中名列前茅。 两位管理理论家 James Champy 和 Michael Hammer 于 1993 年出版的一本书 Reengineering the Corporation 中使用了这个名称来指代重组企业的方法

From Ohio to Oslo and Osaka, many of those laid off in the first half of the 1990s, including a good number of those at AT&T, were "reengineered" out of their jobs. Although ugly names—"downsizing," "outsourcing," and so on—have always been used to disguise routine corporate bloodletting, "business process reengineering" seems to have been at the top of the list in the past few years. The name was used in a book, Reengineering the Corporation, published in 1993 by two management theorists, James Champy and Michael Hammer, to refer to the method of reorganizing businesses around

介绍

Introduction

“流程”，例如销售，而不是行政部门，例如营销部门。 从那时起，再造的信条就传遍了世界各地。 在日本，野村证券研究所制定了一个衡量新闻报道中该词使用情况的指数，以衡量该国的变革意愿。 在英国，再造理论现在正被应用于国民健康服务体系。

"processes," such as selling, rather than administrative fiefs, such as marketing departments. Since then, the reengineering creed has spread far around the world. In Japan, Nomura's Research Institute keeps an index measuring the use of the word in news stories to chart the country's willingness to change. In Britain, reengineering theories are now being applied to the National Health Service.

迄今为止，《企业再造》已售出近 200 万册，詹姆斯·钱皮的《再造管理》（1995 年）和迈克尔·哈默的《再造革命》（1995 年）等各种乏善可陈的后续作品登上了《纽约时报》商业畅销书榜单. 再造运动催生了专家咨询、没完没了的会议、几十种“自己动手做”的录像带，以及无数商学院的课程。现在有迹象表明，再造修正主义者质疑再造理论实施起来有多容易，抱怨“企业厌食症”和“愚蠢化”，宣扬“成长”、“信任”和“忠诚”的美德。假以时日，毫无疑问会有再造再修正主义者重申这种信念。

So far, Reengineering the Corporation has sold almost two million copies, and various lackluster follow-ups, such as James Champy's Reengineering Management (1995) and Michael Hammer's The Reengineering Revolution (1995), have reached the New York Times business best-seller list. The reengineering movement has spawned specialist consultancies, endless conferences, dozens of "do-it-yourself videotapes, and countless courses at business schools. Now there are signs of a backlash—of reengineering revisionists questioning how easy the theory is to put into practice, complaining about "corporate anorexia" and "dumbsizing," and preaching the virtues of "growth," "trust," and "loyalty." In time, there will doubtless be reengineering re-revisionists reaffirming the faith.

一个行业诞生

An Industry Is Born

再造热潮只是本世纪管理大师令人眼花缭乱的力量的最新、最有力的例子。 尽管一些古物学家争辩说 Nicolo Machiavelli 是第一位管理思想家，而其他人认为这一荣誉属于组织建造金字塔的埃及人，但第一个公认的管理大师是 Frederick Taylor，他是基于秒表的“科学管理”之父。 在 1900 年代初期，他的书销量达数百万，而泰勒的咨询费是每天 35 美元——或今天的 630 美元。 泰勒的工人机器理论一直受到批评（例如，查理卓别林在“摩登时代”中对他们进行了令人难忘的讽刺），但这并没有阻止他们被许多领先的美国商人采用，包括亨利福特， 并在世界范围内传播。 从那以后，一大批管理思想家追随着泰勒的脚步。 第二次世界大战后，率先提出“全面质量管理”的爱德华兹·戴明被誉为继道格拉斯·麦克阿瑟将军之后在日本最受尊敬的美国人。

The reengineering craze is merely the latest, most potent example of the bewildering power of management gurus throughout this century. Although some antiquarians argue that Nicolo Machiavelli was the first management thinker and others that that honor belongs to whichever Egyptian organized the construction of the pyramids, the first recognizable management guru was Frederick Taylor, the father of stopwatch-based "scientific management." In the early 1900s his books sold in the millions, and Taylor's consultancy fees were $35 a day—or $630 in today's money. Taylor's worker-as-machine theories always had their critics (Charlie Chaplin, for example, lampooned them memorably in "Modern Times"), but that did not stop them from being adopted by many leading American businessmen, including Henry Ford, and from being spread around the world. Since then, a steady procession of management thinkers has followed in Taylor's path. After the Second World War, W. Edwards Deming, who pioneered "total-quality management," was dubbed the most revered American in Japan after General Douglas MacArthur.

介绍

INTRODUCTION

然而，在 1980 年代，随着整个富裕世界，尤其是美国，试图接受日本的崛起、计算机的普及和工作模式的根本变化，对管理理论的兴趣变得过高。 对于以汤姆·彼得斯为首的越来越信奉福音派的新一代管理理论家来说，随之而来的企业自我分析被证明是一笔财富。 1982 年夏天，彼得斯和麦肯锡的另一位顾问罗伯特·沃特曼 (Robert Waterman) 出版了《追求卓越》(In Search of Excellence)，该书大胆（而且正确地）告诉美国商人，他们的状况比他们想象的要好。 该书销量超过 500 万册，连续两年多位居纽约时报畅销书榜首，并使作者成为百万富翁。

However, interest in management theory went into overdrive in the 1980s as the rich world in general, and America in particular, tried to come to terms with the rise of Japan, the spread of computers, and radical changes in working patterns. For a new breed of increasingly evangelical management theorists, led by Tom Peters, the accompanying corporate self-analysis proved a bonanza. In the summer of 1982 Peters and another consultant from McKinsey, Robert Waterman, published In Search of Excellence, which boldly (and correctly) told American businessmen that they were in better shape than they thought. The book sold more than five million copies, staying at the top of the New York Times best-seller list for more than two years and turning its authors into millionaires.

自从追求卓越以来，大师行业蓬勃发展。 目前，仅美国每年就售出价值约 7.5 亿美元的商业书籍，而音像带、课程和研讨会的市场更大。 不仅再造等最新理论比它们的前辈得到更快、更热心的应用，而且提倡这些理论的人所积累的财富和地位也呈指数级增长。 彼得斯现在被其他大师效仿，他为为期一天的研讨会收取 60,000 美元的费用，并且每年举办大约 60 场此类会议。 他在报纸上发表的专栏文章涵盖了从个人卫生到禅宗等各种主题，并在世界各地发表。 很难见到只在一个大陆上有房子的大师。

Ever since In Search of Excellence, the guru industry has boomed. Some $750 million worth of business books are currently sold in America alone every year, and the market for audio-and videotapes, courses, and seminars is even bigger. Not only are the latest theories such as reengineering more rapidly and zealously applied than their predecessors, but the wealth and status accruing to those who promote them have increased exponentially. Peters, now much copied by other gurus, charges $60,000 for a day-long seminar and conducts about 60 such meetings a year. His newspaper column, in which he opines on subjects ranging from personal hygiene to Zen Buddhism, is syndicated around the world. It is rare to meet a guru who has houses on only one continent.

大师们本身只是一个更大的管理冰山中最明显的一角，这个冰山包括商学院、管理咨询公司和许多商业媒体。 很难想到任何其他学科已经像管理理论一样围绕自身建立了这样一个行业。 现在仅美国公司每年就花费 150 亿美元用于外部建议。 大师滋生地，如麦肯锡，在公司亏损的地方设有办事处。 在世界各地，自认为无所不知的高管们都被鼓励参加从积极主动到道德管理等各个方面的培训课程。 即使在自觉的、愤世嫉俗的英国， 大约 40 家公司提供基于冒险的管理培训课程，肥胖的商人银行家和秃头的债券交易员在这些课程中摇摆过河，并告诉他们的同事他们在篝火旁的真实想法。 5 每年有超过75,000名学生获得工商管理硕士学位

The gurus themselves are only the most visible tip of a much larger management iceberg, which incorporates business schools, management consultancies, and much of the business press. It is hard to think of any other academic discipline that has built such an industry around itself as management theory. American firms alone now spend $15 billion a year on outside advice. Guru breeding grounds, such as McKinsey, have offices wherever firms lose money. Around the world, executives who thought they knew it all are being encouraged to take training courses in everything from as-sertiveness to ethical management. Even in self-conscious, cynical Britain, some 40 companies provide adventure-based management training courses in which fat merchant bankers and balding bond traders swing across rivers and tell their colleagues what they really think about each other around camp fires. 5 Every year more that 75,000 students are awarded master of business administration

介绍

Introduction

美国的工商管理硕士 (MBA) 学位——是 1960 年总数的十五倍。全世界每年有四分之一百万人参加研究生管理入学考试 (GMAT) 以进入 MBA 课程。 商学院遍及东欧和亚洲新解放的经济体； 他们甚至到达了曾被视为古典教育最后遗迹的牛津和剑桥。

(MBA) degrees in America—fifteen times the total in 1960. And every year a quarter of a million people around the world take the Graduate Management Admissions Test (GMAT) for entrance to MBA courses. Business schools are spreading throughout the newly liberated economies of Eastern Europe and Asia; they have reached even Oxford and Cambridge, once regarded as the last preserves of classical education.

正如我们在本书中所解释的那样，管理理论比学术界的任何其他分支都更多地受到人类两种原始本能的推动：恐惧和贪婪。 通常是这两种情绪中的一种说服了奥黑尔机场的一位中层管理人员再拿起一本关于领导力的书，或者诱使俄亥俄州的一位首席执行官再花一百万美元购买咨询费。 然而，同样清楚的是，管理理论与直接或间接影响我们所有人的三场革命密切相关：公司的再造、职业的再造和政府的再造。

As we explain in this book, management theory, more than any other branch of academia, is propelled by two primal human instincts: fear and greed. It is usually one of these two emotions that persuades a middle manager at O'Hare Airport to pick up yet another book on leadership or tempts a chief executive in Ohio to blow yet another million dollars on consulting fees. However, it is also clear that management theory is bound up with three revolutions that directly or indirectly affect all of us: the reinvention of companies, the reinvention of careers, and the reinvention of government.

如今，世界各地的公司都在经历他们的前辈几乎无法想象的扭曲。 公司的流失率惊人——1970 年的美国 500 强公司中只有大约三分之一仍然存在。 即使是最好的公司，也害怕他们最终会陷入这个越来越拥挤的公司墓地，因此正在重组自己。 这不仅适用于 AT&T 这样的裁员者，也适用于电子数据系统 (EDS) 等快速发展的公司，这家计算机服务公司似乎沉迷于管理反思，尽管它几乎没有犯过错误自罗斯·佩罗 (Ross Perot) 于 1962 年以 1,000 美元创立它以来。

Nowadays, companies everywhere are going through contortions that their predecessors could scarcely have imagined. The attrition rate of companies is spectacular—only about a third of America's 500 leading companies from 1970 still exist today. Even the best companies, terrified that they will end up in this ever more crowded corporate graveyard, are reorganizing themselves. This not only applies to job-slashers such as AT&T but to fast-growing companies such as Electronic Data Systems (EDS), a computer-services firm that seems to be addicted to management rethinks despite the fact that it has barely put a foot wrong since Ross Perot founded it with $1,000 in 1962.

即使这种扭曲不是直接受到管理理论的启发，它们也往往会将管理者推回大师的怀抱。 管理理论毕竟是对商业的研究。 它不仅解释了这个或那个公司在做什么，而且还解释了整个公司集团在做什么，以及为什么这样做。 商人了解自己的行业而无需了解其他人的旧借口不再成立。 行业边界无处不在：商业银行、投资银行和经纪业务之间； 计算机硬件和软件供应商之间； 以及出版商、广播公司、电信公司和电影制片厂之间。 即使是最冷静的管理者也不得不接受诸如协同作用和联盟之类的想法——以及

Even when such contortions are not directly inspired by management theory, they tend to drive managers back into the gurus' arms. Management theory, after all, is the study of business. It explains not just what this or that firm is doing but what whole groups of firms are doing, and why. The old excuse that a business person knew his or her own industry and did not need to know about anybody else's no longer holds water. Industry borders are blurring everywhere: between commercial banking, investment banking, and brokerages; between computer hardware and software vendors; and between publishers, broadcasters, telecommunication companies, and film studios. Even the most hard-headed managers are having to come to grips with ideas like synergy and alliances—and the challenge of

介绍

INTRODUCTION

管理不同的、多元文化的组织。 所有这些路径都通向管理理论。

managing disparate, multicultural organizations. All these paths lead to management theory.

随着公司的变化，职业也会发生变化。 工作正在以与企业几乎相同的方式被重塑。 一个男人（通常是男人）期望在同一家公司工作整个职业生涯的日子已经一去不复返了，从学徒开始，逐步晋升，在连续工作 40 年后退休，享受与指数挂钩的养老金、公司马车钟，并在公司历史上名列前茅。 由于公司和员工都试图应对这个更加不稳定的时代，因此他们被标题为《无理性的时代》（1989 年，查尔斯·汉迪 (Charles Handy)）、《变革大师》（1985 年，罗莎贝丝·莫斯·兰特 (Rosabeth Moss Ranter)）等书名所吸引也就不足为奇了, 和 Managing in a Time of Great Change (1996, Peter Drucker)。

As companies change, so do careers. Jobs are being reinvented in much the same way that businesses are. Gone are the days when a man (and it usually was a man) could expect to spend his entire career working for the same company, starting as an apprentice, climbing up through the ranks, and retiring, after 40 years of uninterrupted employment, to enjoy an index-linked pension, a corporate carriage-clock, and a mention in the company history. As both companies and employees try to deal with this more unstable age, it is not surprising that they are drawn to books with titles like The Age of Unreason (1989, by Charles Handy), The Change Masters (1985, by Rosabeth Moss Ranter), and Managing in a Time of Great Change (1996, by Peter Drucker).

更重要的是，需要了解管理知识的人数正在增加。 在 1991-95 年美国创造的 800 万个新工作岗位中，60% 属于“经理和其他专业人士”类别，现在是劳动力中最大的群体。 也不仅仅是白领工人需要从他们的 JIT（及时）了解他们的 TQM（全面质量管理）：如今，即使是西方世界最低级的工厂工人也知道他最宝贵的资产是他的大脑而不是他的手。

What is more, the number of people who need to know something about management is growing. Of the 8 million new jobs created in America in 1991-95, 60 percent belonged to the category of "managers and other professionals," now the largest group in the workforce. Nor is it just white-collar workers who have to know their TQM (total-quality management) from their JIT (just in time): nowadays even the lowliest factory worker in the Western world knows that his most valuable asset is his brain rather than his hands.

正如竞争对手和股东迫使公司质疑他们如何管理自己一样，政府也受到预算赤字和纳税人的刺激。 在许多情况下，这只会导致私有化。 例如，在阿根廷，一批过去耗费纳税人资金的国有企业被以超过 200 亿美元的价格出售。 一些政府已经从私有化转向公共部门管理的下一阶段：试图重组那些必须留在政府手中的机构。 英国的保守党政府重新设计了该国最受珍视的机构之一——福利国家的大部分内容。 它将权力下放给各个学校和医院，让医生和教师有自己的预算， 将这些预算与所教的学生人数或治疗的患者人数联系起来，并编制和发布“生产力”（即挽救生命和通过考试）的“箱子分数”。 这些改革更多地归功于彼得·德鲁克和阿兰·恩托芬等管理理论家，而不是大卫·休谟和埃德蒙·伯克等保守党哲学家。

Just as companies have been forced by competitors and shareholders to question how they manage themselves, so have governments, prodded by budget deficits and taxpayers. In many cases this has simply led to privatization. In Argentina, for instance, a group of state-owned businesses that used to cost taxpayers money were sold for over $20 billion. Some governments have moved from privatization to what might be called the next stage of public sector management: trying to reorganize those institutions that have to remain in the government's hands. Britain's Conservative government has redesigned large parts of one of the country's most cherished institutions, the welfare state. It has devolved power to individual schools and hospitals, given doctors and teachers their own budgets, linked those budgets to the number of pupils taught or patients treated, and compiled and published "box scores" of "productivity" (i.e., lives saved and exams passed). These reforms owe much more to management theorists such as Peter Drucker and Alain Enthoven than they do to Tory philosophers such as David Hume and Edmund Burke.

介绍

Introduction

在大西洋彼岸，克林顿政府痴迷于智囊团、文艺复兴周末等，甚至更加沉迷于管理理论。 1995 年初，比尔·克林顿曾咨询过戴安娜王妃的导师安东尼·罗宾斯和另一位激励专家斯蒂芬·柯维。 希拉里·克林顿 (Hillary Clinton) 难以理解但显然无所不知的健康计划主要由管理狂热者 Ira Magaziner 撰写。 副总统戈尔大部分时间都在根据最新的管理思想重塑政府。 相信管理的力量是为数不多的跨越党派界限的想法之一——阅读德鲁克的演讲者金里奇就是见证。

Across the Atlantic, the Clinton administration, with its obsession with think tanks, Renaissance weekends, and the like, is even more steeped in management theory. In early 1995 it emerged that Bill Clinton had consulted both Princess Diana's mentor, Anthony Robbins, and Stephen Covey, another motivation expert. Hillary Clinton's incomprehensible but apparently omniscient health plan was largely written by a management fanatic, Ira Magaziner. Vice President Al Gore spends most of his time reinventing government in line with the latest management thinking. And a belief in the power of management is one of the few ideas that crosses party lines—as the Drucker-reading Speaker Gingrich bears witness.

焦虑的时代

The Age of Anxiety

凡是援引管理理论的地方，恐惧和焦虑似乎都会随之而来。 在巴伐利亚一家关闭的工厂或纽卡斯尔一家重组后的医院寻求解释，你会听到一种平淡无奇的语言，使裁员听起来更像是一个科学决定，而不是人类悲剧：被解雇的工人“裁员”，“分离， ““被切断”、“未分配”和“主动转移”。 （据说 AT&T 正在执行一项“部队管理计划”，以减少“部队或技能的不平衡”。）

Wherever management theory has been invoked, fear and anxiety seem to have followed. Ask for an explanation at a shuttered factory in Bavaria or a reorganized hospital in Newcastle, and you will hear an anodyne language that makes laying people off sound more like a scientific decision than a human tragedy: fired workers are "downsized," "separated," "severed," "unassigned," and "proactively outplaced." (AT&T is said to be carrying out a "force management program" to reduce "an imbalance of forces or skills.")

尽管他们总是出现在犯罪现场，但大师们还没有被围捕接受讯问。 帕特·布坎南 (Pat Buchanan) 在其共和党总统候选人提名的民粹主义竞选活动中编制的嫌疑人名单包括恶魔何塞（象征性的外国工人偷走你的工作）和“高盛”（象征性的犹太投资银行）——但没有德鲁克或彼得斯。 更多冷静的评论员倾向于谈论经济学。

Despite their invariable presence at the scene of the crime, the gurus have not yet been rounded up for questioning. The list of suspects compiled by Pat Buchanan in his populist campaign for the Republican presidential nomination included the fiendish Jose (the symbolic foreign worker out to steal your job) and "Goldman and Sachs" (the symbolic Jewish investment bank)—but no Drucker or Peters. More sober commentators have tended to talk about economics.

一方面，这是对的。 人们失去工作（或在工作中感到更不安全）的根本原因与竞争、技术变革和政府预算有关。 然而，管理大师声称“他们只是在执行命令”是不够的：他们是他们无法控制的宏观经济力量的仆人。 无论好坏，管理理论在这些力量如何影响人们方面发挥了巨大作用。 尽管美国公司在不进行再造的情况下仍然会裁员，但纪律以及一些

In one way, this is right. The underlying reasons why people have lost their jobs (or feel more insecure in them) have to do with competition, technological change, and government budgets. However, it is not quite enough for the management gurus to claim that "they were only following orders": that they were the servants of macroeconomic forces beyond their control. For better or worse, management theory has played an enormous role in how those forces have affected people. Although American companies would still have shed jobs without reengineering, the discipline, alongside several

介绍

INTRODUCTION

其他管理技术，可能会增加屠杀，并且肯定会影响切割的方式。

other management techniques, probably increased the carnage and certainly affected the way that the cutting was done.

许多最热心的裁员者同时也是管理理论最热心的消费者，这绝非巧合。 例如，AT&T 长期以来一直是专家们的游乐场，永远聘请顾问或派遣员工参加管理课程； 事实上，这家电话巨头要对可以说是有史以来最令人费解的管理口号负责——“把驼鹿放在桌子上”——这与扁平化等级制度和赋予员工权力有关，并且是几次（灾难性的）注入尝试之一现代管理思想融入 AT&T 的 NCR 子公司。

It cannot have been a coincidence that many of the most enthusiastic downsizers have also been the most enthusiastic consumers of management theory. AT&T, for example, has long been a playground for the gurus, forever calling in consultants or sending staff members on management courses; indeed, the telephone giant is responsible for arguably the most baffling management slogan of all time— "Putting the moose on the table"—which had something to do with flattening hierarchies and empowering workers, and was one of several (disastrous) attempts to inject modern management thinking into AT&T's NCR subsidiary.

此外，大量的“焦虑”与失去工作无关，而是与工作场所的重组方式有关。 例如，“延迟分层”不仅会影响那些被解雇的人。 它增加了车间工人的压力，他们现在必须自己做出更多决定。 它还扰乱了人们的职业生涯：由于需要攀登的梯级越来越少，经理们不得不安于横向移动。 同样，大师们一直毫不掩饰地支持衡量个人对公司贡献的方法，从绩效工资到“360 度评估”（人们相互评估）等新设备。 再一次，他们倾向于将这些事情视为“赋权”； 但是一次又一次的调查表明，大多数工人都觉得他们很可怕。 的确，

Moreover, a good deal of "anxiety" has nothing to do with losing one's job but with the way that the workplace is being reorganized. "Delayering," for instance, affects not only those who are fired. It increases pressure on shop-floor workers who now have to make more decisions for themselves. It also disrupts people's careers: with fewer rungs to climb, managers have to be content with moving sideways. Similarly, the gurus have been unabashed supporters of ways to measure an individual's contribution to a company, from performance pay to newer devices such as "360-degree evaluation" (whereby people evaluate each other). Once again, they tend to see these things as "empowering"; but survey after survey suggests that most workers find them frightening. Indeed, one of the ironies of management theory is that although it was invented to make managers' jobs easier, it has often made their lives much more difficult.

管理理论悖论

The Management Theory Paradox

大师们的影响——他们作为人类未被承认的立法者的表面地位——是否有意义？ 一个明显的答案是管理理论很重要，因为管理很重要。 简而言之，它改变了公司和人们的工作方式； 在这个世界上，许多公司比某些国家还大，而且大多数人醒着的时间都花在工作上而不是在家里，这改变了人们的生活——通常是戏剧性的。 虽然大多数其他学者——甚至科学家和经济学家——必须等待数十年才能看到他们的工作产生任何实际影响，但

Does the gurus' influence—their apparent status as the unacknowledged legislators of mankind—make sense? One obvious answer is that management theory matters because management matters. Put simply, it changes companies and the way that people work; and in a world where many companies are bigger than some countries and where most people spend more of their waking hours at work rather than at home, that changes lives—often dramatically. While most other academics—even scientists and economists—have to wait decades to see their work have any practical impact, the

介绍

Introduction

大师们的想法通常会立即得到检验。 很少有其他学科可以声称如此“活跃”。

gurus' ideas are often tested immediately. There are few other academic disciplines that can claim to be so "alive."

但是有一个问题。 甚至其最重要的思想家也承认，管理理论被一个悖论所困扰：这一如此重要的知识学科仍然远非受人尊敬。 正如彼得德鲁克所说，人们使用“大师”这个词只是因为他们不想说“江湖骗子”。 另一位大师亨利·明茨伯格 (Henry Mintzberg) 的座右铭是，“猴子爬得越高，你看到它的屁股就越多，”写在他的墙上。 即使在美国，商学院的学者也被人以居高临下的态度看待，并受到怀疑。 在美国以外，公共休息室和高等学校的反应要激烈得多。 管理大师经常抛出知识上的抓钩，转向经济学、哲学和历史等较古老的学科； 其他学者很少回报。

Yet there is a catch. As even its foremost thinkers admit, management theory is bedeviled by a paradox: this intellectual discipline that matters so much is still far from respectable. As Peter Drucker puts it, people use the word "guru" only because they do not want to say "charlatan." Another guru, Henry Mintzberg, has the motto, "The higher a monkey climbs the more you see its ass," penned to his wall. Even in America, academics at business schools are regarded with condescension—and with suspicion. Outside America, the reaction in common rooms and Grandes Ecoles is far more vicious. Management gurus often throw out intellectual grappling hooks to older disciplines, such as economics, philosophy, and history; the other academics seldom return the favor.

乍一看，这似乎是学术嫉妒的掩饰。 哪个资金不足的中世纪历史学家，在一个古老的图书馆里为数百名观众和邮政工人的薪水辛勤工作，可能不会被“人力资源管理专家”的公务机和巡回演讲的生活方式所困扰？ 但这还不足以解释管理理论的悖论。 一个确凿的事实是，大多数学者对管理理论持粗鲁态度，仅仅是因为他们认为它并不深奥。 而这些疑虑，并不局限于生活在象牙塔中的傲慢自大的人。 与几乎任何出版商私下谈论管理书籍，您可能会发现这种态度：“这本书卖得很好，这难道不令人难以置信吗？” （这不仅仅是对“无聊”商业书籍的文学偏见： 根据某些统计，经理们每购买五本商业书籍就无法完成四本。） 6 那些更直接地涉及管理理论的人也不再更讨人喜欢了。 逼问顾问，给他或她灌酒，他或她很可能会承认与出版商相同的事情。 即使是普通的商界人士——包括那些以其中一种理论的名义解雇了数千人的人——在被问及“知识分子”管理理论如何时也会尴尬地脸红。 迟早，几乎在每种情况下，“废话”这个词都会出现。 他或她很可能会承认与出版商相同的事情。 即使是普通的商界人士——包括那些以其中一种理论的名义解雇了数千人的人——在被问及“知识分子”管理理论如何时也会尴尬地脸红。 迟早，几乎在每种情况下，“废话”这个词都会出现。 他或她很可能会承认与出版商相同的事情。 即使是普通的商界人士——包括那些以其中一种理论的名义解雇了数千人的人——在被问及“知识分子”管理理论如何时也会尴尬地脸红。 迟早，几乎在每种情况下，“废话”这个词都会出现。

At first sight, this looks like a cover for academic jealousy. What underfunded medieval historian, toiling away in an ancient library for an audience of hundreds and a postal worker's salary, could fail to be annoyed by the corporate-jet and speaking-tour lifestyle of a "human-resources management expert"? But this is not enough to explain the management theory paradox. The hard fact remains that most academics are rude about management theory simply because they do not think that it is very profound. And these doubts are not confined to snooty people living in ivory towers. Talk to virtually any publisher privately about management books and you will probably unearth the attitude: "Isn't it incredible that this stuff sells?" (This is more than just literary prejudice against "boring" business books: by some counts, managers fail to finish four in every five business books they buy.) 6 Nor are those who deal more directly with management theory any more flattering. Corner a consultant, fill him or her up with alcohol, and the chances are that he or she will admit the same thing as the publisher. Even ordinary business people—including those who have fired thousands in the name of one of these theories—will blush awkwardly when asked how "intellectual" management theory is. Sooner or later, in virtually every case, the word "bullshit" appears.

也许一个更好的词会是一个古老的盎格鲁-撒克逊语对等词：管理理论缺乏约克郡人过去称之为“底部”的东西。 即使不是全是“废话”，也足以取消资格

Perhaps a better word would be an older Anglo-Saxon equivalent: management theory lacks what Yorkshire folk used to call "bottom." Even if it is not all "bullshit," then enough of it is to disqualify

介绍

INTRODUCTION

其余的部分。 在许多情况下，这要归咎于那些投机取巧的江湖骗子（“用 10,000 美元在三天内改造你的公司”），他们跳上了管理理论的潮流，因为潮流中不再有任何余地来兜售关于管理理论的建议。性或节食。 这样的人很容易成为替罪羊，但是（用和他们一样的热情来混合比喻）当涉及到管理理论悖论时，他们基本上是转移注意力的人。 每年都有大量骇人听闻的经济学论文和难以言喻的诗歌发表，但思想界对经济学或文学并不嗤之以鼻。 真正的问题是，人们对管理理论的严肃标准存在严重怀疑。

the rest. In many cases, the blame lies with the dismal range of tub-thumping charlatans ("Transform your company in three days for $10,000") who have jumped onto the management theory bandwagon because there is no longer any room left on the bandwagons peddling advice on sex or dieting. Such people make convenient scapegoats, but (to mix metaphors with the same enthusiasm as they do) they are basically red herrings when it comes to the management theory paradox. There are plenty of appalling economics papers and unspeakable poems published every year, but the thinking world does not turn up its nose at economics or literature. The real problem is that there are grave doubts about the serious canon of management theory.

控方证人

Witnesses for the Prosecution

根据反对它的案例，管理理论有四个缺陷：它在本质上不能进行自我批评； 它的术语通常是混淆而不是教育； 它很少超越基本常识； 它很时髦，并且被更严格的学科所不允许的矛盾所困扰。 这四项指控的含义是，管理大师是骗子，是我们这个时代的巫医，他们利用商人的焦虑来销售蛇油。 大师们中的许多人可疑地来自“伟大的生活大学”，而不是任何正统的学科，他们之所以存在，主要是因为人们让他们逍遥法外。 现代管理理论并不比部落医学更可靠。 毕竟，巫医往往是靠运气、靠本能或靠反复试验成功的。

Management theory, according to the case against it, has four defects: it is constitutionally incapable of self-criticism; its terminology usually confuses rather than educates; it rarely rises above basic common sense; and it is faddish and bedeviled by contradictions that would not be allowed in more rigorous disciplines. The implication of all four charges is that management gurus are con artists, the witch doctors of our age, playing on business people's anxieties in order to sell snake oil. The gurus, many of whom have sprung suspiciously from the "great university of life" rather than any orthodox academic discipline, exist largely because people let them get away with it. Modern management theory is no more reliable than tribal medicine. Witch doctors, after all, often got it right—by luck, by instinct, or by trial and error.

针对管理理论的第一项指控——缺乏自我批评——我们欣然接受。 事实上，本书的重点之一就是提供这样的批评。 第二项指控——其中大部分是难以理解的官话——我们也欣然接受。 本书的另一个目的是将“managementese”翻译成接近英语的东西。 商学院或管理会议上的水中似乎有某种东西会破坏人们说清楚或写清楚的能力。 阅读以下段落，例如，由两位更好的大师 Gary Hamel 和 CK Prahalad 撰写：

The first charge against management theory—its lack of self-criticism—we happily accept. Indeed, one of the points of this book is to provide just such criticism. The second charge—that much of it is incomprehensible gobbledygook—we also happily accept. Another of the purposes of this book is to translate "managementese" into something approaching English. There seems to be something in the water in business schools or at management conferences that destroys people's capacity to speak plainly or write clearly. Read the following paragraph, for example, written by Gary Hamel and C. K. Prahalad, two of the better gurus:

介绍

Introduction

Wave 参与者让他们的直接下属参与发现过程。 每个波浪都指定了几个“连接销”，负责将波浪的工作与其他波浪的工作相互作用。 变革团队成员担任每一波的教练。 每一波的输出都被其他波和领导委员会进行了彻底的辩论。 最后，一个“整合团队”，由一些更“趋同的思想家”组成，将工作归结为本质，并产生了一个战略架构草案，再次在公司内部进行了广泛讨论。 7

Wave participants involved their direct reports in the discovery process. Each wave appointed a few "linking pins" responsible for interacting the wave's work with that of the other waves. Change team members acted as coaches to each wave. The output of every wave was thoroughly debated by the other waves and with the Leadership Council. Finally, an "integration team," made up of some of the more "convergent thinkers" across the waves, boiled the work down to its essence and produced a draft strategic architecture that again was widely debated in the company. 7

混淆和行话不仅限于印刷文字。 写这本书的想法源于在瑞士管理论坛上举行的一次座谈会，会上满屋子的德国商人都在英勇地努力理解一位美国大师想说的话。 来自现场的每一个直接、实际的问题都得到了讲台上越来越模糊的回答。 具体问题，类似于“我们应该如何应用您的想法？” 回答是关于“应用”等词的含义的哲学沉思，并邀请整个房间讨论“应用”。 制作了一些难以理解的图表“就像一个松散的框架”。 德国商人责怪自己不懂。

Obfuscation and jargon are confined not just to the printed word. The idea for this book sprang out of a symposium held at a Swiss management forum, where a room full of German businessmen endeavored heroically to understand what an American guru was trying to say. Every direct, practical query from the floor received an ever vaguer response from the podium. Specific questions, along the lines of "How should we apply your ideas?" were answered by philosophical musings about what words such as "apply" meant and an invitation to the whole room to discuss "apply." A few incomprehensible diagrams were produced "just as a loose framework." The German businessmen blamed themselves for not understanding.

那么，第三个更重要的指控是什么：在这方便混淆的云层之下，大师们所说的大部分内容都是显而易见的？ 在外人看来，管理大师似乎常常在处理应用常识（“客户为王”）； 他们的许多口号（“全面质量管理”）现在看来很陈词滥调。 当他们所做的只是描述现在时，他们经常声称是在预测未来。 正如列宁的《帝国主义，资本主义的最高阶段》（1917 年）预测第一次世界大战实际发生三年后爆发一样，管理大师们永远在预言一个已经到来的未来。

What, then, of the third, more substantial charge: that, underneath this convenient cloud of obfuscation, most of what the gurus say is blindingly obvious? Too often to outside eyes, management gurus seem to be dealing in applied common sense ("the customer is king"); many of their catchphrases ("total-quality management") now seem trite. They often claim to be predicting the future when all they are doing is describing the present. Just as Lenin's Imperialism, the Highest Stage of Capitalism (1917) predicted the outbreak of the First World War three years after it had actually happened, management gurus are forever prophesying a future that has already arrived.

这其中有一定的道理，但比批评者声称的要少。 当有远见的管理理论家开始谈论这些事情时，有些事情现在让我们觉得显而易见。 例如，彼得·德鲁克 (Peter Drucker) 早在 1950 年代就预测蓝领工人的衰落和“知识工作者”的崛起。 人们不再鼓吹全面质量管理，不是因为质量过时了，而是因为

There is an element of truth in this, but less than critics allege. Some of the things that strike us nowadays as blindingly obvious were anything but obvious when far-sighted management theorists began to talk about them. Peter Drucker, for example, was predicting the decline of the blue-collar worker and the rise of the "knowledge worker" back in the 1950s. People have stopped preaching about total-quality management, not because quality has gone out of fashion, but because

介绍

INTRODUCTION

每个人都在为之奋斗。 此外，陈述显而易见的事情本身并没有错。 聘请管理顾问的理由之一是，他们可以看到外行人显而易见但内行人无法理解的内容。

everybody is striving for it. Besides, there is nothing inherently wrong with stating the obvious. One of the arguments for hiring management consultants is that they can see what is obvious to an outsider but incomprehensible to an insider.

然而，对管理理论最常见的批评集中在第四项指控上：赶时髦。 管理理论家对不断革命充满热情，这会让莱昂托洛茨基或毛泽东羡慕不已。 理论家们永远在揭露想法，用一些首字母缩写词命名并用科学语言装饰，这些想法应该“保证竞争成功”。 几个月后，随着这些想法的尝试和“竞争成功”仍然像以往一样虚幻，理论家们提出了一些新想法。 这些名称不言而喻：Z 理论、目标管理、头脑风暴、管理网格、T 组、内部创业、分流、卓越、四处走动管理等。

However, the most common criticism of management theory focuses on the fourth charge: its faddishness. Management theorists have a passion for permanent revolution that would have made Leon Trotsky or Mao Zedong green with envy. Theorists are forever unveiling ideas, christened with some acronym and tarted up in scientific language, which are supposed to "guarantee competitive success." A few months later, with the ideas tried out and "competitive success" still as illusory as ever, the theorists unveil some new idea. The names speak for themselves: theory Z, management by objectives, brainstorming, managerial grid, T groups, intrapreneureship, demassing, excellence, managing by walking around, and so on.

理论上的时尚反映在公司的时尚上。 大师们总是在发现似乎无意中发现了竞争成功秘诀的公司。 几年后，这些奇迹般的组织摇摇欲坠、陷入困境，甚至破产。 1982 年，In Search of Excellence 确定了 43 家优秀的美国公司，并试图提炼出它们成功的源泉。 但在该书出版后不到五年，所研究的公司中有三分之二已不再优秀。 有些，例如 Atari 和 Avon，陷入了严重的困境； 其他人，如王和杜邦，不再出类拔萃。 IBM 在其严重下滑中表现出色。 （注意到这一趋势后，《商业周刊》制作了一个封面，上面印有一个词，“哎呀！”）但是，汤姆·彼得斯并没有发誓保持沉默，而是出版了更多的书，

The fashion in theories is mirrored by a fashion in companies. Gurus are forever discovering companies that seem to have stumbled on the secret of competitive success. A few years later these miracle organizations are faltering, troubled, or even bankrupt. In 1982 In Search of Excellence identified 43 excellent American companies and tried to distill the sources of their success. But less than five years after the book's publication two-thirds of the companies studied had ceased to be excellent. Some, such as Atari and Avon, were in serious trouble; others, like Wang and Du Pont, were no longer outstanding. IBM was well-advanced in its serious decline. (On noticing the trend, Business Week produced a cover emblazoned with a single word, "Oops!") But, rather than taking a vow of silence, Tom Peters produced yet more books, advocating different solutions to America's problems.

这些理论似乎在管理者中拥有大量愿意（如果感到困惑）的听众。 1995 年，咨询公司 Bain & Company 对世界各地的管理人员如何使用 25 种领先的管理技术进行了一项调查，发现 1993 年，平均每家公司使用了 11.8 种这些技术，1994 年为 12.7 种。管理人员正在使用 14.1 1995 年的技术。8 虽然美国人通常被挑出来作为最严重的罪犯，但他们的消费率 (12.8) 仅略高于法国 (11.4) 和日本 (11.5)，落后于最大的狂欢者英国 (13.7) .

These theories seem to have a large and willing (if confused) audience among managers. In 1995 a survey by Bain & Company, a consultancy, of what use managers around the world made of 25 leading management techniques found that the average company used 11.8 of these techniques in 1993 and 12.7 in 1994. The managers were on course to use 14.1 techniques in 1995. 8 Although Americans are usually singled out as the worst offenders, their consumption rate (12.8) was only slightly higher than that of France (11.4) and Japan (11.5) and behind that of the biggest binger, Britain (13.7).

管理时尚似乎变得越来越善变：一个想法的生命周期现在已经从十年缩短到一年或更短。

Management fashions seem to be growing ever more fickle: the life cycle of an idea has now shrunk from a decade to a year or less.

介绍

Introduction

试图跟上最新时尚的谦虚商人常常发现，当他们实施新的热潮时，它看起来已经过时了。 唯一获胜的是理论家，他们只会越来越富有。 事实上，根据现有的阴谋证据来构建一部奥利弗·斯通的电影并不难。 有名望的权威人士，拥有喷气式飞机的生活方式，一直在寻找方法来更新他们的论点； 想成为大师的人，无论他们是梦想与家人共度时光的过度劳累的管理顾问，还是梦想乘坐头等舱旅行的未就业的商业教授，他们总是试图发明革命性的想法来建立他们的声誉； 业务中的每个人都迫切希望保持车轮转动。

Humble businessmen trying to keep up with the latest fashion often find that by the time they have implemented the new craze, it looks outdated. The only people who win out are the theorists, who just go on getting richer and richer. Indeed, it is not hard to construct an Oliver Stone movie out of the available evidence for a concerted conspiracy. Established gurus, with jet-set lifestyles to support, are always looking for ways to update their arguments; would-be gurus, be they overworked management consultants dreaming of spending some time with their families or underemployed business professors dreaming of first-class travel, are always trying to invent the revolutionary ideas that will establish their reputations; and everybody in the business is desperate to keep the wheel turning.

矛盾的公司

The Contradictory Corporation

所有关于时尚主义的抱怨都没有抓住重点。 尝试想法不一定有错。 就像慢跑或举铁一样，一种新的理论迫使公司锻炼他们的企业肌肉。 （通用电气的杰克韦尔奇甚至将他的一个管理系统称为“锻炼”，暗示管理变革有利于公司健康。）当这些想法相互矛盾时，问题就来了。 管理理论的真正问题在于它把机构和个人拉向了相互矛盾的方向。

All the complaints about faddism miss the point. There is nothing necessarily wrong about trying out ideas. Rather like jogging or pumping iron, a new theory forces companies to exercise their corporate muscles. (General Electric's Jack Welch even dubs one of his management systems "workout," implying that managerial change is good for corporate health.) The problem comes when these ideas contradict each other. The real problem with management theory is that it is pulling institutions and individuals in conflicting directions.

对于每一种将公司拖向一个方向的理论，都有另外两种理论将其拖向另一种方向。 有一瞬间，大师们正在鼓吹全面质量管理——以及检查质量和减少缺陷的重要性； 其次，他们坚持认为最重要的是速度（这意味着在检查质量方面不那么费力）。 有一段时间，他们说一个公司的优势在于它的企业文化，越有特色越好； 接下来，他们命令公司变得更加“多元文化”，以便能够为社会其他人树立一面镜子。 有一段时间，公司被敦促达成一致，然后遵循一个单一的强大“愿景”； 接下来，他们被警告说，他们生活在一个“不确定的时代”，在这个时代，追随任何一个单一的愿景都可能是自杀。 大多数管理理论家都没有弄清楚，是全球性的还是本地性的，是大的还是小的，是为了股东或利益相关者的利益而经营。 通常，他们最终会告诉经理们两者都做。

For every theory dragging companies one way, there are two other theories dragging it in another. One moment, the gurus are preaching total-quality management—and the importance of checking quality and reducing defects; the next, they are insisting that what matters is speed (which means being a little less painstaking about checking quality). One moment, they are saying that what gives a company its edge is its corporate culture, the more distinctive the better; the next, they are ordering companies to become more "multicultural" in order to be able to hold a mirror up to the rest of society. One moment, companies are urged to agree upon and then follow a single strong "vision"; the next, they are being warned that they live in an "age of uncertainty" where following any single vision can be suicidal. Most management theorists have not worked out whether it is important to be global or local, to be big or small, to be run in the interests of shareholders or stakeholders. Usually, they end up telling managers to do both.

介绍

INTRODUCTION

当涉及到公司与其员工的关系时，这些矛盾尤其有害。 管理理论中比较流行的词之一是“信任”——该理论认为，正是这一点使“知识工作者”保持忠诚并激发他们提出想法。 然而，所有的大师们也宣扬“灵活性”的美德，这通常是解雇人的简写。 事实上，企业利益与员工利益之间的矛盾越来越大。 公司为确保自身安全而采取的措施——裁员、签订短期合同或引入灵活的工作时间表——正是让这些员工感到不安全的原因。 与此同时，唯一能够解决这些矛盾的人是——由于所有的拖延——时间最少的人：

The contradictions are particularly poisonous when they involve a company's relations with its staff. One of the more fashionable words in management theory is "trust"—it is this, the theory holds, that will keep "knowledge workers" loyal and inspire them to come up with ideas. Yet all the gurus also preach the virtue of "flexibility," which is usually shorthand for firing people. Indeed, there is a growing contradiction between the interests of companies and those of their employees. What companies do to make themselves secure—laying off workers, putting them on short-term contracts, or introducing flexible work schedules—is precisely what makes those workers feel insecure. Meanwhile, the only person who could sort out these contradictions is the one who—thanks to all that delayering—has the least time to do it: the boss.

公司内部的这些矛盾反映了管理理论核心的更深层次的知识混乱，这使得它与其说是一门连贯的学科，不如说是两种截然对立的哲学之间的战场。 管理理论家通常属于两个相互竞争的学派之一，每个学派都受到不同的人性哲学的启发； 管理实践在这两种立场之间摇摆不定。 科学管理基于这样一种观念，即普通工人是懒惰的懒汉，只有贪婪才能救赎。 管理者的工作是把工作分解成各个组成部分，让最笨的人也能掌握，设计激励机制，让最懒的人也能发挥自己的作用。 另一方面，人本主义管理基于这样的理念，即普通员工是模范人类， 聪明、有创造力和自我激励。 经理的工作是通过将决策权下放给车间员工、创建自我管理团队并鼓励员工就公司如何运作提出建议，确保工作足够有趣，从而激发公司员工的最佳潜能可能会有所改善。 这实质上是“硬”与“软”管理之争。

These contradictions within firms reflect a deeper intellectual confusion at the heart of management theory, which has left it not so much a coherent discipline as a battleground between two radically opposed philosophies. Management theorists usually belong to one of two rival schools, each of which is inspired by a different philosophy of human nature; and management practice has oscillated wildly between these two positions. Scientific management is based on the idea that the average worker is a lazy slob who is only redeemed by greed. The job of the manager is to break down jobs into their component parts, so that even the dumbest persons can master them, and design incentive systems, so that even the laziest will exert themselves. Humanistic management, on the other hand, is based on the idea that the average worker is a model human being, intelligent, creative, and self-motivating. The job of the manager is to ensure that work is interesting enough to bring out the best in the firm's employees, by dint of devolving decisions to shop-floor workers, creating self-managing teams, and encouraging workers to make suggestions about how the company might be improved. This, in essence, is the debate between "hard" and "soft" management.

第一种理论打着科学管理的旗号，直到第二次世界大战才盛行。 第二次是在 1950 年代和 60 年代，在“人际关系运动”的旗帜下取得进展。 在 1980 年代，人文主义者指出日本是一个将权力下放给工人并回避科学管理的国家。 这种温和的方法越来越被严酷的现实所掩盖：尽管他们说了很多好话，但各地的公司都开始裁员。 由

The first theory held sway until the Second World War, in the guise of scientific management; the second gained ground in the 1950s and 1960s, under the banner of the "human-relations movement." In the 1980s the humanists pointed to Japan, as a country that devolved power to workers and eschewed scientific management. This soft approach was increasingly overshadowed by hard realities: for all their kind words, companies everywhere began to cut back staff. By the

介绍

Introduction

1990 年代初期占主导地位的管理理论是再造，它试图使泰勒主义适应计算机时代。

early 1990s the dominant management theory was reengineering, which tried to adapt Taylorism to the age of the computer.

矛盾公司有两个令人震惊的影响。 首先是加剧了董事会上下的焦虑。 美国经理人有一个首字母缩略词，可以概括所有变化的影响：BOHICA——或者弯腰，它又来了。 《商业周刊》援引一位美国经理对管理时尚的看法：“去年是质量圈……今年将是零库存。事实是，再流行一时，我们都会发疯。” 9 那是在 1986 年，从那时起，时尚的速度——以及它们相互矛盾的能力——大大增加了。

The Contradictory Corporation has had two alarming effects. The first has been to reinforce anxiety, from the boardroom down. American managers have an acronym that captures the effect of all the changes: BOHICA—or bend over, here it comes again. Business Week quoted one American manager delivering his verdict on management fashion: "Last year it was quality circles . . . this year it will be zero inventories. The truth is, one more fad and we will all go nuts." 9 That was in 1986, and since then the velocity of fads—and their ability to contradict one another—has increased considerably.

第二个影响与语言和承诺有关。 随着相互矛盾的理论从他们身边飞驰而过，管理者已经学会了如何在没有真正理解理论的情况下对理论进行口头服务，更不用说费心去实施它们了。 许多经理很像旧时的苏联官僚，生活在双重世界中：现实世界和官方认可的意识形态世界。 因此，他们谈论“授权”但习惯性地囤积权力，或者宣称他们正在“重新设计”他们的组织，而实际上他们只是解雇了一些更乏善可陈的员工。

The second effect concerns language—and commitment. As contradictory theories zip past them, managers have learned how to pay lip service to theories without really understanding them, let alone bothering to implement them. Many managers are rather like the Soviet bureaucrats of old, living in a dual world: the real world and the world of officially sanctioned ideology. Thus they talk about "empowerment" but habitually hoard power, or proclaim that they are "reengineering" their organizations when they are really just firing a few of the more lackluster workers.

这种双重说法很重要，因为管理理论是国际精英的语言。 越来越多的统治公司和国家的人用它的术语说话。 对于年轻而有抱负的人来说，商学院教育越来越像是一种必需品（而且更有可能在咨询公司工作一段时间）。 从上海到旧金山，在任何一个机场的商务舱休息室里偷听，你都会听到熟悉的白话。 在政治上，左翼和右翼之间的旧斗争似乎不再重要。 克林顿派和多莱派之间没有意识形态鸿沟。 相反，战场变成了管理效率的战场：谁将“管理”经济，谁将“重组”政府，谁拥有必要的“领导技能”，等等。

This doublespeak matters because management theory is the language of the international elite. An increasing number of people who rule companies and countries speak in its terms. For the young and ambitious, a business school education is looking more and more like a necessity (and a spell at a consulting firm more of a probability). Eavesdrop in the business-class lounge of any airport from Shanghai to San Francisco and you will hear a familiar vernacular. In politics, the old battles between left and right no longer seem to matter. There is no ideological gulf between the Clintonites and Doleites. Instead, the battleground has become one of managerial efficiency: who will "manage" the economy, who will "restructure" government, who has the necessary "leadership skills," and so on. If this debate is carried out in terms that are contradictory or empty, then everyone suffers.

用手术刀，而不是斧头

With a Scalpel, Not a Hatchet

有些人会争辩说，所有这些矛盾表明管理理论本身就是一种矛盾。 我们更愿意

Some would argue that all these contradictions indicate that management theory is itself a contradiction in terms. We prefer to

介绍

INTRODUCTION

将其视为一门不成熟的学科，部分原因是其巨大的经济成功阻碍了它的发展。

see it as an immature discipline, prevented from growing up partly by its enormous financial success.

管理理论与一个世纪前的经济学大致处于同一状态。 它的许多基本原则尚未确立。 该学科仍在等待约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯、弗里德里希·哈耶克或米尔顿·弗里德曼的到来。 它缺乏辩论规则，因此该学科对任何有兴趣的人开放——就像经济学对卡尔·马克思这样的人开放一样。 然而，就像一百年前任何想了解经济学的人都可以借鉴阿尔弗雷德马歇尔、亚当斯密和大卫里卡多等作家一样，管理理论已经有了它的创始人，其中包括阿尔弗雷德斯隆和彼得德鲁克。 管理理论还引发了关于全球化、工作性质和公司结构变化等重大主题的争论。 尽管青春期有过激行为，但该学科产生了行之有效的想法。

Management theory is in roughly the same state that economics was a century ago. Many of its fundamental tenets have yet to be established. The discipline still awaits its John Maynard Keynes, Friedrich Hayek, or Milton Friedman. It lacks rules of debate, so the discipline remains open to anybody with an axe to grind—much as economics was open to the likes of Karl Marx. However, just as anybody wanting to know about economics a hundred years ago could draw on writers such as Alfred Marshall, Adam Smith, and David Ricardo, management theory already has its founding fathers, among them, Alfred Sloan and Peter Drucker. Management theory has also generated debates on such momentous subjects as globalization, the nature of work, and the changing structure of companies. Despite its adolescent excesses, the discipline has generated ideas that work. Japanese manufacturers trounced American ones in the 1980s because they embraced "quality."

深入研究管理理论的几乎任何领域，你最终都会发现一个连贯的立场。 问题是，为了提取金块，你必须挖出大量的华夫饼。 本书试图提取这些金块。

Dig into virtually any area of management theory and you will find, eventually, a coherent position of sorts. The problem is that in order to extract that nugget you have to dig through an enormous amount of waffle. This book is an attempt to extract those nuggets.

毋庸置疑，破坏这个行业会容易得多（而且通常更令人愉快）。 任何希望制作“斧头工作”的人都有丰富的材料。 然而，真正需要的是“手术刀般的工作”，这正是我们在《巫医》中试图做的：我们试图将好的（或者，无论如何，有影响力的）与坏的和无关紧要的——区分开来——并审视其对全球公司和社会的影响。 根据定义，这是一项排他性而非包容性的任务。 如果想法或思想家完全没有通过测试，我们通常会将它们排除在外，而不是浪费笔墨来揭穿它们。

Needless to say, it would have been much easier (and often far more pleasurable) to have trashed the industry. There is a wealth of material for anybody hoping to produce a "hatchet job." What is actually needed, however, is a "scalpel-job," which is what we attempt to do in The Witch Doctors: we try to separate the good (or, at any rate, the influential) from the bad and the irrelevant—and to look at its effect on companies and society around the world. By definition, this has been an exclusive rather than an inclusive task. If ideas or thinkers fail the test completely, we have usually left them out, rather than wasting ink on debunking them.

我们首先研究最有影响力的时尚之一的生命周期和影响：再造（第 1 章）。 然后，我们转向生产和销售管理理论的庞大行业（第 2 章）及其两位著名的大师：彼得德鲁克（第 3 章）和汤姆彼得斯（第 4 章）。 德鲁克是现代管理之父，自然而然地介绍了我们这个时代的大部分重大辩论，而彼得斯则是过去两届中最具影响力的大师

We begin by looking at the life cycle and influence of one of the most influential fads: reengineering (Chapter 1). We then turn to the enormous industry that produces and sells management theory (Chapter 2) and two of its notable gurus: Peter Drucker (Chapter 3) and Tom Peters (Chapter 4). Drucker is the father of modern management and a natural introduction to most of the big debates of our time, while Peters has been the most influential guru of the past two

介绍

Introduction

数十年，不仅因为他所说的，还因为他说话的方式。

decades, not just because of what he has said but also because of the way that he has said it.

同样重要的是要了解传统公司结构在过去十年中崩溃的方式（第 5 章），以及公司内部因此发生的扭曲：尝试将知识、学习和创新结合起来的困难（第 6 章），以及“愿景”与其他形式的战略之间的冲突（第 7 章）。 问题是，所有这些想法，其中许多是老板强加的，是否真的给董事会带来了越来越大的压力，让领导变得越来越困难？ 最重要的是，公司的用途是什么，它们是只对股东负责还是对更广泛的利益相关者群体负责（第 8 章）？ 本节最后将审视所有这些公司的变动如何改变工作世界，以及随之而来的普通人的生活（第 9 章）。

It is also important to look at the way that traditional corporate structures have collapsed over the past decade (Chapter 5), as well as the contortions taking place within companies as a result: the difficulties of trying to combine knowledge, learning, and innovation (Chapter 6), and the conflict between "vision" and other forms of strategy (Chapter 7). The question is, are all these ideas, many of them imposed by bosses, actually putting increasing pressure on the boardroom and making leadership ever more difficult? Above all, what are companies for, and are they responsible to their shareholders alone or to a wider group of stakeholders (Chapter 8)? This section closes with a look at how all these corporate gyrations are changing the world of work, and with it the lives of ordinary people (Chapter 9).

另一个日益受到关注的问题是全球化以及地理因素在多大程度上决定了公司做什么和如何做（第 10 章）。 管理理论本身现在是一个全球性的产业。 精益生产是一种在美国发明但在日本发展起来的理念，它改变了世界各地工厂的运作方式； 日本公司正在努力向西方学习——但他们还有什么可以教给世界其他地方的吗（第 11 章）？ 在管理的新领域，即亚洲发展中国家，中国人开创了一种新型组织（第 12 章），但对西方管理思想的需求仍然很大。 是否会出现一种新的混合体，就像它曾经在日本出现过一样？

Another growing concern is globalization and the extent to which geography determines what companies do and how they do it (Chapter 10). Management theory itself is now a global industry. Lean production, an idea invented in America but developed in Japan, has changed the way that factories around the world operate; Japanese companies are struggling to learn from the West—but do they still have something to teach the rest of the world (Chapter 11)? On management's new frontier, the developing countries of Asia, the Chinese are pioneering a new sort of organization (Chapter 12), but Western management ideas are still in great demand. Will a new hybrid emerge just as it once did in Japan?

公共部门（第 13 章）是管理理论快速取得进展的一个领域（通常令人恐惧），在这个领域，医生现在必须决定治疗病人是否是他们的“核心能力”之一，教师发布使命宣言，以及将军们谈论战争是“最终的基准测试”。 另一个领域是更狂野的（但极其有利可图的）管理领域，其中学科与自助、未来学和彻头彻尾的庸医混杂在一起（第 14 章）。

One area where management theory is making fast—and often frightening—headway is the public sector (Chapter 13), a place where doctors now have to decide whether treating sick people is one of their "core competencies," teachers issue mission statements, and generals talk about war being "the ultimate benchmarking exercise." Another area is the wilder (but extremely profitable) realm of management, where the discipline mixes with self-help, futurology, and downright quackery (Chapter 14).

我们在进行审计时考虑了两组读者。 首先是大量已经购买商业书籍的人，但他们发现它们令人困惑和时髦——而且通常从未读完。 越来越多的人假设某种

We have conducted our audit with two groups of readers in mind. The first is the huge number of people who already buy business books, but who find them confusing and faddish—and usually never finish them. More and more people are assuming some sort of

介绍

INTRODUCTION

管理职责； 经理们越来越害怕失去工作。 这些人需要了解管理——而不仅仅是美国的管理。 我们使用的案例研究从斯德哥尔摩延伸到上海和首尔。 第二组由刚刚了解管理理论的“普通”读者组成。 这一类别应该包括几乎所有聪明的美国人，但它可能包括亚特兰大的一名政府工作人员，他想知道为什么他的妻子在可口可乐的工作被重新设计（并且想知道他是否很快也会被重新设计） ); 一位康奈尔大学的社会学教授，好奇地考察了一门富裕的邻近学科； 或想知道为什么比尔克林顿和纽特金里奇一直提到彼得德鲁克的政治活动家。

managerial responsibility; and managers are more and more frightened of losing their jobs. These people need to know about management—and not just American management. The case studies we use stretch from Stockholm to Shanghai and Seoul. The second group consists of "normal" readers who are only just becoming aware of management theory. This category should encompass virtually every intelligent American, but it could include a government worker in Atlanta who wants to know why his wife has been reengineered out of her job at Coca-Cola (and wonders if he will soon be reengineered out of his job too); a sociology professor at Cornell curious to inspect a wealthy neighboring discipline; or a political activist who wants to know why Bill Clinton and Newt Gingrich keep on mentioning Peter Drucker.

我们的目标是在不混淆通才的情况下挑战专业读者。 如果有任何行话以某种方式从我们的网络中漏掉，我们深表歉意。 一次又一次，面对一个理论或一本书中的一段话，我们会回到三个问题：它是可理解的吗？ 它增加的不仅仅是常识吗？ 有关系吗？ 简而言之，我们试图以他们中最重要的那些人——如彼得·德鲁克和迈克尔·波特——自己坚持认为他们希望自己的理论受到评判的相同术语来评判：作为一门严肃的“知识分子”学科。

Our aim has been to challenge the specialist readers without confusing the generalists. If any piece of jargon has somehow slipped through our net, we apologize. Time and again, confronted by a theory or a passage in a book, we have returned to three questions: Is it intelligible? Does it add more than mere common sense? Is it relevant? In short, we have tried to judge the gurus on the same terms that the foremost of them—such as Peter Drucker and Michael Porter—have themselves insisted that they wish their theories to be judged: as a serious "intellectual" discipline.

第一部分

PART ONE

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

第1章

CHAPTER 1

J>W®fc

J>W®fc

看到人们实践他们所宣扬的并以此为生的景象令人振奋：占星家靠彩票赚了数百万美元，或者婚姻指导顾问沉迷于奢侈。 因此，当与雄心勃勃的年轻咨询公司 CSC Index 有密切联系的独立顾问 Michael Treacy 和同一家公司的管理顾问 Fred Wiersema 在 1995 年初出版了一本名为《市场领导者的纪律》的书时，这似乎是完全合适的，尽管评论冷淡，但该书凭借其自身成为了市场领导者。 它在纽约时报畅销书排行榜上停留了 15 周，攀升至第五位并售出 250,000 册。

There is something heartening about the sight of people practicing what they preach and thriving on it: astrologers making millions on lotteries or marriage-guidance counselors wallowing in uxorious-ness. So when Michael Treacy, an independent consultant with strong links to CSC Index, an ambitious young consultancy, and Fred Wiersema, a management consultant at the same firm, published a book called The Discipline of Market Leaders in early 1995, it seemed entirely appropriate that, despite indifferent reviews, the book became a market leader in its own right. It stayed on the New York Times best-seller list for 15 weeks, climbing as high as number five and selling 250,000 copies.

这个成功故事一直持续到 8 月 7 日的《商业周刊》，该刊发表了一篇长文，声称这两位顾问与 CSC Index 合作，使用了与音乐行业的肮脏部分更常见的策略来获得他们的书进入图表。 对于市场领导者的纪律，顾问和他们的公司花费 250,000 美元在全国各地的书店购买了大约 10,000 本小批量的书，特别关注那些被认为是《纽约时报》的书。 据《商业周刊》报道，这些购买通常不是以 CSC Index 的名义或两位作者的名义进行的； 相反，其他员工和第三方购买了这些书

The success story lasted only until the August 7 edition of Business Week, which published a long article alleging that the two consultants, working in conjunction with CSC Index, had used tactics more commonly associated with the grubbier parts of the music industry to get their book into the charts. With The Discipline of Market Leaders, the consultants and their firm spent $250,000 buying some 10,000 copies of the book in small quantities at bookshops all around the country, paying special attention to those thought to be followed by The New York Times. The purchases, according to Business Week, were often not made in CSC Index's name or in the names of the two authors; instead, other employees and third parties bought the books

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

然后得到报销。 CSC Index 客户购买的另外 40,000 本也通过数百家小书店进行销售。 一家名为 Paragon 的数据库营销公司购买了 10,000 本书籍（CSC Index 已全额报销），不得不将副本存放在停在其办公室外的拖拉机拖车中。 长期以来，咨询公司购买大量员工编写的书籍作为免费赠品分发给他们的客户和潜在客户，或者只是为了装饰办公室，这很常见。 大约在同一时间，Gemini Consulting 购买了 5,000 册《组织变革》（1995 年），这是一本由其两名员工 Francis Gouillart 和 James Kelly 所著的书。 然而，这些购买通常是公开进行的，因此《纽约时报》可以考虑到这种企业的慷慨大方。

and were then reimbursed. Another 40,000 copies that were bought by CSC Index clients were also funneled through hundreds of small bookshops. A database marketing company called Paragon, which bought 10,000 copies of the book (for which it was fully reimbursed by CSC Index), had to store copies in a tractor-trailer parked outside its office. It has long been common for consultancies to buy large quantities of books written by their employees to distribute to their clients and prospective clients as freebies, or just to decorate the office. At about the same time Gemini Consulting was buying 5,000 copies of Transforming the Organization (1995), a book written by two of its own men, Francis Gouillart and James Kelly. However, these purchases are normally done in the open, so that The New York Times can take account of such corporate largesse.

Treacy 和 Wiersema 否认参与任何此类计划，CSC Index 也是如此。 但糟糕的宣传无疑损害了公司。 尽管乍一看花 250,000 美元以最昂贵的方式购买自己的书并没有什么好处，但让一本书进入纽约时报畅销书排行榜却有相当大的副产品。 它增加了该书的海外版权价值，也增加了未来任何书籍的可能预付款。 这也使作者成为扬声器电路中更有价值的商品（丑闻爆发时，特雷西的演讲收费为 30,000 美元）。 成功的光环本身会增加销售额：早先认为《市场领导者纪律》陈腐乏味的人认为其中一定有什么值得大惊小怪的。 然而，主要的潜在赢家是 CSC Index， 与作者共享市场领导者背后思想的版权，并且刚刚开始向其客户介绍这些理论。 它有望获得数千万美元的咨询费。

Treacy and Wiersema denied taking part in any such scheme, as did CSC Index. But the bad publicity undoubtedly damaged the company. Although at first sight there is little to be gained from spending $250,000 buying one's own book in the most expensive way possible, there are considerable spin-offs from getting a book into the New York Times best-seller lists. It increases the value of the book's overseas rights and also of the likely advances on any future books. It also makes the authors a more valuable commodity on the speaker circuit (Treacy was charging $30,000 for a talk when the scandal broke). And the aura of success itself increases sales: people who had earlier dismissed Discipline of Market Leaders as trite decided that there must be something in it to justify the fuss. However, the chief potential gainer had been CSC Index, which shared the copyright to the ideas behind the Market Leaders with the authors and was just beginning to introduce the theories to its customers. It stood to gain tens of millions of dollars in consulting fees.

《商业周刊》的文章产生了毁灭性的影响。 《纽约时报》调整了畅销书排行榜。 其他报纸和杂志报道了这个故事（如果迪斯尼没有决定在接下来的星期一竞购 ABC/Capital Cities，并在下周的大部分时间里垄断美国商业版，这个故事可能会变得更大）。 一位预约了作者发言的会议组织者抱怨说不得不处理参与者打来的愤怒电话。 《商业周刊》还称，CSC Index 使用类似的策略购买了 7,500 册大约同时出版的另一本书，名为 Reengineering Management (1995)。 这次作者

Business Week's article had a crushing effect. The New York Times adjusted its best-seller list. Other newspapers and magazines picked up the story (which might have grown still bigger had Disney not decided to bid for ABC/Capital Cities on the following Monday, monopolizing American business pages for most of the next week). One conference organizer who had booked the authors to speak complained about having to deal with angry telephone calls from participants. Business Week also alleged that CSC Index had used similar tactics to buy 7,500 copies of another book published about the same time, called Reengineering Management (1995). This time the author

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

James Champy，这家咨询公司的创始人之一。 为了结束糟糕的一个月，CSC Index 还失去了《纽约时报》一个利润丰厚的咨询项目的第二阶段。

was James Champy, one of the consultancy's founders. To complete a bad month, CSC Index also lost the second phase of a lucrative consulting project at The New York Times.

逆转工业革命

Reversing the Industrial Revolution

Market Leaders 的丑闻实际上是一个更大的故事的一章——有些人会称之为报应——一个更大的故事也涉及 CSC Index 和 Champy：一个关于再造的故事。 再造可以说是近年来最雄心勃勃的管理理论。 事实上，该运动的创始人 James Champy 和 Michael Hammer（从数学家转为计算机科学家，现在全职提倡再造）坚持认为，再造是自工业革命以来商业思维中最根本的变化。 再造告诉我们，如果管理者想要生存下去，就需要撕毁他们的旧蓝图并彻底重新设计他们的组织。 大师们说，根据理性而不是根据陈旧的传统重新设计，您将确信生产力会得到根本提高。 当被问及他以什么为生时，将数学家的逻辑与改教者的热情相结合的哈默回答说，很简单，“逆转工业革命。” 1个

The scandal over Market Leaders is actually a chapter—some would call it a comeuppance—in a much bigger story also involving CSC Index and Champy: a story about reengineering. Reengineering is arguably the most ambitious management theory of recent years. Indeed, the movement's founders, James Champy and Michael Hammer, a mathematician-turned-computer-scientist who now promotes reengineering full-time, insist that reengineering is the most radical change in business thinking since the industrial revolution. Reengineering teaches that managers need to tear up their old blueprints and completely redesign their organizations if they are to stand any chance of surviving. Redesign in the light of reason rather than according to worn-out traditions, say the gurus, and you will be assured of radical improvements in productivity. Asked what he does for a living, Hammer, who combines a mathematician's logic with a proselyte's enthusiasm, replies, quite simply, "reversing the industrial revolution." 1

再造是 1990 年代第一个伟大的管理时尚，它帮助数百万人失去了工作，并让数百万人以全新的方式工作。 在重组了美国公司之后，该学科的倡导者现在正在向公共部门和世界各地传播它的信息。 到 1996 年，几项调查显示从事再造的欧洲公司多于美国公司。 Champy 和 Hammer 的日文版 Reengineering the Corporation 在头三个月售出了 250,000 册。

Reengineering was the first great management fad of the 1990s, helping millions of people lose their jobs and millions more work in entirely new ways. Having reorganized corporate America, the discipline's apostles are now carrying its message to the public sector and around the world. By 1996 several surveys showed that more European firms than American ones were engaged in reengineering. The Japanese edition of Champy and Hammer's book, Reengineering the Corporation, sold 250,000 copies in its first three months.

为什么再造如此受欢迎？ 要回答这个问题，需要一点场景设置。 到 20 世纪 90 年代中期，大多数经理发现自己陷入了进退两难的境地。 他们对自己近乎盲目的投入的两个想法感到失望。 第一个是技术——尤其是个人电脑，现在每个经理的办公桌上都摆着一台机器。 计算机变得更快、更便宜并且更易于使用。 然而，有一个问题，由经济学家正式发现，但每个会算数的企业财务主管长期以来都怀疑：计算机并不能造人

Why was reengineering so wildly popular? To answer this question, a little scene-setting is necessary. By the mid-1990s most managers found themselves in a quandary. They felt let down by two ideas in which they had invested near-blind devotion. The first was technology—particularly the personal computer, a machine that now sat accusingly on every manager's desk. Computers were becoming faster, cheaper, and much easier to use. However, there was a hitch, officially discovered by economists, but long suspected by every corporate treasurer who could count: computers did not make people

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

任何更有成效。 尽管在整个 80 年代对信息技术进行了大量投资，但大多数可用数据表明公司从中获益甚微。

any more productive. Despite enormous investment in information technology throughout the 1980s, most of the available numbers showed that companies had gained very little from it.

另一个狡猾的朋友是再造、全面质量管理或 TQM 之前的时尚。 当再造准备席卷管理界时，反对“质量”已成为一种管理上的异端行为。 为了简化一点，TQM 意味着第一次就获得正确的产品和服务，而不是等到它们完成后再检查它们是否有错误。 正如每个美国经理都知道的那样，正是通过这种“魔鬼”技术，日本公司，如丰田，制造了更可靠的汽车，并从底特律“偷走了”美国市场。 到 1990 年代初，西方制造商开始模仿这些方法，并开始看到客户满意度和员工士气的提高。

The other treacherous friend was the fad that had preceded reengineering, total-quality management, or TQM. By the time reengineering was preparing to take the world of management by storm, it had become an act of managerial heresy to argue against "quality." To simplify a little, TQM meant getting products and services right the first time, rather than waiting for them to be finished before checking them for errors. As every American manager knows, it was through such "devilish" techniques that Japanese companies, such as Toyota, had built more reliable cars and "stolen" the American market from Detroit. By the early 1990s Western manufacturers were imitating those methods and beginning to see improvements in customer satisfaction and employee morale.

但是“信息技术”和“质量”有一个共同的根本问题：它们似乎涉及与以前大体相同的工作，同样的劳动力——只是用计算机来做，而且做起来更费心。 这台机器没有经过重新设计； 相反，它只是添加了一些新的小工具。 TQM 是一项特别棘手的业务。 质量专家约瑟夫朱兰在 1993 年估计，美国 500 强公司中只有 50 家达到了“世界级质量”。 由于几乎每个人都在这样做，质量已成为基本必需品，而不是竞争优势。 在这样的环境中，经理们开始意识到，生产力、市场份额和盈利能力的持续增长将不得不来自其他地方。 事情发生的时候， 一种新的管理理论已经开始在商学院和咨询公司中流行起来，就在这种不安的认识在美国各地的公司董事会中自我宣布的时候。 该理论具有将技术和质量结合为一体的附加优点。

But "information technology" and "quality" shared a fundamental problem: they seemed to involve doing much the same things as before, with much the same workforce—only doing them with computers and doing them more painstakingly. The machine had not been redesigned; rather, it had simply had a few new gadgets added to it. TQM was a particularly tricky business. Joseph Juran, a quality expert, estimated in 1993 that only 50 of the top 500 American companies had attained "world-class quality." And since virtually everybody was doing it, quality had become more of a basic necessity than a competitive advantage. In such an environment, managers began to sense that continued gains in productivity, market share, and profitability were going to have to come from somewhere else. As it happened, a new management theory had begun to make the rounds of the business schools and consultancies just as this uneasy realization was announcing itself in corporate boardrooms across the United States. The theory had the added virtue of combining technology and quality into one package.

处理亚当斯密

Disposing of Adam Smith

顾名思义，“业务流程再造”是试图将组织分解成其组成部分，然后将其中的一些重新组合在一起以创建一台新机器。 这意味着首先要问机器应该做什么——

"Business-process reengineering," as the name implies, is an attempt to break an organization down into its component parts and then put some of them together again to create a new machine. That means asking what the machine is expected to do in the first place—

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

用行话来说，“过程”应该实现什么。 在一个典型的再造项目中，10 到 20 名年轻顾问来到一家公司，绘制流程图，提议废除旧的会计程序，并建议来自不同部门的人在一个团队中合作（其中很大一部分失去了他们的能力）。工作）。 一家重新设计的公司的优势来自于它的效率，而不是专注于机器最终会产生什么。 过程比产品更重要； 的确，好的产品自然应该遵循好的流程。

in the jargon, what the "processes" are supposed to achieve. In a typical reengineering project, 10 to 20 young consultants descend on a company, draw up maps of process flows, propose ripping up old accounting procedures and suggest that people from different departments work together in one team (with a good portion of them losing their jobs). Rather than focusing on what comes out of the machine at the end, a reengineered company's edge comes from its efficiency.
