Process is more important than product; indeed, good products should naturally follow good processes.

这个概念屠杀了许多圣牛。 第一个是亚当·斯密。 在《国富论》（1776 年）中，斯密提倡一种基于员工专业化和规模经济的生产体系​​。 他的著名观察是，与每个工人制作整个别针的团队相比，一组每个人都专注于任务的特定部分的制针师可以制作更多的别针。 亨利·福特和阿尔弗雷德·斯隆等实业家完善了这个系统，建立装配线并将工人分成不同的部门，例如营销和设计。 大规模生产总是有它的缺点，让许多工人感到无聊和疏远； 最近，由于需求变得更加不平衡，机器接管了越来越多的卑微工作，其存在的全部理由受到了再造工程师的质疑。

This concept slaughters a number of sacred cows. The first is Adam Smith. In The Wealth of Nations (1776), Smith advocated a system of production based on employee specialization and economies of scale. His famous observation is that a group of pin makers who each concentrate on a particular part of the task can make more pins than a group in which each worker makes the whole pin. Industrialists such as Henry Ford and Alfred Sloan perfected this system, building assembly lines and splitting workers into different departmental fiefs, such as marketing and design. Mass production always had its downside, leaving many workers bored and alienated; more recently, its whole raison d'etre has been questioned by the reengineers, as demand has become more uneven and machines have taken over more and more menial jobs.

再造的发现之一是，作为信息技术的结果，回到亚当斯密拒绝的系统往往更有效率。 为什么要花六周时间来处理一张信用表，每个专家填写一行然后将其传递给同事，而一个配备了计算机来处理任何专业问题的职员可以在仅仅90分钟？ 再工程师们争辩说，重要的是客户：客户不关心应该由哪个部门经理在表格上签字：他或她想要的只是一个快速的回答和一个可以对此负责的人。 2个

One of reengineering's discoveries is that, as a result of information technology, it is often more efficient to turn back to the system Adam Smith rejected. Why should it take six weeks to process a credit form, with each specialist filling out a single line before passing it on to a colleague, when a single clerk, armed with a computer to deal with any specialized problems, could get the job done in just 90 minutes? What matters, argue the reengineers, is the customer: and the customer does not care which departmental manager is supposed to sign a form: all he or she wants is a quick answer and somebody who can be held responsible for it. 2

再造者将许多企业惰性归咎于主导大多数大型组织的巨大“功能烟囱”，例如营销部门或信息技术部门。 再造顾问一再发现，浪费在任何特定流程上的大部分时间都浪费在了将信息和组件从一个部门转移到另一个部门的过程中。 再造更喜欢将来自不同职能部门的人分组

Reengineers blame a lot of corporate inertia on the great "functional chimneys," such as marketing departments or information technology departments, that dominate most big organizations. Reengineering consultants have repeatedly discovered that most of the time wasted on any particular process is frittered away during the transfer of information and components from one department to another. Reengineering prefers to group people from different functions

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

进入致力于执行跨越多个职能的流程的团队。 因此，来自营销、设计和研究的人员可以聚集在一个致力于“新产品开发过程”的团队中。

into teams dedicated to carrying out processes that span several functions. Thus people from marketing, design, and research can be gathered together in a team devoted to the "new product development process."

这样的重组也摆脱了再造最喜欢的替罪羊，即中层管理者。 如果一家公司正确地使用信息技术，就不需要在高层和车间之间建立一个连接层。 信息应该只是“水平地”传递而不是“垂直地”过滤。

Such a reorganization also gets rid of reengineering's favorite scapegoat, the middle manager. If a firm uses information technology correctly, there is no need to have a connecting layer of people between the powers on high and the shop floor. Information should just zip around "horizontally" rather than filter down "vertically."

“不要自动化，抹杀”

"Don't Automate, Obliterate"

用它自己刺耳的、毁灭性的语气来说，再设计听起来有点疯狂。 然而，很容易理解为什么即使是非常理智的经理也会接受这个想法。 在业务似乎变得越来越复杂、答案越来越不确定的时候，当其他大师命令管理者通过学习如何生活在“一个不理性的时代”或“在混乱中求生存”来屈服于他们的环境时，再造承诺确定性和控制。 最后，这里提供了一份清晰、严肃的指南，帮助他们重建业务并打败竞争对手。 它也很现代，可以说是第一个使用计算机作为起点的管理理论，而不仅仅是一个巧妙的补充。 它以罕见的华丽面貌被推向市场。

Put in its own strident, devastating tones, reengineering can sound a little mad. However, it is easy to see why even perfectly sane managers have latched onto the idea. At a time when business seems to be getting more complicated and the answers more uncertain, when other gurus order managers to surrender to their circumstances by learning how to live in "an age of unreason" or to "thrive on chaos," reengineering promises certainty and control. Here, at last, is a clear-cut, no-nonsense guide to rebuilding their business and beating the competition. It is also engagingly modern, arguably the first management theory to use computers as a starting point, rather than just a neat addition. And it has been marketed with rare panache.

再造是两个机构的产物，这两个机构位于马萨诸塞州剑桥市，彼此的想法和人员相互补充：CSC Index，巨型计算机科学公司的咨询部门，以及麻省理工学院的斯隆管理学院。 这两个机构都着迷于计算机革命对工作性质和组织结构的影响。 “再造”一词最初是在 20 世纪 80 年代中期创造的，当时 Index Group（CSC Index 的前身之一）的一群受过麻省理工学院培训的年轻顾问策划了对他们自己的“业务流程”的重大重组。 Thomas Gerrity，当时曾在 Index 和麻省理工学院工作，现在是沃顿商学院院长， 回忆起当时因为过于“技术人员”而无法流行而驳回了这个词。 3 但事实证明，“技术人员”正是美国企业所需要的。

Reengineering was the product of two institutions that are just around the corner from each other in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and that feed off each other's ideas and personnel: CSC Index, the consulting arm of the giant Computer Sciences Corporation, and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology's Sloan School of Management. Both institutions were obsessed with the implications of the computer revolution for the nature of work and the structure of organizations. The term "reengineering" was first coined in the mid-1980s when a group of young MIT-trained consultants at the Index Group, one of CSC Index's antecedents, masterminded a major restructuring of their own "business processes." Thomas Gerrity, who then held jobs with both Index and MIT and is now Dean of Wharton Business School, recalls dismissing the term as far too "techie" to catch on. 3 But it turned out that "techie" was just what American business wanted.

大多数商人第一次听说再造是在 Michael Hammer 在 1990 年 7 月/8 月版的一篇文章中

The first place most businessmen heard about reengineering was in an article by Michael Hammer in the July/August 1990 edition of

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

哈佛商业评论，恰当地命名为“再造工作：不要自动化，抹杀”。 三年后，尚比和哈默在《企业再造》一书中更仔细地阐述了这些想法。 它以 17 种语言发行了近 200 万册，是自《追求卓越》以来最畅销的商业书籍之一。 商业媒体以非凡的热情抓住了这个词：标题中使用“再造”的文章数量从 1990 年的 10 篇增加到 1994 年的 800 多篇。 4

the Harvard Business Review, appropriately entitled "Reengineering Work: Don't Automate, Obliterate." Three years later Champy and Hammer laid out the ideas more carefully in Reengineering the Corporation. With sales of almost 2 million copies in 17 languages, it was one of the biggest-selling business books since In Search of Excellence. The business press latched onto the word with extraordinary enthusiasm: the number of articles using "reengineering" in the title increased from 10 in 1990 to well over 800 in 1994. 4

很快，每一家值得挂图的咨询公司都在推销某种形式的再造。 管理咨询公司 Arthur D. Little 将其称为“高性能业务”； 双子座用了“转变”这个词。 业务开始运转。会计和咨询公司普华永道在 1994 年进行的一项调查发现，78% 的财富 500 强公司和 68% 的英国公司都在进行某种形式的再造。 CSC Index同时进行的一项调查得出了几乎相同的数字，但它也发现每家公司的平均再造项目数量在美国是3.3个，在欧洲是3.8个。 该纪律也不限于企业巨头。 管理会计师协会对 2,200 家美国公司进行的更广泛调查

Soon every consultancy worth its flipchart was marketing some form of reengineering. Arthur D. Little, a management consultancy, called it "high-performance business"; Gemini used the word "transformation." And the business rolled in. A survey in 1994 by Price Waterhouse, an accountancy and consultancy firm, found that 78 percent of Fortune 500 companies and 68 percent of British firms were engaged in some form of reengineering. A survey by CSC Index at the same time produced nearly identical figures, but it also found that the average number of reengineering projects for each company was 3.3 in America and 3.8 in Europe. Nor was the discipline limited to corporate giants. A broader survey of 2,200 American companies by the Institute of Management Accountants' Controllers Council in October 1994 found that 60 percent were engaged in some kind of reengineering.

再造工程也已经从其制造业中心地带扩展到服务业、公用事业和公共部门。 威廉·布拉顿 (William Bratton) 是该纪律在美国最大胆的拥护者之一，他于 1994 年至 1996 年初担任纽约警察局局长。该纪律也在地理上传播开来。 在迅速传播的日本，它是由美国公司的当地子公司率先推出的，例如 IBM 日本。 1993 年 12 月，一家日本咨询公司的一场题为“再工程提案——日本式”的讲座吸引了如此多的听众，以至于该咨询公司又开了两场讲座。 1994年初的读卖新闻，a． 流行报纸将“再造”和“中国”列为当年的两个关键词。

Reengineering has also been spreading out of its manufacturing heartland and into service businesses, utilities, and the public sector. One of the boldest apostles of the discipline in America is William Bratton, the head of New York's Police Department from 1994 to early 1996. The discipline has spread geographically as well. In Japan, where it spread quickly, it was pioneered by the local subsidiaries of American companies, such as IBM Japan. In December 1993 a lecture session by a Japanese consultancy entitled "Proposal for Reengineering—Japanese Style" drew such a large crowd that the consultancy put on two more lectures. In early 1994 the Yomiuri Shinbun, a. popular newspaper, cited "reengineering" alongside "China" as the two key words for that year.

比疾病还严重？

Worse than the Disease?

不可避免地，对抹杀如此大惊小怪的纪律与一个词联系在一起：缩小规模。 首席调查

Inevitably, the discipline that made such a fuss about obliteration became associated with one word: downsizing. A survey of chief

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

1995 年 5 月，80 家美国大公司的财务人员发现，想要进行再造的主要原因是削减成本（29%），紧随其后的是“某个重要人物说我们应该这样做”（26%）。 只有十分之一的人这样做主要是为了改善服务或质量。 5 其他调查的结果非常相似。

financial officers at 80 big American companies in May 1995 found that the main reason for wanting to do reengineering was cost cutting (29 percent), followed closely by "someone important said we should do it" (26 percent). Only a tenth did it primarily to improve service or quality. 5 Other surveys had fairly similar results.

1994 年，美国企业的利润增长了 11%，但它也裁掉了 516,069 个工作岗位，并花费了 100 亿美元用于重组费用。 6 最引人注目的瘦身者包括一些最大的赚钱机器：美孚、宝洁、American Home Products 和莎莉。 宝洁首席执行官埃德温·阿茨特 (Edwin Artzt) 表示，他的公司正从 106,000 名员工中裁员 13,000 人以保持竞争力——他斥责公众认为公司重组是麻烦的征兆：“这绝对不是我们的情况。” 7 股市当然不再持怀疑态度：当美孚公司在 1995 年初宣布其裁员十分之一的计划时，这家石油公司的股价飙升至 52 周以来的新高。 同样的重组与企业活力的关联似乎正在其他国家发展：英国 1995 年 9 月，美国股市创下新高，同一周宣布裁员，制药巨头葛兰素威康 (Glaxo-Wellcome) 的 9,000 人受到影响； 在法国，裁员狂热后来才到来，Moulinex 的股票在 1996 年 6 月披露计划裁员 2,600 人（占其员工总数的五分之一）后的第二天上涨了 21%。

In 1994 corporate America saw its profits rise 11 percent, yet it also eliminated 516,069 jobs and spent $10 billion on restructuring charges. 6 The most dramatic slimmers included some of the biggest money machines: Mobil, Procter & Gamble, American Home Products, and Sara Lee. Edwin Artzt, P&G's chief, said that his firm was cutting 13,000 out of its 106,000 workers to stay competitive—and he scolded the public for thinking that corporate restructuring was a sign of trouble: "That is definitely not our situation." 7 The stock market was certainly no longer skeptical: when Mobil announced its plan to shed a tenth of its workforce in early 1995, the oil company's shares jumped to a 52-week high. The same association of restructuring with corporate virility seemed to be developing in other countries: Britain's stock market reached a new peak in September 1995, in the same week as a blitz of job-loss announcements, which affected 9,000 people at Glaxo-Wellcome, a pharmaceutical giant; and in France, where the downsizing cult arrived later, shares in Moulinex jumped by 21 percent the day after the appliance maker disclosed plans to cut 2,600 jobs (a fifth of its workforce) in June 1996.

重新设计在多大程度上对这种流血行为负责？ 许多减肥者直接引用了该学科。 美国电话公司 GTE 就是这种情况。 1994 年初，它提供了一项再造计划的详细信息，该计划将把客户服务中心从 171 个减少到 11 个，将收入收集中心从 5 个减少到 1 个。总共将在未来三年裁掉 17,000 个工作岗位，约 1.2 美元亿美元将投资于新技术，但每年可能节省的成本约为 10 亿美元。 8 显然，再造已成为当时主要的管理时尚，并正在制定议程。 甚至那些以自己的方式减肥的公司仍在考虑进行再造的竞争对手。 就像一对无处不在的电视有氧教练，

To what extent was reengineering responsible for this bloodletting? Many slimmers cited the discipline directly. That was the case at GTE, an American telephone company. In early 1994 it gave details of a reengineering program that would cut its customer-service centers from 171 to 11, and its revenue-collection centers from 5 to 1. In all, 17,000 jobs would go in the next three years, and some $1.2 billion would be invested in new sorts of technology, but the potential cost savings would be about $1 billion per year. 8 Clearly, reengineering had become the predominant management fad of the time and was setting the agenda. Even those companies that were shedding weight in their own way were still thinking about their rivals who were reengineering. Like a pair of omnipresent television-aerobic instructors, Hammer and Champy did not actually need to be at a manager's shoulder to make him or her feel overweight.

责任问题实际上是一个有实际意义的问题，因为到 1994 年底，美国已经开始怀疑对美国到底有多好

The question of responsibility is actually a moot one because by late 1994 there were doubts in America about just how good for the

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

耐心所有这些减肥被证明是。 诚然，它帮助美国提高了竞争力，至少在一段时间内是这样。 美国的单位劳动力成本正在下降，而日本和德国的单位劳动力成本却在上升。 不幸的是，到 1994 年，也有迹象表明它走得太远了，人们开始谈论“厌食症公司”。 美国管理协会的一项研究表明，在任何一年裁员的公司中，有三分之二在第二年再次这样做； 四分之一的受访者在过去五年的三年或更长时间里这样做过。 位于马萨诸塞州的咨询公司 Mitchell & Co. 的另一项研究发现，裁员公司的股票在宣布裁员后的六个月内表现优于股市。 三年后，他们落后了。

patient all this slimming was proving to be. True, it had helped make America more competitive, at least for a while. America's unit-labor costs were falling whereas those of Japan and Germany had risen. Unfortunately, by 1994 there were also signs that it had gone too far, with people beginning to talk about "the anorexic corporation." One study by the American Management Association showed that two-thirds of firms cutting back in any given year did so again the next year; and a quarter of those surveyed had done so in three or more of the past five years. Another study, by Mitchell & Co., a Massachusetts-based consultancy, found that the shares of downsizing companies outperformed the stock market for six months after a downsizing was announced. Three years later they lagged.

任何再造人员对此类统计数据的第一反应当然是声称裁员与再造之间存在相当大的差异。 然而，关于重新设计本身的现有证据仅略好于关于裁员的证据。 诚然，有确认的重新设计成功的例子，特别是 Bell Atlantic、Federal Express、Ford 和 Hallmark Cards。 顾问们也大肆宣传他们的客户在多大程度上提高了他们的生产力。 根据对其客户的研究，CSC Index 得出结论，从根本上改变业务流程会导致“平均降低 48% 的成本、80% 的时间和 60% 的缺陷”。 （在一个典型的再造夸张中，咨询公司继续说：“

The first response of any reengineer to such statistics is, of course, to claim that there is a sizable difference between downsizing and reengineering proper. However, the available evidence on reengi-neering proper is only slightly better than that on downsizing. True, there are examples of confirmed reengineered successes, notably Bell Atlantic, Federal Express, Ford, and Hallmark Cards. There is also plenty of hype from consultants about how much their clients have increased their productivity. From studies of its clients CSC Index concluded that fundamentally changing a business process produced "an average improvement of 48 percent in costs, 80 percent in time and 60 percent in defects." (In a typical piece of reengineering hyperbole, the consultancy went on to say: "The results are startling— but then reengineering is defined in part by the outrageousness of its goals and the ambition of its scope.") 9

然而，一旦调查范围扩大到包括其他人的客户，这样的结果就会烟消云散。 Arthur D. Little 在 1994 年夏天进行的一项调查发现，只有 16% 的经理人完全满意； 68% 的人遇到了意想不到的问题。 到 1994 年底，甚至迈克尔·哈默 (Michael Hammer) 和詹姆斯·钱皮 (James Champy) 也承认，许多重新设计的尝试都没有达到他们的目标。

However, as soon as surveys widen to include other people's clients, such results evaporate. A survey by Arthur D. Little in the summer of 1994 found that only 16 percent of managers were fully satisfied; and 68 percent were encountering unexpected problems. By late 1994 even Michael Hammer and James Champy were admitting that many attempts at reengineering were falling short of their goals.

质量欢迎过程

The Quality-Welcome Process

那么再造有多成功呢？ 不出所料，答案是该学科擅长某些事情而不擅长其他事情。 考虑一个被认为是再造成功案例的公司的案例研究。

So how successful is reengineering? The answer, unsurprisingly, is that the discipline is good at some things and not so good at others. Consider a case study of a company regarded as one of reengineer-ing's successes.

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

1992 年 9 月，英国劳埃德银行 (Lloyds Bank) 着手进行大规模的再造工作：到 1995 年中期，它改变了占其每个分支机构成本三分之二的业务，并涉及几乎所有 29,000 名员工。 10 在许多方面，Lloyds 是一个模型再造者（不仅仅是因为它得到了 Champy 的咨询公司 CSC Index 的建议）。 尽管削减成本是一个动机，但该银行转向再造主要是因为担心其服务质量——尤其是与建筑协会（英国相当于储蓄和贷款公司）相比。 另一个相关的问题是组织——或者说缺乏组织。 在 1980 年代，仅通过增加员工就可以为当地分支机构提供无数新服务。 “

In September 1992 Britain's Lloyds Bank embarked on a massive reengineering effort: by mid-1995 it had changed operations that accounted for two-thirds of the costs at each of its branches and involved nearly all its 29,000 employees. 10 In many ways Lloyds was a model reengineer (and not just because it was advised by CSC Index, Champy's consultancy). Although cost cutting was a motive, the bank turned to reengineering principally because of worries about the quality of its service—particularly in comparison with building societies (Britain's equivalent of savings and loan companies). Another related problem was organization—or rather the lack of it. During the 1980s countless new services had been bolted on to local branches, simply by adding more staff. "We saw the branch system as an enormous bucket into which things could just be dropped," Gordon Pell, the general manager of Lloyds retail operations, recalls.

与其他行业一样，再造被证明是改造劳埃德银行后台以更好地利用技术的好方法。 在该银行的旧系统下，员工被分配到行政等级制度中的狭窄职位。 从客户的角度来看，无数的人和纸片参与了这些工作，这些工作是同一过程的一部分。 例如，在旧的开户系统下，随着不同的员工订购银行卡、检查信用详细信息等，一张纸可能要花一个月的时间从一张桌子转移到另一张桌子。 经过重新设计，一个人负责基本上无纸化（虽然名字荒谬）的“质量欢迎”流程，花了不到一周的时间。

As in other industries, reengineering proved a good way to remodel the back office of Lloyds so as to make better use of technology. Under the bank's old system, staff were slotted into narrow jobs in an administrative hierarchy. Countless people and bits of paper were involved in jobs that, from the customer's point of view, were part of the same process. Under the old system of opening an account, for instance, a piece of paper could spend a month being shuffled from desk to desk as different staff ordered bank cards, checked credit details, and so on. Reengineered so that one person was responsible for a largely paperless (though absurdly named) "quality-welcome" process, it took well under a week.

其他五个进程也被分解并在模拟“实验室”中重新组装，然后以一系列“波浪”传播到整个网络。 在某些情况下，流程看起来有点做作：在重新设计之前，客户将他们的账户转移到另一家银行只是简单地告诉劳埃德他们的新账户在哪里； 在“客户保留流程”下，他们会接受面谈，有时还会被说服留下来。 这看起来只不过是常识性营销，但劳埃德银行的老板们坚称，他们之所以想到这一点，只是因为重新设计。

Five other processes were also broken down and reassembled in a mock "laboratory" before being spread across the network in a series of "waves." In some cases the processes look a little contrived: before reengineering, customers moving their account to another bank simply told Lloyds where their new account was; under the "customer retention process," they are interviewed and sometimes persuaded to stay. This looks like no more than common-sense marketing, but Lloyds bosses insist that it was only thanks to reengineering that they thought of it.

所有流程都受到密切监控（再次使用技术），伦敦摄政街劳埃德银行分行的年轻助理凯特·佩珀 (Kate Pepper) 可以证明这一点。 Pepper 过去常常在遇到客户后的第二天发送开户表格； 在重组下，她立即将他们派出去，从而增加了

All the processes are monitored closely (once again, using technology), as Kate Pepper, a young assistant at Lloyds's branch in London's Regent Street, can attest. Pepper used to send out forms for opening an account the day after she met a customer; under the reorganization, she sent them out immediately and thereby increased the

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

分支机构对此过程的计算机生成分数从 45% 提高到 90%。 但部分改变是让“神秘顾客”——劳埃德派出的间谍——密切监视她的表现。 现在，Pepper 和她同事的薪水中越来越多的部分与​​他们的表现挂钩。

branch's computer-generated score for this process from 45 percent to 90 percent. But part of the change was to have her performance closely monitored by "mystery shoppers"—spies sent by Lloyds. And an increasing proportion of Pepper's salary and those of her colleagues is now tied to their performance.

但是新方法有效吗？ 该银行从再造中获得的最明显收益是财务方面的。 劳埃德银行不会给出任何确切数字，但它声称该项目已经轻松地清除了该银行 12% 的资本回报率。 重新设计带来的许多变化很快就收回了成本。 一方面，有问题的支票簿订单数量下降了 30%——足以支付为监控该活动而购买的所有计算机的费用。

But did the new approach work? The bank's most obvious gain from reengineering has been financial. Lloyds will not give any exact figures, but it claims that the project has comfortably cleared the bank's 12 percent return on capital. Many of the changes introduced by reengineering paid for themselves rapidly. For one thing, the number of faulty checkbook orders fell by 30 percent—enough to pay for all the computers bought to monitor that activity.

然而，对于所有及时的支票簿，劳埃德银行实现其让客户满意的主要目标的证据要少得多。 1996 年初，包括劳埃德银行在内的英国银行受到的爱戴甚至低于十年之初。 原因之一是客户越来越多地遇到因裁员而士气低落的脾气暴躁的员工。 所有的英国银行都在努力削减成本并使以前由人类完成的工作自动化。 为此，他们在 1989 年至 1995 年间裁掉了大约 80,000 人，并谈到要再裁掉 70,000 人。

For all the timely checkbooks, however, there is much less evidence that Lloyds has met its primary goal of making customers happy. Britain's banks, including Lloyds, were even less loved at the beginning of 1996 than they had been at the start of the decade. One reason for this is that customers increasingly encountered grumpy staff demoralized by downsizing. All the British banks struggled to cut costs and to automate jobs previously done by humans. In so doing, they shed some 80,000 people between 1989 and 1995 and talked of laying off another 70,000.

再造是否加剧了这种不安？ 劳埃德避免使用“再造”一词（一位内部人士承认，“太多人将其与毁灭联系在一起”），而是选择了“服务质量改进计划”或 SQIP。 然而，痛苦和担忧是显而易见的。 仅在摄政街，SQIP 结合其他变化，到 1995 年中期，员工人数从 42 人减少到 18 人。 分支机构总数已从 2,100 个减少到 1,800 个。 与其他地方一样，再造对中层管理人员来说尤其艰难：80 个区域经理职位中有 41 个消失了。

Did reengineering contribute to this unease? Lloyds avoided using the word "reengineering" ("too many people associated it with obliteration," admitted one insider), opting instead for a "service quality improvement program," or SQIP. Nevertheless, the pain and worry were obvious. In Regent Street alone, SQIP, combined with other changes, saw the staff decline from 42 to 18 by mid-1995. The total number of branches had been cut from 2,100 to 1,800. As elsewhere, reengineering was particularly tough on middle managers: 41 out of 80 area-manager jobs disappeared.

什么时候停止？ 再造帮助 Lloyds 将运营成本与收入的比率从 1990 年的 64.3% 降低到 1994 年的 63.6%，但许多金融公司的比率低于 60%。 正如这些比率一直在下降一样，客户满意度也在下降。 在美国，一些银行向使用人工柜员而不是 ATM 的人收费； 在英国，诸如 First Direct 之类的电话银行业务正在吸引人们远离银行，而客户已经发现，与电话另一端的语音相比，这些银行并不友好。 劳埃德银行的员工也清楚地认为他们需要一个

When will it stop? Reengineering had helped Lloyds reduce the ratio of operating costs to revenues from 64.3 percent in 1990 to 63.6 percent in 1994, but many financial firms have ratios below 60 percent. Just as these ratios have been declining, so has customer satisfaction. In America, some banks are charging people for using human tellers rather than ATMs; in Britain, telephone banking such as First Direct is drawing people away from banks that customers already find no more friendly than a voice at the other end of the telephone. The staff at Lloyds, too, plainly think that they need a

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

喘息。 他们可能没有意识到的是，下一波再造浪潮必须更加基础，甚至可能质疑劳埃德银行是否需要一个分支网络。

breather. What they may not realize is that the next reengineering wave will have to be more fundamental and might even question whether Lloyds needs a branch network at all.

反弹开始

The Backlash Begins

尽管它陷入了一个似乎需要越来越少的人的行业，但从再造的角度来看，劳埃德并没有被太多血溅。 1994 年 1 月，纽约市和东北部大片地区的电话公司 Nynex 启动了一项耗资 30 亿美元的计划，裁员 16,800 人，占其员工总数的 22%。 11 与 Lloyds 一样，任何成本效益分析都表明，这项工作为自己带来了数倍的回报。 然而，正如 1995 年《商业周刊》的封面故事所表明的那样，这些变化严重损害了士气。 “官员们掌握着自己的命运，”一名 Nynex 员工说。 “我们没有参与。我们受到了影响。” 该计划的建筑师 Robert Thrasher——现在被称为“Thrasher the slasher” ——不得不关掉家里的答录机，因为他收到了太多辱骂信息。 在另一家电话公司 GTE，员工对裁员感到非常愤怒，以至于他们播放广播广告详细说明其所谓的服务下降。

Although it is stuck in an industry that seems to need fewer and fewer people, Lloyds is, in reengineering terms, not too blood-spattered. In January 1994 Nynex, the telephone company for New York City and for a good piece of the northeast, embarked on a $3 billion program that got rid of 16,800 people, or 22 percent of its workforce. 11 As with Lloyds, any cost-benefit analysis would show that the exercise paid for itself several times over. As a cover story in Business Week in 1995 made clear, however, the changes badly damaged morale. "The officers are in charge of their own fates," said a Nynex worker. "We're not involved. We're affected." The plan's architect, Robert Thrasher—now known as "Thrasher the slasher"—had to turn off his answering machine at home because he received so many abusive messages. At another telephone company, GTE, employees have been so enraged by cutbacks that they have run radio advertisements detailing its alleged declining service.

正是在这种背景下，许多管理思想家开始诅咒再造。 Charles Handy 称其为“裁员的礼貌用语”，他宣称“将组织拆散不利于承诺和欣快的状态......当重新设计做得不好时 - 它主要是 - 的问题在于它让人们破碎，甚至留下的人。” 12 Gary Hamel 和 CK Prahalad 合着的 Competing for the Future (1994) 是 20 世纪 90 年代中期最有影响力的一本书，认为再造“更多地是为了支撑今天的业务，而不是创造明天的行业任何成功重组的公司

It was against this background that many management thinkers started damning reengineering. Calling it "a polite word for downsizing," Charles Handy declared that "blowing organizations apart is not conducive to a state of commitment and euphoria.. . . The trouble with reengineering when it is done badly—which it mostly is—is that it leaves people shattered, even the people left behind." 12 The most influential book of the mid-1990s, Competing for the Future (1994) by Gary Hamel and C. K. Prahalad, argues that reengineering has "more to do with shoring up today's businesses than creating tomorrow's industries Any company that succeeds at restructuring

和再造，但未能创造未来的市场，将发现自己在跑步机上，试图在昨天企业的利润和利润稳步下降的情况下领先一步。”13

and reengineering, but fails to create the markets of the future, will find itself on a treadmill, trying to keep one step ahead of the steadily declining margins and profits of yesterday's businesses." 13

重新设计人员试图与这种批评作斗争。 他们的策略之一是引用对他们有利的统计数据。 CSC Index 仍然坚信再造本身并没有导致巨大的失业。 根据 CSC 指数研究，每项再造计划平均仅消除 282 个工作岗位（或所涉及的总工作岗位的 22%）

The reengineers have tried to fight such criticism. One of their tactics has been to cite statistics in their favor. CSC Index still firmly believes that reengineering itself did not lead to huge job losses. According to a CSC Index study, each reengineering initiative wiped out an average of only 282 jobs (or 22 percent of the total involved in

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

每次重组）。 在欧洲，这个数字是 1,001。 在许多情况下，工作岗位是自愿裁掉的，或者人员被转移到组织的其他部门。 当所有这些举措被平均计算出来时，CSC Index 得出的裁员数字为美国每家公司裁员 336 人，欧洲每家公司裁员 760 人。

each reorganization). In Europe the figure was 1,001. In many cases, the jobs were shed voluntarily or the people were moved to other parts of the organization. By the time all these moves are averaged out, CSC Index puts the figure for layoffs at just 336 employees per firm in America and 760 in Europe.

然而，更常见的辩护是人们没有正确地重新设计。 有些人只是在裁员并称之为再造； 其他人则试图照着这本书看，但没能读完前几章。 Champy 声称，只有大约十分之一的公司进行再造是正确的。 “许多批评是基于对再造真正含义的误解，”迈克尔·哈默 (Michael Hammer) 于 1994 年 11 月 5 日在《经济学人》(The Economist) 中写道，“而其余的大部分则反映了对其重要性的有限评估。”

However, a more common defense has been that people were not reengineering properly. Some people were just slashing their workforces and calling it reengineering; others were trying to go by the book but failing to read past the first few chapters. Champy claimed that only about 1 in 10 companies undergoing reengineering was doing it right. "Much of the criticism is based on a misconception of what reengineering really is," Michael Hammer wrote in The Economist on November 5, 1994, "and much of the rest reflects a limited assessment of its significance."

撇开道歉不谈，再造似乎确实存在真正的问题。 具有讽刺意味的是，最大的问题之一是该纪律与再工程师假装鄙视的秒表管理类型太接近了。 Frederick Taylor 和 Henry Ford 等管理先驱对流程着迷； 他们也是管理的软性、人性化方面的糟糕实践者。 再造——有点像泰勒主义——如果人们都是不思考的机器人，没有心灵或灵魂，就会运作良好。 然而，仅仅告诉营销人员他不再是营销部门的成员而是“产品开发过程”的一部分并不能阻止他像营销人员一样思考。

Apologias aside, there do appear to be real problems with reengineering. Ironically, one of the biggest is that the discipline is far too close to the type of stopwatch management that the reengineers pretended to despise. Management pioneers such as Frederick Taylor and Henry Ford were fascinated by processes; they were also lousy practitioners of the softer, human side of management. Reengineering—a little like Taylorism—would work well if people were all unthinking automatons, without hearts or souls. However, simply telling a marketing man that he is no longer a member of the marketing department but part of the "product-development process" does not stop him thinking like a marketing man.

再造对流程而非产品的痴迷也引发了一些问题。 试图将公司的竞争优势从它制造的东西转移到它如何做的可能是成熟、稳定的业务中的明智策略——例如，制造牛奶盒。 然而，如果一家处于瞬息万变的行业的公司生产了错误的产品，那么裁员再多也无济于事。 IBM 的大型机部门可能就是一个很好的例子。 许多再造工作的首批受害者之一是战略部门； 但是，如果没有某种程度的战略思想或远见，再造总是冒着建造一台超级机器的风险，而这台机器的唯一目的就是生产出过时的产品。

Reengineering's obsession with process rather than product also raises some questions. Trying to shift a firm's competitive advantage from what it makes to how it does so might be a sensible strategy in a mature, stable business—manufacturing milk cartons, for instance. If a firm in a faster-changing industry is making the wrong product, however, then no amount of downsizing is going to help it. IBM's mainframe division may be a case in point. One of the first victims of many reengineering efforts is the strategy department; but without some degree of strategic thought or vision, reengineering always risks building a superb machine whose only purpose is to churn out antiquated products.

如果说战略卷土重来，那么另一个最受欢迎的再造代言人——中层经理也卷土重来。 再工程师将中层管理人员视为横向组织的障碍。

If strategy has made something of a comeback, so too has another favorite whipping boy of reengineering, the middle manager. Reengineers see middle managers as barriers to horizontal organizations.

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

然而，它们也可以成为公司文化的源泉，以及有价值信息的宝库。 事实证明，在将董事会的战略家与现场的运营人员联系起来方面，计算机往往不如在组织中拥有长期经验的经理成功。 在许多情况下，在第一年缩减规模并节省大量成本的公司发现，这些节省的成本蒸发殆尽，因为他们不得不培训员工从事许多中层管理人员熟知的工作。

Yet they can also be the source of a company's culture, and the repositories of valuable information. Computers, it emerges, are often less successful at connecting the strategists in the boardroom to operational staff in the field than managers with long experience with the organization. In many cases, firms that have downsized and produced big cost savings in the first year have seen those savings evaporate as they have had to train people to do jobs that many middle managers knew by heart.

《加州管理评论》1995 年底发表的一项美国公司研究发现，裁员对公司的创新记录有不利影响。 14 这并不一定意味着再造会阻止研发部门产生创意； 更可能的问题是，再造破坏了允许产品在组织内获得认可的非正式联系网络。 在某些工作外包的情况下，主要受益者是那些同样的中层管理人员，他们现在被聘为合同工。 事实上，剥夺中层管理人员使得员工很难获得长期承诺：如果阶梯的所有中间梯级都缺失，则很难设计职业结构。

A study of American companies published in late 1995 by the California Management Review found that downsizing had an adverse effect on the innovation record of companies. 14 That does not necessarily mean that reengineering stops research and development departments from producing ideas; the more likely problem is that reengineering destroys the informal network of contacts that allow a product to gain acceptance within an organization. In some cases where jobs have been contracted out, the chief beneficiaries are those same middle managers, now hired as contract labor. Indeed, ripping out middle management has made it hard to get long-term commitment from workers: it is very difficult to devise a career structure if all the middle rungs of the ladder are missing.

经过再造的人觉得他们的雇主打破了老板和工人之间隐含的道德契约——“我们会尽我们所能为你工作，只要你只在绝对必要的时候解雇我们。” 施乐公司在 1994 年初至 1995 年中期期间解雇了大约十分之一的员工，导致其家长式作风的声誉遭到破坏，而这段时间正是该公司盈利的时期。 大约在同一时间，AT&T 的一位老板，一位热心的再工程师，向《经济学人》承认，他公司的信任度直线下降：“过去我们对员工说，‘照你说的去做，你就有了一份工作生活。' 然后我们背叛了他们。” AT&T 员工对 Ma Bell 的任何热情都会在 1996 年 1 月又裁员 40 人时消失， 000 人（后来将数字减少到 28,000 时几乎没有恢复）。 英国电信将其员工从 1990 年的 232,000 人裁减至 1995 年的 148,000 人，这对士气造成了毁灭性的影响。 1995 年的内部调查表明，只有五分之一的公司员工认为可以信赖管理人员言出必行。

Reengineered people feel that their employers have broken the implicit moral contract between bosses and workers—"We'll work as hard as we can for you just so long as you only fire us if it is absolutely necessary." Xerox saw its reputation for paternalism destroyed when it fired about 1 in 10 of its workers between the beginning of 1994 and the middle of 1995, a period when it was making a profit. At about the same time, one boss at AT&T, an enthusiastic reengineer, confessed to The Economist that trust levels at his firm had plummeted: "In the past we said to employees, 'Do as you're told and you have a job for life.' Then we betrayed them." Any warm feeling AT&T's staff felt for Ma Bell would have disappeared in January 1996 when it layed off another 40,000 people (and were hardly restored when it later reduced the figure to 28,000). British Telecom cut its workforce from 232,000 in 1990 to 148,000 in 1995, with devastating effect on morale. Internal surveys in 1995 suggested that only one-fifth of the firm's employees thought that managers could be relied upon to do what they said.

正在进行再造的公司的员工通常花更多的时间讨论潜在的失业问题

Employees in companies that are undergoing reengineering often spend more time discussing potential job losses than they do

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

思考他们的工作。 1995 年 3 月，费城 CoreStates 金融公司宣布将解雇 890 人，即其员工的 6%。 “每个人都在想 * 我的未来是什么，我在这里做什么？”一名员工告诉《华尔街日报》。 “在过去的一个月里，人们有超过 50% 的时间都在谈论。整天都是在喝水。” 在 West-inghouse 的告别派对上，人们开玩笑说“成功者要离开，失败者要留下”。 美国管理协会在 1995 年年中进行的一项调查发现，与 1993 年复苏真正开始之前相比，一半以上的受访者感到工作不堪重负。 在英国进行的一项类似民意调查发现，70% 的员工感到安全感不如两年前； 44% 的人感到工作到很晚的压力，31% 的人说人们害怕生病时请假。 15

thinking about their work. In March 1995 CoreStates Financial Corporation of Philadelphia announced it would fire 890 people—or 6 percent of its staff. "Everybody is thinking * What is my future, what am I doing here?'" one employee told The Wall Street Journal. "For the last month people have been talking more than 50 percent of the time. It's watercooler talk all day long." At good-bye parties at West-inghouse, people joked that "the winners get to leave; the losers get to stay." A survey by the American Management Association in mid-1995 found that more than half the respondents felt more overwhelmed by work than they had in 1993, before the recovery really started. A similar poll in Britain found that 70 percent of workers felt less secure than they had two years before; 44 percent felt pressure to work late and 31 percent said people were afraid to take time off if they were sick. 15

换句话说，再造比最初宣传的要少。 但这并不意味着它没有用。 再造往往在物流和订单履行方面特别有效，因为它迫使公司专注于速度和服务——客户最感兴趣的两个方面。 因此，通过再造，EMI Records 在北美的制造和分销部门设法将在销售高峰期按时交付给零售商的光盘 (CD) 数量从 90% 提高到 99% 以上。 （销售高峰时间很重要，因为就像《市场领导者的纪律》一样，许多人只会在唱片或书籍畅销时购买。）EMI 还声称，每年运输 CD 装置的成本下降了30%；

In other words, reengineering is less than it was originally cracked up to be. But that does not mean it is useless. Reengineering tends to work particularly well in logistics and order fulfillment, because it forces a company to concentrate on speed and service—the two that most interest its customers. Thus, through reengineering, the manufacturing and distribution side of EMI Records in North America managed to increase the number of compact discs (CDs) being delivered on time to retailers during their peak selling period from 90 percent to over 99 percent. (The peak selling time matters because, as in the case of The Discipline of Market Leaders, many people will only buy a record, or book, when it is a hit.) EMI also claimed that the annual cost of transporting CD units fell by 30 percent; and labor productivity at the distribution sites increased by 70 percent.

有时，再造可以激励整个行业。 由于纪律严明，美国的货运铁路公司将自己重塑为客户的后勤部门。 铁路不仅仅是将箱子从一个点运送到另一个点，而是借助计算机让他们的客户了解每个箱子的下落。 有些还与他们的老对手卡车司机联系起来，以提供更无缝的服务。 现在，像克莱斯勒这样的公司雇用铁路公司将他们的汽车从工厂门口一路运到经销商门口。

Occasionally, reengineering can galvanize an entire industry. Thanks to the discipline, America's freight-carrying railway companies recast themselves as the logistical arm of their customers. Rather than just ferrying boxes from one point to another, the railroads keep their customers informed about the whereabouts of each box with the aid of computers. Some also link up with their old foes, the truckers, to provide a more seamless service. Now companies such as Chrysler hire railway companies to take their cars all the way from the factory gate to the dealer's doors.

即使批评者认为再造最血腥，他们也往往会忘记替代方案是什么。 英国电信、AT&T 和 Nynex 可能伤痕累累，但它们的状态肯定比

Even when critics consider reengineering at its most bloody, they tend to forget what the alternatives are. British Telecom, AT&T, and Nynex may be bruised, but they are surely in a better state than

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

法国电信或 NTT。 人们很容易嘲笑 IBM 董事长 Lou Gerstner，因为他宣称“我们进入 1995 年时已经完成了大部分正确的裁员”（这是他描述 1994 年 IBM 裁员 35,000 人的方式）； 但 IBM 的状况看起来仍然好于法国的 Bull。 蓝色巨人还说明了再造批评者可能夸大的另一点。 这家计算机制造商通常与通用汽车和 Digital 等公司一起被列入缩小规模但仍未解决问题的公司名单。 那是真实的。 但他们最初陷入困境的真正原因与再造无关。

France Telecom or NTT. It was easy to chuckle at Lou Gerstner, IBM's chairman, for declaring that "we enter 1995 with the bulk of our right sizing behind us" (which was his way of describing 1994's 35,000 redundancies at IBM); but IBM still looked in better shape than, say, France's Bull. And Big Blue also illustrates another point that critics of reengineering may have exaggerated. The computer maker is often included alongside firms such as General Motors and Digital in lists of firms that have downsized and still not solved their problems. That is true. But the real reason that they got into trouble in the first place had nothing to do with reengineering.

再造再造

Reengineering Reengineered

需要的不是完全放弃再造，而是对其进行完善。 到 1996 年，有人谈论要对纪律采取更“整体”或“有机”的方法，让管理人员甚至工人参与进来。 对于一门包罗万象的学科来说，这样的妥协并不容易。 然而，整体再造的一个例子可以在康宁看到，这家科技公司总部位于纽约州北部阿巴拉契亚山脉山脚下的同名小镇。 16

What is needed is not to abandon reengineering completely but to refine it. By 1996 there was talk of taking a more "holistic" or "organic" approach to the discipline, involving managers and even workers. Such compromises do not come easily to an all-encompassing discipline. However, an example of a holistic version of reengineering can be seen at Corning, a technology company headquartered in the small town of the same name in the foothills of the Appalachian mountains in upstate New York. 16

康宁是一家典型的家长式公司（尽管“家长式”这个词被康宁人反对，认为在政治上过于不正确）。 1983年至1996年的公司董事长是创始人的曾孙James Houghton； 他的兄弟艾默里 (Amory) 在他之前担任主席，现在在国会代表周边地区。 （如果你在大街上理发，你就会盯着一张“Amo”笑脸的海报。）该镇 12,000 名成年居民中有一半为康宁工作。 整个家庭都为公司工作了几十年，不记得康宁不支付工资的时候。 关于康宁（“美国最小城镇中最大的公司”，杰米·霍顿 (Jamie Houghton) 的说法）的一切都宣告了其对良好企业公民的承诺，

Corning is the quintessential paternalist company (though the term "paternalist" is frowned on by Corningites as being too politically incorrect). The company chairman from 1983 to 1996 was James Houghton, the great-grandson of the founder; his brother, Amory, preceded him as chairman and now represents the surrounding area in Congress. (If you get a hair cut on main street, you stare up at a poster of "Amo's" smiling face.) Half the town's 12,000 adult inhabitants work for Corning. Whole families have worked for the company for decades and cannot remember a time when Corning did not pay their salaries. Everything about Corning ("the biggest company in the smallest town in the United States," according to Jamie Houghton) proclaims its commitment to good corporate citizenship, from its splendid new headquarters deliberately built low so as not to overshadow the town to the leaflets in the lavatories warning of the dangers of herpes, smoking, and bulimia nervosa.

如果重新设计意味着摧毁他的家乡，霍顿断然拒绝考虑重新设计。 但到 1993 年底，高级管理人员，其中一些人还担任了当时公司的董事会成员

Houghton refused categorically to consider reengineering if it meant destroying his home town. But by the end of 1993 senior managers, some of whom also sat on the boards of companies that were

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

正在进行再造，觉得康宁不能再忽视新的管理理论了。 公司的股价下跌了四分之一。 表面上的问题出在道康宁公司，这是一家与陶氏化学公司成立的独立合资企业，生产硅胶乳房植入物。 这家公司被成千上万的女性起诉，要求赔偿可能造成的损失。 但 Coming 的根本问题是双重的：在组织上，它一团糟——它有大约 150 个不同的业务，每个业务都有自己的法律地位。 而那些业务——光纤、医疗服务、催化转化器等等——都没有赚钱。

undergoing reengineering, felt that Corning could not ignore the new management theory any longer. The company's share price had fallen by a quarter. The ostensible problem was Dow Corning, a separate joint venture with Dow Chemicals producing silicone breast-implants. This company was being sued by thousands of women for potential damages. But Coming's underlying problems were twofold: organizationally, it was a mess—it had some 150 different businesses, each with its own legal status. And those businesses—fiber optics, medical services, catalytic converters, and so on—were not making money.

过去，这家以热衷于管理理论而臭名昭著的公司在将其对利润的热情与对家长式作风的承诺结合起来时，出人意料地毫不费力。 康宁通过将自己从一家玻璃制造商（它曾经为爱迪生的电灯制造玻璃）转变为一家科技公司，避免了裁员当地工人。 全面质量管理、高绩效工作场所和员工授权等最近的时尚本质上意味着对员工友善。 再造的名声大不相同。 Coming 管理层面临的挑战是，看看他们能否在不破坏小镇经济和打破长达一个世纪的开明劳资关系承诺的情况下进行再造。

In the past the company, which is notorious for its enthusiasm for management theories, had had surprisingly little difficulty in combining its zest for profits with its commitment to paternalism. Corning had avoided laying off local workers by transforming itself from a glassmaker (it once made the glass for Edison's electric lights) into a technology company. Recent fashions such as total-quality management, high-performance workplaces, and employee empowerment had essentially meant being nice to workers. Reengineering had a very different reputation. The challenge for Coming's management was to see if they could reengineer without destroying their small town's economy and breaking a century-long commitment to enlightened industrial relations.

由于进入该学科的时间相当晚，康宁拥有了大量的经验可以借鉴——尤其是 Hammer 承认失败的大量再设计工作的例子。 因此，它采取了不同的方法。 其他公司失败的最大原因之一是缺乏高层的一致参与； 康宁确保高级管理人员赞助每组再造工程师，并确保公司总裁罗杰·阿克曼（他在 1996 年初杰米·霍顿退休后成为董事长）亲自负责每个项目。 再造经常失败，因为公司更热衷于满足股市对快速修复的渴望，通常是通过解雇员工，而不是引入结构性变化。 令华尔街懊恼的是，康宁直截了当地拒绝宣布任何立即裁员。

By coming to the discipline fairly late, Corning had a huge amount of experience to draw on—not least the numerous examples of reengineering efforts that Hammer admits have failed. It thus took a different approach. One of the biggest causes of failure in other companies has been the lack of consistent involvement from the top; Corning made sure that senior managers sponsored each group of reengineers and that the company's president, Roger Ackerman (who became chairman when Jamie Houghton retired in early 1996), took personal responsibility for each program. Reengineering has often failed because companies are keener on slaking the stock market's thirst for quick fixes, usually by firing workers, than on introducing structural changes. To Wall Street's chagrin, Corning refused, point blank, to announce any immediate redundancies.

在其他地方，重新设计是由使用计算机的顾问强加的。 在康宁，顾问们被告知要留在幕后。 事实上，康宁并没有将再造强加给敌对的员工，而是让员工自己进行再造。 1994 年 1 月，它询问了关键员工，其中许多人来自中层

Elsewhere reengineering had been imposed by computer-wielding consultants. At Corning the consultants were told to stay in the background. Indeed, rather than imposing reengineering on a hostile workforce, Corning got the workers to do their own reengineering. In January 1994 it asked key employees, many of them from middle

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

管理层（一个通常被再造工程师鄙视的群体），为了从上到下重新设计他们的公司，他们放弃了几个月的本职工作。 公司为他们提供了一座大楼（被称为“Donut-U”，因为它在 Dunkin Donuts 商店旁边），告诉他们穿着便服出现（现在是整个公司的政策），并将他们分成小组看看“制造”和“创新”等过程。

management (a group normally despised by reengineers), to forsake their proper jobs for a few months in order to redesign their company from top to bottom. The company put a building at their disposal (known as the "Donut-U," because it was next to a Dunkin Donuts store), told them to turn up in casual clothes (now policy throughout the company), and divide themselves into teams to look at processes such as "manufacturing" and "innovation."

康宁确保再造人员能够轻松接触到高级管理层。 它还投入了大量精力来解释劳动力正在发生的事情。 罗杰·阿克曼 (Roger Ackerman) 定期举行城镇会议，他和他的同事会在会议上解释正在发生的事情以及原因。 （会议也被录像并分发给无法参加的人。）公司杂志经常刊登有关该过程的文章。 鼓励员工通过电子邮件表达他们的担忧——如果他们愿意，可以匿名——并向他们提供“压力咨询”。

Corning made sure that the reengineers had easy access to senior management. It also put a huge amount of effort into explaining what was going on to the workforce. Roger Ackerman held regular town meetings at which he and his colleagues explained what was happening and why. (The meetings were also videotaped and distributed to those who could not attend.) The company magazine ran frequent articles on the process. Workers were encouraged to express their worries by e-mail—anonymously if they preferred—and they were offered "stress counseling."

再造人员引入了一些几乎与再造过程相同的变化，例如重组其混乱的业务（他们发现其 95% 的销售额仅来自其一半的产品）。 再造将好富顿和车间之间的经理层级从七层减少到五层，简化了决策制定，并裁掉了两名高级副总裁及其员工。 虽然总是很难对这些事情给出一个数字，但该公司计算出，在 1996-97 年，再设计可以节省 5000 万到 6000 万美元。

The reengineers introduced a number of changes that are almost par for the course in reengineering, such as reorganizing its tangle of businesses (they found that 95 percent of its sales came from only half of its products). Reengineering cut the number of levels of managers between Houghton and the shop floor from seven to five, simplified decision making, and got rid of two senior vice presidents and their staffs. Though it is always difficult to put a figure on such things, the company calculated that reengineering could produce $50 million to $60 million in savings in 1996-97.

但康宁的再造工程师们也利用他们的自由对这门学科进行了两项重要的修改。 首先，他们确保再造在董事会和工厂车间的应用一样多。 大部分裁员来自管理层，最大的结构性变化之一发生在公司总部：将更多权力移交给运营部门。 其次，康宁的再造人员确保变革是渐进的而不是革命性的。 Corningites 并没有从 Hammer 和 Champy 的白纸开始，而是试图在公司已经做得很好的基础上再接再厉。

But the Corning reengineers also used their freedom to introduce two important modifications to the discipline. First, they made sure that reengineering applied in the boardroom just as much as on the factory floor. The bulk of the cuts in manpower came from management, and one of the biggest structural changes took place at the corporate headquarters: more power was handed over to the operating units. Second, the Corning reengineers made sure that change was evolutionary rather than revolutionary. Far from starting with Hammer and Champy's clean sheet of paper, the Corningites tried to build on what the company was already doing right.

在康宁，没有人假装再造是没有摩擦的。 在镇上的教堂和酒吧里，这个词一直是紧张的、常常是愤怒的讨论话题。 Wlien 是作者之一

Nobody at Corning pretends that reengineering has been free of friction. The word has been the subject of nervous, often angry, discussions in the town's churches and bars. Wlien one of the authors

进行中的时尚

The Fad in Progress

他开玩笑地问，如果他冒充管理顾问进入当地的一家酒吧会发生什么，他被直截了当地告诉他不要考虑这个想法。 两家当地报纸一再暗示该公司有一项秘密计划，要重新设计这个社区，使之不复存在。 当地工会认为再设计就像骷髅头和交叉骨一样悬在山谷上空。 一项内部调查得出的结论是，公司 33% 的员工承受着压力，而其中只有 12% 的人能够应对压力。

jokingly asked what would happen if he went into one of the local bars posing as management consultants, he was flatly told not to entertain the thought. The two local newspapers have repeatedly hinted that the company has a secret plan to reengineer the community out of existence. The local union sees reengineering hanging over the valley like a skull and crossbones. An in-house survey concluded that 33 percent of the firm's workers were suffering from stress, and only 12 percent of those were coping with it.

尽管如此，到 1995 年年中，当我们参观这家公司时，总体感觉还是如释重负。 Corningites 敏锐地意识到，他们已经引入了他们那个时代最令人恐惧的管理技术，而没有遭受大规模裁员或经常伴随的激烈的工业纠纷。 是的，公司被迫解雇了一些工人，但他们中的大多数人都提前退休了。 利润在增加，这意味着留下来的人的工作更有保障。 一个世纪以来的家长式作风可能意味着霍顿和阿克曼一开始就比其他再造工程师具有相当大的优势。 尽管如此，他们似乎确实找到了一条中间道路，其中不需要诸如“抹杀”之类的词。

Still, by mid-1995, when we visited the company, the overall feeling was one of relief. Corningites were acutely conscious that they had introduced the most feared management technique of their time without suffering massive layoffs or bitter industrial disputes that often accompanied it. Yes, the company had been forced to get rid of some workers, but most of them had gone through early retirement. Profits were improving, meaning that the jobs of those who remained were much more secure. A century's worth of paternalism may have meant that Houghton and Ackerman started with a considerable advantage over other reengineers. All the same, they did seem to have found a middle way where words such as "obliteration" were not necessary.

最重要的是，他们拒绝了再造信条的一个基本部分，该信条首先使该学科对其他经理如此有吸引力，即它是一个机械的、科学的过程。 霍顿和阿克曼并没有将其视为关于如何重组公司的重组手册，而是将其更多地视为一种背景音乐形式。 他们有时听，有时关掉。

Above all, they had rejected one of the fundamental parts of the reengineering creed that had first made the discipline so appealing to other managers, the idea that it is a mechanical, scientific process. Rather than regarding it as a retooling manual on how to reorganize a company, Houghton and Ackerman had looked on it more as a form of background music. Sometimes they listened to it, and sometimes they turned it off.

衰落的市场领导者的绝望

The Desperation of Fading Market Leaders

在像康宁这样的地方，重新设计重新设计为一门学科可能不足以挽救重新设计作为一门生意。 毕竟，销售标签上写着“不管你有什么抱怨，这会治愈你”的药物要比销售标签上写着“这种治疗可能成功或不成功，取决于你的情况”的药物容易得多。情况。这可能会很痛苦，而且很可能会产生意想不到的副作用。”

The reinvention of reengineering as a discipline in places like Corning may not be enough to save reengineering as a business. After all, it is much easier to sell a medicine with a label saying "This will cure you, no matter what your complaint," than it is to sell one with a label saying "This treatment may or may not succeed, depending on your circumstances. It is likely to be painful and could well have unintended side effects."

更糟糕的是，到 1995 年市场领导者纪律出现的那一年，再造已经成为一种商品

To make things worse, by 1995, the year when The Discipline of Market Leaders appeared, reengineering had become a commodity

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

商业。 大型咨询公司——尤其是 Andersen Consulting——已经进入市场。 到 1995 年年中，CSC Index 仅是美国第四大再造专家。

business. Big consultancy firms—particularly Andersen Consulting—had moved into the market. By mid-1995 CSC Index was only the fourth largest reengineering specialist in America.

正是在这种背景下，CSC 指数对 Champy 乏善可陈的后续作品 Reengineering Management (1995) 和命运多舛的市场领导者纪律给予了支持。 但即使采用不同寻常的营销方法，这两本书也未能填补空白。 所需要的是一种新的时尚，一种可以在全世界树立品牌、宣传、销售和传播的新理念。 但是对于管理理论行业来说，情况总是如此。

It was against this background that CSC Index threw its weight behind both Champy's lackluster follow-up, Reengineering Management (1995), and the ill-fated Discipline of Market Leaders. But even with unusual marketing methods, neither book filled the gap. What was needed was a new fad, a new idea that could be branded, preached, sold, and spread all around the world. But then with the management theory industry that is always the case.

第2章

CHAPTER 2

任何遇到宾夕法尼亚大学沃顿商学院院长的人都会感到惊讶，他期待一位超凡脱俗的学者，只为思想而活。 Thomas Gerrity 一如既往的流畅，完美的剪裁和完美的发型。 他在谈话中充斥着商业流行语，而不是学术参考，甚至称他的大学校长为“首席执行官”。

Anyone who meets the dean of the Wharton Business School at the University of Pennsylvania expecting an unworldly academic who lives for nothing but ideas is in for a surprise. Thomas Gerrity is as smooth as they come, immaculately tailored and perfectly coiffed. He litters his conversation not with scholarly references but with business buzzwords, even referring to his university's president as "the CEO."

Gerrity 的商业方言不仅仅是矫揉造作。 他是新一代院长中的一员：被拉回学术界以迫使商学院实践他们所宣扬的商人。 在他的前世，Gerrity 是 CSC Index 的创始人之一，CSC Index 是一家发明再造的咨询公司（见第 1 章）。 作为沃顿商学院的院长，格里蒂试图将自己的信条付诸实践，将他的学生和教授分成不同的团队。 每支队伍至少包括两名非美国人； 每个教师团队都包括来自不同学科的教授。 他还改变了获得终身教职和奖励年度加薪的制度，以便将重点从发表学术文章（曾经是成功的唯一途径）转移到教学和“领导力”上。

Gerrity's business patois is not just affectation. He is one of a new breed of deans: businessmen who have been roped back into acade-mia in order to force business schools to practice what they preach. In his previous life Gerrity was one of the founders of CSC Index, the consultancy that invented reengineering (see Chapter 1). As dean of Wharton, Gerrity has tried to put his own creed into practice, dividing both his students and his professors into specially varied teams. Each team includes at least two non-Americans; each faculty team includes professors from different academic disciplines. He has also changed the system for gaining tenure and awarding annual pay raises in order to shift the emphasis from publishing academic articles (once the only road to success) to teaching and "leadership."

许多这些变化都需要花钱，但凭借 1.35 亿美元的年度预算，Gerrity 有能力进行试验。 在年度预算为 1.95 亿美元的哈佛商学院，一个新的

Many of these changes cost money, but with an annual budget of $135 million, Gerrity can afford to experiment. Over at Harvard Business School, where the annual budget is $195 million, a new

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

院长 Kim Clark 正在实施他自己的类似改革，包括将 500 个案例研究放到网上的计划。 （仅哈佛大学就花费 1100 万美元用于升级其信息技术。）自从《商业周刊》于 1988 年 11 月开始发布商学院排名以来，像 Gerrity 和 Clark 这样的院长就有权篡改教学大纲，建造豪华的新建筑，并聘请昂贵的“明星”教授。 由于 Gerrity 的改革，沃顿商学院这所具有财务头脑的学校以学生在毕业典礼结束时将美元钞票而不是帽子抛向空中而闻名，它已经跻身这些榜单的首位。

dean, Kim Clark, is implementing similar reforms of his own, including a plan to put 500 case studies on-line. (Harvard is spending $11 million alone on upgrading its information technology.) Ever since Business Week started publishing a ranking of business schools in November 1988, deans like Gerrity and Clark have had a license to tamper with the syllabus, throw up plush new buildings, and recruit expensive "star" professors. Thanks to Gerrity's reforms, Wharton, a financially minded school where the students have been known to throw dollar bills rather than caps into the air at the end of their graduation ceremony, has powered its way to the top of these tables.

正如 Gerrity 自己的职业生涯所表明的那样，商学院、咨询公司以及他们交易的想法实际上是同一个繁荣行业的一部分。 几乎每个参与管理理论的人都以这样或那样的方式从中赚钱。 事实上，“管理理论行业”似乎不受经济周期的影响：咨询公司在客户雇用较少的情况下雇佣更多的员工，而随着周围大学的崩溃，商学院变得更加华丽和数量众多。

As Gerrity's own career suggests, business schools, consultancies, and the ideas they trade in are really part of the same prosperous industry. Virtually everybody involved in management theory is making money out of it in one way or another. Indeed, the "management theory industry" seems immune to economic cycles: consultancies take on ever more staff as their clients employ fewer, and business schools become more ornate and numerous as the universities around them crumble.

正如我们将看到的，这种成功在很大程度上反映了对该行业产品看似无穷无尽的需求。 管理理论一直吸引着成千上万想要出人头地的人； 现在它已经进入了数百万害怕被落在后面的市场。 然而，该行业的成功和范围也对产生的想法产生了影响。 在如此巨大的既得利益下，自我批评几乎是闻所未闻的。 该行业对更多想法进行加工、印刷、销售和反流的不懈追求，使它成为一门特别流行的学科，在这里，想法是被抓住的，而不是成熟的。 换句话说，行业经常推动理论，而不是相反。

This success, as we shall see, is largely a reflection of the seemingly endless demand for the industry's product. Management theory has always appealed to thousands of people who want to get ahead; now it has tapped into the market of the millions who are scared of being left behind. However, the success and scope of the industry has also had an effect on the sort of ideas produced. With such huge vested interests, self-criticism is almost unheard of. And the industry's relentless appetite for more ideas to process, print, sell, and regurgitate had helped to make it a peculiarly faddish discipline where ideas are grabbed at, rather than matured. In other words, the industry has often driven the theory, rather than the other way around.

行业的广度

The Breadth of the Industry

管理行业大致可以分为三个部分。 其中最明显的是管理咨询业务，该业务在全球雇用至少 100,000 名全职员工，并且在过去十年中的增长速度是世界经济增长速度的两倍多。 据 Gartner 集团称，1994 年，它产生了大约 114 亿美元的费用。 最大的公司 Andersen Consulting 在 1995 年带来了将近 35 亿美元的收入——不是

The management industry can be divided more or less into three parts. The most obvious of these is the management consulting business, which employs at least 100,000 people full-time around the world and has been growing more than twice as fast as the world economy for the past decade. In 1994, according to the Gartner group, it generated about $11.4 billion in fees. The biggest firm, Andersen Consulting, brought in just under $3.5 billion in 1995—not

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

算上其姐妹会计师事务所安达信 (Arthur Andersen) 收取的另外 8 亿美元的咨询费。 1 其他三家咨询会计联合公司收取的费用超过 10 亿美元：Ernst & Young、Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu 和 Coopers & Lybrand。 然而，最赚钱（也是第二大，收入为 15 亿美元）的是麦肯锡：其每位合伙人的收入为 468,000 美元，而 Andersen 为 125,000 美元。 其他大牌“战略”顾问——Booz, Allen & Hamilton； 双子咨询； 美世管理； 波士顿咨询集团； 亚瑟·D·利特尔； Bain & Company——每个合作伙伴的收入都超过 200,000 美元。 Gartner 预测，1999 年的费用收入几乎翻了一番，达到 210 亿美元。衡量该行业年轻活力的一个指标是，今天的一半以上

counting another $800 million of consultancy fees booked by its sister accountancy firm, Arthur Andersen. 1 Three other consultancy-accountancy combines collected over $1 billion in fees: Ernst & Young, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu, and Coopers & Lybrand. However, the most profitable (and also the second biggest, with revenues of $1.5 billion) is McKinsey: its revenue per partner was $468,000— compared with Andersen's $125,000. The other big "strategic" consultants—Booz, Allen & Hamilton; Gemini Consulting; Mercer Management; the Boston Consulting Group; Arthur D. Little; Bain & Company—all booked over $200,000 per partner. Gartner predicts that fee income could almost double to $21 billion in 1999. A measure of the youthful vitality of the industry is that more than half of today's leading consulting firms did not exist five years ago.

咨询机构已经取代牛剑和常春藤盟校，成为权贵的托儿所。 事实上，来自后者的学生争先恐后地进入前者，并且有充分的理由。 由前麦肯锡人领导的公司名单从美国的 IBM、Levi Strauss 和美国运通延伸到法国的 Bull 和英国的 Asda。 即使是反文化商业的象征 Ben & Jerry's，现在也由该公司的一名前顾问经营。 在英国，这家咨询公司的老男孩名单包括英国工业联合会现任主席（以及他的两位前任）、英格兰银行副行长、首相政策部门负责人、伦敦交通局局长，以及最年轻的内阁大臣（威廉黑格）。 鼓励校友竭尽全力保持联系，

Consultancies have replaced Oxbridge and the Ivy League as the nurseries of the powerful. Indeed, students from the latter jostle to get into the former, and with good reason. The list of companies headed by ex-McKinseyites stretches from America's IBM, Levi Strauss, and American Express to France's Bull and Britain's Asda. Even Ben & Jerry's, that symbol of countercultural commerce, is now run by a former consultant from the firm. In Britain, the consultancy's old-boy list includes the present head of the Confederation of British Industry (and both his immediate predecessors), the deputy governor of the Bank of England, the head of the prime minister's policy unit, the boss of London Transport, and the youngest cabinet minister (William Hague). Alumni are encouraged to go out of their way to keep in touch, with the result that McKinsey has an even broader reach than its office network, which stretches across 35 countries, would suggest.

管理行业的第二部分由商学院组成。 仅美国就有大约 700 所商学院。 所有这些机构都挤满了急于成为管理理论家的学者：美国管理学会 1995 年的会议，该学科的年度盛会，吸引了不少于 4,500 人。 《哈佛商业评论》和《加州管理评论》等期刊的影响力和受众远远超出了产生它们的大学。 GMAT 考试本身就是一项巨大的业务，几乎世界上每所商学院都要求其未来的学生参加 GMAT 考试。 一年四次，

The second part of the management industry is made up of the business schools. There are about 700 business schools in the United States alone. All these institutions are teeming with academics desperate to make their name as management theorists: the 1995 meeting of the American Academy of Management, the discipline's annual jamboree, attracted no fewer than 4,500 people. Journals such as the Harvard Business Review and the California Management Review have an influence and an audience far beyond the universities that spawned them. The GMAT examination, which practically every business school in the world compels their prospective students to sit, is a huge business in its own right. Four times a year,

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

60,000 人在 100 多个国家的 700 个中心坐下来，试图证明自己有资格学习管理。

60,000 people sit down in 700 centers in over 100 countries to try to prove themselves worthy of studying management.

MBA 的受欢迎程度很容易解释。 哈佛商学院 1974 届毕业生的典型成员现在看起来将以 800 万美元的净资产退休，他们的继任者很可能会视他们为穷光蛋。 2 1994 年，哈佛大学和斯坦福大学毕业生的起薪中位数达到 100,000 美元。 如今，以银行和管理咨询公司为首的最热心的招聘人员以 30,000 美元的奖金、无息贷款、股票期权、学费报销、免费汽车和搬家津贴让学生眼花缭乱。 最近一次斯坦福大学 1990 年代初毕业生聚会的邀请函包括要求与会者“凑钱”以换取感恩的学生送给母校的小礼物； 一位毕业生在他订好机票后，

The MBA's popularity is easy to explain. The typical members of Harvard Business School's class of 1974 now look set to retire with a net worth of $8 million, and the chances are good that their successors will look down on them as paupers. 2 In 1994 the median starting pay for graduates from Harvard and Stanford hit $100,000. Nowadays, the keenest recruiters, led by banks and management consultancies, dazzle the students with offers of bonuses of $30,000, interest-free loans, stock options, tuition reimbursements, free cars, and moving allowances. Invitations to a recent reunion of Stanford graduates from the early 1990s included a request that attendees "chip in" for a small gift from the grateful students to their alma mater; it was only after he had booked his airline ticket that one graduate, who had foolishly taken a lowly paid job in the British civil service, realized that the chipping in amounted to $1,000 a head.

尽管来自最好的学校的最优秀的学生有这样的财富，但人们对 MBA 的平均价值持怀疑态度。 毕竟，对于许多学生来说，两年的学费和放弃的薪水的总成本很容易达到 100,000 美元； 衡量商学院教育收益的正确方法不仅仅是拿起薪，而是将其与没有 MBA 的人的收入进行比较。 罗彻斯特商学院的罗纳德·耶普尔 (Ronald Yeaple) 为就读商学院的成本和收益构建了一个经济模型，他发现几乎在所有情况下，学生都需要几年时间才能获利。 3 七年后，哈佛商学院的一名学生可以获得近 150,000 美元的正净值，但前 20 所学校中有 5 所学校的普通学生都处于亏损状态。

Despite this bonanza for the best students from the best schools, there are doubts about how much the average MBA is worth. After all, for many students the combined costs of two years of tuition and forgone salary can easily come to $100,000; and the proper way to measure the gain from a business school education is not just to take the starting salary but to compare it against what one would have earned without the MBA. One academic who constructed an economic model of the costs and benefits of going to business school, Ronald Yeaple of Rochester Business School, found that in nearly all cases it took several years for students to make a profit. 3 After seven years, a Harvard Business School student could claim a positive net value of nearly $150,000, but average students from 5 of the top 20 schools were all sitting on losses.

管理行业的第三个也是定义最不明确的部分是所谓的大师业务。 个人管理思想家有很多赚钱的方法。 最明显的是写商业书籍，商业书籍已经从 20 世纪 70 年代中期少量销售的外来物种变成了如今的主流摇钱树。 美国每年出版大约 2,000 本商业书籍，其中最好的一本可以卖出数百万本。 直到 1980 年代，商业书籍还是一个相当默默无闻的专业，销量仅次于学术数字。 随着汤姆·彼得斯和罗伯特·沃特曼合着的《追求卓越》的出版，这一切都发生了变化，

The third and least-well defined part of the management industry is what might be called the guru business. There are plenty of ways for individual management thinkers to make money. The most obvious is by writing business books, which have gone from being an exotic species selling in small numbers in the mid-1970s to a mainstream cash cow today. About 2,000 business books appear each year in America, and the best of these can sell in the millions. Until the 1980s business books were a fairly obscure specialty, selling in little more than academic numbers. All this changed with the publication of In Search of Excellence by Tom Peters and Robert Waterman, which

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

一年内售出 100 万册，两位作者都成了名人。 在 1983 年的某一时刻，纽约时报畅销书排行榜的前三名被商业作家占据（顺便说一句，他们都曾一起在康奈尔大学学习过）：汤姆·彼得斯（Tom Peters {In Search of Excellence，1982 年）、约翰·奈斯比特(Megatrends, 1983) 和 Kenneth Blanchard {The One Minute Manager, 1983)。 两年后，李·艾柯卡的自传成为有史以来最畅销的商业书籍，也是有史以来最畅销的精装本之一。 从那时起，每一位称职的出版商都开始着手发现、培养和提拔有才华的商业作家。

sold a million copies in one year and turned both its authors into celebrities. At one point in 1983 the top three slots in the New York Times best-seller list were filled by business authors (who, incidentally, had all studied at Cornell University together): Tom Peters {In Search of Excellence, 1982), John Naisbitt (Megatrends, 1983), and Kenneth Blanchard {The One Minute Manager, 1983). Two years later Lee Iacocca's autobiography became the best-selling business book of all time, and one of the best-selling hardbacks ever. From then on every publisher worth his or her salt set out to discover, nurture, and promote talented business writers.

然而，对于许多管理理论家来说，书籍在很大程度上是一种为更有利可图的活动做广告的形式。 其中许多涉及谈论一种或另一种。 如今，没有至少一位大师，任何商务会议都是不完整的。 这样的作者不仅使活动具有知识优势，而且他们可能是唯一不试图将演讲变成自己公司商业广告的演讲者。 这些演示还让观众有机会了解最新的理论，而无需仔细阅读本书。 商业演讲圈正在迅速扩大。 仅美国会议委员会现在每年就举办 100 场活动（是五年前的两倍）：这意味着它每年至少邀请 2,000 位演讲者。 4 1995 年，最大的收入者可能是 Harvey MacKay， 他是一家信封制造公司的老板，也是一位以《与鲨鱼畅游而不被生吞》而闻名的励志大师，他每次演讲的收费为 50,000 美元，并且每年发表大约 50 场演讲。 这使麦凯与亨利·基辛格和科林·鲍威尔将军处于同一水平。 其他一些大师，包括一直很受欢迎的汤姆彼得斯，收费也不低。 与个别公司举行的全天研讨会或讲习班的报酬可能更高。

Nevertheless, for many management theorists, books are largely a form of advertising for even more profitable activities. Many of these involve speaking of one kind or another. Nowadays no business conference is complete without at least one guru. Not only do such authors give the event an intellectual edge, but they will probably be the only speakers who do not try to turn their speech into a commercial for their own company. These presentations also give the audience a chance to catch up on the latest theories without having to plough through the book. The business speaking-circuit is expanding quickly. America's Conference Board alone now holds 100 events a year (double the number five years ago): that means it calls on at least 2,000 speakers a year. 4 In 1995 the biggest earner was probably Harvey MacKay, the boss of an envelope-manufacturing firm and a motivational guru best known for Swim with the Sharks without Being Eaten Alive, who charged $50,000 a speech—and gave about 50 of them a year. This put MacKay on the same level as Henry Kissinger and General Colin Powell. A clutch of other gurus, including the persistently popular Tom Peters, charged not much less. All-day seminars or workshops with individual companies can be even more remunerative.

与好莱坞电影公司一样，大师们发现了如何通过一系列渠道推销他们的想法，包括日记、录音带和录像带以及训练营。 总部位于加利福尼亚州帕洛阿尔托的三家培训和传播公司 Tom Peters Group 制作视频，制作定期时事通讯，并通常帮助扩展他的品牌。 它最近推出的产品之一是“盒子里的汤姆彼得斯商学院”，它配有 42 张“个人议程卡”、14 张“时间卡”和两个骰子，一个是彩色的，一个是白色的。 值得注意的是，也许“商学院”是

Like the Hollywood studios, the gurus have discovered how to sell their ideas through a range of outlets, including diaries, audio-and videocassettes, and training camps. The Tom Peters Group, three training and communication companies headquartered in Palo Alto, California, produce videos, churn out a regular newsletter, and generally help to stretch his brand. One of its more recent offerings is "The Tom Peters Business School in a Box," which comes complete with 42 "personal agenda cards," 14 "time cards," and two dice, one colored, one white. Significantly, perhaps, the "Business School" was

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

他的三名员工的工作，只有彼得斯的前言。 与此同时，“学习型组织”的先驱彼得圣吉似乎引入了特许经营：他允许台湾追随者杨秀英翻译他的书籍，并在华语世界推广他的思想。

the work of three of his employees and has only a foreword by Peters. Meanwhile, Peter Senge, a prophet of "the learning organization," seems to have introduced franchising: he has allowed a Taiwanese follower, Young Show-ing, to translate his books and popularize his ideas in the Chinese-speaking world.

多付钱，在这儿

Overpaid and Over Here

这些粗略的划分——咨询公司、商学院和大师——意味着管理行业的结构和定义比实际情况要严密得多。 例如，哪里应该包括“MBA-ware”卖家——制作自学管理程序的软件公司，这些程序的名称如“Negotiator Pro”和“ManagePro”？ 或者更多的正统软件制造商专门设计他们的产品来帮助公司实施管理时尚？ （德国 SAP 的迅速崛起主要归功于其为进行再造活动的公司提供的产品。 ) 那些将高管团队带到非洲丛林或苏格兰高地以磨练领导技能的公司呢？ 还是专门为外包工人提供咨询的公司？ 或者越来越多的管理心理学家-心理计量师为理想的新员工起草档案，或者接受过治疗自杀青少年的培训的精神病学家发现“促进”团队会议并告诉高层管理人员如何应对压力更有利可图精英阶层的生活？

These rough divisions—into consultancies, business schools, and gurus—imply that the management industry is much more structured and narrowly defined than it really is. Where, for instance, should one include "MBA-ware" sellers—software companies that make teach-yourself-management programs with names such as "Negotiator Pro" and "ManagePro"? Or more orthodox software makers that design their products specifically to help companies implement management fads? (The rapid rise of Germany's SAP can be attributed largely to its products for companies conducting reengineering exercises.) And what about companies that take groups of executives to the African bush or to the Scottish highlands so that they can hone their leadership skills? Or the firms that specialize in counseling outsourced workers? Or the growing numbers of management psycholo-gists-psychometrists who draw up profiles of desirable recruits, or psychiatrists trained to deal with suicidal teenagers who have found it more remunerative to "facilitate" team meetings and tell top executives how to cope with the pressures of life among the elite?

让管理行业变得更加复杂的是，它现在是一个全球实体。 不久前，任何想了解管理的人都会去美国大学，学习美国大师，争论美国公司，并可能加入一家美国咨询公司。 关于这个主题的大辩论——比如关于科学管理和人文管理的相对优点的辩论——几乎都是在美国人之间进行的。 但在过去的二十年里，世界其他地区已经开始迎头赶上。

What makes the management industry even more complicated is that it is now a global entity. Not so long ago, anyone who wanted to understand management went to an American university, studied American gurus, argued about American corporations, and probably joined an American consultancy. The great debates in the subject— such as the one about the relative merits of scientific and humanistic management—were almost all conducted between Americans. But in the past two decades the rest of the world has started to catch up.

从布拉德福德到巴塞罗那再到柏林，欧洲的城市现在到处都是商学院。 有几所——位于巴黎郊外的欧洲工商管理学院、伦敦商学院 (LBS) 和瑞士管理发展学院——值得在美国第一大学院中占有一席之地。 1994 年，仅英国人就在 100 所学校的 MBA 学费上花费了大约 5000 万英镑，其中大约一半用于商业书籍。 CON-

From Bradford to Barcelona to Berlin, the cities of Europe are now littered with business schools. A few—Insead, just outside Paris, the London Business School (LBS), and Switzerland's Institute for Management Development—deserve a place in America's first division. Britons alone spent about £50 million on MBA fees at 100 schools in 1994—and about half that figure on business books. Con-

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

欧洲大陆人，尤其是法国人，仍然持怀疑态度，但大多数领先的美国大师已经突破了。 《追求卓越》在法国三年内售出了 100,000 册，在德国、荷兰、西班牙和瑞典的销量甚至更高。 考虑到 In Search of Excellence 几乎没有提到欧洲，这是一项了不起的成就； 在将近十年后出版的《解放管理》一书中，精明的彼得斯用整整一章的篇幅介绍瑞士-瑞典工业巨头 Asea Brown Boveri (ABB) 和德国的中型公司。 如今，加里哈梅尔和亨利明茨伯格等北美领先的大师每年至少有一部分时间在欧洲度过（分别在伦敦商学院和欧洲工商管理学院）。

tinental Europeans, particularly the French, remain a little more skeptical, but most of the leading American gurus have broken through. In Search of Excellence sold 100,000 copies in three years in France and did even better in Germany, Holland, Spain, and Sweden. This was quite an achievement given that In Search of Excellence barely mentioned Europe; in Liberation Management, published almost a decade later, the canny Peters devoted whole chapters to Asea Brown Boveri (ABB), a Swiss-Swedish industrial giant, and Germany's medium-size companies. Nowadays, leading North American gurus such as Gary Hamel and Henry Mintzberg spend at least part of the year in Europe (at LBS and Insead, respectively).

欧洲也开始产生自己的大师。 迄今为止，只有一位欧洲大师以美国标准排名第一：英国的查尔斯·汉迪 (Charles Handy)。 然而，一群其他名字——John Kay 和 Sumantra Ghoshal（都在伦敦商学院）和 Yves Doz（欧洲工商管理学院）——正在敲门。 还有几个领域，欧洲大师们看起来似乎领先于美国同行，尤其是管理跨国公司的文化方面。 欧洲的任何大公司都会很快成为跨国公司。 荷兰国际文化研究所的 Geert Hofstede 或多或少地发明了文化多样性作为管理主题，他指出各国对薪酬和等级制度的态度可能大相径庭。 Fons Trompenaars，也是荷兰人，

And Europe is beginning to produce gurus of its own. There is as yet only one European guru who ranks in the first division by American standards: Britain's Charles Handy. However, a cluster of other names—John Kay and Sumantra Ghoshal (both at LBS) and Yves Doz (Insead)—are knocking on the door. There are also several areas in which European gurus look as if they are ahead of their American counterparts, particularly the cultural side of managing multinationals. Any big firm in Europe becomes multinational very quickly. Geert Hofstede of the Netherlands' Institute of International Culture more or less invented cultural diversity as a management subject, pointing out that attitudes toward pay and hierarchy can vary enormously from country to country. Fons Trompenaars, also of the Netherlands, is one of the leading writers on corporate culture.

事实上，在许多“软”管理领域，欧洲人比更注重科学的美国人拥有更强大的传统。 许多专家现在正在重新审视 1950 年代英国塔维斯托克研究所由 Elliot Jacques 领导的一组心理学家所做的关于人类动机的工作。 在年轻的美国大师们似乎将大半辈子都花在研究越来越深奥的分支学科的时代，欧洲人相对缺乏专业性可能是一个优势。 彼得·德鲁克将查尔斯·汉迪描述为“当今最有趣的管理作家”的一个原因是他看到了自己的影子：他们都没有接受过相对较少的正规管理教育，都在现实世界中工作过（汉迪是石油公司的高管，德鲁克是银行家），而且都是多面手， 对社会学和政治学的兴趣与对管理学的兴趣一样大。 不应忘记，德鲁克本人曾经是欧洲人。

Indeed, in many "soft" management areas Europeans have a much stronger tradition than the more scientifically based Americans. Many gurus are now reexamining work done on human motivation at Britain's Tavistock Institute back in the 1950s by a team of psychologists led by Elliot Jacques. And at a time when the younger American gurus seem to spend half their lives studying more and more esoteric subdisciplines, the Europeans' comparative lack of specialization may be an advantage. One reason that Peter Drucker has described Charles Handy as "the most interesting management writer today" is that he sees shades of himself: both had comparatively little formal management education, both served time in the real world (Handy as an oil executive, Drucker as a banker), and both are generalists, as interested in sociology and politics as they are in management. Drucker, it should not be forgotten, was himself a European once.

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

随着西欧稳固地进入其轨道，管理行业现在正在向东和向南移动。 通过将管理理论引入前苏联集团，西方政府和商学院希望培养出一批熟悉西方管理语言和技术的人才。 斯德哥尔摩经济学院在里加设有一个前哨基地，每年向来自爱沙尼亚、拉脱维亚和立陶宛的 100 名学生教授经济学和商业学。 即使在莫斯科，商学院也开始出现，尽管许多毕业生似乎沉浸在对流行语的小狗般的热情中。 一位西方企业家回忆说，他不得不对他的新员工大喊大叫，说 EBIT（商学院称“息税前利润”）等首字母缩略词是双重毫无意义的：首先， 企业家不知道 EBIT 是什么意思； 其次，它基于毫无意义的数字。 甚至南非也贡献了一种叫做 ubuntu 管理的东西，它融合了西方思想和非洲传统，比如部落忠诚。

With Western Europe firmly within its orbit, the management industry is now moving east and south. By introducing management theory to the former Soviet bloc, Western governments and business schools hope to create a cadre of people who are familiar with the language and techniques of Western management. The Stockholm School of Economics has an outpost in Riga that teaches economics and business to 100 students a year from Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania. Even in Moscow, business schools are starting to appear, although many of the graduates seem wrapped up in their puppy-like enthusiasm for buzzwords. One Western entrepreneur recalls having to shout at his new recruit that relentlessly mouthing acronyms such as EBIT (business school speak for "earnings before interest and taxes") was doubly pointless: first, the entrepreneur did not know what EBIT meant; and, second, it was based on meaningless figures. Even South Africa has made a contribution with something called ubuntu management, which blends Western ideas with African traditions, such as tribal loyalty.

然而，最大的增长是在远东地区（见第 12 章）。 长期以来，该地区一直将聪明的年轻人送到美国的商学院——台湾政府中到处都是拥有美国 MBA 学位的人。 现在，亚洲正在建立自己的学校，尽管远远不能满足对它们的需求。 在中国，一个极度缺乏训练有素的管理人员的国家，中欧国际工商学院计划从目前位于上海郊区的临时住所搬到浦东的一个巨大的新校区，浦东是该市尚未建成的金融中心， 1997 年：它还将每年招收的学生增加一倍，达到 120 名学生（它每年已经有 4,000 名申请者）。 尽管大多数亚洲大企业仍然是家族企业，但咨询公司已经取得了令人瞩目的进展。 麦肯锡 印度办事处是公司发展最快的分支机构。 随着受过商学院教育的年轻一代亚洲人接手，顾问们可以期待大富翁。

However, the biggest growth is in the Far East (see Chapter 12). The region has long sent its bright young people to American business schools—Taiwan's government is stuffed with people with American MBAs. Now Asia is producing schools of its own, though nowhere near enough to meet the demand for them. In China, a country that is desperately short of trained managers, the China Europe International Business School plans to move from its present temporary home on the outskirts of Shanghai into a huge new campus in Pudong, the city's as-yet-unbuilt financial center, in 1997: it will also double its annual intake to 120 students (it already gets 4,000 applicants a year). Despite the fact that most of the big Asian businesses remain family-run operations, the consultancies have already made impressive progress. McKinsey's Indian office is the company's fastest-growing branch. As the younger business-school-educated generation of Asians takes over, the consultants can expect a bonanza.

踏上香港任何一辆拥挤的电车，你都会发现一个年轻的中国人正在为汤姆彼得斯或约翰奈斯比特的最新产品感到困惑。 在 1995 年一项针对商界人士的大型泛亚调查中，大约一半的受访者在过去两年内购买过西方管理作家的书籍（尽管值得注意的是，几乎相同比例的人承认他们购买过一本西方管理作家的书）

Step onto any of Hong Kong's crowded trams and you will find a young Chinese puzzling over the latest offering from Tom Peters or John Naisbitt. In a mammoth pan-Asian survey of business people in 1995, roughly half of the respondents had bought a book by a Western management writer in the previous two years (although it was noticeable that nearly the same proportion admitted that they had

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

还没看完）。 5 对于许多西方大师来说，亚洲巡回演讲提供的诱惑与音乐综艺对老年摇滚明星的吸引力大致相同。 钱不错（每场研讨会 25,000 美元），观众人数众多且相对不挑剔，一两件亚洲轶事会为他们在国内的表演增添趣味。 唯一的问题是，在如此少的本地竞争中，他们还能生存多久。 目前知名的亚洲大师只有日本的大前健一一人，但后起之秀更是层出不穷。 Insead 最优秀的思想家之一是韩国人 Chan Kim。

not finished reading it). 5 For many Western gurus, Asian speaking tours offer much the same enticements that the musical variety do for elderly rock stars. The money is good ($25,000 a seminar), the audience is large and relatively uncritical, and an Asian anecdote or two will turn up to spice up their performances back home. The only question is how long they will be able to survive with so little local competition. At present there is only one well-known Asian guru, Kenichi Ohmae of Japan, but there are plenty of rising stars. One of the best thinkers at Insead is Chan Kim, a South Korean.

理论的重要性

The Importance of Theory

使管理行业团结在一起并为其提供大部分活力的是管理理论。 理论和工业相互促进——结果两者都变得更大。 对于三类人来说，理论和金钱之间的联系尤为重要：教授、顾问和经理。

What keeps the management industry together and provides much of its vitality is management theory. Theory and industry feed off each other—and both grow bigger as a result. For three groups of people, the link between theory and money is particularly important: professors, consultants, and managers.

越来越多的学者不仅热衷于想出引人注目的新想法，而且热衷于推销它们。 曾经，这种对公众的兴趣可能会激起学术排斥。 现在，随着更理想的大学城的房价飙升，每位年轻教授都梦想着写一本畅销书； 而且，即使是最好的商学院也在拼命争夺学生，每一位商学院院长都鼓励他。 曾经，商学院的教授们以将难以理解的想法隐藏在难以理解的散文中，只为少数听众而自豪。 现在，像哈佛商学院的 Rosabeth Moss Kanter 和斯坦福大学的 Jeffrey Pfeffer 这样的人，故意写出通俗易懂的散文，并允许他们的出版商开展时髦的广告活动，包括新闻资料袋、书籍签名和领先商人的背书。

Increasingly, academics are keen not just on thinking up striking new ideas, but on selling them. Once such a taste for publicity might have provoked academic ostracism. Now, with house prices in the more desirable university towns soaring, every young professor dreams of writing a best-seller; and, with even the best business schools desperately competing for students, every business school dean encourages him. Once business school professors prided themselves on cloaking incomprehensible ideas in impenetrable prose for a tiny audience. Now the likes of Rosabeth Moss Kanter, of Harvard Business School, and Jeffrey Pfeffer, of Stanford, write in deliberately accessible prose and allow their publishers to mount jazzy advertising campaigns, with press kits, book signings, and endorsements by leading businessmen. Although it is difficult to condemn any management theorist who can write books in English, it is hard to imagine the same hoopla surrounding the launch of, say, an economics textbook.

值得注意的是，商学院的学者正在建立自己的咨询公司。 Michael Porter 是 Monitor 的董事； 罗莎贝丝·莫斯·坎特 (Rosabeth Moss Kanter) 是波士顿另一家咨询公司 Goodmeasure 的创始人。 只是为了表明英国人可以玩同样的游戏，约翰凯是伦敦经济学的创始人。 事实上，学术界和商业界之间的界限往往如此模糊，以至于很难对人进行分类。 Should Kenichi Ohmae——麦肯锡东京长长负责人

Significantly, business school academics are setting up their own consultancies. Michael Porter is a director of Monitor; Rosabeth Moss Kanter is a founder of Goodmeasure, another Boston-based consultancy. Just to show that the British can play the same game, John Kay is a founder of London Economics. Indeed, the lines between acade-mia and commerce are often so blurred that it is hard to categorize people. Should Kenichi Ohmae—long head of McKinsey's Tokyo

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

现在是他自己的咨询公司的负责人，他在世界各地的商学院举办座无虚席的讲座，并编辑哈佛商学院关于全球化等主题的书籍——算作学者还是顾问？ 由普华永道主办的麻省理工学院“CEO 思想峰会”是学术聚会还是企业公关策略？

operation and now head of his own consultancy, who gives packed lectures at business schools around the world and edits Harvard Business School books on subjects like globalization—be counted as an academic or a consultant? Is a "CEO thought summit" at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology sponsored by Price Waterhouse an academic get-together or a corporate public relations ploy?

对于咨询公司而言，新创意与利润之间的联系更加清晰。 正如一位顾问所说，“客户希望您增加他们的智力资本。” 麦肯锡每年在研究上花费 5000 万至 1 亿美元。 《麦肯锡季刊》（看起来好像在努力打败《哈佛商业评论》，偶尔也会这样做）和麦肯锡全球研究所长期以来一直给公司带来准学术的光彩。 现在几乎所有其他咨询公司都会出版一本名为 Prism 或 Insights Quarterly 的杂志。 Gemini 的 Transformations 是一种更不稳定的产品，它带有已经突出显示或下划线的重要段落。 Booz, Allen & Hamilton 为追赶麦肯锡做出了最坚决的尝试，该公司任命了各种知识主管。

For consultancies, the link between new ideas and profit is even clearer. As one consultant puts it, "Customers expect you to add to their intellectual capital." McKinsey spends $50 million to $100 million a year on research. The McKinsey Quarterly (which looks as if it is trying to best the Harvard Business Review, and occasionally does) and the McKinsey Global Institute have long given the firm a quasi-academic glow. Virtually every other consultancy nowadays produces a magazine with a name like Prism or Insights Quarterly. One of the more flaky products, Transformations, from Gemini, comes with significant passages already highlighted or underlined. The most determined attempt to catch up with McKinsey has been made by Booz, Allen & Hamilton, which has appointed sundry knowledge officers. It has also brought in Joel Kurtzman, a former editor of the Harvard Business Review, to run a new periodical, Strategy & Business.

很少有什么能像一本畅销的商业书籍那样反映咨询公司的情况。 公司再造帮助 CSC Index 将其年收入从该书出现之前的 7000 万美元提高到 1994 年的 1.6 亿美元以上。Arthur D. Little 的目标是每年至少出版一本大书，并为顾问提供写作时间，如果他们能来的话提出一个足够好的建议。 Product Juggernauts: How Companies Mobilize to Generate a Stream Market Winners（1995 年）是一项关于产品创新的出色研究，结果就是其中之一。 6 咨询公司乐于安排此类书籍在杂志上连载，在报纸上刊登广告，并得到知名商人的认可。 他们中的一些人甚至安排批量购买书籍——例如《市场领导者的纪律》。

Few things reflect as well on a consultancy as a best-selling business book.
