Reengineering the Corporation helped CSC Index raise its annual revenues from $70 million before the book appeared to more than $160 million in 1994. Arthur D. Little aims to produce at least one big book a year and offers consultants time off for writing if they can come up with a good enough proposal. Product Juggernauts: How Companies Mobilize to Generate a Stream of Market Winners (1995), an excellent study of product innovation, was one result. 6 Consultancies happily arrange for such books to be serialized in magazines, advertised in newspapers, and endorsed by well-known businessmen. A few of them even arrange for the books to be bought in bulk—as in the case of The Discipline of Market Leaders.

制作下一部管理大片的争夺表明咨询业的竞争已经变得多么激烈。 咨询曾经是一种舒适的业务。 现在，Andersen Consulting 和 Electronic Data Systems (EDS) 等巨头正在向该地区投入资源。 EDS 已经吞并了业内历史最悠久的公司之一 A. T Kearney。 Gemini 和 Mercer 这两家领先的战略公司本身就是合并的产物

The scramble to produce the next management blockbuster shows how competitive consulting has become. Consulting used to be something of a cozy business. Now giants such as Andersen Consulting and Electronic Data Systems (EDS) are pouring resources into the area. EDS has already gobbled up one of the oldest firms in the business, A. T Kearney. Two of the leading strategic companies, Gemini and Mercer, are themselves the products of the consolidation

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

几家小公司。 尽管压力越来越大，但在渴望被视为最新趋势的发起者和那些担心成为其奴隶的咨询公司之间仍然存在明显的区别，尽管他们可能热衷于跟上潮流。 第一阵营包括大部分后来到场的，比如CSC Index和Gemini。 相比之下，麦肯锡出版了几本轰动一时的书——汤姆·彼得斯、罗伯特·沃特曼和大前健一都曾为该公司工作——但它回避了年轻竞争对手那种协调一致的“这是我们的新想法”的方法。 这在一定程度上是规模的函数：即使公司想要将一个想法强加给客户，其合作伙伴也可能不会全部同意此举。 但这也是因为麦肯锡拥有令人印象深刻的人脉网络， 不需要时髦的新产品来充当名片。 有趣的是，最初以增长份额管理和基于时间的管理等理念而闻名的波士顿咨询集团也采用了类似的方法。

of several smaller firms. Despite this increased pressure, there remains a clear difference between consultancies eager to be seen as originators of the latest trend and those wary of becoming its slaves, though they may be keen on keeping up to date. The first camp includes most of the later arrivals on the scene, such as CSC Index and Gemini. By contrast, McKinsey has produced several blockbuster books—Tom Peters, Robert Waterman, and Kenichi Ohmae have all worked for the firm—but it has shied away from the sort of concerted "this is our new idea" approach of its younger rivals. This is partly a function of size: even if the firm wanted to force a single idea down its clients' throats, its partners might not all agree to the move. But it is also because McKinsey, with its impressive array of contacts, does not need jazzy new products to act as calling cards. Interestingly, the Boston Consulting Group, which originally made its name with ideas such as growth-share management and time-based management, also takes a similar approach.

这并不意味着更成熟的公司的顾问对自己写书的热情有所降低。 自 1980 年以来，麦肯锡已经出版了 50 多本书籍，而 1960 年至 1980 年间只有两本。尽管工作时间很长，但不乏愿意牺牲晚上、周末和假期来撰写有关管理的顾问。 自从汤姆·彼得斯 (Tom Peters) 通过宣传一项内部研究项目，将自己从默默无闻的麦肯锡人（名叫托马斯·彼得斯）转变为中层经理的招贴画以来，顾问们一直梦想着写一部商业大片。 在最坏的情况下，一本成功的书可以赢得客户并使顾问晋升。 充其量，它可以让一个人开始作为独立顾问和演讲者的职业生涯。

That does not mean that consultants at the more established firms are any less keen on writing books themselves. McKinsey has churned out over 50 books since 1980, compared with only two between 1960 and 1980. Despite famously long hours, there is no shortage of consultants who are willing to sacrifice their evenings, weekends, and holidays to write on management. Ever since Tom Peters transformed himself from an unknown McKinseyite (named Thomas J. Peters) to the middle manager's pinup by publicizing an internal research project, consultants have daydreamed about writing a business blockbuster. At worst, a successful book can win clients and project the consultant up through the ranks; at best, it can allow one to launch a career as an independent consultant and speaker.

公司董事长的脑海中似乎也浮现出同样的想法。 越来越多的退休商人正在开辟第二职业——并积累第二财富——成为管理专家。 英国 ICI 和蔼可亲的前老板约翰·哈维-琼斯爵士主演了一部电视连续剧“疑难解答”，在该剧中，他周游世界，为其他经理人提供建议； 他还把自己变成了商业巡回演讲中最熟悉的人物之一。 实践老板有时间提出新理论的日子可能已经结束，但他们仍在试图影响学术观点。 ABB 负责人 Percy Barnevik 是商学院的常客，并撰写了哈佛大学的介绍

Much the same thoughts seem to be going through the minds of corporate chairmen. More and more retired businessmen are carving out second careers—and piling up second fortunes—as management pundits. Sir John Harvey-Jones, the amiable former boss of Britain's ICI, has starred in a television series, "Troubleshooter," in which he wanders the world dispensing advice to other managers; he has also turned himself into one of the most familiar figures on the business lecture circuit. The days when practicing bosses had time to come up with new theories may be over, but they are still trying to influence academic opinion. Percy Barnevik, head of ABB, is a regular guest at business schools and has written the introduction to a Harvard

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

商学院关于全球化的书。 《哈佛商业评论》定期对领先的商人进行搜查式审讯，并且不乏心甘情愿的受害者。 英国美体小铺 (Body Shop) 的创始人安妮塔·罗迪克 (Anita Roddick) 对她在斯坦福商学院担任客座讲师的几周感到非常沮丧，以至于她试图通过一场关于这家具有社会责任感的公司的热情演讲来撼动美国管理学院 1995 年的会议。 她还创办了一所新管理学院，这是一所新时代的商学院，其中加入了一些社会公益活动。

Business School book on globalization. The Harvard Business Review regularly subjects leading businessmen to searching interrogations and has no shortage of willing victims. Anita Roddick, the founder of Britain's Body Shop, was so frustrated by her few weeks as a guest lecturer at Stanford Business School, that she tried to shake up the 1995 conference of America's Academy of Management with a passionate lecture on the socially responsible company. She is also founding a New Academy of Management, a sort of new-age business school with a spot of social do-goodery thrown in.

人们很想诅咒首席执行官，因为他们在本应照顾股东的时候却花这么多时间追逐鬼火理论。 然而，在许多情况下，主要受益人是他们所领导的公司。 对管理理论的品味使公司能够以“勇往直前”的形象出现——甚至让他们有机会赚钱。 公司获得关注的一种方式是将自己宣传为“卓越中心”——并向观看其表现的人收费。 每年有 2,400 名管理朝圣者长途跋涉到位于密苏里州的柴油发动机装配商 Springfield Manufacturing，观看它实践所谓的“开卷管理”。 该公司从旅游、各种录像带、书籍和录音带中赚取 140 万美元。 其他圣地包括迪斯尼世界，这里有“

It is tempting to damn chief executives for spending so much time chasing will-o'-the-wisp theories when they should be looking after their shareholders. In many cases, however, the chief beneficiary is the company they head. A taste for management theory allows companies to present themselves as "go ahead"—and even gives them a chance to earn money. One way for a company to get noticed is to promote itself as a "center of excellence"—and charge people for watching it perform. Every year 2,400 management pilgrims trek to Springfield Manufacturing, a diesel-engine assembler based in Missouri, to watch it practice something called "open-book management." The company earns $1.4 million from the tours, and assorted videotapes, books, and audiotapes. Other meccas include Disney World, home to a "people-management seminar," and AT&T's Universal Card service center, where guests pay $375 a day to watch the telephone giant demonstrate its skills in customer service. 7 Quite apart from the money such demonstrations earn, they spread the word that Motorola and Federal Express, for instance, are the last thing in quality.

另一种类似的策略是将自己宣传为一所独立的小型商学院。 美国的默克、3M、宝洁、迪斯尼、万豪、IBM、麦当劳、摩托罗拉，英国的Unipart等公司都以“大学”的名义冠以内部培训项目的尊严。 这些大学的“教师”成员与其新身份相称，热衷于发展新思想，而不仅仅是传播公认的智慧，以便看起来与时俱进。

Another similar tactic is to promote oneself as a small business school in one's own right. Companies such as Merck, 3M, Procter & Gamble, Disney, Marriott, IBM, McDonald's, and Motorola in the United States, and Unipart in Britain have all dignified their in-house training programs with the title of "university." As befits their new-found status, the "faculty" members of these universities are keen on developing new ideas, not just transmitting received wisdom, in order to seem up to date.

人们几乎忍不住赞扬管理行业的广度。 有这么多不同类型的人，有着如此不同的风格和观点，渴望为管理理论做出贡献，结果之一是它有助于扩大该学科的受众。 对于大多数类型的读者来说，这里有一些东西，来自做梦的幻想家

One is almost tempted to praise the breadth of the management industry. One result of having so many different sorts of people, with such diverse styles and perspectives, eager to contribute to management theory, is that it helps to widen the discipline's audience. There is something there for most sorts of readers, from fantasists who dream

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

想了解组织运作方式的社会科学家。 退休的商人通常写轶事，展示他们自己的职业如何证明一般的商业原则，而学者则对强大的分析技术（如回归分析）有弱点。 蓬勃发展的创造力也为公司创造了一个不断扩大的管理工具聚宝盆。

of getting rich quick to social scientists who want to understand the way organizations operate. Retired businessmen usually write in anecdotes, showing how their own careers demonstrate general business principles, while academics have a weakness for powerful analytical techniques, such as regression analysis. Flourishing creativity also creates an expanding cornucopia of management tools for companies.

另一方面，看看管理行业的各个领地——教师、顾问、商人、出版商、软件制造商等等——也得出了一个令人担忧的结论：一群名副其实的人在炒作大师们中获得了既得利益，几乎没有人能从批评他们中获益。 在某种程度上，甚至媒体也被收编了。 大师们定期为商业杂志和报纸撰写文章。 《金融时报》、《商业周刊》和《经济学人》等新闻机构都在扩大会议业务，将自己变成管理思想的提供者和批评者。 总的来说，我们认为主流商业媒体对大师们的容忍度终于有所降低。 一些管理行业的最新产品——特别是， 市场领导者的纪律和组织转型——评论家给了（当之无愧的）困难时期。 各种专栏作家，例如《金融时报》的露西·凯拉维 (Lucy Kellaway)，专长是在咨询公司和出版商的每日新闻稿的垃圾提示周围匆匆忙忙，这些新闻稿现在聚集在每个管理记者的门外，并找到一些特别荒谬的新时尚来嘲笑。 然而，考虑到我们的既得利益，公平地记录许多其他人认为媒体的批判本能正在进一步消退。 “你认为我们收到了多少来自出版物的请求，这些出版物正在对重新设计等时尚进行另一项调查？” 一位高级顾问抱怨道，他认为“群体心态” 每增加一个新的管理页面或管理通讯员，记者人数就会增加。 他认为，记者更感兴趣的是成为第一个报道明显趋势的人，而不是调查这种趋势是否真的有效。

On the other hand, looking at the management industry's various fiefs—the teachers, consultants, business people, publishers, software makers, and so on—also suggests a worrying conclusion: a veritable army of people have a vested interest in hyping the gurus, and almost nobody gains by criticizing them. Even the press has, to some extent, been coopted. Gurus regularly write articles for business magazines and newspapers. News organizations such as the Financial Times, Business Week and, yes, The Economist, are all expanding their conference business, turning themselves into both purveyors of management thought and critics of it. In general, we would argue that the mainstream business press is, at last, getting a little less tolerant of the gurus. Some of the management industry's more recent offerings—notably, The Discipline of Market Leaders and Transforming the Organization —were given a (deservedly) hard time by reviewers. Various columnists, such as Lucy Kellaway in the Financial Times, make a specialty of scurrying around the rubbish tip of daily press releases from consultancies and publishers that now gathers outside every management journalist's door, and finding some particularly absurd new fad to ridicule. However, given our vested interest, it is only fair to record that many other people reckon that the media's critical instincts are fading even further. "How many requests do you think we receive from publications doing yet another survey of fads like reengi-neering?" moans one senior consultant, who thinks that "the pack mentality" among journalists increases with each and every new management page or management correspondent. Journalists, he argues, are more interested in being the first to write about an apparent trend than investigating whether the trend actually works.

在焦虑中茁壮成长

Thriving on Anxiety

如果所有这些既得利益者将管理行业转变为一台令人印象深刻的营销机器，它们并不能完全解释为什么客户会投身于它的车轮下。 什么驱动

If all these vested interests transform the management industry into an impressive marketing machine, they do not completely explain why customers fling themselves under its wheels. What drives

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

一个为了阅读一些关于组织变革的长篇大论而早早进入坟墓的人？ 是什么驱使一家面目全非的公司派关键员工参加昂贵的解放管理研讨会？

a man who is already working himself into an early grave to read some screed on organizational transformation? And what drives a company that is staring oblivion in the face to send key employees on expensive seminars on liberation management?

管理大师的学生 Andrzej Huczynski 认为，部分原因在于管理者对自己地位的焦虑。 美国第一所商学院的建立是为了让管理人员能够直视法学院和医学院的毕业生。 经理们参加高管教育项目和国际会议，因为这是专业人士所做的事情。 经理们对“科学管理”大加赞赏，因为每个人似乎都有一个科学分支来支持他们。

Andrzej Huczynski, a student of management gurus, argues that part of the answer lies in managers' anxiety about their status. The first American business schools were built so that managers could look graduates from the great schools of law and medicine straight in the eye. Managers went on executive-education programs and international conferences because that was the sort of thing that professional people did. Managers lapped up "scientific management" because everybody who was anybody seemed to have a branch of science to support them.

一些最成功的大师曾经是管理自我的无耻奉承者。 彼得·德鲁克 (Peter Drucker) 将他的经典著作《管理实践》(The Practice of Management) 命名为“对美国社会最重要职能的研究”。 “经理，”他说，“是每个企业中充满活力的、赋予生命的元素。” Henry Mintzberg 一再强调管理者工作的难度和复杂性，强调管理者是特殊的人，要与棘手的问题作斗争。 Tom Peters 尝试了一种略有不同的策略，告诉经理们不仅他们很重要，而且他们相当古怪。 他们的孩子可能称他们为正方形。 他们的妻子可能会失望，因为他们不像以前那么有趣了。 但是，听了汤姆·彼得斯的话，他们变成了疯子，

Some of the most successful gurus have been shameless flatterers of managerial egos. Peter Drucker subtitled his classic The Practice of Management "a study of the most important function in American society." "The manager," he argued, "is the dynamic, life-giving element in every business." Henry Mintzberg has repeatedly stressed the difficulty and complexity of managers' jobs, reinforcing the idea that managers are special people, grappling with intractable problems. Tom Peters tries a slightly different tactic, telling managers not just that they are important but also that they are rather wacky. Their children may call them squares. Their wives may despair that they are not as much fun as they used to be. But, listening to Tom Peters, they become crazy guys, dreaming impossible dreams and making unbelievable things happen.

普通苦苦挣扎的医生或大学教授可能会惊讶地发现，管理者是缺乏社交安全感的人。 商学院闪闪发光的建筑和精心修剪的草坪，无不彰显着财富的傲慢。 在过去十年中，高层管理人员的收入大幅增加，而车间工人的收入却停滞不前甚至下降。 难道真正为自己的地位焦虑的人是传统精英的成员，比如公务员和学者？ 答案是，从社会角度来看，管理阶层可能比过去更有保障。 但是今天的管理者还有很多其他事情需要担心，而管理理论家已经成为发现和平息这些担忧的行家。

The average struggling doctor or university professor might be surprised to discover that managers are socially insecure people. The gleaming buildings and carefully manicured lawns of business schools bespeak the arrogance of wealth. Top managers have seen their incomes increase substantially over the past decade, at a time when the income of shop-floor workers has stagnated or even declined. Surely the people who are really anxious about their status are members of the traditional elites, such as civil servants and academics? The answer is that, in social terms, the managerial class is probably more secure that it used to be. But today's managers have a lot of other things to be worried about, and management theorists have become virtuosos at discovering and calming these worries.

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

经理们比以往任何时候都更加害怕未来。 他们知道自己正经历着全球经济的重大变化——亚洲的崛起、IBM 等蓝筹公司的衰落、职业阶梯的崩溃——他们不知道这些变化是否会让他们变得富有或成为成功人士伤亡。 在最基本的层面上，他们害怕失去工作。 首先是在美国，然后是英国，现在在欧洲和日本，公司已经打破了管理工作是终生工作的惯例。

Managers are much more fearful of the future than they have ever been before. They know that they are living through momentous changes in the global economy—the rise of Asia, the fall of blue chip companies like IBM, the collapse of career ladders—and they do not know whether those changes will make them rich or turn them into casualties. At the most basic level, they are terrified of losing their jobs. First in the United States, then in Britain, and now in Europe and Japan, companies have broken with the convention that a job in management is a job for life.

即使他们在最近一轮的重组中幸存下来，经理们仍然不得不接受彻底重新设计的工作。 毕竟，当他们“管理”时，他们实际上应该做什么？ 他们是战略制定者吗？ 穿西装的军士长？ 教练？ 业余心理治疗师？ 在过去等级森严、员工恭顺的时代，从来没有出现过这样的异端问题：高层管理人员制定战略，将任务细分为不同的组成部分，并设计激励方案，而下属则监督工人，如果他们懈怠，就会大声训斥他们。 但是现在，随着计算机将信息交到越来越多的员工手中，并将决策权下放给一线员工，传统的管理权力来源正在消失。 有些“瘦”

Even if they have survived the latest round of restructuring, managers still have to come to terms with radically redesigned jobs. What, after all, are they actually supposed to do when they "manage"? Are they strategy setters? Sergeant majors in business suits? Coaches? Amateur psychotherapists? In the old days of steep hierarchies and deferential workers, such heretical questions never arose: senior managers set strategy, subdivided tasks into their component parts, and designed incentive schemes, and their juniors supervised workers and bawled them out if they slacked off. But now that computers are putting information in the hands of more and more employees and decision making is being devolved to front-line workers, the traditional sources of managerial authority are disappearing. Some "lean" factories have even introduced a quasi-Maoist device called "360-degree assessment," whereby managers have to listen to frank reports on their personal foibles and failings from the people they are supposed to be managing.

美国心理学家艾伦·凯彻 (Allan Katcher) 问过美国高级管理人员，他们最不希望下属了解他们的哪些方面。 在 20 个案例中，有 19 个答案是相同的。 他们担心他们的下属会知道他们觉得自己的工作有多么不足。 这些颤抖的吉娃娃是职业经理人，在他们的职业生涯中被培养成为顶级犬。 然而，许多最终担任此类管理职位的人获得晋升并不是因为他们的管理技能，而是因为他们在其他工作中的出色表现——如工程师、律师或社论作家。 在他们以前的工作中，他们无疑鄙视管理理论。 或许，他们依然鄙视它； 但现在要根据他们的管理能力对他们进行评估，他们不情愿地被它迷住了。 所以他们求助于那些“知道”的人，

Allan Katcher, an American psychologist, has asked senior American executives what they would least want their subordinates to know about them. In 19 out of the 20 cases the answer was the same. They feared that their subordinates would learn how inadequate they felt in their jobs. These trembling Chihuahuas were professional managers, groomed throughout their careers to become top dogs. Yet many people who end up in such managerial positions are promoted not for their managerial skills but for their excellence in other jobs—as engineers or lawyers or editorial writers. In their former jobs, they no doubt despised management theory. Perhaps, they despise it still; but now that they are going to be evaluated on the basis of their managerial abilities, they reluctantly fall under its spell. So they turn to the people who "know," guiltily buying a book on

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

管理层，然后组织一次会议，例如，来自麦肯锡的顾问担任“协调人”。

management, then organizing a conference, with, say, a consultant from McKinsey to act as a "facilitator."

对于这些焦虑不安的男男女女，管理书籍提供了一种难得的安全感。 最明显的受益者是那些专注于个人而非组织的边缘思想家：因此斯蒂芬柯维的新时代心理疗法（高效能人士的七个习惯，1989 年）和激励大师如安东尼罗宾斯的魅力。 然而，管理层的焦虑也帮助了一些作者，这些作者为他们的读者提供了一个更笼统的解释，说明他们到底发生了什么。 例如，查尔斯·汉迪 (Charles Handy) 的《无理性时代》(The Age of Unreason, 1989) 解决了终生工作消失的问题。 后续作品 The Empty Raincoat (1995) 着眼于生活失衡的普遍感觉，有些人日以继夜地工作，而另一些人无所事事。 即使是相当简单的管理书籍也经常以专为吸引紧张情绪而设计的包装形式出现。 谁会猜到控制你的命运或其他人的意志（1993）实际上是杰克韦尔奇的（相当不错的）商业传记？ 汤姆彼得斯的一本书开头引用了英特尔老板安迪格罗夫的话：“只有偏执狂才能生存”； 另一本名为《混乱中的繁荣》（Thriving on Chaos，1989 年）。 管理书籍的理想“独特销售建议”类似于“买我的书，否则你将不会成为避免被裁员或签订短期合同的精英之一。” 谁会猜到控制你的命运或其他人的意志（1993）实际上是杰克韦尔奇的（相当不错的）商业传记？ 汤姆彼得斯的一本书开头引用了英特尔老板安迪格罗夫的话：“只有偏执狂才能生存”； 另一本名为《混乱中的繁荣》（Thriving on Chaos，1989 年）。 管理书籍的理想“独特销售建议”类似于“买我的书，否则你将不会成为避免被裁员或签订短期合同的精英之一。” 谁会猜到控制你的命运或其他人的意志（1993）实际上是杰克韦尔奇的（相当不错的）商业传记？ 汤姆彼得斯的一本书开头引用了英特尔老板安迪格罗夫的话：“只有偏执狂才能生存”； 另一本名为《混乱中的繁荣》（Thriving on Chaos，1989 年）。 管理书籍的理想“独特销售建议”类似于“买我的书，否则你将不会成为避免被裁员或签订短期合同的精英之一。”

To these anxiety-ridden men and women, management books offer a rare source of security. The most obvious beneficiaries are those fringe thinkers who concentrate on the individual rather than the organization: hence the charm of Stephen Covey's new-age psychotherapy {The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People, 1989) and of motivational gurus such as Anthony Robbins. However, managerial angst has also helped brass tacks authors who provide their readers with a more general explanation of what exactly is happening to them. For instance, Charles Handy's The Age of Unreason (1989) addresses the disappearance of jobs for life. A follow-up, The Empty Raincoat (1995), looks at the widespread feeling that life is out of balance, with some people working round the clock and others having nothing to do. Even fairly straightforward management books often come in packages designed to appeal to the nervous. Who would have guessed that Control Your Destiny or Somebody Else Will (1993) is actually a (fairly good) business biography of Jack Welch? One book by Tom Peters begins with a quotation from Andy Grove, the boss of Intel: "Only the paranoid survive"; another is called Thriving on Chaos (1989). The ideal "unique selling proposition" for a management book is something along the lines of "Buy me or else you will not be among the elite who will avoid being downsized out of a job or put on a short-term contract."

通常，大师们给人一种错觉，即对于世界的所有复杂性，只要大师是一个人的向导，答案就真的相当简单。 《追求卓越》充满了“答案出奇地简单，尽管被大多数管理者忽略”的保证。 8 要找到真相，一个人既不需要巨大的大脑，也不需要魔杖。 彼得斯甚至争辩说，正是这本书无情的常识性使它成为畅销书：“没有魔法——实用的常识——被证明是它最大的卖点。” 他随后出版的著作《追求卓越的激情》（A Passion for Excellence，1985 年）的第一章被称为“显而易见的闪光”。 使想法看起来简单的另一种方法是将它们转化为公式，例如 Douglas McGregor 的“X 理论和 Y 理论”。

Often, the gurus offer the illusion that, for all the complexities of the world, the answers are really rather straightforward, provided the guru is one's guide. In Search of Excellence is full of reassurances that "the answer is surprisingly simple, albeit ignored by most managers." 8 To find the truth one needs neither a gigantic brain nor a magic wand. Peters even argued that it was the book's relentlessly commonsensical nature that made it a best-seller: "The absence of magic—practical common sense—turned out to be its biggest selling point." The first chapter of his subsequent book, A Passion for Excellence (1985), was called "A flash of the obvious." Another way to make ideas seem simple is to translate them into formulas, such as Douglas McGregor's "theory X and theory Y." Nowadays alliterative formulas are so rampant that a reader does not know whether the "three Cs" refers to commitment, creativity, and competition, as

管理理论产业

The Management Theory Industry

正如 Rosabeth Moss Kanter 所说，Kenichi Ohmae 宣扬或能力、联系和概念。

Kenichi Ohmae preaches, or competence, connections, and concepts, as Rosabeth Moss Kanter would have it.

当这种魅力不能消除管理者的恐惧时，他们通常会点燃他们的野心。 对管理理论的品味可以帮助聪明的年轻管理人员抢占同事的先机。 被选中参加昂贵的管理研讨会意味着他们受到顶头上司的青睐。 参加研讨会让他们接触到一种流行的语言，并帮助他们与来自其他公司的同样雄心勃勃的同事建立联系。 （它也可以让你从做任何真正的工作中解脱出来。）拥护一个想法表明经理乐于改变，愿意承担风险，了解最新的想法。 将时尚付诸实践的机会让他在整个公司获得了更高的知名度，考验了他作为变革推动者的勇气，而不仅仅是现状的傀儡，

When such charms are not soothing managers' fears, they are usually firing their ambitions. A taste for management theory can help bright young executives to steal a march on their colleagues. Being chosen to attend an expensive management seminar means that they are in favor with their immediate superiors. Attending the seminar gives them access to a trendy language and helps them to network with similarly ambitious colleagues from other companies. (It also makes a welcome break from doing any real work.) Championing an idea suggests that a manager is open to change, willing to take risks, in touch with the latest thinking. The chance to put the fad into practice gives him much higher visibility throughout the company, tests his mettle as an agent of change and not just a stooge of the status quo, and generally increases his chances of winning promotion.

经理们热衷于管理理论的另一个原因是防御性的：还有什么比让你的专业披上科学理论的尊严更能捍卫你的地盘呢？ 彼得德鲁克的“目标管理”强化了总经理的地位。 全面质量管理强化了生产主管的作用。 培训部门永远在寻找有助于增加培训预算的想法，而“人力资源专家”对任何主张“以人为本”（借用一位教授的书名）的理论家来说都是傻瓜。斯坦福商学院，Jeffrey Pfeffer）。

Another reason that managers are keen on management theory is defensive: what better way to defend your turf than to clothe your specialism with the dignity of scientific theory? Peter Drucker's "management by objectives" strengthened the position of general managers. Total-quality management reinforced the role of production chiefs. The training department is forever on the lookout for ideas that will help inflate the training budget, while the "human resource specialists" are suckers for any theorist who argues for "putting people first" (to borrow the title of a book by a professor at Stanford Business School, Jeffrey Pfeffer).

赶时髦的重要性

The Importance of Being Faddish

为什么经理们会从一个理论跳到另一个理论，而不是只满足于一个理论，或者随着他们的失望情绪的增加，完全拒绝整个大师业务？ 为什么管理大师不断撕毁神圣的文本并从头开始？ 答案的曙光应该已经很明显了。 准大师的数量之多意味着市场上总是有无数的想法。 管理思想的消费者普遍存在恐惧和野心，这意味着市场总是不稳定的。

Why do managers flit from theory to theory rather than settling for just one or, as their disappointment mounts, rejecting the whole guru business entirely? And why do management gurus keep tearing up the sacred texts and starting from scratch? The glimmer of an answer should already be apparent. The sheer number of would-be gurus means that there are always numerous ideas in the marketplace. The prevalence of fear and ambition among the consumers of management ideas means that the market is always unstable.

可以说，美国管理专业化为当前的管理风潮奠定了基础

Arguably, the ground for the current frenzy of management fads was prepared by the professionalization of management in America

怎么运行的

HOW IT WORKS

在第二次世界大战之后。 这一变化背后的前提是一套通用概念和通用原则可以适用于所有情况。 对这些普遍理念的信仰使管理者摆脱了早期对临时内部管理实践的依赖，并使他们准备好成为大规模生产和大规模销售的管理技术的消费者。

in the wake of the Second World War. The premise behind this change was that a set of general concepts and generic principles could be applied in all circumstances. Belief in these universal ideas weaned managers from their earlier reliance on improvised in-house management practices and prepared them to become consumers of mass-produced and mass-marketed managerial techniques.

这种有条不紊的系统允许流行但不围绕它们建立，只持续了 1980 年代。 突然间，它的大部分固定点都受到质疑。 大规模生产模式似乎不再奏效。 良好管理的典范——通用汽车和 IBM 等公司——正在下滑。 在系统之外发明的想法——诸如“精益生产”和“客户-供应商”伙伴关系等外国概念——似乎具有优势。 美国公司现在不得不咨询汤姆彼得斯和丰田，而不仅仅是哈佛商学院和麦肯锡。 所谓的管理时尚主义的速度几乎在任何地方都呈指数级增长。 越是恐慌的公司，他们就越是在技术之间飞来飞去以寻求救赎。 理查德·帕斯卡尔 (Richard Pascale) 于 1990 年在边缘管理中强调的 27 种时尚中，有三分之二产生于 1980 年代。 从那时起，这个过程只是加快了。

This regimented system, which allowed for fads but was not built around them, lasted only as long as the 1980s. Suddenly, most of its fixed points were called into question. The mass-production model no longer seemed to be working. The paragons of good management—companies such as General Motors and IBM—were slipping. Ideas that had been invented outside the system—foreign notions such as "lean production" and "customer-supplier" partnerships— appeared to have the edge. American companies now had to consult Tom Peters and Toyota rather than just the Harvard Business School and McKinsey. What might be called the velocity of management fad-dism increased exponentially just about everywhere. The more companies panicked the more they flitted from technique to technique in search of salvation. Of the 27 fads highlighted by Richard Pascale in Managing on the Edge in 1990, two-thirds were spawned during the 1980s. Since then the process has only speeded up.

而且，从管理行业的角度来看，该系统的美妙之处在于没有一个公式有效——或者，至少，它们没有像痛苦或贪婪的买家所希望的那样完全有效。 结果是大师们获得了巨额利润，但他们的客户却感到困惑。 “在过去的 18 个月里，”一位中西部设备制造商告诉 Pascale，“我们听说利润比收入更重要，质量比利润更重要，人比利润更重要，客户比我们的员工更重要。 ，大客户比我们的小客户更重要，增长是我们成功的关键。难怪我们的业绩不稳定。”

And, from the management industry's viewpoint, the beauty of the system is that none of the formulas work—or, at least, they do not work as completely as the anguished or greedy buyers hope. The result is enormous profits for the gurus but confusion for their clients. "In the past 18 months," one Midwestern equipment manufacturer told Pascale, "we have heard that profit is more important than revenue, quality is more important than profit, that people are more important than profit, that customers are more important than our people, that big customers are more important than our small customers, and that growth is the key to our success. No wonder our performance is inconsistent."

管理行业值得反复指责的一件事是，它经常将自己的想法作为永久解决方案出售。 仔细研究表明，管理仍然是一门艺术而不是一门科学，尽管它的愿望恰恰相反。 考虑到这一点，我们现在来看看这些想法本身，从两位最著名的巫医的工作开始：彼得德鲁克和汤姆彼得斯。

One thing that the management industry deserves to be flagellated for repeatedly is that it so often sells its ideas as permanent solutions. Close study indicates that management remains an art rather than a science, its aspirations to the contrary notwithstanding. With that in mind, we will now look at the ideas themselves, beginning with the work of the two best-known witch doctors: Peter Drucker and Tom Peters.

第二部分

PART TWO

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

第3章

CHAPTER 3

在知识分子生活的大多数领域，没有人能完全决定谁是佼佼者——有时是因为思想流派的对立面有冠军，有时是因为有太多优秀的样本可供选择。 然而，在管理大师的世界里，没有争论。 彼得德鲁克是无可争议的男性领袖。 他也是任何学科中为数不多的可以声称改变了世界的思想家之一：他是私有化的发明者，新一代知识工作者的倡导者，管理学作为一门严肃的知识学科的拥护者。 一位韩国商人甚至为了向这位伟人致敬而采用德鲁克作为他的教名。 这也许有点极端，甚至可悲，但德鲁克是唯一一位管理理论家，每个受过良好教育的人，

In most areas of intellectual life nobody can quite decide who is the top dog—sometimes because rival schools of thought have rival champions, sometimes because there are so many fine specimens to choose from. In the world of management gurus, however, there is no debate. Peter Drucker is undisputed alpha male. He is also one of the few thinkers from any discipline who can claim to have changed the world: he is the inventor of privatization, the apostle of a new class of knowledge workers, the champion of management as a serious intellectual discipline. One South Korean businessman has even gone so far as to adopt Drucker as his Christian name in deference to the great man. This is perhaps a little extreme, even sad, but Drucker is the one management theorist who every reasonably well-educated person, however contemptuous of business or infuriated by jargon, really ought to read.

这个无与伦比的位置与年龄和产量有很大关系。 现在，在他 80 多岁的时候，当今天的管理专家正在重新设计他们的火车时，德鲁克是一位领先的管理专家。 自从 20 世纪 40 年代发现这门学科以来，他的著作数量惊人：26 本书、数千篇文章、数以万计的讲座，天知道给管理者提供了多少实用建议。 并非所有这些都经受住了时间的考验。 德鲁克后来的一些作品有点单薄，用

This unrivaled position has a lot to do with age and output. Now in his late 80s, Drucker was a leading management pundit when today's management pundits were reengineering their train sets. Since discovering the discipline back in the 1940s, he has produced an astonishing quantity of work: 26 books, thousands of articles, tens of thousands of lectures, and goodness knows how much practical advice for managers. Not all of it has stood the test of time; and some of Drucker's later work is a little thin, padded out with

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

不谦虚地提及他的早期作品。 然而，让所有这些努力都值得的是他的智慧。 无论德鲁克头上有多少条死胡同，他那永不磨灭的好奇心总能让读者深思。 德鲁克会说他讨厌“大师”这个词，认为它是江湖骗子的同义词。 但事实上，他是唯一一位真正配得上这一荣誉的管理思想家。

immodest references to his early work. Yet what makes all this effort worthwhile is the sheer quality of his intellect. No matter how many blind alleys Drucker heads up, his relentlessly curious mind always makes the reader think. Drucker will say that he hates the word "guru," thinking it synonymous with charlatan. But, in truth, he is the one management thinker who genuinely deserves the accolade.

德鲁克之路

The Road to Drucker

根据汤姆彼得斯的说法，在德鲁克之前“没有真正的管理纪律”。 1 然而，将几乎任何现代管理思想追溯到 20 世纪初的“先驱者和先知”——有时甚至更早——已经成为一种时尚。 但是，对于现代读者（更不用说现代管理者）来说，学术界对谁先说的争论兴趣有限。 即使 Cato 列出的罗马帝国省级行政人员的职位描述清单是 2000 年后 Charles Handy 关于工作场所的理论的远祖，但每个理智的现代经理人的合乎逻辑的反应应该是：“那又怎样？”

According to Tom Peters, "no true discipline of management" existed before Drucker. 1 Yet it has become fashionable to trace virtually any modern management idea to the "pioneers and prophets" of the early twentieth century—and sometimes even further back. But, for the modern reader (let alone the modern manager), the academic squabbles over who first said what are of limited interest. Even if Cato's list of job descriptions for provincial administrators in the Roman empire is a distant ancestor of Charles Handy's theories about the workplace 2,000 years later, the logical response of every sane modern manager should be: "So what?"

彼得·德鲁克（Peter Drucker）部分归功于他自己的才能，部分归功于他开始撰写有关管理的时代，他是第一位始终通过相关性测试的管理思想家。 就像他的圣经同名人物一样，他是当前教会建立的基石，正如他之前在旷野中哭泣的声音所证实的那样。

Peter Drucker, thanks in part to his own talents and in part to the era in which he began to write about management, is the first management thinker consistently to pass this relevancy test. Like his biblical namesake, he is the rock on which the current church is founded, as the voices crying in the wilderness who preceded him will confirm.

从某种意义上说，管理与人一样古老。 德鲁克自己指出，“所有伟大的企业建设者——从文艺复兴时期佛罗伦萨的美第奇和 17 世纪末英格兰银行的创始人到我们这个时代的 IBM 的托马斯·沃森——都有一个清晰的商业理论他们所有的行动和决定。” 管理的历史可以追溯到公元前 5000 年的苏美尔人 2 无论是金字塔的建造还是凯撒大帝入侵不列颠，都需要具备管理方面的基本技能和才能。

Management, in one sense, is as old as man. Drucker himself has pointed out that "all the great business builders—from the Medici of Renaissance Florence and the founders of the Bank of England in the late seventeenth century down to IBM's Thomas Watson in our day— had a clear theory of the business which informed all their actions and decisions." One history of management has traced the craft back to the Sumerians of 5000 b.c. 2 Organizing either the construction of the pyramids or Julius Caesar's invasion of Britain must have required basic skills and talents that might be described as management.

许多人会说 Niccolo Machiavelli（1469-1527）是第一位西方管理理论家。 《金融时报》曾将马基雅维利的《君主论》称为 16 世纪的戴尔·卡耐基 (Dale Carnegie) 的《如何赢得朋友和影响他人》。 3 任何接触公司政治的高管（即世界上的每一位经理）都可以

Many would say Niccolo Machiavelli (1469-1527) was the first Western management theorist. The Financial Times once dubbed Machiavelli's The Prince the sixteenth-century equivalent of Dale Carnegie's How to Win Friends and Influence People. 3 Any executive exposed to corporate politics (i.e., every manager in the world) could

彼得·德鲁克

Peter Drucker

做比阅读王子更糟糕的事情，并把它关于成为“伟大的伪装者和伪装者”的建议牢记在心。

do worse than read The Prince and take to heart its advice about being "a great dissembler and pretender."

管理考古学家发现在工业革命期间出现了更多重要人物。 既有经济理论家如亚当·斯密（1723-90）和让·巴蒂斯特·萨伊（1767-1832），他们都为企业的经营写了很多篇幅，也有经济实务家，如伊莱·惠特尼（1765-1835），一位美国枪支制造商，他用可互换的零件制造了他的步枪，因此可以说发明了装配线，还有罗伯特欧文（1771-1858 年），一位苏格兰磨坊主，他认为通过像对待人一样对待工人来赚钱人（他不会雇用任何未满十岁的孩子），因此被誉为“人事管理的先驱”。 4 然而，

Management archaeologists find more significant individuals appearing during the Industrial Revolution. There were not only economic theorists such as Adam Smith (1723-90) and Jean Baptiste Say (1767-1832), both of whom devoted many pages to the running of enterprises, but also practitioners such as Eli Whitney (1765-1835), an American gun maker who built his rifles from interchangeable parts and thus, arguably, invented the assembly line, and Robert Owen (1771-1858), a Scottish mill owner who thought there was money to be made by treating workers as if they were human beings (he would not employ any child under the age of ten) and thus has been deemed "the pioneer of personnel management." 4 However, it was only with the introduction of mass production around the beginning of the twentieth century that business demanded the creation of a new elite of managers and a new, formal science of management theory.

至少在美国，这门新科学的主要灵感来自发明碳钢机床的工程师 Frederick Winslow Taylor。 泰勒相信只有一种最好的组织工作的方法，并且可以通过详细研究完成每项工作所涉及的时间和动作来发现这种方法。 秒表、电影摄影机、计算尺和心理生理测试——这些都是泰勒和他的助手们的交易工具。 科学管理的核心原则很明确：将工作分解成最简单的部分； 选择最合适的工人来适应可用的工作； 将这些工人变成专家，每个人都是自己指定任务的专家； 沿着流水线安排这些专业工作；

The principal inspiration for this new science, in America at least, was Frederick Winslow Taylor, an engineer who invented carbon-steel machine tools. Taylor believed that there was a single best method of organizing work, and that this method could be discovered through a detailed study of the time and motion involved in doing each job. The stopwatch, the motion picture camera, the slide rule, and psycho-physiological tests—these were the tools of the trade of Taylor and his acolytes. The principles at the heart of scientific management were clear: break jobs down into their simplest parts; select the most suitable workers to fit the available jobs; turn those workers into specialists, each an expert in his own appointed task; arrange these specialized jobs along an assembly line; and design the right package of incentives (including bonuses and prizes) to ensure that the workers did indeed work.

在泰勒的世界里，“经理”不仅仅是执行老板指示的不假思索的军士。 他们在将工厂变成“平稳运行的机器”的过程中发挥了两个重要作用。 首先是协调各种专业任务（毕竟，很难指望工人自己了解他们的专业如何适应更大的企业）； 第二个是监督和激励工人（他们可能很容易厌倦他们乏味的例行公事）。 分工原则也适用于管理者：会计、招聘、

In Taylor's world, "managers" were not just unthinking sergeants carrying out the owner's instructions. They played two vital roles in turning factories into "smoothly running machines." The first was to coordinate the various specialized tasks (after all, the workers themselves could hardly be expected to understand how their specialty fitted into the larger enterprise); the second was to monitor and motivate the workers (who might easily weary of their tedious routine). The principle of the division of labor also applied to managers: there were specialists in accounting, recruiting,

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

等等。 在金字塔的顶端坐着精英，泰勒版的柏拉图监护人，他们的工作是设计和规范整个系统，监督竞争对手的行为，最重要的是，提前计划。

and so on. At the top of the pyramid sat the elite, Taylor's version of Plato's guardians, whose job it was to design and regulate the entire system, to monitor the behavior of competitors, and, above all, to plan ahead.

泰勒的想法以惊人的速度转化为实践——尤其是亨利·福特，他是一位像泰勒一样的白手起家的机械师，在他位于底特律郊区海兰帕克的新工厂里。 与此同时，泰勒主义帮助塑造了一种新型教育机构——商学院的课程。 第一所商学院沃顿商学院于1881年在宾夕法尼亚大学成立。芝加哥大学和加利福尼亚大学于1899年都成立了本科商学院。纽约大学的斯特恩工商管理学院、达特茅斯的阿莫斯塔克商学院在接下来的十年里，管理学和哈佛大学工商管理研究生院紧随其后。 《管理评论》成立于 1918 年，美国管理协会成立于 1925 年。到第一次世界大战结束时，Arthur D. Little 最初是一家工程公司，在其服务中包括了管理建议。 詹姆斯麦肯锡于 1925 年成立了他的咨询公司。

Taylor's ideas were translated into practice remarkably quickly— particularly by Henry Ford, a self-made mechanic just like Taylor, at his new factory in Highland Park, a suburb of Detroit. At the same time, Taylorism helped shape the curriculum at a new sort of educational institution, the business school. The first business school, Wharton, was set up at the University of Pennsylvania in 1881. The University of Chicago and the University of California both established undergraduate schools of commerce in 1899. New York University's Stern School of Business Administration, Dartmouth's Amos Tuck School of Administration, and Harvard's Graduate School of Business Administration followed in the next decade. The Management Review was founded in 1918, the American Management Association in 1925. By the end of the Great War, Arthur D. Little, originally an engineering firm, included management advice among its services. James McKinsey set up his consultancy firm in 1925.

具有讽刺意味的是，考虑到亨利·福特对泰勒思想的支持，科学管理的首批成果之一就是通用汽车公司的成功，阿尔弗雷德·斯隆在通用汽车公司将自己变成了一名职业经理人，脱离了车间的喧嚣。 （相比之下，亨利·福特是一个顽固的爱管闲事的人，他的公司一直处于近乎混乱的状态。）泰勒的许多弟子进入了州和地方政府，并试图将科学管理应用于教室和手术室等场所。 5 国会早在 1912 年就该主题举行了听证会，宣传了这一新想法。 工程师出身的赫伯特·胡佛 (Herbert Hoover) 试图通过科学管理提高政府效率。

Ironically, given Henry Ford's patronage of Taylor's ideas, one of the first results of scientific management was the success of General Motors, where Alfred Sloan turned himself into a professional manager, detached from the hurly-burly of the shop floor. (In contrast, Henry Ford was an inveterate meddler, keeping his firm in a state of near chaos.) Many of Taylor's disciples found their way into state and local government and tried to apply scientific management to places like the schoolroom and the operating theater. 5 Congress held hearings on the subject as early as 1912, giving publicity to the new idea. Herbert Hoover, an engineer by training, tried to use scientific management to make government more efficient.

但科学管理的拥护者并没有完全按照自己的方式行事。 一个被称为人际关系学派的竞争理论家团体希望看到员工参与管理决策。 女性管理理论先驱玛丽·帕克·福莱特 (Mary Parker Follett) 强调，“我们永远无法将人与机械方面完全分开。” 6 哈佛商学院的心理学家埃尔顿·梅奥 (Elton Mayo) 强调了生产力的非经济回报：“只要商业专注于不考虑人性和社会动机的商业方法，那么

But the apostles of scientific management did not have it all their own way. A rival group of theorists, who became known as the human-relations school, wanted to see workers involved in managerial decisions. Mary Parker Follett, a pioneering female management theorist, stressed that "we can never wholly separate the human from the mechanical side." 6 Elton Mayo, a psychologist based at the Harvard Business School, emphasized noneconomic rewards for productivity: "So long as commerce specializes in business methods which take no account of human nature and social motives, so long

彼得·德鲁克

Peter Drucker

我们可以期望罢工和破坏活动成为工业的常见伴随物吗？”

may we expect strikes and sabotage to be the ordinary accompaniment of industry."

这种人文主义的管理学派在欧洲最具影响力，尤其是在英国，那里强大的手工业工会与泰勒主义对峙，而领先的商人则寻求更温和的方法。 吉百利 (Cadbury) 和朗特里 (Rown-trees) 等贵格会商人敦促其他雇主像对待人而不是机器一样对待他们的员工。 英国汽车工业之父威廉理查德莫里斯对引入新系统的困难感到非常沮丧，他将其命名为“混乱生产”。 7 心理学家 CS Myers 批评科学管理对人类动机采取简单化的观点。 另一位心理学家埃利奥特雅克专注于群体行为的社会动态，并在第二次世界大战后将伦敦的塔维斯托克研究所变成了人文管理的总部。

This humanistic school of management was at its most influential in Europe, particularly in Britain, where the powerful craft unions faced off with Taylorism and leading businessmen sought a gentler approach. Quaker businessmen such as the Cadburys and the Rown-trees urged other employers to treat their workers like human beings rather than machines. William Richard Morris, the father of Britain's automobile industry, was so dismayed by the difficulties of introducing the new system that he christened it "mess production." 7 C. S. Myers, a psychologist, criticized scientific management for taking a simplistic view of human motives. Elliot Jacques, another psychologist, focused on the social dynamics of group behavior and after the Second World War turned Tavistock Institute in London into the headquarters of humanistic management.

相当多的欧洲主要知识分子卷入了科学管理与人文管理之间的斗争。 在德国，前卫思想家对科学管理形成了一种狂热崇拜：沃尔特·格罗皮乌斯 (Walter Gropius) 和路德维希·希尔伯-塞默 (Ludwig Hilber-seimer) 等包豪斯建筑师试图将设计与科学管理结合起来； Bertolt Brecht 和 Fritz Lang 简短地赞美了新的热潮。 组织理论之父马克斯·韦伯 (Max Weber) 研究了不同类型的官僚机构，以了解哪种官僚机构效率最高。 在英国，知识分子通常站在人文主义者一边。 奥尔德斯·赫胥黎 (Aldous Huxley) 在他的著作《美丽新世界》(1932) 中，英国出生的查理·卓别林 (Charlie Chaplin) 在他的电影《摩登时代》(Modern Times) (1936) 中，乔治·奥威尔 (George Orwell) 在他 1946 年的论文“詹姆斯·伯纳姆 (James Burnham) 和管理革命”中

A fair number of Europe's leading intellectuals became caught up in the struggle between scientific and humanistic management. In Germany, avante garde thinkers made a cult of scientific management: Bauhaus architects like Walter Gropius and Ludwig Hilber-seimer tried to marry design with scientific management; Bertolt Brecht and Fritz Lang briefly sang the praises of the new craze. Max Weber, the father of organizational theory, studied different types of bureaucracies to see which would be the most efficient. In Britain, intellectuals usually sided with the humanists. Aldous Huxley in his book Brave New World (1932), English-born Charlie Chaplin in his film Modern Times (1936), George Orwell in his 1946 essay "James Burnham and the Managerial Revolution" and his novel Nineteen Eighty-Four (1949)—all expressed their fear of mass production, scientific management, and the reduction of the individual into a cog in a vast industrial machine.

知识分子难民

An Intellectual Refugee

那么，这就是彼得德鲁克在第二次世界大战前夕偶然发现的有点精神分裂的学科。 德鲁克蔑视他是管理学发明人的说法（尽管有一本关于他的书同名）。 相反，他争辩说，到 20 世纪 30 年代中期，“什么都没有发生”。 没有人问过“什么是管理？”这个问题。

This, then, was the slightly schizophrenic discipline that Peter Drucker stumbled upon on the eve of the Second World War. Drucker scorns the idea that he was the man who invented management (although there is a book about him with that title). Instead, he argues that by the mid-1930s "nothing had come together." Nobody had asked the question "What is management?"

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

德鲁克 1909 年出生于奥地利的上层中产阶级。 他的父亲是一位国际化的政府官员，在他八九岁时将年轻的德鲁克介绍给了西格蒙德弗洛伊德。 作为一名学生，他结识了历史学家卡尔·波兰尼和军事战略家弗里茨·克雷默等杰出知识分子。 他于 1931 年在法兰克福大学获得国际法和公法博士学位，并在德国经济学期刊上发表文章。

Drucker was born in 1909 into the Austrian upper middle class. His father, a cosmopolitan government official, introduced young Drucker to Sigmund Freud when he was eight or nine years old. As a student, he got to know such illustrious intellectuals as Karl Polanyi, a historian, and Fritz Kraemer, a military strategist. He earned a doctorate in international and public law from Frankfurt University in 1931 and published articles in German economics journals.

导致这位维也纳知识分子写下当时与管理一样脱离主流的东西的事件是复杂的，而且在很大程度上是偶然的。 他在 20 多岁时试图避开阿道夫·希特勒，并在银行、咨询、学术法律和新闻等多个工作之间漂泊。 （他的新闻培训包括担任女性专页的代理编辑。）他最终在一所美国大学找到了归宿，教授政治学、哲学和经济学。 他的第一本书《经济人的终结》（1939 年）专注于政治和经济学，并对大屠杀发出警告。 他的第二本书《工业人的未来》（1942 年）激怒了学术评论家，因为它将经济学与各种社会科学混为一谈。 在其中，德鲁克认为公司具有社会意义和经济目的。

The events that led this Viennese intellectual to write about something then as removed from the mainstream as management were complicated and largely accidental. He spent his 20s trying to avoid Adolf Hitler and drifted between a number of jobs, including banking, consultancy, academic law, and journalism. (His journalistic training included a spell as the acting editor of a women's page.) He finally found a home in an American university, teaching politics, philosophy, and economics. His first book, The End of Economic Man (1939), concentrated on politics and economics and warned about the Holocaust. His second book, The Future of Industrial Man (1942), annoyed academic critics because it mixed economics with various social sciences. In it Drucker argued that companies had a social dimension as well as an economic purpose. This unorthodox idea also attracted the attention of General Motors.

这家美国汽车巨头，当时是世界上最大的公司，邀请德鲁克为其画像，并允许他不受限制地接触从阿尔弗雷德斯隆以下的通用汽车公司的员工。 结果，《公司的概念》决定了德鲁克的命运。 这本书立即成为日本和美国的畅销书，并一直在印刷。 然而，它进一步疏远了有地盘意识的美国学术界：经济学家认为它是庸俗的社会学，而政治学家则认为它是经济学疯了。 一位评论家希望“这位有前途的年轻学者现在将他的相当多的才能投入到一个更受人尊敬的学科中”。 8 由于天然盟友的排斥，德鲁克被迫撰写有关管理的文章。

The American car giant, then the biggest company in the world, invited Drucker to draw its portrait and gave him unrestricted access to GMers, from Alfred Sloan down. The result, The Concept of the Corporation, sealed Drucker's fate. The book immediately became a best-seller, in Japan as well as in America, and has been in print ever since. However, it further alienated turf-minded American academics: economists regarded it as vulgar sociology, and political scientists dismissed it as economics gone mad. One reviewer hoped that "this promising young scholar will now devote his considerable talents to a more respectable subject." 8 Shunned by his natural allies, Drucker was forced to write about management.

从那时起，德鲁克几乎发明或影响了管理理论的每个部分（因此，他的名字将以惊人的频率出现在本书中）。 许多主导他作品的主题都出现在公司的概念中。 与德鲁克的所有书籍一样，《公司的概念》是一部漫游记述：它从一个来自中国的故事开始，然后在不同的时间，担心

Since then Drucker has either invented or influenced virtually every part of management theory (his name will thus crop up in this book with infuriating frequency). Many of the themes that have dominated his work were present in The Concept of the Corporation. Like all Drucker's books, The Concept of the Corporation is a roaming narrative: it begins with a story from China and, at different times, worries about

彼得·德鲁克

Peter Drucker

维多利亚时代英国人中绅士的比例（在德鲁克看来，这一比例很小）和俄罗斯工业管理的效率。 该书的中心目的是将公司视为一个社会系统和一个经济组织。 书中最长的两个部分分别是“作为人类努力的公司”和“作为社会机构的公司”。 德鲁克发现人们一起工作的方式本身就很有趣，而不仅仅是一种赚钱的方式。

the percentage of Victorian Englishmen who were gentlemen (a minute fraction, in Drucker's view) and the efficiency of Russian industrial management. The book's central purpose was to treat a company as a social system as well as an economic organization. The two longest sections in the book are entitled "The Corporation as Human Effort" and "The Corporation as a Social Institution." Drucker found the way that people worked together interesting in its own right rather than merely as a means to make profits.

尽管如此，德鲁克的大多数读者所关注的主题是去中心化。 德鲁克展示了通用汽车的分权结构如何使其能够应对诸如从战争过渡到和平等挑战——并得出结论认为，这家汽车公司“充分意识到了分权化的概念，从而从中获得了一种整体行为模式和成功解决方案的基础经济生活中最困难的具体问题。” 9 虽然德鲁克明确表示他对一般组织的权力下放价值持怀疑态度，但福特和通用电气等其他美国大公司争先恐后地效仿。 到 1980 年代，德鲁克因“将 75%-80% 的财富 500 强企业转向激进的权力下放”而受到赞誉。 10

All the same, the subject that most of Drucker's readers seized upon was decentralization. Drucker showed how GM's decentralized structure enabled it to respond to challenges such as the transition from war to peace—and concluded that the car firm "realized its concept of decentralization sufficiently to obtain from it an overall pattern of behavior and a basis for the successful solution of the most difficult concrete problems of economic life." 9 Although Drucker made it clear that he had doubts about the value of decentralization for organizations in general, other big American companies, such as Ford and General Electric, rushed to copy it. By the 1980s, Drucker was credited with "moving 75 % -80 % of the Fortune 500 to radical decentralization." 10

德鲁克的人

Drucker's People

从德鲁克对汽车公司的剖析中得出的两个最有趣的问题——并且从那以后一直主导着他的工作——与权力下放的关系很小。 一个与赋予工人权力有关（或“创建自治的工厂社区”，正如德鲁克当时有点笨拙地说的那样），另一个与知识工作者的崛起有关（即工人的价值在于什么）他脑子里想的不是他能用手做的事）。

The two most interesting issues that have come out of Drucker's dissection of the car company—and that have dominated his work ever since—have only a marginal connection with decentralization. One has to do with empowering workers (or "creating the self-governing plant community," as Drucker somewhat clumsily put it at the time), and the other with the rise of the knowledge worker (i.e., the worker's whose value lies in what he has in his head not in what he can do with his hands).

对于所有枯燥的学术语言，公司的概念本质上是对通用汽车将劳动力视为一种资源而不仅仅是一种成本的热情恳求。 德鲁克坚持认为，劳资关系应该建立在人们愿意从事自己的工作并为自己的产品感到自豪的基础上。 他也是装配线的严厉批评者，尽管当时它被认为是最先进的制造业形式。 在“流水线思维”中，他说，“一个

For all its dry academic language, The Concept of the Corporation was essentially a passionate plea for GM to treat labor as a resource rather than just as a cost. Drucker insisted that industrial relations ought to be based on people's desire to be engaged in their job and proud of their product. He was also a stern critic of the assembly line, even though at the time it was regarded as the most advanced form of manufacturing. In "the assembly-line mentality," he said, "a

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

工人 [is] 效率越高，他就越像机器，他就越不像人。”11 德鲁克反驳说，流水线生产的单调实际上使其成为一个低效的过程——部分原因是生产线必须适应速度最慢的成员，部分原因是工人们从未从看到成品中获得任何工作满足感。

worker [is] the more efficient, the more machine-like and the less human he is." 11 Drucker countered that the monotony of assembly-line production actually made it an inefficient process—partly because the line had to adjust to the speed of the slowest member and partly because workers never got any job satisfaction from seeing the finished product.

这种自我管理的热情超前于时代。 如今，电池制造等团队制造技术已司空见惯，许多公司将更多权力交给员工。 当日本汽车制造商于 1980 年代在英国开设工厂并告诉 Geordie 工厂工人他们应该像铆钉、焊接和锤子一样思考时，许多英国汽车老板嘲笑外国人的天真。 今天，欧洲的每家汽车厂都在模仿他们的方法。 通用汽车的悲剧在于，它在 1940 年代拒绝了德鲁克关于使用团队的建议——结果却在 1970 年代被日本人灌输了同样的教训。

This enthusiasm for self-management was ahead of its time. Nowadays, team-manufacturing techniques such as cell-manufacturing are commonplace, and many companies are handing more power to their workers. When Japanese car makers set up shop in Britain in the 1980s and told Geordie factory workers that they were supposed to think as well as rivet, weld, and hammer, many of Britain's car bosses scoffed at the foreigners' naivete. Today every car factory in Europe imitates their methods. The tragedy for GM was that it rejected Drucker's advice about using teams in the 1940s—only to have the same lesson rammed down its throat by the Japanese in the 1970s.

德鲁克著作的第二个重要主题是，旧的工业无产阶级需要被知识工作者取代。 他认为，发达国家正在从“商品经济”向“知识经济”转变，管理也因此发生转变。 管理者必须学习如何调动员工的思想，而不是简单地控制员工的双手。 这种更温和的方法是对泰勒秒表理论及其商业支持者的直接挑战。 但“知识工作者”（德鲁克于 1959 年创造的一个术语）的概念也给政客们提出了问题。 它表明一个国家的原材料实际上是其受过教育的工人； 因此，培训和教育很重要。 而不是试图保护垂死的行业免受更便宜、更少“知识”的侵害

A second great theme of Drucker's work has been that the old industrial proletariat needs to be replaced with knowledge workers. The advanced world is moving from "an economy of goods" to "a knowledge economy," he argues, and management is being transformed as a result. Managers are having to learn how to engage the minds, rather than simply control the hands, of their workers. This softer approach is a direct challenge to Taylor's stopwatch theories and their fans in business. But the idea of "a knowledge worker" (a term that Drucker coined in 1959) also poses questions for politicians. It suggests that a country's raw materials are really its educated workers; hence the importance of training and education. And rather than try to defend dying industries against cheaper, less "knowledgeable" workers abroad, governments should concentrate on improving the country's stock of knowledge, but otherwise keep well out of the way.

通常，德鲁克不仅仅局限于管理者和政府应该如何处理这些新知识工作者的问题。 在他职业生涯的大部分时间里，他都在研究知识工作者自己如何适应这个他们既不是工人也不是老板的新世界。 由于他们，而不是他们的雇主，控制着现代社会的关键生产资产，也就是说，脑力，他们拥有更多

Typically, Drucker has not just confined himself to the question of how managers and governments ought to handle these new knowledge workers. He has spent much of his career looking at how the knowledge workers themselves can come to terms with this new world in which they are neither workers nor bosses. Since they, rather than their employers, control the key productive asset of modern society, that is to say, brain power, they have considerably more

彼得·德鲁克

Peter Drucker

比他们的前辈更自由。 工人是自由的，或者用德鲁克没有发明但不幸帮助合法化的行话来说，工人“有权”塑造自己的职业生涯，从一家公司跳到另一家公司以追求最高薪水或最有趣的工作。 但德鲁克也很快发现，这种自由既可以带来解放，也可以带来不稳定：知识工作者需要更多的培训、新的养老金安排和其他方面的关注。

freedom than their predecessors. Workers are free, or in the jargon that Drucker did not invent but unfortunately helped to legitimize, are "empowered" to shape their own careers, hopping from firm to firm in pursuit of the highest salary or the most interesting job. But Drucker was also quick to spot that this freedom could be destabilizing as well as liberating: knowledge workers needed more training, new pension arrangements, and other kinds of attention.

德鲁克关于改变工作性质的想法从那以后激励了整整一代作家更详细地研究这个主题。 今天，很少有人会质疑已经发生的变化，但他们可能会争辩说，这种转变并没有像预期的那样根本。 尽管如此，大多数人和这一代的杰出成员查尔斯·汉迪 (Charles Handy) 一样承认，“几乎所有事情都可以追溯到德鲁克”。 12 此外，德鲁克通过拒绝成为银行家的机会开始了他的职业生涯，并且一直与学术界保持着某种矛盾的关系，他本人就是典型的知识工作者。

Drucker's ideas about the changing nature of work have since inspired a whole generation of writers to look in more detail at the subject. Today, few would dispute that changes have taken place, but they might argue that the transformation has not been as fundamental as predicted. Still, most people would admit, along with Charles Handy, a prominent member of this generation, that "virtually everything can be traced back to Drucker." 12 Furthermore, Drucker, who started his career by turning down opportunities to become a banker and has always enjoyed a somewhat ambivalent relationship with academia, is himself an archetypal knowledge worker.

理性的诱惑

The Rational Temptation

与此同时，德鲁克不仅仅是人际关系管理学派的另一个代表，一个总是从人性角度寻找的“软”启发者。 事实上，他的思想中一直有强硬的“泰勒主义”一面。

At the same time, Drucker was not simply another exponent of the human-relations school of management, a "soft" inspirer always looking for the human angle. In fact, there has always been a hard, "Taylorist" side to his thinking.

德鲁克发明了理性管理学派最成功的产品之一，即“目标管理”，这种方法在战后几十年主导了“战略思维”。 管理实践（1954 年）强调公司和经理的明确目标，并敦促将长期战略转化为短期目标。 尤其是，德鲁克认为，公司应该有一个由总经理组成的精英团队来为更专业的经理制定战略和设定目标。 他认为，公司的结构应该遵循其战略：“组织本身并不是目的，而是达到业务绩效和业务结果的手段……组织结构的设计必须使企业目标的实现五、十、

Drucker invented one of the rational school of management's most successful products, "management by objectives," an approach that dominated "strategic thinking" in the postwar decades. The Practice of Management (1954) emphasized clear objectives, both for the corporation and the manager, and urged translating long-term strategy into short-term goals. In particular, Drucker believed that a firm should have an elite group of general managers determining strategy and setting objectives for more specialized managers. The structure of the firm, he argued, should follow its strategy: "Organization is not an end in itself, but a means to the end of business performance and business results. . . . Organization structure must be designed so as to make possible the achievement of the objectives of the business five, ten, fifteen years hence."

自 20 世纪 80 年代初以来，目标管理一直笼罩在阴云之中。 最好的现代公司，如 3M 和摩托罗拉，允许

Management by objectives has been under a cloud since the early 1980s. The best modern companies, such as 3M and Motorola, allow

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

想法——包括长期战略的想法——来自组织的底层而非高层（见第 8 章）。 那些坚持使用命令和控制系统的公司——尤其是通用汽车——看起来死板得令人绝望。 问题在于命令控制式管理将高级管理层与最了解市场和产品的人（普通员工）隔离开来。 因此，当前流行的另一个伟大的德鲁克主题是通过延迟和授权将决定权交还给员工。

ideas—including ideas for long-term strategies—to emerge from the bottom of the organization rather than from on high (see Chapter 8). Those companies that have stuck with the system of command and control—notably General Motors—have looked hopelessly inflexible. The problem is that command-and-control management cuts senior management off from the people who know both their markets and their products best: the ordinary workers. Hence the current fashion for that other great Drucker theme, handing decisions back to workers through delayering and empowerment.

总的来说，目标管理看起来像是一种将被淘汰的时尚。 问题是，赋能先知为何要采取如此死板的管理方式？ 他的批评者说，德鲁克迷失了方向，盲目地支持两种不相容的方法。 但更宽泛的解释也是可能的。

On balance, management by objectives looks like a fad that will remain in the graveyard. The question is, why did the prophet of empowerment take such a rigid approach to management? His critics say that Drucker lost his way, faddishly endorsing two incompatible approaches. But a more generous interpretation is also possible.

德鲁克一直在努力——正如他从那以后所做的那样——在人文主义和理性主义学派的最佳选择之间建立平衡。 他认为，目标管理与授权并不矛盾：高级管理人员应该为下属设定总体目标，但允许他们决定如何实现这些目标。 在他的目标管理阶段，他继续强调企业文化的重要性。 他是最早认识到公司是由共同的未来愿景凝聚在一起的人之一，而提出这一愿景是老板的工作。

Drucker was trying—as he has done ever since—to create a balance between what was best in both the humanist and rationalist schools. Management by objectives is not incompatible with empowerment, he argued: senior managers should set general goals for their subordinates but allow them to decide how to reach those goals. And throughout his management-by-objectives phase, he continued to lay heavy emphasis on the importance of corporate culture. He was one of the first people to realize that companies are held together by a shared vision of the future—and that it is the boss's job to come up with that vision.

德鲁克怀疑，如果社会要避免无政府状态和异化，就需要将授权等软性理念与目标管理等硬性理念结合起来，这一点被证明是有先见之明的。 任何研究巴林银行倒闭的人都会发现，很难不加批判地支持赋权。 但简单地恢复旧的命令和控制系统可能会疏远大多数公司的成功所依赖的知识工作者。 德鲁克式的妥协看起来是最好的前进方式。

Drucker's suspicion that, if society is to avoid both anarchy and alienation, soft ideas like empowerment need to be mixed with harder ones like management by objectives is proving prescient. Anybody who studies the collapse of Barings will find it hard to be an uncritical supporter of empowerment. But simply restoring the old system of command and control risks alienating the knowledge workers on whom the success of most companies depends. Druckerish compromise looks like the best way forward.

管理新世界

New Worlds to Management

德鲁克是最早意识到良好管理不仅限于美国的人之一。 在 1950 年代，当大多数人认为日本只不过是廉价小玩意儿的制造商时，德鲁克开始着迷于日本的特质

Drucker was one of the first people to realize that good management is not restricted to the United States. In the 1950s, when most people dismissed Japan as nothing more than a maker of cheap knickknacks, Drucker became fascinated by Japan's idiosyncratic

72

72

彼得·德鲁克

Peter Drucker

管理方法。 在《公司的概念》出版后，日本人几乎把他当作圣人对待——现在仍然如此。 现在亚洲其他地区都能感受到他的影响力。

approach to management. Following the publication of The Concept of the Corporation, the Japanese treated him almost like a sage—as they still do. His influence is now felt in the rest of Asia.

也许德鲁克最有见地的观察是，管理在生活的各个领域都发挥着至关重要的作用，而不仅仅是在商业领域：它对大学、教堂、医院或慈善机构的重要性与对肥皂粉制造商的重要性一样。 事实上，他拒绝了斯坦福大学和哈佛大学的教席，因为这两所学校都希望他在教学中专注于商业案例研究，在咨询工作中专注于商业组织，在写作中专注于商业案例。 但是，他回答说，管理不仅仅是一个商业问题，它也是一个问题。 它是“所有现代机构的决定性机构”。 为了与这种方法保持一致，他自己的客户包括美国女童子军等志愿组织以及大公司；

Perhaps Drucker's most insightful observation is that management plays a vital role in all spheres of life, not just in business: it is as important for universities, churches, hospitals, or charities as it is for the manufacturers of soap powder. Indeed, he refused chairs at Stanford and Harvard because both schools wanted him to concentrate on business case studies in his teaching, business organizations in his consulting work, and business examples in his writing. But, he responded, management is not only a business concern; it is "the defining organ of all modern institutions." In keeping with this approach, his own clients include voluntary organizations such as the American Girl Scouts as well as large companies; and the management school that Claremont College in California founded in his honor recruits about a third of its students from outside the business world.

德鲁克对将管理理论引入公共部门的热情不应被误认为是对政府的热情。 正是德鲁克给世界带来了“私有化”的理念——他总是抱怨政府无能为力。 在不连续的时代（1969 年）中，他认为政府的工作是治理而不是尝试做私营部门可以做的事情。 在德鲁克看来，政府管辖范围之外的事情远远超出了电话公司和公用事业。 即使在他后来的一本书《后资本主义社会》（1993 年）中，他质疑股东资本主义的陈词滥调，他仍然坚持认为政府避免经济萧条的最佳方式是停止干预经济。 战争，德鲁克认为，

Drucker's enthusiasm for taking management theory to the public sector should not be mistaken for enthusiasm for government. It was Drucker who gave the world the idea of "privatization"—and he has always complained about the inability of government to run just about anything. In The Age of Discontinuity (1969), he argues that the job of governments is to govern rather than try to do things that could be done by the private sector. In Drucker's view, things that lie outside the government's scope extend well beyond telephone companies and utilities. Even in one of his later books, Post Capitalist Society (1993), where he questions shibboleths of shareholder capitalism, he still insists that the best way for governments to avoid depressions is to stop meddling with the economy. Warfare, Drucker has argued, is the only example of a modern government program that has achieved its objectives.

他还重要吗？

Does He Still Matter?

德鲁克要么带路，要么以无数更小的方式为他人扫清道路。 多亏了他的广泛思想和他的长寿，德鲁克发挥了让其他大师羡慕不已的那种影响力。 即使在批评他时，他的同行也会怀着崇敬的态度接近他——想到他们饱受诟病的行业至少有一个，这让他们近乎松了一口气

Drucker either led the way or cleared the path for others in countless smaller ways as well. Thanks to the broad scope of his ideas and his longevity, Drucker has exercised the sort of influence that leave other gurus bursting with envy. Even when criticizing him, his peers approach him with reverence—which verges on relief at the thought that their much maligned industry has at least one

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

阶级行为。 “我们对彼得·德鲁克的感激之情是无限的，”汤姆·彼得斯曾经承认。

class act. "Our debt to Peter Drucker knows no limit," Tom Peters once admitted.

这种尊重在企业界得到了回应。 当被问及他关注了哪些管理书籍时，比尔盖茨回答说，“嗯，德鲁克，当然，”然后引用其他小人物。 13 德鲁克也很满意地看到他的许多想法付诸实践。 年轻的亨利·福特在战后试图重建他的公司时，将《公司的概念》作为他的教科书。 正如德鲁克自己吹嘘的那样，这本书“对美国商业、公共服务机构、政府机构产生了直接影响——但对通用汽车公司却毫无影响。” （德鲁克指出，如果一位通用汽车经理被发现有这本书，他的职业生涯就结束了。）密歇根大学和纽约大主教管区等不同的机构都使用这本书来重组自己。 这是为进入戴高乐精英国家行政学院的学生开的第一本书。 公司的概念也让日本人开始思考将权力下放给他们的工人。 德鲁克最近的一位粉丝是伊利诺斯州南巴林顿柳溪社区教堂的主任牧师比尔·海贝尔斯牧师，他是美国最成功的“超级主义者”之一。 他的办公室外挂着彼得德鲁克的名言：“你的业务是什么？你的客户是谁？客户认为什么有价值？” 海波斯对德鲁克非常了解，认为他是“智慧人物”。 14 公司的概念也让日本人开始思考将权力下放给他们的工人。 德鲁克最近的一位粉丝是伊利诺斯州南巴林顿柳溪社区教堂的主任牧师比尔·海贝尔斯牧师，他是美国最成功的“超级主义者”之一。 他的办公室外挂着彼得德鲁克的名言：“你的业务是什么？你的客户是谁？客户认为什么有价值？” 海波斯对德鲁克非常了解，认为他是“智慧人物”。 14 公司的概念也让日本人开始思考将权力下放给他们的工人。 德鲁克最近的一位粉丝是伊利诺斯州南巴林顿柳溪社区教堂的主任牧师比尔·海贝尔斯牧师，他是美国最成功的“超级主义者”之一。 他的办公室外挂着彼得德鲁克的名言：“你的业务是什么？你的客户是谁？客户认为什么有价值？” 海波斯对德鲁克非常了解，认为他是“智慧人物”。 14 他的办公室外挂着彼得德鲁克的名言：“你的业务是什么？你的客户是谁？客户认为什么有价值？” 海波斯对德鲁克非常了解，认为他是“智慧人物”。 14 他的办公室外挂着彼得德鲁克的名言：“你的业务是什么？你的客户是谁？客户认为什么有价值？” 海波斯对德鲁克非常了解，认为他是“智慧人物”。 14

This respect is echoed in the corporate world. When asked which management books he has paid attention to, Bill Gates replies, "Well, Drucker, of course," before citing other lesser mortals. 13 Drucker has also had the satisfaction of seeing many of his ideas put into practice. The younger Henry Ford took The Concept of the Corporation as his text when he tried to rebuild his company after the war. As Drucker himself has boasted, the book "had an immediate impact on American business, on public service institutions, on government agencies—and none at all on General Motors." (If a GM manager was found with a copy of the book, Drucker noted, his career was over.) Institutions as diverse as Michigan University and the Archdiocese of New York have used the book to restructure themselves. It was the first book to be prescribed for students entering Charles de Gaulle's elite Ecole Nationale d'Administration. The Concept of the Corporation also set the Japanese thinking about devolving power to their workers. One of Drucker's more recent fans is the Reverend Bill Hy-bels, senior pastor of Willow Creek Community Church in South Barrington, Illinois and one of America's most successful "megamin-isters." He has a quotation from Peter Drucker hanging outside his office: "What is your business? Who is your customer? What does the customer consider value?" Hybels has got to know Drucker well and regards him as "a wisdom figure." 14

然而，甚至围绕着管理行业的伟大图腾也产生了质疑。 德鲁克从未像他从大师或公众那里得到的那样多地受到学术界的奉承。 （“在学术界的眼中，我从来都不是很受人尊敬，”他自己承认。） 15 没有一个学术管理理论领域是他自己创立的，就像迈克尔波特在战略领域和西奥多莱维特在市场营销领域所做的那样。 一些学者认为他是记者而不是学者，并且扭曲刀法，认为他是油嘴滑舌的泛化者而不是一流的记者。 汤姆彼得斯回忆说，当他还是斯坦福商学院的学生时，他从未在任何阅读清单上看到过德鲁克的名字。

Yet, even around the management industry's great totem doubts swirl. Drucker has never enjoyed quite as much adulation from acad-emia as he has from either guruland or from his public. ("I have never been quite respectable in the eyes of academia," he himself confesses.) 15 There is no single area of academic management theory that he has made his own, as Michael Porter did with strategy and Theodore Levitt did with marketing. Some academics regard him as a journalist rather than a scholar, and, twisting the knife, as a glib gen-eralizer rather than a first-class reporter. Tom Peters recalls that he never saw Drucker's name on any reading list when he was a student at Stanford Business School.

最没有说服力的批评是，德鲁克只是陈述了显而易见的事实，他一贯的主题——关于知识工作者的崛起、明确目标的重要性、企业既是社会机构又是经济机构这一事实——都是太过分了。

The least persuasive criticism is that Drucker does little more than state the obvious, that his persistent themes—about the rise of the knowledge worker, the importance of clear objectives, the fact that firms are social as well as economic institutions—are all too

彼得·德鲁克

Peter Drucker

显而易见，值得一提，更不用说一遍又一遍地重复了。 如前所述，这个论点的问题在于，他的大部分观察结果都是显而易见的，只是因为德鲁克让它们如此。 德鲁克是他自己在普及一种看待世界的方式方面取得成功的牺牲品。 不管明显与否，他的一些见解似乎还没有被管理精英所接受。 如果美国的老板们理解德鲁克关于企业社会本质的论点，他们会用一只手解雇他们的工人，同时用另一只手给自己大幅加薪吗？

obvious to bear mentioning, let alone repeating over and over again. The trouble with this argument, as mentioned earlier, is that most of his observations are obvious only because Drucker has made them so. Drucker is a victim of his own success in popularizing a way of looking at the world. And obvious or not, some of his insights do not seem to have gotten through to the managerial elite just yet. Would America's bosses be sacking their workers with one hand, while awarding themselves huge pay raises with the other, if they understood Drucker's arguments about the social nature of firms?

其他批评更有力。 德鲁克有时会设法同时做到简单化和晦涩难懂。 他一再指出人类生活在一个组织社会中，但未能阐明这意味着什么。 在《后资本主义社会》中，他抱怨美国已经接受了养老基金社会主义，但他的评论更像是一种文字游戏，而不是对美国社会的深入分析。 从广义上讲，他是对的，真正的老板不是约翰·洛克菲勒和摩根大通之类的人，而是工人自己。 他们是通过养老金权利拥有社会大部分资本的人，也是通过工资和社会福利获得社会大部分回报的人。 但称这种大众资本主义不是更好吗？

Other criticisms have had more force. Drucker sometimes manages to be both simplistic and obscure at the same time. He repeatedly states that humans live in a society of organizations but fails to make clear what this means. In Post-Capitalist Society, he complains that America has embraced pension-fund socialism, but his comments are presented more as a play on words than a deep analysis of American society. In a broad sense, he is right that the real bosses are not the likes of John D. Rockefeller and J. P. Morgan, but the workers themselves. They are the ones who own most of society's capital, through their pension rights, and who receive most of society's rewards, through their wages and social benefits. But would it not be better to call this popular capitalism?

德鲁克的作品也可能因其参差不齐而受到批评。 尽管《公司的概念》可能被认为是一本论证严密且基于原始研究的典范专着，但他后来的一些书可能是杂乱无章和重复的，充满了循环使用的例子。 他的声音也变得不那么有特色了。 尽管早在 1954 年他就主张“组织结构应该包含尽可能少的管理层级”，但他在 1980 年代对“信息化组织”和剥离管理层级的热情似乎并不高不同于 Tom Peters 之后的吠叫声。

Drucker's work may also be criticized for its unevenness. Whereas The Concept of the Corporation may be considered a model monograph that is tightly argued and based on original research, some of his later books can be rambling and repetitive, full of recycled examples. His voice has also become less distinctive. Although it is true that as early as 1954 he was arguing that an "organization structure should contain the least possible number of management levels," his enthusiasm in the 1980s for "information-based organizations" and for stripping out layers of management seemed not much different from the voices of the baying pack following Tom Peters.

总的来说，他对小公司的把握不如大公司。 在公司的概念中，他断言，“我们今天知道，在现代工业生产中，特别是在现代大规模生产中，小单位不仅效率低下，而且根本无法生产。” 16 事实上，这本书帮助启动了持续 20 年的“大组织热潮”。 德鲁克后来改口了：他现在相信“财富 500 强已经结束”，并且越来越多地写了关于企业家精神重要性的文章，就像他 1985 年的书中一样，

In general, he is not as good on small firms as big ones. In The Concept of the Corporation, he asserted, flatly, "We know today that in modern industrial production, particularly in modern mass production, the small unit is not only inefficient, it cannot produce at all." 16 Indeed, the book helped to launch the "big organization boom" that lasted for the next 20 years. Drucker has since recanted: he now believes that "the Fortune 500 is over" and has written progressively more about the importance of entrepreneur ship, as in his 1985 book,

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

创新创业船。 （任何在印刷品上指责德鲁克是大公司的粉丝的人都会收到一封长信，记录他对权力下放的热情。）尽管如此，德鲁克似乎仍然对德怀特领导下主导美国的大公司更加熟悉艾森豪威尔与在罗纳德里根领导下重振国家的中小型企业相比。 关于一家小公司，他写的没有《公司的概念》那么好。

Innovation and Entrepreneur ship. (Anybody who accuses Drucker in print of being a fan of big companies is in for a long letter, chronicling his enthusiasm for decentralization.) All the same, Drucker still seems much more at home with the giant corporations that dominated the United States under Dwight Eisenhower than with the small to medium-sized businesses that regalvanized the country under Ronald Reagan. He has written nothing as good as The Concept of the Corporation about a small company.

另一方面，指责德鲁克是万事通而非大师，更多地揭示了学术界的局限性，而不是德鲁克的缺点。 请记住，德鲁克曾被逐出经济学和政治学的象牙塔，因为他的著作不适合它们狭隘的分类。 至于对他诉诸新闻黑暗艺术的指控，这可能只是说明他具有可读性的另一种方式。 德鲁克过去是——现在仍然是——一个太古怪的人物，不适合构成现代学术界的那些有地盘意识的墨守成规者。

On the other hand, the charge that Drucker is a jack-of-all-trades rather than a master of one reveals more about the limitations of academia than it does about Drucker's shortcomings. Remember that Drucker was expelled from the ivory towers of economics and political science because his work would not fit into their narrow classifications. As for charges that he resorts to the dark art of journalism, that may be just another way of saying that he is readable. Drucker was—and still is—too idiosyncratic a figure to fit in with the turf-conscious conformists who make up modern academia.

在一个由具有纳秒级记忆力的美国商学院专家主导的行业中，德鲁克乐于跨越几个世纪，并引用唐朝的中国、七世纪的拜占庭或十八世纪的法国。 他的历史知识使他能够为当代辩论提供一盏明灯：例如，在评论全球化时，他指出，在第一次世界大战之前，“跨国”制造业的份额比今天更大。 菲亚特（成立于 1899 年）和西门子（成立于 1847 年）等公司几乎刚起步，国外的产量就超过了国内。 亨利·福特虽然是一个臭名昭著的排外主义者，但在他开始扩建他在底特律的原始汽车厂之前，他就开始了他的英国子公司。 17

In a business that is dominated by American business school specialists with nanosecond memories, Drucker is happy to range across the centuries and use a reference to China of the Tang dynasty, or seventh-century Byzantium, or eighteenth-century France. His historical knowledge allows him to throw a shaft of light on contemporary debates: commenting on globalization, for example, he points out that a larger share of manufacturing was "multinational" before the First World War than it is today. Companies such as Fiat (founded in 1899) and Siemens (founded in 1847) produced more abroad than at home almost as soon as they got off the ground. Henry Ford, although a notorious xenophobe, started his English subsidiary before he began to expand his original automobile plant in Detroit. 17

在撰写有关商业联盟的文章时，德鲁克通常会提及他的女主人公简·奥斯汀，以及她对王朝联盟的痴迷。 在评论华尔街最近一轮的投机热潮时，他很快就在反省查尔斯·狄更斯的《小杜丽特》中的一些片段； 最令人惊讶的是，他在一篇关于知识型组织兴起的文章中提到了英属印度的公务员制度。 更重要的是，这不是普通的博学。 他引用的是马克思的《资本论》第 3 卷而不是第 1 卷，引用的是哈灵顿而不是洛克。 在其他活动中，

In writing about business alliances, Drucker usually throws in a reference to his heroine, Jane Austen, and her obsession with dynastic alliances; in commenting on the latest bout of speculative fever on Wall Street, he is soon regurgitating bits of Charles Dickens's Little Dorrit; and, most surprisingly of all, he illustrates an article on the rise of the knowledge-based organization with a reference to the civil service in British India. What is more, this is not garden-variety erudition. He quotes from Volume 3 rather than Volume 1 of Marx's Das Kapital, from Harrington rather than Locke. Among other activities,

彼得·德鲁克

Peter Drucker

他写了两部小说，并在克莱尔蒙特研究生院担任东方艺术系主任。

he has written two novels and held a chair in Oriental Art at Clare-mont Graduate School.

德鲁克的历史不是教科书上能找到的那种：他的兴趣既不在于旧历史的国王和王后，也不在于新历史的资本家和无产者，而是管理者和组织。 他的英雄是让·博丹（至少在德鲁克看来）发明了民族国家，还有奥古斯特·博尔西格，他发明了德国学徒制度。 他的标志是能够在全景和引人注目的特写镜头之间切换。 有那么一刻，他正在对汽车行业的崛起进行广泛的概括； 接下来他讲了一件关于亨利·福特被遗忘的合伙人的轶事。 他不怕预测未来，也不怕概括过去。 他有过失败的经历（记得他对大公司的钦佩），

Drucker's is not the sort of history that can be found in the textbooks: his interest lies neither in the kings and queens of the old history nor in the capitalists and proletarians of the new, but in managers and organization. His heroes are the likes of Jean Bodin, who (according to Drucker at least) invented the nation-state, and August Borsig, who invented the German apprenticeship system. His trademark is his ability to cut between panoramic views and striking close-ups. One moment he is churning out broad generalizations about the rise of the car industry; the next he is relating an anecdote about Henry Ford's forgotten partner. He is not afraid to predict the future as well as to generalize about the past. He has had his share of failures (remember his admiration for large companies), but his batting average is higher than most (notably in the case of privatization and the collapse of the Soviet Union).

最后的百科全书作家

The Last Encyclopaedist

可以说，德鲁克根本不是管理理论家，而是欧洲传统中的世界主义知识分子。 德鲁克是最后的百科全书作家之一，他蔑视现代学术界的高度专业化，并决心了解关于一切的一切。 他用广泛的参考文献来说明他的著作，从精神分析和音乐学到经济学和社会学，从现实生活中的案例研究到学术文献。

Arguably, Drucker is not a management theorist at all, but a cosmopolitan intellectual in the European tradition. Drucker is one of the last of the encyclopaedists, contemptuous of the hyper specialization of modern academia and determined to know everything about everything. He illustrates his writings with a wide range of references, from psychoanalysis and musicology to economics and sociology, from real-life case studies to academic literature.

人们可能会问，这位博学之士为何将如此多的精力集中在管理上？ 油嘴滑舌的回答，“因为它很重要，”可能是真实的。 发现管理对德鲁克的影响与发现上帝（或马克思）对普通人的影响是一样的。 “管理是机构的器官，”他赞美道，“是将暴民转变为组织，将人类努力转变为绩效的器官。” 18

Why, one might well ask, did this polymath concentrate so much of his energy on management? The glib answer, "because it is important," is probably the truthful one. Discovering management had much the same effect on Drucker as discovering God (or Marx) has on lesser mortals. "Management is the organ of institutions," he hymns, "the organ that converts a mob into an organization, and human efforts into performance." 18

如果说德鲁克的著作中贯穿着一个核心主题，那就是：好的管理充其量只会带来经济进步和社会和谐。 马克思对资本主义即将灭亡的预测基于“资本生产力递减的必然规律”； 这是因为管理者已经成功地

If there is a core theme running through Drucker's writings, it is this: at best, good management will bring economic progress and social harmony in its wake. Marx based his prediction of the imminent demise of capitalism on the "inexorable law of the diminishing productivity of capital"; and it is because managers have succeeded in

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST

通过意识到提高生产率的关键在于更聪明地工作而不是工作更长时间，现代经济从成功走向成功，从而战胜了这条定律。 德鲁克认为，一些国家取得持续增长突破的真正原因不是因为他们发现了新技术，而是因为他们发明了新组织。 因此，阿尔弗雷德斯隆的通用汽车是比内燃机更令人敬畏的创造，而医院是比任何新奇医学更重要的医学突破。

outfoxing this law, by realizing that the key to improved productivity lies in working smarter rather than working longer, that the modern economy goes from success to success. The real reason, Drucker argues, that some countries made the breakthrough into sustained growth is not because they discovered new technologies but because they invented new organizations. Thus Alfred Sloan's General Motors is a more awesome creation than the combustion engine, and the hospital is a more important medical breakthrough than any newfangled medicine.

德鲁克对管理的难度不抱幻想。 在 Managing in a Time of Great Change 中，他于 1995 年出版了一本散文集，重点讨论了使现代经理人的生活陷入困境的三个问题。 首先是当代管理变革的巨大规模，因为垂直整合的公司让位于网络化组织。 第二是管理失败的频率。 他指出，大多数管理者都未能理解在革命时代管理意味着什么，他们把时间花在修补业务上，而实际上他们应该重新思考其所依据的整个理论。 第三是企业与其环境之间日益紧张的关系：企业对不断创新的需求与社区对稳定的需求之间； 在知识瞬息万变的本质和人类思维的有限能力之间； 企业参与国际竞争的需要与社会对共同利益的兴趣之间的矛盾。

Drucker has no illusions about how difficult management is. In Managing in a Time of Great Change, a collection of essays published in 1995, he focuses on three problems that are making the modern manager's life hell. The first is the sheer scale of contemporary managerial change, as vertically integrated companies give way to networked organizations. The second is the frequency of managerial failure. Most managers, he points out, have failed to understand what it means to manage in revolutionary times, and they spend their time tinkering with their business when they should really be rethinking the whole theory on which it is based. The third is the growing tension between business and its environment: between business's need for perpetual innovation and the community's need for stability; between the rapidly changing nature of knowledge and the limited capacity of the human mind; between business's need to compete internationally and society's interest in the common good.

好的管理意味着工人和消费者都做体面的事情，而不仅仅是为老板积累利润。 “一个组织是一个人，一个社会，实际上是一种道德现象，”德鲁克指出，今天的再造工程师应该被迫学习这句话。 德鲁克认为，最优秀的管理者是被为客户创造价值的愿望所驱使，而做到这一点的最佳方式是不仅将员工视为生产成本，而且将其视为能够做出持续和有价值贡献的资源。 这种对工人福祉的热情导致哈佛商学院教授 Rosabeth Moss Ranter 将德鲁克与罗伯特欧文进行比较，

Good management means doing the decent thing by both workers and consumers, not just amassing profits for bosses. "An organization is a human, a social, indeed a moral phenomenon," Drucker notes, in a phrase that today's reengineers ought to be forced to learn. Drucker has argued that the best managers are driven by the desire to create value for customers, and that the best way to do this is to treat workers not just as costs of production, but as resources, capable of making a sustained and valued contribution. This enthusiasm for the well-being of workers led Rosabeth Moss Ranter, a professor at Harvard's business school, to compare Drucker to Robert Owen, the nineteenth-century Scotsman who ordered his factory managers to show the same due care to their vital human machines as they did to the new iron and steel that they so lovingly burnished.

德鲁克是对的吗？ 莫斯·兰特 (Moss Ranter) 将德鲁克归类为“管理乌托邦”。 也许他是，但还有更糟糕的梦想家。

Is Drucker right? Moss Ranter classifies Drucker as "a management Utopian." Perhaps he is, but then there are worse sorts of dreamers.

<r

<r

第 4 章

CHAPTER 4

当大多数人听到“管理大师”这个词时，他们会想到汤姆·彼得斯。 他与罗伯特·沃特曼 (Robert Waterman) 合着的第一本书《追求卓越》(In Search of Excellence) 是最初的管理大片：1982 年首次印刷就售出了 100 万册，经过多次重印，两位作者都成为了百万富翁。 它现在已经售出超过五百万册。 更多的书随之而来。 彼得斯源源不断地提供磁带、视频、文章，并与他的助手们一起制作一份古怪但可读的时事通讯。 在国际巡回演讲中，彼得斯比罗纳德·里根、诺曼·施瓦茨科普夫和奥利弗·诺斯等流星更持久，也更胜一筹。 每年都有成千上万的中层管理人员目瞪口呆地看着彼得斯，双臂挥动，额头冒汗，说教时声音嘶哑，

When most people hear the term "management guru," they think of Tom Peters. His first book, In Search of Excellence, cowritten with Robert Waterman, was the original management blockbuster: it sold a million copies on its first printing in 1982, went through numerous reprintings, and turned both of its authors into millionaires. It has now sold more than five million copies. More books have followed. Peters pours out a constant stream of tapes, videos, articles, and, together with his army of assistants, a quirky but readable newsletter. On the international lecture circuit, Peters has outlasted and out-earned such shooting stars as Ronald Reagan, Norman Schwarzkopf, and Oliver North. Every year thousands of middle managers gape in awe as Peters, arms flailing, brow sweating, voice hoarse with preaching, urges them to nuke hierarchy and learn to thrive on chaos.

全天的 Tom Peters 研讨会仍然是一项活动。 在幻灯片的背景下，诸如“英语中最重要的句子！？”之类的信息。 他命令那些穿着西装的困惑的年轻观察者犯错误并找乐子。 1 “你登广告招聘市场营销工作。Luciano Benetton 走进来。他没穿衣服。你雇用他吗？” 然后他事后补充道：“别担心：反正他也不想工作。” 有一瞬间，你被告知要向伦敦四季酒店免费针线包中的螺纹针学习； 下一刻彼得斯在赞美一个

An all-day Tom Peters seminar remains an event. Against a backdrop of slides with messages such as "The Most Important Sentence in the English Language!?" he orders the befuddled young watchers in suits to make mistakes and to have fun. 1 "You advertise for a marketing job. Luciano Benetton walks in. He's wearing no clothes. Do you hire him?" Then he adds as an afterthought: "Don't worry: he wouldn't want to work ioxyou anyway." One moment you are being told to learn from the threaded needle in a complimentary sewing kit in London's Four Seasons hotel; the next moment Peters is praising a

先知和布道者

PROPHET AND EVANGELIST
