《为未来而战》可能与 1990 年代的任何管理书籍一样接近必读。 但是，就其所有优点而言，《为未来而竞争》并非没有困扰管理理论的两个弊病。 首先是该学科将公司拉向相反方向的热情。 哈梅尔和普拉哈拉德的“延伸”概念与所有其他关于“赋权”和“信任”的理论相得益彰：想象一群快乐的人一起出发去寻找他们的梦想慈祥的父亲形象。 在实践中，对于大多数员工来说，“伸展”意味着被告知要竭尽全力去追求一个无法实现的目标——大多数人会形容为地狱般的目标。 第二个问题是行业' 重新发明轮子的倾向。 1960 年，哈佛商学院教授西奥多·莱维特 (Theodore Levitt) 撰写了一篇名为《营销短视症》的文章，认为公司应该根据广泛的定位而不是具体的产品来定义自己。 随着铁路将自己重新定义为“运输公司”，炼油厂将自己重新归类为“能源加工商”，并开始考虑收购其他矿产公司，这导致了大量的华夫饼。 但它并没有带来多少清晰的思路，这种做法最终过时了。 它认为公司应该根据其广泛的定位而不是特定的产品来定义自己。 随着铁路将自己重新定义为“运输公司”，炼油厂将自己重新归类为“能源加工商”，并开始考虑收购其他矿产公司，这导致了大量的华夫饼。 但它并没有带来多少清晰的思路，这种做法最终过时了。 它认为公司应该根据其广泛的定位而不是特定的产品来定义自己。 随着铁路将自己重新定义为“运输公司”，炼油厂将自己重新归类为“能源加工商”，并开始考虑收购其他矿产公司，这导致了大量的华夫饼。 但它并没有带来多少清晰的思路，这种做法最终过时了。

Competing for the Future is probably as close to required reading as any management book in the 1990s. But, for all its virtues, Competing for the Future is not free of two of the maladies afflicting management theory. The first is the discipline's enthusiasm for pulling companies in opposite directions. It would be nice to think that Hamel and Prahalad's concept of "stretch" sits well with all those other theories about "empowerment" and "trust": one imagines a team of cheery souls setting off together in search of their dream watched over by a kindly father figure. In practice, for most workers, "stretch" means being told to work their butts off in pursuit of an unattainable goal—something that most people would describe as hell. The second problem is the industry's propensity for reinventing the wheel. In 1960, Theodore Levitt, a professor at Harvard Business School, wrote an article called "Marketing Myopia," which argued that companies should define themselves in terms of their broad orientation rather than their specific products. This led to a great deal of waffle as railroads redefined themselves as "transportation companies" and oil refineries reclassified themselves as "energy processors" and began to think about buying other mineral companies. But it did not produce much clarity of thinking, and the practice eventually went out of fashion.

为未来而战的支持者会争辩说，这是一种比莱维特的方法更复杂、更精密的方法。 然而，这并没有使现代核心竞争力比 1960 年代的核心竞争力更容易找到。 在金融服务和被认为是多媒体的混乱行业中，公司在决定哪些业务与他们的技能相匹配时遇到了困难。 银行真的与股票经纪人和保险公司属于同一行业吗？ 报纸大亨的技能在好莱坞或电子出版业更有用，还是两者都不是？ 即使公司不得不采取行动，他们也常常走错方向。 Henry Mintzberg 指出，如果马车公司在世纪之交决定，他们需要开始将自己视为运输公司并转向汽车，

Supporters of Competing for the Future would argue that it is a much more complicated, more sophisticated approach than Levitt's. However, that does not make modern core competencies any easier to find than their 1960s' equivalent. In both financial services and the jumble of industries that pass for multimedia, companies are having trouble deciding which businesses match their skills. Are banks really in the same industry as stockbrokers and insurers? Would a newspaper baron's skills be more useful in Hollywood or in electronic publishing, or neither? Even when companies have to make a move, they often go in the wrong direction. Henry Mintzberg points out that, if horse-drawn carriage companies had decided, at the turn of the century, that they needed to start thinking of themselves as transport companies and moved into cars, they would probably have

战略

Strategy

仍然被福特之类的公司淘汰，因为他们没有制造内燃机的专业知识； 相反，最好建议他们利用自己的操作技能，例如为儿童制作木制玩具或为鞭打市场生产马鞭。 18

still been wiped out by the likes of Ford, because they had no expertise in making combustion engines; instead they would have been better advised to capitalize on their operating skills, such as making wooden toys for children or turning out horse whips for the flagellation market. 18

说到底，所有的策略都是在赌未来。 愿景——不亚于计划——取决于制定者。 即使是最愚蠢的彩票玩家也能看出，正确预测未来的公司比那些没有正确预测未来的公司做得更好。 Hamel 和 Praha-lad 几乎没有通过关注押注于可能的未来并获胜的公司（佳能、摩托罗拉、微软等）而不是押注于同样的赌注但失败的公司来加强他们的论点。 苹果输给了微软，因为世界上所有的远见都无法弥补更平凡的商业技能的缺乏。 可以说，公司的不幸之一是被聘请来为公司增加一些世俗专业精神的熟练管理人员约翰·斯卡利 (John Sculley) 也花了太多时间思考该行业的长期未来。

In the end, all strategy is gambling on the future. Visions—no less than plans—are only as good as those who make them. Even the dumbest lottery player can figure out that companies that predict the future correctly do better than those that do not. Hamel and Praha-lad hardly strengthen their argument by focusing on companies that have bet on a possible future and won (Canon, Motorola, Microsoft, etc.) rather than on companies that have made the same bet and lost. Apple lost to Microsoft because all the vision in the world cannot make up for the lack of more mundane business skills. Arguably, one of the company's misfortunes was that the skilled administrator who was brought in to add some mundane professionalism to the company, John Sculley, also spent too much of his time musing on the long-term future of the industry. 19 As chairman of General Motors in 1981-90, Roger Smith did everything right in Hamel and Prahalad's terms, dreaming of making GM "the car company of the twenty-first century" and spending billions to improve the company's technological skills, but he still saw his company's share of the domestic market fall from 46 percent to 35 percent.

“远见卓识”也不局限于像通用汽车这样的常年失败者。 德州仪器试图利用其在计算器、手表和家用电脑等领域的半导体业务中形成的核心竞争力。 但它的经理们缺乏管理此类以消费者为导向的业务的必要经验。 萨奇兄弟决定，银行业和咨询业都是“以人为本的企业”，对相同的管理技术做出反应。 总的来说，航空公司已经开始经营酒店，尽管将两者结合起来似乎是明智的。

Nor is "poor visioning" confined to perennial losers like GM. Texas Instruments tried to exploit the core competencies it had developed in its semiconductor business in areas such as calculators, watches, and home computers. But its managers lacked the necessary experience in managing such consumer-oriented businesses. The Saatchi Brothers decided that banking and consultancy were both "people businesses" that would respond to the same management techniques. Airlines, on the whole, have made a hash of running hotels, even though it seemed sensible to combine the two.

展望未来，很容易看到不少愿景以泪水告终。 由于压倒性的贪婪和过热的想象力，好莱坞一些最富有的人即将在多媒体上损失巨额资金。 美国最成功的两位软件业亿万富翁对其行业的发展有着截然相反的看法。 甲骨文公司的拉里·埃里森认为，个人电脑将让位于廉价、易用的电脑

Looking forward, it is easy to see quite a few visions ending in tears. Some of the richest people in Hollywood are about to lose spectacular amounts of money on multimedia, thanks to a combination of overwhelming greed and overheated imagination. America's two most successful software billionaires have diametrically opposite visions of how their industry will develop. Larry Ellison of Oracle believes that the personal computer will give way to cheap, easy-to-use

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

网络终端，能够从中央数据库中提取信息。 对比尔·盖茨来说，这只是“拉里提出的一系列错误设想中的最新一个”； 他自己的愿景仍然集中在个人电脑上。 20 毫无疑问，在 10 年内，Hamel 和 Prahalad 的儿子会写一本书，说视力是正确的，并使它看起来像是一个容易的选择； 今天，盖茨和埃里森面对的任何普通人都会想起古老的嘲讽：“两个人说他们是耶稣；其中一个一定是错的。”

network terminals, which will be able to pull down information from a central database. To Bill Gates this is just "the latest in a string of misconceived visions that Larry has been coming up with"; his own vision remains centered on the personal computer. 20 Doubtless, in 10 years some son-of-Hamel and son-of-Prahalad will write a book saying that vision was correct, and make it seem an easy choice; today, any normal mortal confronted by Gates and Ellison is reminded of the old jibe: "Two men say they're Jesus; one of them must be wrong."

第 8 章

CHAPTER 8

>*^%。

>*^%.

1995 年 5 月召开的英国天然气公司年度股东大会是一件不同寻常的事情。 它不仅吸引了大约 4,000 名股东（创纪录），而且还是两个塞德里克家族的故事。 第一个是塞德里克·布朗，当时是这家私有化公用事业公司的首席执行官，他是一个有点名气的匿名人士，他突然发现自己被小报称为“英国最讨厌的人”，因为他给自己提供了 492,000 英镑的补偿方案； 第二个是一头猪，也叫塞德里克，它在主人的圈子里是最贪婪的，因此在主人面前脱颖而出。 当人类 Cedric 试图在大厅里维持秩序时，与他同名的猪人坐在外面，从标有“股票期权”的溢出槽中大口大口地吃着土豆皮。

The annual general meeting of British Gas in May 1995 was an unusual affair. Not only did it attract some 4,000 shareholders—a record—but it was also a tale of two Cedrics. The first was Cedric Brown, then the chief executive of the privatized utility, a slightly worthy and anonymous man who had suddenly found himself dubbed by the tabloids "the most hated man in Britain" for awarding himself a compensation package of £492,000; the second was a pig, also called Cedric, who had distinguished himself to his owner by being the greediest in his sty. While the human Cedric tried to keep order in the hall, his swinish namesake sat outside, guzzling potato peelings from overflowing troughs labeled "share options."

也许 Brown 只能为这场猜谜游戏负责。 然而，他只是最近遭受外界愤怒的全球几位老板之一。 商业界的局外人、养老基金，甚至个人股东，都开始提出痛苦的问题：谁拥有一家公司？ 谁负责运行它？ 公司对社区、环境、机会均等有什么责任？ 这些问题——尤其是那些与公司治理和道德有关的问题——曾经是一些杂耍。 现在他们在每次董事会会议上都会被讨论。

Perhaps Brown had only himself to blame for this charade. However, he is only one of several bosses around the world to suffer the wrath of the outside world recently. Outsiders in the business community, pension funds, even individual shareholders, have begun asking painful questions: Who owns a company? Who is accountable for running it? What responsibility does a company have to the community, to the environment, to equal opportunities? These questions—particularly those concerning corporate governance and ethics—used to be something of a sideshow. Now they are discussed at every board meeting.

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

公司内部人士最近并没有证明自己的异端，对领导的性质和行为提出了令人不安的问题。 应用“谁？”这个问题 几乎任何未解决的管理理论问题——例如“谁来选择公司的愿景？” 或者“谁来释放组织的企业家？”——答案几乎总是“首席执行官”。 事实上，这个不幸的灵魂的责任随着组织变得越来越扁平，以及他们的“内部创业者”感到越来越有权力和自负而变得越来越大。 最高层的男性，或偶尔的女性，通常可能是唯一拥有将整个组织团结在一起所需的权威和影响力的人。 “任何机构都不可能生存，”彼得·德鲁克 (Peter Drucker) 曾经说过，“ 如果它需要天才或超人来管理它。 它的组织方式必须能够在完全正常的人的领导下相处。”人们可能会认为，在将近一个世纪之后，管理理论会从领导力中去除一些超人元素。取而代之的是，最新的管理时尚恰恰相反：比以往任何时候都更繁重的责任被压在组织的头上。

Corporate insiders have not proven themselves any less heretical of late, posing disturbing questions about the nature and conduct of leadership. Apply the question "Who?" to virtually any unsolved problem of management theory—as in "Who will choose the company's vision?" or "Who will unleash the organization's entrepreneurs?"—and the answer is nearly always "the chief executive." Indeed, this unfortunate soul's responsibilities have grown all the greater the flatter organizations have become and the more empowered and uppity their "intrapreneurs" feel. The man, or occasionally the woman, at the top may often be the only one with the authority and reach needed to hold the entire organization together. "No institution can possibly survive," Peter Drucker once argued, "if it needs geniuses or supermen to manage it. It must be organized in such a way as to be able to get along under a leadership of perfectly normal human beings." One might have thought that, after nearly a century, management theory would have removed some of the superhuman element from leadership. Instead, the latest managerial fashion is just the opposite: more onerous responsibilities than ever are being heaped on the head of the organization.

那么领导者应该如何领导呢？ 不幸的是，关于领导力的书籍对这个问题给出了相互矛盾的答案。 有人说领导力很容易掌握：它只涉及设定明确的目标、对员工诚实、说“我们”而不是“我”等等。 其他人则鼓吹领导力是如此深奥和本能，以至于它是只有少数人天生具有的天赋：没有多少公告牌和使命宣言，没有多少“人类工程学”可以将乔·普普尔变成杰克·韦尔奇。

So how should the leader lead? Unfortunately, the books on leadership offer contradictory answers to this question. Some say that leadership is fairly easy to pick up: that it involves no more than setting clear goals, being honest with one's employees, saying "We" not "I," and so on. Others preach that leadership is so damned esoteric and instinctive that it is a gift only a few are born with: no number of bulletin boards and mission statements, no amount of "human engineering" is going to turn Joe Public into Jack Welch.

这场辩论在管理学上相当于心理学中先天与后天的辩论。 可以改变组织的领导者的显着稀缺，以及少数人说服他人追随他们的非正统方式，是自然方面的有力论据。 尽管如此，包括沃伦·本尼斯和约翰·阿代尔在内的一些思想家坚持认为领导力是可以教的——这一观点让人回想起军人的想法，即可以训练男人做任何事情。 哪种思想流派会占上风？ 那些必须立即满足对大师智慧话语胃口的读者可以跳到本章的下一部分。 对于那些可以忍受场景设置的小转移的人来说，可能是

This debate is management's equivalent of psychology's nature-versus-nurture debate. The notable scarcity of leaders who can change organizations, and the unorthodox ways in which those few people persuade others to follow them, is a powerful argument on the side of nature. Nevertheless, some thinkers, including Warren Bennis and John Adair, insist that leadership can be taught—a view that harkens back to the military idea that men can be trained to do anything. Which school of thought will prevail? Those readers whose appetite for words of wisdom from the gurus must be slaked immediately can jump ahead to the next section of this chapter. For those who can tolerate a small diversion for scene setting, it may be

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

考虑一下现代老板，以及当前一代超级老板与管理理论之间奇怪的非生产性关系是有用的。

useful to consider the standing or the modern boss, and the strangely unproductive relationship between the current generation of super-bosses and management theory.

从业者的心

The Mind of the Practitioner

在本世纪的大部分时间里，成功的老板往往扮演公众想象中的两个完全负面的角色。 在一个角色中，他们是邪恶的资本家，他们试图通过任何可能的方式赚钱，缝合市场，并联合起来反对小人物。 这就是报纸漫画中出现的多头蛇洛克菲勒，以及奥逊·威尔斯在《公民凯恩》中讽刺的威廉·伦道夫·赫斯特。 或者，商务人士只是，嗯，无聊：他们是西装革履的公司职员，就像公寓里的杰克·莱蒙 (Jack Lemmon)。 “办公室”是乏味的比喻。 在 1960 年代，这两张照片都被拍到了极端。

For most of this century, successful bosses tended to fill two entirely negative roles in the public imagination. In one role, they were evil capitalists who tried to make money by any means possible, who sewed up markets, and who ganged up against the little guy. This was the many-headed serpent Rockefeller that appeared in newspaper cartoons and the William Randolph Hearst who Orson Welles lampooned in "Citizen Kane." Alternatively, business people were just, well, boring: they were suited company men like Jack Lemmon in The Apartment. "The office" was a metaphor for tediousness. During the 1960s, both images were taken to extremes.

最近，流行的想象力开始以更有利的眼光来构想商人。 反商业情绪并没有完全消失：帕特·布坎南 (Pat Buchanan) 在 1996 年的竞选活动中设法煽动了一些余烬。 但大多数自由派政党，例如美国的民主党和英国的工党，似乎从未像现在这样亲商。 现代企业家，尤其是计算机行业的企业家，如比尔·盖茨和史蒂夫·乔布斯，被认为出奇地“酷”，尽管他们的商业行为有时与约翰·D·洛克菲勒一样冷酷无情。 在 1992 年的美国总统大选中，商人罗斯·佩罗曾一度在民意调查中领先乔治·布什和比尔·克林顿： 华盛顿仍然有人相信，如果这位电子数据系统公司的前任老板证明自己是一个不那么古怪的竞选者，他本可以获胜。 四年后，尽管公众强烈反对大企业和裁员，但另一位古怪的商人史蒂夫福布斯也留下了深刻的印象。

More recently, the popular imagination has begun to conceive of the businessman in a more favorable light. Antibusiness sentiment has not disappeared entirely: Pat Buchanan managed to fan some of the embers in the 1996 campaign. But most liberal parties, such as America's Democratic Party and Britain's Labour Party, have never seemed more pro-business. Modern entrepreneurs, particularly those in the computer industry, such as Bill Gates and Steve Jobs, are regarded as surprisingly "cool," even though their business practices are sometimes just as ruthless as John D. Rockefeller's. In America's 1992 presidential election, a businessman, Ross Perot, at one stage led both George Bush and Bill Clinton in the opinion polls: there are still people in Washington who believe that the former boss of Electronic Data Systems could have won if he had proved a less eccentric campaigner. Four years later, despite a public backlash against Big Business and downsizing, another eccentric businessman, Steve Forbes, also made a mark.

在较低级别的政府中，美国选民发现管理能力——或者至少是表面上的——是一种不可抗拒的资产。 骚乱过后，洛杉矶求助于在现实世界中受过教育的商人理查德·里奥丹 (Richard Riordan) 来重组这座伤痕累累的城市。 与此同时，在美国之外，意大利人信任西尔维奥贝卢斯科尼，因为他来自精简的现代私营部门。 左翼与其在墙壁上涂抹马克思主义口号，不如

At lower levels of government, American voters have found managerial competence—or at least the appearance of it—an irresistible asset. In the aftermath of the riots, Los Angeles turned to Richard Riordan, a businessman schooled in the real world, to reorganize the scarred city. Meanwhile, outside the United States, Italians trusted Silvio Berlusconi because he came from the lean, modern private sector. Rather than daubing the walls with Marxist slogans, left-wing

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

学生们开始张贴来自重量级金融出版物的关于贝卢斯科尼资产负债表的批评文章。

students took to sticking up critical articles from heavyweight financial publications about Berlusconi's balance sheet.

这种现象可能主要反映了选民对现代职业政治家的失望。 但它似乎也代表了对管理、效率和在私营部门已经过考验的领导类型的渴望。 比那些参选的商人名单更能说明问题的是越来越长的“假设？” 如果他们愿意，可以发起政治挑战的老板名单。 美国会在下一次选举中在比尔克林顿和鲍勃多尔之间做出选择，还是在杰克韦尔奇和比尔盖茨之间做出选择？ 英国宁愿在约翰·梅杰、帕迪·阿什当和托尼·布莱尔之间做出选择，还是在汉森勋爵、约翰·哈维-琼斯爵士和理查德·布兰森之间做出选择？ 在芬兰，是否会有政治家愿意反对诺基亚的 Jorma Ollia，或者在爱尔兰反对 Tony O' 亨氏的赖利？ 即使在被炸毁的贝鲁特，人们也能找到“全面质量管理”会议的广告牌，骄傲地站在一簇黄色的真主党横幅旁边。

This phenomenon may be principally a reflection of voters' frustration with modern professional politicians. But it also seems to represent a craving for management, for efficiency, for the type of leadership that had been tested in the private sector. Much more revealing than the list of those businessmen who have run is the increasingly long "What-if?" list of those bosses who could mount a political challenge if they wanted to. Would America at the next election rather choose between Bill Clinton and Bob Dole—or between Jack Welch and Bill Gates? Would Britain rather choose between John Major, Paddy Ashdown, and Tony Blair—or between Lord Hanson, Sir John Harvey-Jones, and Richard Branson? In Finland, would any politician willingly campaign against Jorma Ollia of Nokia, or in Ireland against Tony O'Reilly of Heinz? Even in bombed-out Beirut one can find a billboard for a "total-quality management" conference standing proudly next to a cluster of yellow Hezbollah banners.

考虑到公众期望的重要性，人们可能期望商界人士成为新管理理论的伟大创造者。 现实更令人失望。 在管理的早期，枪支制造商伊莱惠特尼和工厂老板罗伯特欧文等人确实是管理思想家。 如前所述，二十世纪初最重要的两位思想家都是商人：亨利·福特和阿尔弗雷德·斯隆。 在 IBM，该公司的创始人 Thomas Watson 帮助定义了客户服务的含义。 “塑造伟大组织的信念，”他的儿子（以及 IBM 的继任者）小托马斯·沃森 (Thomas Watson Junior) 曾写道，“通常源于一个人的性格、经验和信念。” 在今天的日本，人们仍然向商人寻求商业理论， 如第 11 章所述。在韩国，三星公司的老板李健熙发明了一种“新管理哲学”，大致可以描述为一半是加州新时代主义，一半是韩国专制。 现代老板理论家的另一个例子是巴西商人兼作家里卡多·塞姆勒 (Ricardo Semler)，他将自己的家族企业——一家名为 Semco 的泵和螺旋桨制造公司，带到了极致的授权，即使是汤姆·彼得斯 (Tom Peters) 在他最惊艳的时候也没有做到梦想着。 Semco 曾经是那种连上厕所都要计时的地方。 现在工人们选择自己的老板； 其中三分之一选择自己支付。 现代老板理论家的另一个例子是巴西商人兼作家里卡多·塞姆勒 (Ricardo Semler)，他将自己的家族企业——一家名为 Semco 的泵和螺旋桨制造公司，带到了极致的授权，即使是汤姆·彼得斯 (Tom Peters) 在他最惊艳的时候也没有做到梦想着。 Semco 曾经是那种连上厕所都要计时的地方。 现在工人们选择自己的老板； 其中三分之一选择自己支付。 现代老板理论家的另一个例子是巴西商人兼作家里卡多·塞姆勒 (Ricardo Semler)，他将自己的家族企业——一家名为 Semco 的泵和螺旋桨制造公司，带到了极致的授权，即使是汤姆·彼得斯 (Tom Peters) 在他最惊艳的时候也没有做到梦想着。 Semco 曾经是那种连上厕所都要计时的地方。 现在工人们选择自己的老板； 其中三分之一选择自己支付。

Given the weight of public expectations, one might have expected business people to be great generators of new management theories. The reality is more disappointing. In the early days of management, men such as the gun maker Eli Whitney and the mill owner Robert Owen were indeed management thinkers. As already mentioned, two of the most important thinkers of the early twentieth century were businessmen: Henry Ford and Alfred Sloan. Over at IBM, the company's founder, Thomas Watson, helped define what customer service meant. "The beliefs that mould great organizations," his son (and successor as head of IBM) Thomas Watson Junior once wrote, "frequently grow out of the character, the experience and the convictions of a single person." In Japan today, people still look to businessmen for theories about business, as explained in Chapter 11. In Korea, Lee Kun Hee, the boss of Samsung, has invented a "new management philosophy" that can roughly be described as one part Californian new-ageism and two parts Korean autocracy. Another example of the modern boss-theorist is Ricardo Semler, a Brazilian businessman and author, who has taken his family firm, a pump-and propeller-making company called Semco, to extremes of empowerment that even Tom Peters at his most wowish has not dreamed of. Semco used to be the sort of place where even visits to the lavatory were timed. Now workers choose their own bosses; a third of them select their own pay.

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

然而，在欧洲和美国，boss-theorists 很少见。 ABB 的 Percy Barnevik 可能是个例外（见第 10 章）。 大多数执业的老板都喜欢被视为拥有最新思想，但没有时间将自己的想法写在纸上。 密歇根商学院受人尊敬的教授诺埃尔·蒂奇 (Noel Tichy) 最近声称，二十世纪产生了“只有两位商业领袖将因其思想而被人们铭记：通用汽车公司的阿尔弗雷德·斯隆和通用电气公司的杰克·韦尔奇”，第一位许多读者的本能可能是质疑韦尔奇是否算数。 1 尽管韦尔奇在美国管理学中享有近乎神圣的地位，但可以说他的管理理论与其说是革命性的，不如说是奇闻轶事。 是的，他赋予了工人权力，但其他很多人也是如此。 他的格言——“不要管理，

In Europe and America, however, boss-theorists are few on the ground. ABB's Percy Barnevik maybe an exception (see Chapter 10). Most practicing bosses like to be seen as aufait with the latest thinking but do not have time to put their own thoughts on paper. When Noel Tichy, a respected professor at the Michigan School of Business, recently claimed that the twentieth century had produced "only two business leaders who will be remembered for their ideas: Alfred Sloan of General Motors and Jack Welch of General Electric," the first instinct of many readers may have been to question whether Welch counted. 1 Despite his near divine status in American management, Welch's management theory is arguably more anecdotal than revolutionary. Yes, he empowered workers, but so did a lot of other people. His maxims—"Don't manage, lead," "Control your own destiny or somebody else will"—are punchy rather than profound. Massive though Welch's achievement is, it cannot be compared to Sloan's.

事实上，我们许多最受尊敬和最成功的商人似乎都是本能地进行管理，并没有特别受到该学科正式研究的影响。 也有例外，例如大卫·帕卡德，他在《惠普之道》中说，“没有任何其他运营政策比目标管理对惠普的成功贡献更大”，然后继续热情地引用德鲁克的话。 2 但大多数管理者并不那么谦虚。 珀西·巴内维克 (Percy Barnevik) 说，每个人都同意什么才是一家好公司，从授权到权力下放。 棘手的部分是将这些想法付诸实践，没有理论可以告诉公司如何去做。 比尔盖茨承认钦佩彼得德鲁克，但在其他方面对这一类型持怀疑态度。 他指出，在 20 世纪 80 年代初期，大多数管理学作家都在对 IBM 赞不绝口，而就在他作为一名年轻企业家发现这个巨人脚踏实地的同时。 3个

In truth, many of our most esteemed and successful businessmen seem to manage instinctively, and without having been particularly influenced by a formal study of the discipline. There are exceptions, such as David Packard, who says in The HP Way that "no other operating policy has contributed more to Hewlett-Packard's success than management by objectives" and then goes on to quote Drucker enthusiastically. 2 But most managers are less modest. Percy Barnevik says that everybody agrees on what makes for a good company, from empowerment to decentralization. The tricky part is putting these ideas into practice, and no theory can tell a firm how to do that. Bill Gates admits to an admiration for Peter Drucker but otherwise treats the genre with suspicion. He points out that in the early 1980s most management writers were raving about IBM at just the same time that he, as a young entrepreneur, was discovering that the giant had feet of clay. 3

盖茨自己的书《未来之路》（The Road Ahead，1995 年）几乎没有谈到管理。 它是关于信息技术的。 严格来说，大多数（或关于）老板的书都不是管理理论著作。 相反，它们往往属于三类之一。 第一个可能被描述为“来自高层的提示”。 最早的商业畅销书之一是拿破仑·希尔 (Napoleon Hill) 的《思考致富》(Think and Grow Rich, 1937)。 4 虽然后来的作家对希尔说实话的能力表示怀疑，但作者始终声称这本书是从他作为一名幼稚记者被派去采访安德鲁卡内基时开始的

Gates's own book, The Road Ahead (1995), has virtually nothing to say about management; it is about information technology. Most books by (or about) bosses are not, strictly speaking, works of management theory. Instead, they tend to fall into one of three categories. The first might be described as "tips from the top." One of the first business best-sellers was Think and Grow Rich (1937) by Napoleon Hill. 4 Although subsequent writers have cast doubts on Hill's ability to tell the truth, the author always claimed that the book began when, as a cub reporter, he was sent to interview Andrew Carnegie

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

1908 年，钢铁大亨建议他采访其他商业领袖，以找出他们成功的秘诀。 最终，希尔吸引了 500 多人，其中包括洛克菲勒、福特、乔治·伊士曼和弗兰克·伍尔沃斯：该成果于 1937 年出版，至今已售出 700 万册。

in 1908 and the steel baron suggested that he interview other business leaders to find the secret of their success. In the end, Hill collared over 500 people, including Rockefeller, Ford, George Eastman, and Frank W. Woolworth: the result, published in 1937, has since sold 7 million copies.

马克·麦考马克 (Mark McCormack) 在哈佛商学院 (Harvard Business School) 所著的“他们没有教给您的东西”（1984 年）是最近出版的一本“高层秘诀”书。 Mc-Cormack 经营着一家成功的体育推广公司——他彻底改变了这一行业。 然而，任何想从中寻找德鲁克式的关于如何转变服务业的见解的读者都会感到沮丧。 相反，它显然是一个随机的想法列表，其中大部分由其作者的一些轶事来说明：准时，“积极地”倾听，“一旦你卖了，就闭嘴”。 McCormack 介绍了时间管理的概念，说他是周围最好的时间管理者之一，并给出了如何节省这些时间的提示，例如了解您经常访问的建筑物中哪部电梯最快，或者， 如果您乘飞机抵达机场，请让您的司机在不太拥挤的登机口接您。 5 有用，但有人怀疑，这些东西创造了创纪录的利润。

A more recent "tips from the top" book is Mark McCormack's What They Don't Teach You at Harvard Business School (1984). Mc-Cormack runs a successful sports-promotion business—a trade he revolutionized. Yet any reader looking in it for some Druckerish insight on how to transform a services industry will come away frustrated. Rather, it is an apparently random list of thoughts, most of them illustrated by a couple of anecdotes featuring its name-dropping author: be punctual, listen "aggressively," "once you've sold, shut up." Having introduced the idea of time management by saying that he is one of the best time managers around, McCormack gives hints on how to save those seconds, such as knowing which elevators are the quickest in a building you visit frequently, or, if you are arriving by plane at an airport, getting your driver to pick you up at the less crowded departures gate. 5 Useful, but not, one suspects, the stuff of which record profits are made.

相比之下，80 年代另一位伟大的经理兼作家 Lee Ia-cocca 属于“我按我的方式行事”学派。 他的书名为艾柯卡 (Iacocca) (1985)，人们更容易记住这句话，“亨利福特让我的孩子受苦，为此我永远不会原谅他”，而不是任何管理洞察力。 6 本书接近尾声的一章称为“管理的关键”，将他的行业技能概括为三个基本要素：与你的主管举行季度会议、果断、专注于人而不是信息。 这本书的重点似乎是艾柯卡拥有一套独特的无法教授的技能。

By contrast, the other great manager-writer of the 1980s, Lee Ia-cocca, belongs to the "I did it my way" school. His tome, modestly titled Iacocca (1985), is probably better remembered for the line, "Henry Ford made my kids suffer, and for that I'll never forgive him," than for any management insight. 6 A chapter near the end of the book called "The Key to Management" reduces the skills of his trade to three essentials: have quarterly meetings with your executives, be decisive, and concentrate on people rather than information. The whole point of the book seems to be that Iacocca has a unique collection of unteachable skills.

值得补充的是，后来对艾柯卡神话有了更冷静的看法的其他作家将这位汽车大亨描绘成一个花太多时间寻求补贴和推销自己，而很少制造更好的汽车的人。 7 然而，确实有一些真正成功的老板，他们的成就似乎建立在类似的不可转让的商业技能之上。 阅读鲁珀特·默多克的任何传记，最持久的印象之一就是“没有他，这一切都无法实现”。 几乎所有新闻集团的

It is worth adding that other writers, who have since taken a cooler look at the Iacocca myth, have depicted the car baron as somebody who spent too much time hunting subsidies and promoting himself, and too little building better cars. 7 Nevertheless, there are genuinely successful bosses whose achievements seem to be built on similarly nontransferable business skills. Read any biography of Rupert Murdoch, and one of the most lasting impressions is that "none of this can work without him." Nearly all News Corporation's

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

大多数成功的赌博都是默多克的个人预感； 很难想象他的继任者会继承他的管理风格。

most successful gambles have been personal hunches of Murdoch; it is hard to imagine his successor inheriting his management style.

然而，这并不意味着默多克或 Ia-cocca 的职业与管理理论格格不入。 新闻集团的历史可以改写为全球化的案例研究——默多克可以像任何大师一样流利地谈论这个主题（尤其是在他筹集资金的时候）。 翻开艾柯卡在克莱斯勒的时光，你会发现大量日本管理技巧——尤其是与客户服务和精益生产有关的技巧。 可以说，正是艾柯卡未能将此类事情做得更彻底，才迫使他的继任者重新拯救这家美国汽车巨头。

Yet that does not mean that the careers of either Murdoch or Ia-cocca are alien to management theory. News Corporation's history could be rewritten as a case study in globalization—a subject about which Murdoch can talk as fluently as any guru (particularly when he is raising money). Scratch away at Iacocca's time at Chrysler and you will find plenty of Japanese management techniques—particularly ones concerning customer service and lean production. It was arguably Iacocca's failure to do such things more thoroughly that forced his successors to re-rescue the American car giant.

管理者书籍的最后一类，“修复者”，接近佩罗竞选的精神：即优秀的管理者可以利用经验和直觉，而不是任何伟大的理论来解决问题。 修理者的主要例子是约翰·哈维-琼斯爵士。 在长期担任 ICI 主席并取得相当成功之后（以及一段时间的《经济学人》主席），他发现了第二人生，成为“麻烦解决者”的明星——约翰爵士在 BBC 的一个受欢迎的系列节目中访问公司并试图解决问题他们。 尽管约翰爵士并不害怕求助于大师（尤其是在后来的书中，例如 Managing to Survive, 1993），但他的方法是实用主义者的方法。 他的整个风格，从他古怪的领带到他老年足球运动员的发型，都是一个会直截了当地告诉你的人。 他做的。 约翰爵士 他的建议往往是“你应该卖掉这个工厂”或“你应该停止生产这些”，而不是“你应该重新设计这个业务”。 任何管理者都可以从 Trouble-shooter 中学到很多东西——比从理论家撰写的大多数管理书籍中学到的更多，但它再次没有提供蓝图——就像阿尔弗雷德·斯隆那样。

The last category of manager books, "the fixer," is close to the spirit of the Perot campaign: namely, that a good manager can draw on experience and instinct rather than any great theory to fix problems. The prime example of the fixer is Sir John Harvey-Jones. After a long and fairly successful spell as chairman of ICI (and also a stint as chairman of The Economist), he discovered a second life as the star of "Troubleshooter"—a popular BBC series in which Sir John visited companies and tried to fix them. Although Sir John is not afraid to invoke gurus (particularly in later books such as Managing to Survive, 1993), his approach is that of a pragmatist. His whole style, from his outlandish tie to his elderly-footballer haircut, is that of a man who will give it to you straight. Which he does. Sir John's advice tends to be along the lines of "You should sell this plant" or "You should stop making these" rather than "You should reengineer this business." Any manager can learn a great deal from Trouble-shooter—more than from most management books written by theorists, but once again it does not offer a blueprint—in the same way that, say, Alfred Sloan did.

理论与实践的普遍分离可以说是管理理论成熟的反映。 举一个经济学的例子，人们希望他们的财政部长了解货币主义和凯恩斯主义。 他们不希望他们花业余时间在黑板上试验复杂的新公式。 然而，无法回避的事实是，伟大的管理者与清晰的管理理论之间的关系并不总是直接的，部分原因可能是管理理论对大多数老板的工作帮助不大。

The general separation of theory from practice is, arguably, a reflection of the maturity of management theory. To use a parallel example from economics, people expect their finance ministers to know their way around monetarism and Keynesianism; they do not expect them to spend their spare time experimenting with complicated new formulas on blackboards. Yet, there is no getting away from the fact that the relationship between great managers and articulable management theory is not always direct, perhaps in part because management theory has done little to help most bosses in their jobs.

关于领导力的大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES That Leadership Thing

即使在管理理论的任性、口诛笔伐的世界里，没有哪个学科比领导力产生更多的废话。 据统计，领导力有 130 种定义。 Warren Bennis 和 Burt Nanus 在 Leaders: The Strategies for Taking Charge (1985) 中指出：“从来没有这么多人工作这么久却说得这么少。” 卡罗尔·肯尼迪在 1994 年抱怨说：“从亚历山大大帝到纳尔逊、蒙哥马利，再到适当的时候，毫无疑问，诺曼·施瓦茨科普夫将军都会使用古老的军事类比。”我在战场上的品质。” 8 借用这些军事隐喻之一，写领导力有点像入侵俄罗斯。 即使是德鲁克班的作家也往往会遇到深雪。

Even in the wayward, word-spattering world of management theory, no subject has produced more waffle than leadership. By one count, there are 130 definitions of leadership. "Never have so many labored for so long to say so little," argued Warren Bennis and Burt Nanus in Leaders: The Strategies for Taking Charge (1985). "Time and again the old military analogies are rolled out from Alexander the Great to Nelson, Montgomery and in due course no doubt General Norman Schwarzkopf," Carol Kennedy complained in 1994. "Business leadership is evidently harder to recognize and define than the 'follow me' qualities on a battlefield." 8 To borrow one of these military metaphors, writing about leadership is a little like invading Russia. Even writers of Drucker's class tend to run into deep snow.

正如任何新老板都会立即了解到的那样，管理时尚让最高职位变得更加困难。 部分问题是结构性的：高层和底层之间的管理层次不多。 许多总部现在只有不到 100 人，必须更快地做出决策。 与此同时，现代老板不再专横专横。 领导力不再是发布指令，而是释放他人的能量。 在 Charles Handy 的联邦制公司模型中，“除了在战争时期或类似时期外，中心不经营公司。” 现在是时候从老板的角度来看待混乱的知识型组织了。

As any new boss will immediately learn, management fashion has made the top job immensely more difficult. Part of the problem is structural: there are not as many layers of management between top and bottom. Many head offices now contain fewer than 100 people, and decisions have to be made more quickly. At the same time, the modern boss is no longer supposed to be bossy. Leadership is no longer about issuing instructions but about releasing other people's energies. In Charles Handy's Federalist model of the company, "the centre does not run the corporation except in times of war or its equivalent." It is time now to look at the chaotic knowledge-based organization from the boss's point of view.

尽管阿尔弗雷德斯隆建立他的系统部分是为了关押像亨利福特这样不守规矩的老板，但大多数老板都对这种结构感到满意。 它有严格的规则。 老板有三重工作：制定战略、设计管理结构和实施有效控制。 1960 年代和 70 年代的许多管理风潮——尤其是目标管理——给了老板们一个很好的借口来坚持斯隆的模式而不是质疑它。 毕竟，为经理设定目标只是确定斯隆模型“战略”部分的另一种方式。 如果商业世界似乎发展得更快，那只是意味着战略、结构和控制必须更加复杂和全面。 今天的老板们似乎已经疲倦地承认失败了：斯隆模式“在 1970 年代是正确的，

Although Alfred Sloan built his system in part to cage unruly bosses like Henry Ford, it was a structure most bosses felt happy with. It had firm rules. The boss had a threefold job: to set the strategy, design a management structure, and install effective controls. Many of the management fads in the 1960s and 1970s—particularly management by objectives—gave bosses a good excuse to stick with Sloan's model rather than to question it. Setting an objective for a manager was, after all, just another way of determining the "strategy" part of Sloan's model. If the business world appeared to be moving faster, that just meant that strategies, structures, and controls had to be that little bit more complicated and comprehensive. Today's bosses wearily seem to have admitted defeat: The Sloanist model "was right for the 1970s," argues Jack Welch. "A growing handicap in the 1980s and it would have been a ticket to the boneyard in the 1990s."

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

当然，没有人愿意在坟场结束，而且很难找到任何现代老板对授权说坏话。 但是我们应该相信他们吗？

No one wants to end up in the boneyard, of course, and it is hard to find any modern boss who has a bad word to say about empowerment. But should we believe them?

最近关于领导力的管理文献倾向于赞扬 Jean Kvasnica 等人，他是惠普公司的一位经理，他通过摆脱困境领导了几个成功的项目，或者 Jaguar 的北美经理，他们在经历了困难重重的重组之后，实际上把最多的困难的人负责员工参与小组——再次取得成功。 然而，大多数老板会把 Kvasnica 送到公司医生那里，并解雇捷豹的麻烦制造者。 很难说杰克·韦尔奇哪个更真诚：是鼓吹赋予通用电气员工权力的美德的那个人，还是当他在基德皮博迪的“授权”交易员遭受巨额亏损时大发雷霆的人。 事实上，大多数老板更愿意把自己看成是统帅一军的将军， 而不是像 Peter Senge 这样的大师希望他们成为的教师促进者。 英国大都会的谢泼德勋爵曾将自己的风格描述为“轻握喉咙的管理”。

Recent management literature on leadership has tended to praise people such as Jean Kvasnica, a Hewlett-Packard manager who has led several successful projects by getting out of the way, or Jaguar's North American managers, who, after a troubled restructuring, actually put the most difficult people in charge of employee involvement groups—again with successful results. However, most bosses would have sent Kvasnica to the company doctor and fired the troublemakers at Jaguar. It is hard to tell which Jack Welch is the more genuine person: the one who preached the virtues of empowering General Electric's employees, or the one who went ballistic when his "empowered" traders at Kidder Peabody ran up huge losses. In reality, most bosses would much rather see themselves as generals at the head of an army, rather than as the teacher-facilitators that gurus such as Peter Senge would like them to be. Lord Sheppard of Britain's Grand Metropolitan once described his own style as "management by a light grip on the throat."

更糟糕的是，在许多公司，新的自由意味着批评老板的自由。 在英国，英国石油公司、英国电信公司、宝马公司，甚至英国橄榄球队都尝试过“360 度反馈”——让员工告诉老板他们对他们的看法。 在某些情况下，答案是直接给出的； 在其他情况下（通常是更成功的案例），答案会通过第三方匿名过滤，然后由第三方将好消息或坏消息告诉老板。

To make things worse, at many companies the new freedom means freedom to criticize the boss. In Britain companies such as British Petroleum, British Telecom, BMW, and even the English rugby team have experimented with "360-degree feedback"—letting the workers tell the bosses what they think of them. In some cases, the answers are given directly; in others (usually more successful cases), the answers are filtered anonymously through a third party who then tells the boss the good or bad news.

然而，老板们对“学习型组织”的困扰，并不是纯粹的自我问题。 激发他人（尤其是成千上万的人）的潜能比仅仅吸收信息和发出命令更困难。 正如已经指出的那样，要设计出一种既能让人们想出新点子又能为组织赋予共同目标的结构是极其困难的。 当前所有关于成为教练而不是将军的重要性的讨论都倾向于忽视成为一名教练有多么困难。 “管理就像手中握着一只鸽子，”洛杉矶道奇队的汤米·拉索达 (Tommy La-sorda) 说。 “捏得太紧，你会死。你的手张得太多，你会松手。” 9

However, bosses' problems with "learning organizations" are not purely ones of ego. Bringing out the best in others (particularly thousands of others) is more difficult than just absorbing information and sending out commands. As already pointed out, it is devilishly difficult to devise a structure that allows people to come up with new ideas while giving an organization a common purpose. All the current talk about the importance of being a coach rather than a general tends to overlook how difficult being a coach is. "Managing is like holding a dove in your hand," argued Tommy La-sorda of the Los Angeles Dodgers. "Squeeze too tight, you kill it. Open your hand too much, you let it go." 9

先天与后天的大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES Nature versus Nurture

无论他们在授权方面存在什么问题，老板们显然都更加重视工作中的“领导”部分，而不是纯粹的“管理”部分。 沃伦·本尼斯 (Warren Bennis) 在一份著名但长长的清单中列出了两者之间的区别。 （“经理保持；领导者发展。经理关注系统和结构；领导者关注人。经理依赖控制；领导者激发信任。”）10 然而，能够区分经理和领导者与找到将前者变成后者的方法不同。

Whatever their problems with empowerment, bosses are clearly putting more emphasis on the "leadership" part of their job and less on the purely "managerial" part. The difference between the two was set out by Warren Bennis in a famous but long list. ("The manager maintains; the leader develops. The manager focuses on systems and structure; the leader focuses on people. The manager relies on control; the leader inspires trust.") 10 However, being able to tell the difference between managers and leaders is not the same as finding a way to turn the former into the latter.

最近，公司开始尝试以系统的方式培养领导力，其目的可能与其说是教授领导力，不如说是磨练领导力。 毫不奇怪，让“软的东西变硬”的领导者之一是惠普公司，它根据 26 种特征来衡量人们的领导潜力，然后派员工参加培训课程。 每年一月，通用电气大约有 80,000 名员工填写内部简历表。 通用电气以 1 到 5 的等级来监控人们的“无边界”（你会因阻碍在公司内部传播的想法而得低分）。 它还有一个称为“Session C”的正式流程，将经理与工作相匹配，每年占用 Welch 整整一个月的时间。

Recently companies have set about trying to develop leadership in a systematic way, aiming perhaps not so much at teaching leadership as at honing it. Not surprisingly, one of the leaders in making "the soft stuff hard" is Hewlett-Packard, which measures people's leadership potential against a list of 26 characteristics, then sends staff on a coaching course. Each January some 80,000 people at General Electric fill out internal resume forms. GE monitors peoples' "boundarylessness" on a scale of 1 to 5 (you score low points for blocking ideas traveling around the company). It also has a formal process called "Session C," matching managers to jobs, which occupies a whole month of Welch's time every year.

尽管如此，领导力培训仍然是一项不精确和浪费的业务。 为了找到 25 名可能管理其大型业务的领导者，百事公司培训了大约 100 人。 有一次，美国银行跟踪了 1,000 名潜在领导者的进展情况； 六年后，超过 80% 的人离开了。 有时即使是最受推崇的培训系统也会被证明是有缺陷的。 在 80 年代初期，IBM 被认为是培养领导者的理想摇篮； 今天，它被视为企业官僚的墓地。

All the same, leadership training remains an imprecise and wasteful business. To find 25 leaders likely to run its big operations, PepsiCo trained some 100 people. At one time the Bank of America tracked the progress of 1,000 potential leaders; six years later more than 80 percent of them had left. And sometimes even the best-regarded training systems can turn out to be flawed. In the early 1980s, IBM was thought of as being the ideal cradle to develop leaders; today, it is dismissed as a graveyard of corporate bureaucrats.

事实上，可以说，即使先天和后天的力量相结合也是不够的：就像拿破仑的将军一样，现代领导人需要运气——尤其是在时机方面。 美国最受尊敬的老板之一，联合信号公司的劳伦斯·博西迪 (Lawrence Bossidy)，被问及一个人如何改变一个大型组织； 他回答说，阐明了“燃烧平台”的变化理论：“当工人站在海上石油钻井平台上时，工头大喊‘跳入水中’，他们不仅不会跳，而且不会感觉到对工头太客气了。可能会有

Indeed, it is possible to argue that even the combined powers of nature and nurture are not enough: like Napoleon's generals, modern leaders need to be lucky—particularly when it comes to timing. One of America's most widely admired bosses, Lawrence Bossidy of Allied Signal, was asked how a single person can change a large organization; he replied by enunciating the "burning platform" theory of change: "When the roustabouts are standing on the offshore oil rig and the foreman yells 'jump into the water,' not only won't they jump, but also they won't feel too kindly towards the foreman. There may

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

成为水中的鲨鱼。 只有当他们看到平台上升起的火焰时，他们才会跳起来。 克莱斯勒的平台明显着火了； 公司变了。 IBM 的平台没有明显燃烧； 11 换句话说，老板扭转公司局面的能力更多地取决于公司的状况，而不是老板的性格。

be sharks in the water. They'll jump only when they see the flames shooting up from the platform. Chrysler's platform was visibly burning; the company changed. IBM's platform was not visibly burning; it didn't." 11 In other words, a boss's ability to turn companies around depends more on the state of the company than the boss's character.

即便如此，领导力可以为公司的成功做出巨大贡献。 首先，眼光很关键。 为了改变组织，认同一组特定的想法或价值观是有帮助的。 关键不在于愿景应该是正确的，甚至不是特别深刻，而是它应该成为多元化群体的凝聚力。 在某些情况下，甚至不必详细说明该理论。 理查德·布兰森 (Richard Branson) 实际上对维珍所说的话相当软弱； 真正重要的是他代表某种做事方式。

Even so, leadership can contribute a great deal to a company's success. First, vision is crucial. In order to change organizations, it helps to be identified with a particular set of ideas or values. The point is not that the vision should be right or even particularly profound, but that it should be a rallying point for a diverse group of people. In some cases, the theory does not even have to be spelled out. What Richard Branson has actually said about Virgin has been fairly flaccid; what really matters is that he stands for a certain way of doing things.

二是“交易型领导”和“变革型领导”之间的鸿沟扩大了。 具有讽刺意味的是，这两个术语是由一位不成功的政治家詹姆斯麦格雷戈伯恩斯设计的，他是约翰肯尼迪的顾问，然后竞选国会议员。 他认为，交易型领导者是以针锋相对的方式与他们的追随者打交道的：你给我你的选票，我会给你一份工作。 变革型领导者会发现下属没有意识到的深刻需求，并着手去满足它。 后一种方法会产生更高的忠诚度。 正如社会学家指出的那样，“规范”组织权力是一种强大的力量：它引导人们做你想让他们做的事，因为他们拥有相同的价值观，而不是因为他们对大棒和胡萝卜做出反应。

The second is that the gulf between "transactional leadership" and "transformational leadership" has widened. These two terms were devised, ironically, by an unsuccessful politician, James McGregor Burns, who was an adviser to John F. Kennedy and then ran for Congress. Transactional leaders, he decided, were ones who dealt with their followers on a tit-for-tat basis: you give me your vote, I will get you a job. A transformational leader is somebody who spots a profound need that the follower had not realized existed and sets out to meet it. This latter approach engenders far greater loyalty. As sociologists have pointed out, "normative" organizational power is a strong force: it leads people do what you want them to do because they share the same values rather than because they are responding to sticks and carrots.

关于现代企业领导力的最后一点更像是一种直觉：特立独行似乎是一种决定性的优势。 “跳出框框的思维”，用新的行话来说，已经变得更有价值了，因为大多数公司都可以把基本的事情做得完美，平凡的产品可以立即被复制。 在一个大多数老板都在做同样事情的世界里——扁平化他们的指挥结构，把他们的员工变成企业家——往往是那些古怪的人脱颖而出，吸引了更好的员工，并梦想着更令人兴奋的产品。 越来越少的聪明的商学院毕业生想加入大公司——除非那些大公司本身就是像微软和维珍这样的特立独行者。 1989 年，斯坦福大学 70% 的 MBA 毕业生加入了大公司； 1994 年，只有 50% 的人这样做了。

The final point to make about modern business leadership is more of a hunch: being a maverick seems to be a decided advantage. "Out-of-the-box thinking," to use the new jargon, has become more valuable now that most companies can do perfectly the basic things and mundane products can be copied instantaneously. In a world in which most bosses are doing the same things—flattening their command structures, turning their workers into entrepreneurs—it is often the quirky individuals who stand out, attracting better employees and dreaming up more exciting products. Fewer and fewer bright business school graduates want to join big companies—unless those big companies are themselves mavericks like Microsoft and Virgin. In 1989, 70 percent of Stanford's MBA graduates joined big companies; in 1994, only 50 percent did.

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

与比尔·盖茨、鲁珀特·默多克或理查德·布兰森交谈，您的第一印象是永无止境的好奇心。 然而，大多数领导力课程都集中在管理的具体细节上； 大多数经理都是狭隘得令人沮丧的人（只要看一眼任何《商业名人录》中列出的爱好）。 一些鼓舞人心的经理特别鼓励年轻的成功人士开阔眼界。 富士施乐的老板 Yotaro Kobayashi 惊讶地发现，作为一名崭露头角的经理，他被心目中的偶像乔·威尔逊派往科罗拉多州的阿斯彭研究所学习柏拉图和亚里士多德； 小林现在已经在日本设立了一个类似的中心，试图鼓励日本极端循规蹈矩的商人开阔眼界。 Tom Peters 向成千上万的中层管理人员传达了同样的信息，

Talk to Bill Gates, Rupert Murdoch, or Richard Branson and the first impression you get is one of relentless curiosity. Yet most leadership programs concentrate on the nuts and bolts of management; and most managers are depressingly narrow people (as a glance at the hobbies listed in any Business Who's Who demonstrates). Some inspirational managers have made a point of encouraging young highflyers to broaden their minds. Yotaro Kobayashi, Fuji Xerox's boss, was surprised when, as an up-and-coming manager, he was sent off by his hero, Joe Wilson, to the Aspen Institute in Colorado to learn about Plato and Aristotle; Kobayashi has now set up a similar center in Japan, in an attempt to encourage Japan's ultraconformist businessmen to broaden their minds. Tom Peters takes the same message to thousands of middle managers, when he encourages them to throw away their management books and read novels—or even race yaks.

当前管理结构很少培养的另一种特立独行的资产是失败的经验。 1960 年代，韦尔奇在通用电气首次受到关注，因为他经营的一家塑料厂倒闭了。 作为一名年轻的企业家，理查德·布兰森 (Richard Branson) 在将一些唱片从法国走私到英国后，在警察局的牢房里度过了一夜。 鲁珀特·默多克 (Rupert Murdoch) 在 1990 年代初几乎破产。 贝比鲁斯可能以他的本垒打而闻名，但他也创造了三振记录。 然而，由于这些更扁平的管理结构，拥有这些建设性失败经历之一的机会是有限的。

Another maverick asset that current management structures do little to cultivate is the experience of failure. Welch was first noticed at General Electric in the 1960s because he ran a plastics plant that blew up. As a youthful entrepreneur, Richard Branson spent a night in a police cell after smuggling some records into Britain from France. Rupert Murdoch nearly went bust at the beginning of the 1990s. Babe Ruth may have been best known for his home runs, but he also set a record for strikeouts. Thanks to those flatter management structures, however, the chance of having one of these constructive experiences of failure is limited.

那么，现代老板将何去何从？ 简单的答案是过度劳累。 他（或她）面临着远比他的前任复杂得多的挑战：今天的老板被期望在保留某种形式的控制权的同时放弃权力，在创造公司内部的共同文化的同时挖掘员工的创造性才能。 他不得不花更多的时间去会见和激励那些恼人​​的知识工作者，这些知识工作者现在分布在越来越广泛的国家。 最重要的是，他必须是一个特立独行的人，过去可能曾失败过，并且了解他的亚里士多德和德鲁克。 猎头市场以每年 15% 的速度增长，现在老板与秘书离婚或结婚已成为常态，这不足为奇。

So where does that leave the modern boss? The simple answer is overworked. He (or she) faces a far more complex challenge than his predecessors: today's boss is expected to give away power while keeping some form of control, and to tap the creative talents of his employees while creating a common culture within the company. He has to spend far more time meeting and motivating those irritating knowledge workers, who are now spread across an increasingly wide range of countries. On top of all this, he has to be a maverick who may have failed in the past and who knows his Aristotle as well as his Drucker. It is hardly surprising that the executive search market is growing at 15 percent a year, and that it is now normal for bosses to be divorced or married to their secretaries.

换句话说，管理理论似乎未能通过德鲁克的挑战：建立一个不需要“天才或超人”领导的机构。 远非轻松的工作

In other words, management theory seems to have flunked Drucker's challenge: to come up with an institution that does not need to be led "by geniuses or supermen." Far from easing the job of

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

作为领导者，管理理论似乎让它变得更加困难——事实上，这几乎是不可能的。 即使是回顾过去伟大领袖的神圣借口，也似乎越来越弄巧成拙。 温斯顿丘吉尔会成为多元文化公司中的优秀“教师领导者”吗？ 亚历山大大帝会不会准备好让身穿 T 恤的知识工作者中队消失几年来追随他们自己的想法？

a leader, management theory seems to have made it more difficult— in fact, well nigh impossible. Even the hallowed excuse of looking back to great leaders of the past seems increasingly self-defeating. Would Winston Churchill have been a good "teacher-leader" in a multicultural corporation? Would Alexander the Great have been prepared to let squadrons of T-shirted knowledge workers disappear to follow their own ideas for a couple of years?

不负责任、性别歧视和围攻

Unaccountable, Sexist, and under Siege

尽管管理理论家将所有这些责任都推给了老板和董事会，但直到最近，他们还不太热衷于开发让这些新近有远见的领导者对他们的远景负责的方法。 这是一个严重的缺陷。 再次呼吁德鲁克：“任何政府，无论是公司政府还是国家政府，如果不明确对结果负责，也不明确对某人负责，就会堕落为平庸和绩效不佳。” 12 这不可能完全是巧合，虽然公司的几乎所有其他部分都经过了重新设计、重新设计和改造，但大师和顾问却让那些认可这些革命的人独自一人。 从来没有巫医通过建议改变统治家族来提升自己的事业。

Although management theorists have piled all these responsibilities on the boss and the boardroom, they have, until recently, been less keen on developing ways of holding these newly visionary leaders accountable for their visions. This is a serious flaw. To call in Drucker once again: "Any government, whether that of a company or of a nation, degenerates into mediocrity and malperformance if it is not clearly accountable for results and not clearly accountable to someone." 12 It cannot be entirely coincidental that, although virtually every other part of the company has been redesigned, reengi-neered, and reinvented, the gurus and consultants have left the people who have sanctioned these revolutions alone. No witch doctor ever advanced his career by suggesting a change of ruling family.

根据一个古老的笑话，公司的董事会就像“鱼上的欧芹”——用于装饰目的而不是任何更重要的东西。 即使接受这种描述，大多数木板也不再制作特别开胃的装饰。

According to the old joke, a company's board is like "the parsley on the fish"—there for ornamental purposes rather than anything more substantial. Even accepting this description, most boards no longer make a particularly appetizing garnish.

白人男性占美国劳动力的 43%，但占据了 95% 的高级管理职位。 女性唯一做得好的领域——助理副总裁和办公室经理等中层管理职位——是受再造影响最严重的领域。 美国最著名的女性首席执行官之一、食品和零售集团 Beatrice 的洛伊达·刘易斯 (Loida Lewis) 获得这份工作主要是因为她从已故丈夫那里继承了股票。 在法国，高层管理人员甚至更巧妙地被来自小型公务员学校 ENA 的“Enarques”抢走。 1993 年，法国 125 家最大公司的老板几乎有一半是前公务员。

White men constitute 43 percent of America's workforce, but hold 95 percent of its senior management positions. The only area in which women have done well—middle-management jobs such as assistant vice presidents and office managers—is the one that has been hardest hit by reengineering. One of America's best-known women chief executives, Loida Lewis of Beatrice, a food and retailing conglomerate, got the job principally because she inherited stock from her late husband. In France, the senior layers of management are even more deftly snapped up by the "Enarques" who have come from the tiny civil service school, ENA. In 1993 almost half the bosses of France's 125 largest companies were former civil servants.

1970 年，《今日管理》调查了 200 家英国大公司的董事会成员。 1995年杂志

In 1970, Management Today looked at the composition of the boardrooms of 200 big British companies. In 1995 the magazine

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

对 2,000 家公司重复了该练习。 13 经过四分之一个世纪的剧烈经济和社会变革，英国董事会的典型成员仍然是 50 岁出头的受过牛津剑桥教育的男性。 只有 3.7% 的董事是女性——其中许多人担任非执行职务。 最明显的变化迹象是，在 FTSE-100 公司中，董事会的薪酬包在平均工资仅增长 50% 的时期内实际增长了三倍（达到 248,000 英镑）。

repeated the exercise with 2,000 companies. 13 After a quarter of a century of radical economic and social change, the typical inhabitant of the British boardroom remains an Oxbridge-educated male in his early 50s. Only 3.7 percent of the directors were women—and many of these held nonexecutive posts. The most obvious sign of change was that, at FTSE-100 companies, pay packets in the boardroom had risen threefold in real terms (to £248,000) in a period when average wages were up only 50 percent.

这种排他性很重要。 美国的 WASP 精英缺乏应对日益多元文化的国内市场的丰富经验，更不用说策划征服世界市场了。 法国培养了擅长某些类型管理的精英，例如长期规划或大型基础设施项目，但在计算机等快速发展的行业中却超出了其深度。 更糟糕的是，世界各地担任董事和首席执行官的穿蓝西装、白衬衫的中年男性之间的相似性增加了“欧芹效应”。 汤姆·彼得斯 (Tom Peters) 指出，美国高级管理人员的同质性使得将公司划分为自治的、相互竞争的单位的夸张计划毫无意义。 这也意味着公司与消费者脱节。 调查显示， 即使涉及相当大的产品，如汽车或人寿保险，现在购买什么的决定通常（如果不是主要的话）由女性做出。 汽车公司或保险公司的女性董事很少，也没有杰出​​的首席执行官。

This exclusiveness matters. America's WASP elite lacks the range of experience to deal with an increasingly multicultural home market, let alone to mastermind the conquest of world markets. France has bred an elite that is good at certain types of management, such as long-range planning or big infrastructure projects, but out of its depth in fast-moving industries such as computers. Worse, the very similarity between the middle-aged, blue-suited, white-shirted men who are directors and chief executives around the world increases the "parsley effect." Tom Peters has pointed out that the homogeneity of America's senior managers makes a nonsense of high-falutin' plans to divide companies into autonomous, competing units. It also means that companies grow out of touch with their consumers. Surveys have shown that, even when it comes to fairly chunky products such as cars or life insurance, the decision about what to buy is now often—if not mostly—made by a woman. There are very few female directors of car companies or insurers—and no prominent chief executives.

门口的股东

Shareholders at the Gate

促使董事会改变做法的主要压力并非来自专家，而是来自新一类的股东权利活动家。 其中包括 Robert Monks 等人，他是一位和蔼可亲的美国人，他曾于 1992 年初在《华尔街日报》上以“不良资产”为标题刊登了关于 Sears 的整版广告，以及德国经济学教授 Ekkehard Wenger，他专门研究造成他在年度会议上表现出悲伤，并通过引用席勒的话来捍卫他通常毫不掩饰的风格：“必须尽可能粗暴地告诉德国人真相。”

The chief pressure on boards to change their ways has not come from the gurus but from a new class of shareholders-rights activists. These include individuals such as Robert Monks, a genial American who once took out a full-page advertisement about Sears in The Wall Street Journal in early 1992 under the title "Nonperforming assets," and Ekkehard Wenger, a German economics professor who specializes in causing grief at annual meetings and who defends his often unsubtle style by quoting Schiller: "One must tell the Germans the truth as coarsely as possible."

然而，大部分影响力来自加州公共雇员退休系统 (Calpers)、

However, most of the clout has come from institutions such as the California Public Employees Retirement System (Calpers), the

174

174

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

国家工人养老基金对其投资组合采取了积极的态度，大量持有公司股份，然后试图迫使它们做出改变。 在美国，养老基金经理和其他受托机构有义务在年度股东大会上投票。 但他们也被激励采取行动，美国对老板友好的州，如特拉华州，允许时代华纳等笨拙的巨头选择较低的收购要约或采用“毒丸”和“金色降落伞”，从而进行收购收购方的成本更高，并保护董事会自己的薪水。

state-workers' pension fund, which has taken a vigorous approach to its portfolio, building up big blocks of shares in companies and then trying to force them to change. In America pension-fund managers and other fiduciary organizations are obliged to vote at annual general meetings. But they have also been spurred into action by the way that boss-friendly states in America, such as Delaware, allow lumbering giants such as Time Warner to choose lower takeover offers or adopt "poison pills" and "golden parachutes," which make takeovers more expensive for acquirers and protect the board's own salaries.

普遍的股东压力导致了一系列公众调查，包括英国的 Cadbury 和 Greenbury 报告以及法国的 Vienot 报告。 一系列研究表明，Calpers 和沃伦巴菲特等干预主义股东的投资回报率更高。 至少在美国，愤怒的股东已经说服董事会罢免一些美国最大公司的老板，包括美国运通、IBM 和 WR Grace。 他们还通过起诉他们迫使董事们齐心协力。 1994年美国股东对董事提起的诉讼有347起； 平均支出为 770 万美元。

General shareholder pressure has led to a spate of public inquiries, including the Cadbury and Greenbury reports in Britain and the Vienot report in France. A string of studies has shown that interventionist shareholders, such as Calpers and Warren Buffett, have got better returns on their investments. And in America, at least, angry shareholders have persuaded boards to boot out the bosses of some of America's biggest companies, including American Express, IBM, and WR Grace. They have also forced directors to get their act together by suing them. There were 347 suits filed against directors by shareholders in America in 1994; the average payout was $7.7 million.

在高管薪酬、继任和非执行董事方面，很少有国家坚持要求董事会和老板问责。 这份清单上最难以接受的项目是高管薪酬。 几乎无论以何种标准衡量，总的来说，董事——尤其是老板——一直在慷慨地支付自己的薪水。 1994 年美国的“赢家”是绿树金融公司的劳伦斯·卡斯，这是一家消费金融公司，他的薪水是比尔·克林顿 20 万美元薪水的 100 多倍。 从 1990 年到 1995 年，美国首席执行官的平均薪酬增长了 92%（达到 375 万美元）； 同期，公司利润增长了 75%，工人工资增长了 16%（达到 26,652 美元）。 14 授权管理股权的股份现在占美国最大的 200 家公司已发行股份的 10%。 但真正的问题与其说是规模问题，不如说是性能问题。 大部分高额报酬来自股票期权交易，如果老板成功，他们会慷慨地奖励他们，但如果他们不成功，则不会惩罚他们。

Few countries insist on accountability from boards and bosses when it comes to executive pay, succession, and nonexecutive directors. The hardest-to-swallow item on this list is executive pay. By virtually any measure, directors in general—and bosses in particular—have been paying themselves generously. In 1994 the "winner" in America was Lawrence Cass of Green Tree Financial, a consumer-finance company, who was paid more than 100 times the $200,000 salary of Bill Clinton. Between 1990 and 1995 the average American chief executive's pay rose 92 percent (to $3.75 million); over the same period, corporate profits rose 75 percent and workers' pay 16 percent (to $26,652). 14 Shares authorized for management equity now account for 10 percent of the outstanding shares of America's biggest 200 firms. But the real problem is not so much one of scale as of performance. Most of the high payments come from share-option deals that reward bosses generously if they succeed but fail to punish them if they do not.

类似的单向赌注现在对于其他高级经理来说也很常见。 IBM 首席财务官 (CFO) 的“价值共享”交易诱使 Jerry York 担任 Kirk Kerkorian 的同一职位

Similar one-way bets are now common for other senior managers, too. The "value-sharing" deal that tempted Jerry York, IBM's chief financial officer (CFO), to the same post at Kirk Kerkorian's

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

Tracinda Corporation 在 1995 年价值 2500 万美元。 《首席财务官》杂志的一项调查得出的结论是：“尽管越来越多的首席财务官在薪酬方面承担风险，但只有少数人与股东分担下行风险和上行回报。” 15 Barings 丑闻中最有趣的部分之一是建立在 Nick Leeson 业绩之上的奖金金字塔。 交易员本人获得了 420,000 英镑的奖金； 那些在他之上的人得到了更多。

Tracinda Corporation in 1995 was worth $25 million. A survey by CFO magazine concluded that "although more CFOs are taking risks with their compensation, only a few are sharing downside risk as well as upside reward with their shareholders." 15 One of the most interesting parts of the Barings scandal was the pyramid of bonuses constructed on top of Nick Leeson's performance. The trader himself was on a £420,000 bonus; those above him got much more.

薪酬的问题在于，虽然它让一些股东非常恼火，但一个人在一家价值数十亿美元的公司中不应得的百万美元薪水很少是一个大到足以说服股东反抗的问题——尤其是当金融世界本身鲜为人知的时候薪水方面的节俭。 在英国天然气公司的股东大会上，机构居然投票支持了围攻的塞德里克·布朗。 因此，董事会的批评者集中精力让老板们更多地透露他们的薪水和原因，希望借此羞辱他们，让他们表现良好。

The problem with pay is that, although it annoys some shareholders intensely, one man's undeserved million-dollar salary in a multi-billion-dollar company is seldom a big enough issue to persuade shareholders to revolt—particularly when the financial world itself is hardly known for parsimony when it comes to paychecks. At British Gas's shareholder meeting, the institutions actually voted in favor of the besieged Cedric Brown. Critics of the boardroom have consequently concentrated on getting bosses to reveal more about what they are paid and why, hoping to shame them into good behavior.

大多数老板仍然认为选择继任者是他们的特权。 这种滥用职权在欧洲大陆最为严重：例如，在法国，一家大公司的管理权从一个 Enarque 移交给另一个 Enarque 时几乎不与公司所有者说一句话的情况仍然很正常。 两家通用电气公司——美国的 GE 和英国的 GEC——都对新老板的选择犹豫不决。 但是，对于执政时间过长而拒绝退休的老板们，我们能做些什么呢？ 迄今为止，最激进的解决方案来自伦敦商学院的约翰·凯：他请求为老板提供固定任期，理由是专制结构正在“潜移默化地腐蚀”除了最杰出的男人和女人之外的所有人。

Most bosses still regard it as their privilege to choose their successor. The abuse is worst in continental Europe: in France, for example, it is still normal for the stewardship of a large company to pass from one Enarque to another with barely a word to the company's owners. The two General Electrics—America's GE and Britain's GEC—have both dithered over the choice of a new boss. But what can be done about bosses who have simply held on to power too long and refuse to retire? So far the most radical solution has come from John Kay of the London Business School: he has pleaded for fixed terms for bosses on the grounds that authoritarian structures are "insidiously corrupting" for all but the most remarkable men and women.

更好的解决方案是强制董事会履行职责并代表股东的利益。 非执行董事，尤其是非执行董事长是这一过程的重要组成部分：毕竟，兼任董事长的首席执行官有点像给自己批改试卷的学生。 在英国，继 1992 年 12 月的吉百利报告之后，该国 80% 以上的大公司都任命了非执行董事长。 在美国，权力略微向董事会的非执行成员转移，他们现在更加认真地对待自己的工作。 现在甚至还有“董事学院”，例如斯坦福法学院的董事学院。 四分之三

A better solution would be to force the board to do its job and represent shareholders' interests. Nonexecutive directors and, particularly, nonexecutive chairmen are a vital part of this process: after all, a chief executive who is also chairman is a bit like a student who marks his own exam papers. In Britain, in the wake of the Cadbury Report in December 1992, over 80 percent of the country's biggest companies have a nonexecutive chairman. In America, power has shifted slightly toward the nonexecutive members of the board who are now taking their job much more seriously. There are now even "director schools" such as the Directors College at Stanford Law School. Three-quarters

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

在 1995 年接受猎头公司 Korn/Ferry 调查的 1,000 名董事中，有的表示他们的董事会有明确的目标来衡量首席执行官 (CEO) 的绩效； 三分之二进行了正式的年度审查。 1992 年，通用汽车罢免罗伯特·斯坦普尔 (Robert Stempel) 的政变是由约翰·斯梅尔 (John Smale) 领导的一群非执行董事组织的，约翰·斯梅尔 (John Smale) 随后成为非执行董事长。

of the 1,000 directors quizzed by headhunter Korn/Ferry in 1995 said that their boards had clear objectives for measuring the performance of chief executive officers (CEOs); two-thirds had formal annual reviews. The coup at General Motors that got rid of Robert Stempel in 1992 was organized by a group of nonexecutive directors led by John Smale, who then became nonexecutive chairman.

这并不是说非执行董事是万无一失的。 许多相同的名字不断出现在与糟糕的业绩和糟糕的公司治理相关的公司董事会上。 1995 年，一家缝纫图案公司的退休经理莉莉安·阿菲尼托 (Lilyan Affinito) 担任 Kmart 和 Tambrands 等公司的董事会成员，年薪 30 万美元。 16 这样的董事习惯于在最严重的公司灾难中毫发无伤。 也是 Smale 说服了 Stempel 的继任者 Jack Smith，让 Jose Ignacio Lopez de Arriortua 担任北美业务负责人，因为他的成本削减对这家汽车巨头的底线产生了如此大的影响。 （洛佩兹随后前往大众汽车公司。）并且，在 1995 年 12 月，斯梅尔将主席职位交还给了史密斯，并明确表示，与美国的许多其他董事一样，

This is not to say that nonexecutive directors are infallible. Many of the same names keep popping up on the boards of companies associated with lousy performance and poor corporate governance. In 1995 Lilyan Affinito, a retired manager at a sewing-pattern company, earned $300,000 a year for sitting on the boards of the likes of Kmart and Tambrands. 16 Such directors have a habit of emerging unscathed from the worst corporate wrecks. It was also Smale who persuaded Stempel's successor, Jack Smith, to offer Jose Ignacio Lopez de Arriortua the job as head of North American operations because his cost cutting had such a big effect on the car giant's bottom line. (Lopez then took off to Volkswagen.) And, in December 1995, Smale handed back the chairmanship to Smith, making it clear that, like many other directors in America, he regarded splitting the two posts as an emergency procedure.

无论他们多么不高兴，美国股东至少可以感谢上帝，因为他们不必与法国公司打交道。 1966 年，一项法律允许法国公司采用两级德国式监事会。 不到五分之一的人愿意这样做。 尽管有证据表明苏伊士、法国航空公司和里昂信贷银行管理不善，但法国公司一直抵制将总统与总干事分开的企图。 集体董事会责任的理念并未载入法国法律。 在 1994 年对法国独立董事的一项调查中，超过一半的人表示他们没有足够的信息来对老板进行控制。 17 “在盎格鲁-撒克逊模式中，市场实施了非常强的控制，”里昂信贷董事长让·佩雷勒瓦德 (Jean Peyrelevade) 指出。 “

However unhappy they may be, American shareholders can at least thank God that they do not have to deal with French firms. In 1966 a law allowed French companies to adopt a two-tier German style of supervisory board. Fewer than 1 in 50 have bothered to do so. Despite evidence of poor management at Suez, Air France, and Credit Lyonnais, French companies have resisted attempts to divide the president from the directeur general. The idea of collective board responsibility is not enshrined in French law. In a 1994 survey of independent directors in France, over half said that they did not have enough information to exercise control over bosses. 17 "In the Anglo-Saxon model there is a very strong degree of control exercised by the market," Jean Peyrelevade, chairman of Credit Lyonnais has pointed out. "The French market is too weak to fulfill that role." 18 Even when members of France's narrow business elite do fall out, the boss can usually shrug off the challenge. When Jacques Calvet, the head of Peugeot, threatened to resign as a director of Generale des Eaux over the selection of a new chief executive, Guy Dejounay, the water utility's boss, ignored him, and Calvet stayed anyway.

大辩论 伦理问题

THE GREAT DEBATES A Question of Ethics

有趣的是，卷入 20 世纪 90 年代中期腐败丑闻（当地称为 les affaires）的法国老板通常被指控滥用公司资金。 这强调了道德与公司治理之间的一般联系。 对于不亚于初出茅庐的公司来说，好名声很容易失去，而且很难重建。 企业伦理研究是管理理论中发展最快的领域之一。

Interestingly, the French bosses caught in the corruption scandals of the mid-1990s (known locally as les affaires) were usually charged with abus des biens sociaux, abuse of corporate funds. This underscores the general link between ethics and corporate governance. For companies no less than debutantes, a good name is easy to lose and very hard to rebuild. The study of corporate ethics is one of the fastest-growing areas in management theory.

荷兰皇家/壳牌来之不易的形象是一家更友善、更温和的石油公司，意识到其社会责任和时尚的多元文化，但在 1995 年迅速被摧毁——首先是它试图在北海倾倒布伦特斯帕尔石油钻井平台（正确的决定，因为它发生了，尽管没有得到很好的解释），然后是它与尼日利亚政府的联系，该政府处决了本·萨罗维瓦（Ben Sarowiwa），这位诗人通过调查石油巨头的环境记录在他的国家引起了轩然大波。

Royal Dutch/Shell's hard-earned image as a kinder, gentler sort of oil company, conscious of its social responsibilities and fashionably multicultural, was quickly destroyed in 1995—first by its attempt to dump the Brent Spar oil rig in the North Sea (the correct decision, as it happened, though poorly explained), and then by its association with the Nigerian government that executed Ben Sarowiwa, a poet who had caused a fuss in his country by investigating the oil giant's environmental record.

壳牌的困境可能会让许多人感到极端。 但如今，公司最终可能会因为一些温和的事情而成为头条新闻。 1995 年 10 月，Bausch & Lomb 成为商业周刊 1995 年 10 月封面故事的主题，标题为“盲目野心”。 - 禁止向灰色市场经销商提供眼镜。 这个问题主导了公司随后的董事会会议。 政客们也发现公司很容易出丑。 1995 年，美国劳工部长罗伯特·赖希 (Robert Reich) 特意带记者去加利福尼亚的一家血汗工厂，向他们展示运往蒙哥马利沃德 (Montgomery Ward) 和代顿哈德逊 (Dayton Hudson) 等零售商的商品，该血汗工厂最近遭到警方突击搜查。

Shell's dilemma may strike many as extreme. But nowadays companies can end up in the headlines for milder things. In October 1995 Bausch & Lomb was the subject of an October 1995 cover story in Business Week headlined "Blind Ambition," which argued that in its go-getting quest for profits the company had jumped over certain commercial niceties such as selling its supposedly exclusive Ray-ban glasses to grey-market distributors. The issue dominated the company's subsequent board meetings. Politicians have also discovered that companies are easy to embarrass. In 1995 Robert Reich, America's labor secretary, made a point of taking journalists to a Californ-ian sweatshop, recently raided by the police, to show them goods bound for retailers such as Montgomery Ward and Dayton Hudson.

如今，公司董事会必须考虑一种不同的问责制。 他们负责管理的许多资产都是无形资产——尤其是公司的声誉。 在发达国家越来越多的消费者基于“非商业”理由做出商业决定的环境中，米尔顿·弗里德曼 (Milton Friedman) 的格言，即公司唯一的责任是合法地赚钱，看起来越来越站不住脚了。 一家不违法但被视为对社会不负责任的公司日子不好过。 出于同样的原因，Levi Strauss、Johnson & Johnson、Body Shop 和 Ben & Jerry's 等公司都因他们的“道德”声誉而繁荣。

Nowadays, a company's board has to think about a different sort of accountability. Many of the assets they are charged with looking after are intangible ones—notably the firm's reputation. In an environment where more and more consumers in the developed world make commercial decisions on "noncommercial" grounds, Milton Friedman's maxim that a company's only responsibility is to make money legally looks ever less defensible. A firm that does not break the law but is seen as socially irresponsible has a tough time. By the same token, firms such as Levi Strauss, Johnson & Johnson, Body Shop, and Ben & Jerry's have all prospered from their "ethical" reputations.

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

从管理理论家的角度来看，伦理存在两个问题。 首先是，就像母性和苹果派一样，没有人反对道德。 美国商学院有 500 多门“伦理学”课程（其中一所甚至将学生送到修道院）。 到 1995 年，大约三分之二的美国公司拥有正式的道德准则； 三分之一设有道德操守办公室或监察员。 然而，评论员并没有注意到道德活动的浪潮因此席卷了全国。

There are two problems with ethics from a management theorist's point of view. The first is that, like motherhood and apple pie, nobody is against ethics. There are over 500 courses in "ethics" at American business schools (one even sends its students off to a monastery). By 1995 about two-thirds of American companies had formal codes of ethics; a third had ethics offices or ombudsmen. Commentators have not, however, noted a wave of ethical activity sweeping the country as a result.

第二个问题更为严重：人们的言行之间存在着巨大的差距。 这方面的一个主要例子是最近发生的一系列举报案件，在这些案件中，试图举报所谓“不道德”行为的经理被辞退了。 （在一个涉及美国农业综合企业 Archer Midland Daniels 的案例中，举报人甚至在该公司的家乡遭到一名传教士的嘲笑。）很少有公司准备像 Ben & Jerry's 那样走得那么远，并允许外部人士公布对其业绩的审计。 即使是有道德的公司也很难坚持自己的高标准。 1995 年 1 月，曾因泰诺氰化物丑闻的诚实行为而赢得赞誉的强生公司不得不支付 7 美元。

The second problem is more serious: there is a yawning gap between what people say and what they do. One of the prime examples of this is a series of recent whistleblower cases in which managers who tried to report alleged "unethical" behavior were hounded out of their jobs. (In one case involving American agribusiness Archer Midland Daniels, the whistleblower was even pilloried by a preacher in the company's home town.) Few firms are prepared to go as far as Ben & Jerry's and allow outsiders to publish audits of their performance. Even ethical firms have trouble sticking to their own high standards. In January 1995 Johnson & Johnson, which had earlier earned plaudits for its honest behavior over the Tylenol cyanide scandal, had to pay out $7.5 million in fines and costs after admitting that a subsidiary had shredded documents relating to a federal investigation.

在某些情况下，失误更多地与形象有关，而不是与实质有关——尽管这可能具有足够的破坏性。 在文件显示其化妆品中的某些成分过去曾由其他公司在动物身上进行过测试后，Body Shop 被迫重新声明其产品未在动物身上进行过测试。 然而，也有证据表明，许多公司对道德只采取了肤浅的方法。 在哈佛商学院的 Joseph Badaracco 和麦肯锡的 Allen Webb 对年轻经理人的一项调查中，大多数受访者认为在道德方面“过度投资”并不是获得成功的途径：只有三分之一的人认为他们的公司会尊重举报人。 19 与许多其他理论家一样，Badaracco 和 Webb 认为责任在于董事会：首先， 建立严格的道德规范和明确的制裁； 第二，给自己树立一个好榜样。

In some cases the lapses have more to do with image than with substance—though that can be damaging enough. Body Shop was forced to rephrase a claim that its products were not tested on animals after documents revealed that some of the ingredients that went into its cosmetics had been tested on animals by other firms in the past. However, there is also evidence that many firms have only a skin-deep approach to ethics. In a survey of young managers by Joseph Badaracco of Harvard Business School and Allen Webb of McKinsey, most of the respondents thought that "overinvesting" in ethics was not the way to get ahead: only a third thought that their companies would respect whistleblowers. 19 Like many other theorists, Badaracco and Webb believe that responsibility lies with the board: first, to set up strict ethical codes with clear sanctions; and second, to set a good example themselves.

但这些董事代表谁行事？ 到目前为止，在本章中，一般假设是股东。 但是越来越吵闹的理论家们认为，现代企业是

But on whose behalf are these directors acting? So far in this chapter, the general assumption has been the shareholders. But an increasingly noisy group of theorists argue that the modern firm is

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

对更广泛的人群“负责”——包括当地社区和员工。 谁最终应该拥有一家公司？

"accountable" to a wider group of people—including its local community and its workers. Who, in the end, should own a company?

利益相关者的事

That Stakeholder Thing

查尔斯·汉迪 (Charles Handy) 宣称：“现在是我们扼杀神话的时候了，这个神话是股东在经营企业，而我们所有人都是为了他们而工作。” 20 英国领先的管理理论家认为，股东资本主义是为企业所有者同时也是其管理者的时代而设计的。 如今，大多数个人股东是赌徒而不是所有者，他们在公司之间交换，就好像他们是赛马人挑选马匹一样。 鉴于其规模，养老基金的眼光略长，但根据 Handy 的说法，它们的角色更类似于金融家而不是所有者。 在收购的第一时间，他们通常会卖光。 此外，Handy 认为，股东资本主义基本上是一种“机器时代模式”， 专为公司的主要资产是其财产的时代而设计； 既然大多数公司的价值都在于其员工的头脑，“匿名的外人拥有或交易人员的集合”是不合适的。

"It is time we killed a myth," Charles Handy has declared, "the myth that it is the shareholders who run the business, and that it is for them that we all work." 20 Britain's leading management theorist argues that shareholder capitalism was designed for an era when the owners of a business were also its managers. Nowadays, most individual shareholders are punters rather than owners, swapping between companies as if they were racegoers picking horses. By dint of their size, pension funds take a slightly longer-term view, but, according to Handy, their role is more akin to that of financiers rather than owners. At the first whiff of a takeover, they usually sell out. Besides, argues Handy, shareholder capitalism is basically a "machine-age model," designed for the days when the chief asset of a firm was its property; now that the value in most companies resides in the heads of its employees, it is not appropriate "for anonymous outsiders to own or trade collections of people."

在汉迪看来，公司治理本质上是一个政治问题； 因此，应该通过某种权力分立以政治方式解决这一问题，以便行政部分（管理人员）与立法部分（股东）分开，而由会计师和其他观察员组成的“司法机构”制定规则. 公司不应该是正式的公司，而应该是“会员社区”——成员可以是与企业有利益关系的任何人，从员工到客户。 Handy 认为，资金仍应通过股票筹集，股票仍应赋予股东对公司运营方式的一些发言权——但他们不应赋予股东解雇董事会或出售公司的权利，而不是员工的头上。 股东们说，

Corporate governance, in Handy's eyes, is essentially a political problem; it should thus be settled in a political way through some kind of separation of powers, so that the executive part (the managers) is separated from the legislative part (the shareholders), while "a judiciary" of accountants and other observers sets the rules. Rather than being formal corporations, companies should be "membership communities"—the members being anyone, from workers to customers, who have a stake in the enterprise. Money should still be raised through shares, Handy argues, and the shares should still entitle shareholders to some say in the way the company is run—but they should not entitle them to fire its board or sell the company over the heads of its employees. Shareholders with, say, a 1 percent stake in a company would get membership rights.

世界各地有几个强大的公司治理传统，现在几乎所有这些传统都在自己的国家遭到抨击。 为了简单起见，我们集中讨论讨论最多的两种模式：美国体系，类似于英国体系； 德国的情况与日本和欧洲大陆其他国家的情况大体相似。

There are several strong traditions of corporate governance around the world, and almost all of them are now under fire in their own countries. In the interests of simplicity, we concentrate on the two most discussed models: the American system, which is similar to the British one; and the German one, which is broadly similar to that in Japan and others in Continental Europe.

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

在美国制度下，很大一部分权力最终掌握在股东手中。 接管相当普遍，股东也可以通过“代理”决议来纠缠董事，迫使“他们的”经理做这做那。 相比之下，德国模式为利益相关者——尤其是银行和工人——提供了更大的发言权。 德国实行两级董事会制度，其中管理委员会由监事会监督。 根据 1976 年的一项法律，股东代表（几乎总是银行）和工人在监事会中拥有同等权力——但董事长（通常由股东选出）拥有决定性的一票。

Under the American system, a great deal of power ultimately rests with the shareholders. Takeovers are fairly common and shareholders can also pester directors through "proxy" resolutions by which they force "their" managers to do this or that. By contrast, the German model gives a much greater voice to stakeholders—particularly banks and workers. Germany has a two-tier board system in which the managerial board is monitored by a supervisory board. Under a 1976 law, shareholders' representatives (nearly always banks) and workers have equal power on the supervisory board—but the chairman (usually chosen by the shareholders) has the casting vote.

随着时间的推移，这两个系统的变化超出了它们的拥护者愿意承认的范围。 许多华尔街人士会争辩说，美国的利益相关者与股东之间的争论在本世纪初就已经解决，当时道奇兄弟起诉亨利福特从他们都持有股份的汽车公司中扣留过多利润，密歇根州最高法院裁定“商业公司的组织和经营主要是为了股东的利益。” 但很明显，现代美国公司——尤其是多业务联合企业——与 19 世纪最初的股份制公司几乎没有什么相似之处。 公司不再是一个家庭的财产，而是成为很多人的投资。

Over time, both systems have changed more than their adherents like to admit. Many Wall Streeters would argue that the stakeholder-shareholder debate in America was settled earlier this century when the Dodge Brothers sued Henry Ford for keeping back too much profit from the car company in which they all had shareholdings, and the Michigan Supreme Court ruled that "a business corporation is organized and carried on primarily for the profit of the stockholders." But it is clear that the modern American company—particularly the multibusiness conglomerate—barely resembles the original joint-stock companies of the nineteenth century. Rather than being one family's property, a company had become a lot of people's investment.

早在 1950 年代，彼得·德鲁克 (Peter Drucker) 对这个问题的最初解决方案就是争辩说，公司的管理层是受托人，不对任何单一的股东或利益相关者群体负责。 这听起来像是一个舒适的解决方案。 但是，正如德鲁克承认的那样，直到 1980 年代，美国老板们几乎都在做他们想做的事。 在那些年的收购热潮中，股东的权利被猛烈重申，所有者经常在经理们的脚下出售公司。 现在，在美国有很多关于“股东价值最大化”的讨论，但根据德鲁克的说法，这也无济于事，因为它迫使公司在最短期限内进行管理。 “长期结果，”德鲁克认为，“不能通过将短期结果叠加在短期结果上来获得。” 21

Peter Drucker's original solution to this problem, back in the 1950s, was to argue that a company's management was a trustee, accountable to no single group of shareholders or stakeholders. This sounded like a comfortable solution. But, as Drucker admits, American bosses did pretty much what they wanted until the 1980s. In the takeover boom of those years shareholders' rights were fiercely restated, with the owners often selling off the company from under the managers' feet. Now, there is a great deal of talk in America about "maximizing shareholder value," but this will not wash either, according to Drucker, because it forces the company to be managed for the shortest term. "Long-term results," argues Drucker, "cannot be gained by piling short-term results on short-term results." 21

此外，与汉迪一样，德鲁克怀疑这是否是激励知识工作者的明智方式：“工程师不会有动力让投机者致富。” 德鲁克比汉迪更热衷于股东权利，但他仍然认为，某种形式的权力分立对于给经理人管理空间是必要的。 他认为应该有某种正式的

Moreover, like Handy, Drucker has doubts about whether this is a sensible way to inspire knowledge workers: "An engineer will not be motivated to make a speculator rich." Drucker is more enthusiastic about shareholders' rights than Handy, but he still believes that some kind of formal separation of powers is necessary to give managers room to manage. He thinks that there should be some sort of formal

大辩论

THE GREAT DEBATES

“业务审计”，允许长期所有者设定管理人员的公开绩效目标，然后让他们继续执行。

"business audit," which would allow long-term owners to set the managers public performance targets, and then let them get on with it.

德鲁克，尤其是汉迪，一段时间以来一直在表达的那种批评，现在已经成为政治主流。 1995 年，《观察家报》的编辑威尔·赫顿 (Will Hutton) 的《我们所处的国家》(The State We're In) 在英国出人意料地成为畅销书，这场论战将英国假定的社会弊病归咎于股东资本主义，并认为解决方案在于持股。 1996 年初，工党领袖托尼·布莱尔也宣称自己是“利益相关者社会”的信徒——尽管他对这个词的含义含糊不清。 在私人简报会上，他明确表示，他的想法并非受到赫顿的影响，而是受到伦敦商学院的约翰凯的影响，后者是利益相关者价值观的另一位著名倡导者。

The sort of criticisms that Drucker and, particularly, Handy, have been voicing for some time have now reached the political mainstream. In 1995 Will Hutton, the editor of the Observer newspaper, had a surprise best-seller in Britain with The State We're In, a polemic that blamed shareholder capitalism for Britain's presumed social ills and argued that the solution lies in stakeholding. In early 1996 Tony Blair, the leader of the Labour Party, also declared himself a believer in a "stakeholder society"—though he was tantalizingly vague about what the phrase meant. In private briefings, he made it clear that his thinking was influenced not by Hutton but by John Kay of the London Business School, another prominent advocate of stakeholder values.

在 1996 年初的国情咨文中，比尔克林顿要求美国公司将“长期繁荣置于短期利益之上”。 他的劳工部长罗伯特·赖希 (Robert Reich) 是德国等利益相关者协会的长期仰慕者，他在《纽约时报》上发表了一篇文章，指责公司放弃了对社区和员工的责任。 赖希认为，在过去，绅士资本家会注意平衡股东、员工和广大公众的利益； 在“电子资本主义”时代，无拘无束的投资者只是寻求最低的工资和最宽松的监管。 他的解决方案是鼓励企业通过税收处罚来维持工作和社区。

In his State of the Union Address at the start of 1996, Bill Clinton asked American firms to put "long-term prosperity above short-term gain." Robert Reich, his labor secretary and a long-term admirer of stakeholder societies such as Germany, wrote an article in The New York Times accusing companies of abandoning their responsibilities to communities and employees. In the old days, Reich argued, gentlemanly capitalists took care to balance the interests of shareholders, employees, and the public at large; in the age of "electronic capitalism," footloose investors simply look for the lowest wages and the laxest regulations. His solution is to encourage firms to maintain jobs and neighborhoods through tax penalties.

德国问题

The German Question

但是利益相关者的拥护者证明了他们的观点吗？ 到目前为止，英国和美国的利益相关者游说团体更善于指出股东资本主义的不足，而不是提出他们自己的健全的系统。

But have the advocates of stakeholding proved their case? So far the stakeholder lobby in both Britain and America has been much better at pointing to the inadequacies of shareholder capitalism than at coming up with robust sounding systems of their own.

他们的大部分论点都依赖于对德国（或日本）的钦佩之情，并认定他们自战后的出色表现“证明”了利益相关者资本主义的存在。 这不成立。 首先，还有许多其他因素可以解释德国和日本的“成功”，例如它们强大的教育体系和悠久的制造技能。 其次，成功看起来

Much of their argument relies on gazing admiringly at Germany (or Japan) and deciding that their impressive performance since the war "proves" the case for stakeholder capitalism. This does not hold water. First, many other factors explain Germany and Japan's "success," such as the strength of their education systems and their long-established manufacturing skills. And, second, that success looks

董事会风暴

Storm in the Boardroom

现在日本和德国的经济已经跌跌撞撞，这更值得怀疑。

more questionable now that the Japanese and German economies have stumbled.

德国体系的许多特点更多地归因于环境而不是深思熟虑的策略。 很少有德国公司被引用：该国的股票市值不到其国内生产总值 (GDP) 的三分之一。 德国股市的流动性远低于伦敦和纽约的同行，这使得德国投资者很难卖出他们的股票。 还请注意，其中许多投资者是银行。

Many of the peculiarities in the German system owe more to circumstance than to deliberate strategy. Very few German companies are quoted: the country's stock market capitalization amounts to less than a third of its gross domestic product (GDP). The German stock market is much less liquid than its counterparts in London and New York, and this makes it difficult for German investors to trade out of their shares. Note, too, that many of those investors are banks.

这个系统正在发生变化，部分原因是金融放松管制正在创造一个新的、更具批判性的基金经理阶层，但主要是因为它运作不佳。 一个由银行家组成的监事会几乎没有采取什么措施来阻止戴姆勒-奔驰在 1980 年代的悲惨多元化或 Metallgesellschaft 对石油期货的灾难性调情。 银行家和股东有不同的优先事项：股东希望公司赚取尽可能多的利润，而银行家则满足于赚到足够的利润来偿还贷款。 员工的优先事项也与股东不同。 邀请工人进入董事会无疑是德国制造商目前正在与高工资和相对较低的生产率作斗争的原因之一。

This system is changing, partly because financial deregulation is creating a new, more critical class of fund manager, but mostly because it has not worked very well. A supervisory board stuffed with bankers did little to prevent Daimler-Benz's woeful diversification in the 1980s or Metallgesellschaft's disastrous flirtation with oil futures. Bankers and shareholders have different priorities: shareholders want the company to make as big a profit as possible, whereas bankers are content if it makes enough profit to pay off its loans. Employees, too, have different priorities from shareholders.
