这种大胆的企业家精神是华侨资本主义的典型特征。 它的根源在于大约 100 年前从大陆各省（通常是广东、福建或海南等沿海省份）迁移过来的家庭。 与犹太企业家一样，家庭关系因迫害而有所缓和。 距印度尼西亚上一次反华大屠杀仅 30 年； 马来西亚 26 年的新经济政策有利于马来人而不是华人。 “驱使海外华人的不是贪婪，”曾在香港经营李嘉诚帝国的西蒙穆雷说。 “这是恐惧——以及对金钱能给你的保护的渴望。”

Such entrepreneurial chutzpah is typical of overseas-Chinese capitalism. Its roots lie in the families that migrated from various mainland provinces—usually coastal ones such as Guandong, Fujian, or Hainan—about 100 years ago. As with Jewish entrepreneurs, family ties have been tempered by persecution. It is only 30 years since the last anti-Chinese pogrom in Indonesia; Malaysia's 26-year-old New Economic Policy favors ethnic Malays over ethnic Chinese. "It is not greed that drives the overseas Chinese," argues Simon Murray, who used to run Li Ka-shing's empire in Hong Kong. "It is fear—and the yearning for the protection that money will give you."

在这个不安全的世界里，氏族几乎和家庭一样重要。 在大多数情况下，创业资金来自家族成员。 即使在今天，东南亚食品行业的很大一部分仍由讲同一地区方言的中国人控制。 一位广东银行家承认，他仍然必须花两倍的时间与非广东客户通电话，以向他们保证他没有歧视他们。 马来西亚和印度尼西亚两位最富有的人郭鹤年和林小良之间长期存在的非正式联盟，在很大程度上归功于他们都是福建华人，另外两位盟友邱继平（创立马来亚联合工业公司）和Mochtar Riady（印度尼西亚力宝集团的创立者）。

In this insecure world, clans have proved almost as important as families. In most cases the funds to start businesses came from fellow clan members. Even today, a fair chunk of Southeast Asia's food business is controlled by Chinese who speak the same regional dialect. One Cantonese banker confesses that he still has to make a point of spending twice as long on the telephone to non-Cantonese clients to reassure them that he is not discriminating against them. The long-standing informal alliance between the two richest men in Malaysia and Indonesia, Robert Kuok and Liem Sioe Liong, owes much to fact that both are Hokkien Chinese, as are two other allies, Khoo Kay Peng (who founded Malayan United Industries) and Mochtar Riady (who set up Indonesia's Lippo group).

中国经理人喜欢吹嘘说，与墨守成规的西方同行相比，他们的业务建立在谈判关系而非合同的基础上。 华侨企业的主要资产通常是其关系（或联系）。 在许多西方管理理论家都在推崇“隐性知识”、“供应商关系”等重要性的时代，这让海外华人看起来耳目一新。 事实上，许多最重要的关系都是政治关系。 1940 年代后期，Salim Group 的创始人 Liem Sioe Liong 在为他叔叔在中爪哇的花生油生意工作时，与当地一位后来成为总统的军需官建立了友谊：

Chinese managers like to boast that, in contrast to their legalistic Western peers, their businesses are based on negotiating relationships not contracts. The chief assets of an overseas-Chinese business are usually its guanxi (or connections). In a time when many Western management theorists are exalting the importance of "tacit knowledge," "supplier-provider relationships," and the like, this makes the overseas Chinese look refreshingly modern. In fact, many of the most important guanxi are political ones. In the late 1940s Liem Sioe Liong, the founder of the Salim Group, was working for his uncle's peanut-oil business in Central Java when he struck up a friendship with a local army quartermaster who went on to become president:

他们手中的世界

THE WORLD IN THEIR HANDS

拉登·苏哈托。 曼谷人开玩笑说，Sophon-panich家族控制的Charoen Pok-phand集团雇佣了这么多泰国政客，开内阁会议就够了。

Raden Suharto. The people of Bangkok joke that the Charoen Pok-phand group, which is controlled by the Sophon-panich family, has employed so many Thai politicians that it could hold a cabinet meeting.

以“信任”为基础的松散创业网络的想法往往会让哈佛大学的研究人员变得疯狂——通常是为了取笑网络人自己。 （“我想不出哪个组织的内斗比这更普遍了，”一位人脉广泛的中国女商人说。）几乎所有的决定。 这有助于诸如一次握手可以购买建筑物的房地产交易等业务。 它还允许公司快速改变方向。 在香港，制造假发、鲜花和收音机的行业如雨后春笋般涌现，获利，然后消失。

The idea of loose entrepreneurial networks based around "trust" is the sort of thing that tends to make researchers from Harvard go all gooey—often to the amusement of the networkers themselves. ("I can't think of an organization where in-fighting is more rife," says one well-connected Chinese businesswoman.) In truth, most overseas-Chinese firms only work because they are centralized dictatorships: the head of the family makes nearly all the decisions. This helps in businesses such as those dealing in property where one handshake can buy a building. It also allows firms to change direction quickly. In Hong Kong industries making wigs, flowers, and radios have sprung up, profited, and then disappeared.

在中国，如此敏捷的网络建设再次带来了快速的回报。 华侨占中国外商直接投资的一半。 到 1996 年，正大集团（Charoen Pokphand）于 1979 年首次进入中国大陆，从中国获得的收入可能达到 30 亿美元。 它在中国拥有大约 80 家农业综合企业，从种鸡场一直延伸到快餐鸡店，更不用说其他业务，例如啤酒、房地产和摩托车。 当大多数西方汽车行业都在吵着要进入中国时，一家食品公司怎么可能拥有一家摩托车厂？ 和往常一样，答案是通过关系。 Charoen 然后通过与本田结盟来购买所需的技能，就像它在零售业（与荷兰的 Makro）和电信（与美国的 Nynex）方面所做的一样。

In China, such nimble-footed network building has brought quick rewards once again. The overseas Chinese account for half the foreign direct investment in China. By 1996 Charoen Pokphand, which first entered the mainland in 1979, could claim revenues of $3 billion from China. It owned some 80 agribusiness companies in China, stretching all the way from breeder farms to fast-food chicken shops, not to mention other businesses, for example, in beer, property, and motorcycles. How on earth could a food company get hold of a motorcycle plant when most of the Western car industry is clamoring to get into China? The answer, as usual, is through guanxi. Charoen then bought the skills it needed by forming an alliance with Honda, just as it has done in retailing (with Holland's Makro) and telecommunications (with America's Nynex).

不可出口

Unexportable

在小范围内，中国的家族管理与西方所能提供的一样好。 达到一定规模，中国管理层几乎可以应对任何问题，尤其是在其所在的快速增长的市场中。 这些公司的灵活性常常让西方公司相形见绌。 欧洲和美国许多最健康的企业也是小型家族企业，但它们往往只在一个行业和一个国家开展业务。 竹子网络的荣耀在于它遍布各种公司和行业，在机会出现时抓住机会。

On a small scale, Chinese family management is as good as anything the West has to offer. Up to a certain size, Chinese management can cope with virtually any problem, particularly in the fast-growing markets where it is based. The flexibility of such companies often puts Western companies to shame. Many of the healthiest businesses in Europe and America are small family-owned ones too, but they tend to operate in only one industry and only one country. The glory of the bamboo network is that it spreads across a variety of companies and industries, seizing opportunities as they present themselves.

264

264

亚洲新模式？

A New Model in Asia?

但一旦这些公司开始达到与西方跨国公司相同的规模，与外国公司的比较就不那么讨人喜欢了。 与日本人和韩国人不同，海外华人在亚洲之外几乎没有取得成功。 大多数根本没有尝试过。 像李嘉诚这样的人经常遇到麻烦（尽管在 20 世纪 90 年代中期，他终于在英国移动电话网络 Orange 中找到了赢家）。 Insead 的 Henri-Claude de Bettignies 说，他建议亚洲公司首先学习如何进行跨文化管理：“你不能在美国或欧洲成为业余爱好者，”他直截了当地说。

But once the companies begin to reach the same size as Western multinationals, the comparison with foreign companies is less flattering. Unlike the Japanese and the Koreans, the overseas Chinese have had little success outside Asia. Most simply have not tried. Those who have, such as Li Ka-shing, have often run into trouble (although in the mid-1990s he finally found a winner with Orange, a British cellular telephone network). Henri-Claude de Bettignies of Insead says that he advises Asian companies to learn how to manage across cultures first: "You cannot be an amateur in America or Europe," he says flatly.

对于中国资本主义的批评者来说，亚洲以外的失败意味着人们应该以更挑剔的眼光看待国内的成功。 他们的第一个指控是，大多数海外华人的财富并非来自战胜对手，而是来自在任何人都不会输的赌场赌博：亚洲财产。 这种指控在香港尤为明显，例如，国泰航空公司的几名飞行员现在成为千万富翁，仅仅是因为他们在 1970 年代在半山区购买了一套小公寓，而半山区现在是香港最抢手的地区之一。 大多数本地亿万富翁，包括李嘉诚，大部分的钱都是从实体店赚来的。 但在未来，从财产中轻松挑选可能会更难一些。 蓬勃发展的亚洲城市的写字楼现在比西方的写字楼更贵。 还有，香港' 作为进入中国的唯一门户（并且土地供应有限）的独特地位正在下滑。 已经有几家西方公司直接跨入北京或上海，无视在香港设立大本营的既定做法。

For critics of Chinese capitalism, the failures outside Asia mean that people should cast a more critical eye over the successes at home. Their first charge is that most overseas-Chinese fortunes have not come from outmanaging their opponents but from gambling in a casino where nobody could lose: Asian property. This charge rings particularly true in Hong Kong where, for example, several Cathay-Pacific pilots are now multimillionaires simply because they bought a small flat in the Mid-Levels, now one of the most sought-after parts of town, in the 1970s. Most of the local billionaires, including Li Ka-shing, have made most of their money from bricks and mortar. But easy pickings from property may be a little harder to come by in the future. Offices in booming Asian cities are now more expensive than offices in the West. Also, Hong Kong's unique position as the only gateway into China (and one with a limited supply of land) is slipping. Already several Western companies have leapfrogged straight into Beijing or Shanghai, ignoring the established practice of setting up a base camp in Hong Kong.

就其本身而言，关于海外华人只是过度发展的房地产大亨的指控并不完全正确； 尽管房地产通常是他们的主要业务，但他们在其他领域也取得了成功。 其他不那么直率的批评也有人提出。 麦肯锡顾问特雷弗·麦克默雷 (Trevor MacMur-ray) 认为，太多的海外华人企业是“建设者”，而不是“建设者”，这意味着他们追求某种特许经营权（例如，经营菲律宾长途电话系统或澳门渡轮），而不是试图创造具有国际竞争力的产品或服务。 随着许多利润更高的特许经营权因放松管制和竞争而被削弱，这些公司作为建筑商的弱点将暴露出来。

By itself, the charge that the overseas Chinese are just overgrown property magnates is not entirely true; although property is usually their main business, they have also been successful in other fields. Other, less blunt criticisms have also been voiced. Trevor MacMur-ray, a consultant at McKinsey, argues that too many overseas-Chinese businesses are "structurers" as opposed to "builders," meaning that they chase after franchises of one sort or another (e.g., running the Philippines long-distance telephone system or the Macao ferry) rather than trying to create internationally competitive products or services. As many of the more profitable franchises are being worn down by deregulation and competition, the firms' weaknesses as builders will be exposed.

他们手中的世界

THE WORLD IN THEIR HANDS

在大多数海外华人企业中，制造仍然意味着用廉价的手来借来技术。 戈登·雷丁 (Gordon Redding) 认为，问题与组织和想法一样重要。 他认为，一家老式的家族企业天生就没有能力制造出像丰田雷克萨斯这样的东西，因为复杂的汽车制造需要协调、权力下放和信任员工的老板。 “你需要有部门，比如营销、生产和设计，而不是只给老大一个模糊的领域。”

In most overseas-Chinese businesses, manufacturing still means applying cheap hands to borrowed technology. Gordon Redding argues that the problem has as much to do with organization as with ideas. An old-style family company is constitutionally incapable of building something like Toyota's Lexus, he argues, because sophisticated car making requires coordination, decentralization, and bosses who trust their employees. "You need to have departments, such as marketing, production, and design, rather than just vague areas given to Number-one son."

另一个日益增长的弱点是人。 很少有聪明的经理愿意为一个他们永远无法成为董事长，而且职业阶梯往往很模糊的组织工作。 很多时候，尊重权威（和年龄）意味着批评老板是不可接受的。 香港的一项调查发现，中国专业人士更愿意为西方和日本经理（事实上，任何非中国人）工作。 另一项由英国克兰菲尔德管理学院对全球 1,000 名高管进行的调查发现，为香港企业工作的人认为最不符合他们公司的想法。

Another growing weakness is people. Few bright managers want to work for an organization where they can never become the chairman, and where career ladders tend to be vague. Too often, respect for authority (and age) means that criticizing the boss is unacceptable. One survey in Hong Kong found that Chinese professionals preferred to work for Western and Japanese managers (anybody, in fact, who is not Chinese). Another survey, this time of 1,000 executives around the world by Britain's Cranfield School of Management, found that those working for Hong Kong businesses felt most out of line with their companies' thinking.

为什么黎智英只对了一半

Why Jimmy Lai Is Half Right

由于这些问题，一些专家说，海外华人资本主义属于过去而不是未来。 作为证据，他们引用了许多西方公司在亚洲大部分消费品市场取得的进步。 其中一位愤世嫉俗者是香港最著名的出版商黎智英。 他认为“关系已经死了。只要商业意味着只与少数政客或关系达成交易，关系就很重要。在消费市场上，关系毫无意义。你必须制造好的产品或提供好的服务。事实上，关系，特别是腐败的人，很快就会对你不利——即使在中国也是如此。” 他举了一位著名的香港商人的例子，以及他与中国领导人的关系。 赖认为，在邓小平去世后，所有这些联系都将变得微不足道。

Owing to these problems, some experts say, overseas-Chinese capitalism belongs to the past not the future. As evidence they cite the progress made by many Western companies in most of Asia's consumer-goods markets. One of these cynics is Jimmy Lai, Hong Kong's best-known publisher. He argues that "guanxi are dead. They were important as long as business meant striking deals with only a few politicians or relations. They count for nothing in consumer markets. You have to make good products or offer good services. In fact, connections, particularly corrupt ones, will count against you soon—even in China." He gives the example of one well-known Hong Kong businessman and his connections with the Chinese leadership. All those connections, argues Lai, will count for little after Deng Xiaoping dies.

赖先生自己的职业生涯表明他说对了一半。 作为取得巨大成功的佐丹奴（第一家员工故意向顾客说“早安”的亚洲零售连锁店）的创始人，以及作为香港发展最快的出版物之一苹果公司的出版商，黎明是活生生的例子想要是肯定的

Lai's own career shows he is half right. As the founder of the enormously successful Giordano, the first Asian retailing chain where staff deliberately said "Good Morning" to customers, and as the publisher of Apple, one of Hong Kong's fastest-growing publications, Lai is living proof that giving people what they want is a sure

亚洲新模式？

A New Model in Asia?

在现代亚洲赚钱的方式。 然而，黎智英也因在报纸上批评中国政府而被迫出售他在佐丹奴的股份，他需要全天候保护自己免受同样得罪的香港黑社会的侵害。 至于赖所批评的那位知名商人，他在北京的人脉似乎比邓家要深得多。

way to make money in modern Asia. However, Lai has also been forced to sell off his stake in Giordano because he criticized the Chinese government in his newspapers, and he needs round-the-clock protection against Hong Kong triads whom he has also offended. As for the well-known businessman whom Lai criticizes, his contacts in Beijing seem to go considerably deeper than the Deng family.

与其他类型的公司一样，海外华人公司是其环境的产物； 随着环境的变化，他们也会发生变化。 “我们从来没有过大的本土市场，”雷蒙德·钱 (Raymond Ch'ien) 解释说，他承认，他的香港食品公司南顺与许多同行一样，在进入大陆时不得不改变经营方式。 几乎每个大家族集团都在以这样或那样的方式尝试引进西方思想。 问题是他们对改变的承诺有多大。 最常见的反应是让所有孩子都去哈佛和斯坦福。 不幸的是，当这些年轻的 MBA 回国时，他们通常会匆匆离开并进行交易，而不是尝试建立或重组企业。

Overseas-Chinese companies, no less than any other sort, are the product of their environment; and as that environment changes, so do they. "We have never had big home markets," explains Raymond Ch'ien, who admits that Lam Soon, his Hong Kong food company, like many of its peers, had to change the way it did business when it went into the mainland. Virtually every big family group is experimenting in one way or another with importing Western ideas. The question is how committed they are to change. The most common response has been to pack off all the children to Harvard and Stanford. Unfortunately, when these young MBAs return, they usually rush off and do deals rather than try to build or reorganize businesses.

另一个有点恐慌的反应是招聘更多的管理人员，尤其是受过西方培训的管理人员。 事实上，郭鹤年的香格里拉连锁酒店的所有总经理都是西方人（他的几位最亲密的顾问也是如此）。 但这种对管理的热情往往需要有所保留。 通常西方顾问的角色与教父电影中的（非意大利人）“consiglieri”没有什么不同：一个有用的管理员，但当家庭做任何重要事情时第一个被排除在外的人。 外部投资者也被视为二等公民。 尽管上市公司的家族股份很少超过 40%，但他们通常表现得好像拥有全部股份。 董事会会议通常只持续 15 分钟，资产在私营公司和上市公司之间肆无忌惮地洗牌。 随着亚洲公司发行更多资本（1995 年发行了约 360 亿美元的新股），这种情况将逐渐改变，但阻力很大。 透明度与品牌和人力资源部门一样，被视为“非亚洲”。

Another slightly panicky reaction has been to recruit more managers, particularly Western-trained managers. Virtually all the general managers at Robert Kuok's Shangri-La hotel chain are Westerners (as are several of his closest advisers). But this enthusiasm for management often needs to be taken with a pinch of salt. Usually the Western adviser's role is not dissimilar to the (non-Italian) "consiglieri" in the Godfather films: a useful administrator but the first person to be excluded when the family does anything important. Outside investors, too, are treated like second-class citizens. Even though family stakes in public companies are seldom more than 40 percent, they usually act as if they own the whole thing. Board meetings often last only 15 minutes, and assets are brazenly shuffled between private and public companies. This will gradually change as Asian companies issue more capital (some $36 billion of new shares were issued in 1995), but there is considerable resistance. Transparency, like branding and human-resource departments, is regarded as "Un-Asian."

充满西方的希望

Full of Western Promise

认为管理理论在某种程度上“非亚洲”的想法是无稽之谈。 例如，几乎没有任何一家西方航空公司可以向新加坡航空公司传授服务或营销方面的知识，尽管该航空公司拥有

The idea that management theory is somehow "un-Asian" is twaddle. There is little, for instance, that any Western carrier can teach Singapore Airlines about service or marketing, even though the airline has

他们手中的世界

THE WORLD IN THEIR HANDS

具有鲜明的亚洲特色。 但与大多数中国家族企业不同的是，新航拥有营销部门、广告预算和多项复杂的培训计划。 1996 年初，香港最大的银行之一东亚银行的首席执行官李大维警告亚洲商人不要认为亚洲有独特的经商方式。 他指出，孔子（这个名字在任何有关亚洲商业的争论中都经常被迅速提及）实际上根本没有时间花在商人身上。 李认为，奖励员工或建立职业经理人核心不是“西方”； 这只是良好的管理。

a distinctly Asian character. But then Singapore Airlines, unlike most Chinese family companies, has a marketing department, an advertising budget, and several sophisticated training programs. In early 1996 David Li, the chief executive of the Bank of East Asia, one of Hong Kong's biggest banks, warned Asian business people not to assume that there was a uniquely Asian way of doing business. He pointed out that Confucius (a name usually invoked rapidly in any argument about Asian business) actually had no time at all for merchants. Rewarding employees well or building up a core of professional managers, argued Li, is not "Western"; it is simply good management.

这并不意味着可以将西方管理理论随意移植到东方结构中。 例如，在西方，“业务流程再造”已被用来削减成熟行业的松弛。 在与亚洲一样快速增长的市场中，通常需要稍微放松一下。 尽管如此，“更友善”的再造工程似乎在亚洲非常奏效。 Thai Farmers Bank（与 Loxley 一样，由 Lamsam 家族控制）和 East Asia 银行都声称因迎合这种时尚而极大地提高了生产力——尽管两家银行都没有在这个过程中解雇任何人。

That does not mean that Western management theories can be grafted onto Eastern structures at random. In the West, for instance, "business process reengineering" has been used to cut flab in mature industries. In markets growing as quickly as Asia's, a little slack is often necessary. Nevertheless, a "kinder" version of reengineering seems to have worked extremely well in Asia. Both Thai Farmers Bank (which, like Loxley, is controlled by the Lamsam family) and the Bank of East Asia claim enormous increases in productivity from embracing the fad—though neither has sacked anybody in the process.

在专注于核心竞争力方面，类似的渐进方法看起来也很合适。 如前所述，亚洲以外的公司如果在一两个专业领域建立规模和专业知识，就会做得最好。 在亚洲，多元化还没有证明是弱点：毕竟，在泰国这样一个没有任何电信经验的国家，为什么像正大集团这样的鸡肉食品公司不应该拿到牌照呢？ 事实上，家庭分散风险通常是有意义的。 在中国和越南等一些快速发展的国家，这种分散的方法可能仍会产生红利。 不过，总的来说，想要具有国际竞争力的公司将不得不专注于一些核心业务。

A similar gradual approach also looks appropriate when it comes to concentrating on core competencies. As noted earlier, outside Asia companies do best if they build up scale and expertise in one or two specialist areas. Within Asia, diversification has not yet proved a weakness: after all, in a country like Thailand where nobody has any telecommunications experience, why shouldn't a chicken-food company like Charoen Pokphand grab a license? Indeed, it has often made sense for families to diversify their risks. In some fast-developing countries such as China and Vietnam this scattershot approach may still yield dividends. In general, though, companies that want to be internationally competitive will have to focus on a few core businesses.

遗传缺陷

The Hereditary Defect

即使是那些永远不想离开亚洲的中国企业家也需要重组他们的管理层，还有一个令人信服的原因：继任。 目前，由于无法将所有权与管理权分开，所有的中国公司都在代代相传时摇摆不定。 在一些

There is one final compelling reason why even those Chinese entrepreneurs who never want to leave Asia need to reorganize their management: succession. At present, because they are unable to separate ownership from management, all Chinese companies wobble when command passes from one generation to another. In some

亚洲新模式？

A New Model in Asia?

在某些情况下，帝国实际上已经分裂：香港亿万富翁包玉刚爵士将他的帝国分裂，由他的四个女婿管理。 在其他情况下，战斗已经爆发。 1992 年，Soeryad-jaya 家族失去了对印度尼西亚第二大公司 Astra 的控制权，因为其中一个儿子经营的 Bank Summa 遭受了巨大损失。 直到 1995 年，Winston Wang 看起来肯定会继承台湾最大的工业公司台塑。 然后，在传出婚外情后，他似乎与父亲王永庆闹翻了。

cases, empires have actually been split up: Sir Y. K. Pao, a Hong Kong billionaire, divided his empire so that it could be run by his four sons-in-law. In other cases, fights have broken out. In 1992 the Soeryad-jaya family lost control of Astra, Indonesia's second biggest firm, because of enormous losses at Bank Summa, which had been run by one of the sons. Until 1995, Winston Wang looked certain to inherit Formosa Plastics, Taiwan's biggest industrial company; then, following reports of an extramarital affair, he appeared to have fallen out with his father, Wang Yung-ching.

一句中国古话说，富贵不过三代。 但继任对于各地的家族企业来说都是一个问题。 不同之处在于，在亚洲以外，成功的家族企业——玛氏、福特、塞恩斯伯里等——已经转变为王朝式公司，家族和公司之间有明确的分工，因此子女的能力较少一个问题。 韩国的财阀才刚刚开始着手解决这个问题。 1996 年 1 月，现代汽车打破传统，宣布计划引入外部董事； 它还试图在公司内部提拔非家族成员。

One old Chinese proverb says that wealth never survives the third generation. But succession is a problem for family businesses everywhere. The difference is that, outside Asia, successful family businesses—Mars, Ford, Sainsbury, and so on—have turned into dynastic corporations, where there are clear divisions between the family and the firm, so that the competence of the children is less of an issue. Korea's chaebol have just begun to grapple with this problem. In January 1996 Hyundai broke with tradition by announcing plans to bring in outside directors; it is also trying to promote nonfamily members inside the company.

必须服从的施

Shih Who Must Be Obeyed

海外华人管理的诱惑就是不要管它，因为海外华人已经想出了一种极其复杂的经营小公司的方法，但他们永远不会像说的那样成长为世界级的大公司，本田和丰田都有。 那有什么坏处呢？ 华侨管理的真正优势在于能够不断建立这些快速发展的小公司网络和应对不确定性的能力。 如果乏味的旧帝国不会受到太多阻碍，这看起来像是繁荣的良方。 只要有中国商人相信朝鲜的一小块被遗弃的地方可以成为“北方的新加坡”，中国资本主义就不需要管理理论。

The temptation with overseas-Chinese management is simply to leave it alone, on the grounds that the overseas Chinese have come up with an extremely sophisticated way of running small companies, but that they will never mature into large worldbeaters in the same way that, say, Honda and Toyota have. And where is the harm in that? The real strength of overseas-Chinese management lies in its ability to keep on building these networks of fast-moving small companies and their capacity to cope with uncertainty. Providing the stodgy old empires do not get too much in the way, this looks like a recipe for prosperity. As long as there are Chinese business people who believe a small godforsaken piece of North Korea can become "the Singapore of the North," Chinese capitalism does not need management theory.

然而，一些中国公司已经开始将西方理念与亚洲理念相结合，创造出令人兴奋的新事物。 考虑两个相当肮脏的办公室，一个在台北，世界上最丑陋的城市之一；另一个在台北。 另一个在九龙，过度拥挤的手指

However, a few Chinese companies have begun to mix Western ideas with Asian ones to create something new and exciting. Consider two fairly dingy offices, one in Taipei, one of the world's most hideous cities; the other in Kowloon, the overcrowded finger of land

他们手中的世界

THE WORLD IN THEIR HANDS

居住在港岛的人仍然认为海港是错误的一面。

still considered the wrong side of the harbor by those who live in Hong Kong Island.

第一个办公室属于施斯坦。 就连他的朋友也不会形容 Shih 是一个衣着时髦的人，他的办公室感觉就像 20 世纪 70 年代的假日酒店套房。 尽管如此，施是世界上最有趣的公司之一背后的大脑。 与许多台湾科技公司一样，宏基集团于 1980 年代首次以设备制造商的身份出现，为知名度更高的西方和日本公司生产电脑零件。 到 1996 年，它仍在为 Hitachi 生产计算机，并为许多其他大型科技公司生产组件。 但宏基也凭借自身实力成为第七大个人电脑制造商，并计划进军消费电子市场。 Shih 自信地预测 Acer 的收入——仅在 1995 年就增长了四分之三，达到 5 美元。

The first office belongs to Stan Shih. Not even his friends would describe Shih as a snappy dresser, and his office feels like a 1970s Holiday Inn suite. Nevertheless, Shih is the brains behind one of the world's most interesting companies. Like many Taiwanese technology companies, the Acer group first appeared in the 1980s as an equipment manufacturer, making computer parts for better-known Western and Japanese companies. By 1996 it was still making computers for Hitachi and components for a host of other big technology companies. But Acer had also become the seventh biggest personal computer maker in its own right and was planning an assault on the consumer-electronics market as well. Shih was confidently predicting that Acer's revenues—which in 1995 alone rose by three-quarters, to $5.7 billion—would reach $15 billion by the end of the decade.

参观位于台湾科技展示中心新竹科学园区的宏碁总厂，乍一看似乎证实了每个西方人的偏见，即像施先生这样的人通过将廉价的亚洲人手与西方技术结合起来而取得成功。 左边坐着数百名进口的年轻菲律宾人正在组装 Apple Powerbook； 在右边，一个机器人在运输集成电路并播放嘈杂的电子版“Camptown Races”。 这种偏见有一点道理，但不多。 正如菲律宾人所证明的那样，施和其他人一样缺乏廉价劳动力。 此外，宏碁的真正意义在于，它不仅仅是一家零部件供应商； 其制造组织也是世界一流的。 正如 Redding 承认的那样，Acer 显然已经通过了 Gordon Redding 的 Lexus 测试。

A visit to Acer's main factory in the Hsinchu Science Park, Taiwan's technology showcase, seems at first to confirm every Westerner's prejudice that people like Shih get ahead by uniting cheap Asian hands with Western technology. To the left sit hundreds of imported young Filipinas assembling Apple Powerbooks; to the right a robot transports integrated circuits and plays a noisy electronic version of "Camptown Races." There is a little truth in this prejudice, but not much. As the Filipinas prove, Shih is just as short of cheap labor as anybody else. Besides, the real point about Acer is that it is not just a component supplier; its manufacturing organization is also world class. Acer has clearly passed Gordon Redding's Lexus test— as Redding admits.

换句话说，施的成就与管理和组织的关系与技术的关系一样大。 施的哲学受到两种经历的影响。 1970 年代，他在一家老式家族所有的科技公司工作，但公司倒闭的部分原因是很难批评家族做出的任何决定，即使这些决定明显错误； 部分原因是公司的利润被抽走到家族的私人公司中。 Shih 的妻子一直在 Acer 帮助他，但他拒绝让他的孩子加入他的行列。 第二次经历是 1980 年代后期宏碁的一场危机，当时总部迫使不同的业务部门遵循一个核心战略：

Shih's achievement, in other words, has as much to do with management and organization as it does with technology. Shih's philosophy has been colored by two experiences. In the 1970s he worked for a technology company owned by an old-style family, but the business collapsed in part because it was extremely difficult to criticize any decisions made by the family even when they were obviously wrong; and in part because the company's profits were siphoned off into the family's private companies. Shih's wife has always helped him at Acer, but he refuses to let his children join him there. The second experience was a crisis at Acer in the late 1980s caused by the head office forcing different businesses to follow one central strategy of

亚洲新模式？

A New Model in Asia?

扩张。 当时提出辞职的施先生此后一直试图以一种很少有中国家庭（或美国首席执行官）会支持的方式下放权力。

expansion. Shih, who tendered his resignation at the time, has since tried to decentralize power in a way that few Chinese families (or American chief executives) would countenance.

宏碁被分成不同公司的网络，所有公司都有自己的老板、人事制度和薪资结构。 （到 1996 年只有两家上市；施计划到 2000 年再上市 19 家。）当货物从一个部门转移到另一个部门时，它们以市场价格进行，没有任何部门有义务使用对方的服务。 Shih 自己的职责是组织拥有 80 名员工的总部：其收入来自股息，以及向其他集团收取法律和会计服务费用。 史坚称，如果有任何部门离开该组织，他不会反对。 他唯一的规定是离职的公司不能使用 Acer 名称。

Acer is split up into a network of different companies, all with their own bosses, personnel systems, and salary structures. (By 1996 only two had stock market listings; Shih plans to list 19 more by 2000.) When goods pass from one division to another, they do so at market prices, and no division is under any obligation to use the other's services. Shih's own role is to organize the headquarters, which employs 80 people: its revenues come from dividends, and from charging the other groups for its legal and accounting services. Shih insists that he would not object if any division left the group. His only stipulation would be that the departing company could not carry the Acer name.

换句话说，施将中国家族企业的所有最佳特征——速度、企业家精神、网络——制度化为精英制度。 通过这样做，他创建了一个即使总部设在圣何塞而不是台北也看起来很新鲜的组织。 事实上，施的小型独立企业联合会可能是一些西方公司正在经历的问题的答案。 例如，IBM 的业务可能永远不会发展出自己的个性，只要它们仍然是部门。 但如果蓝色巨人像宏碁那样被拆分，一些隐藏的人才可能会浮出水面。

In other words, Shih has taken all the best features of the Chinese family business—speed, entrepreneurialism, networking—and institutionalized them into a meritocratic system. In so doing, he has created an organization that would seem fresh even if it was based in San Jose instead of Taipei. Indeed, Shih's federation of small independent firms could be the answer to the problems some Western companies are experiencing. IBM's businesses, for instance, will probably never develop personalities of their own as long as they remain divisions. But if Big Blue was divided up in the same way that Acer has been, some of that hidden talent might emerge.

有趣的是，其他具有创业精神的亚洲科技公司似乎也在采取与宏碁相同的策略。 遍布新竹园区和班加罗尔（印度的“硅高原”）等地的小型专业出口商网络往往对西方和亚洲的管理风格采取同样的挑选和匹配态度，这可能是因为他们的大多数创始人都曾为西方公司工作过. 另一家新竹园区公司微电子科技有限公司是卫星通信的先驱，由从惠普公司流亡的 Patrick Wang 创立； 全球最大的芯片代工厂台积电创始人张忠谋在德州仪器工作了25年。 台积电聘请了50名在美国拥有10年以上工作经验的工程师。 它的 26 位经理曾上过商学院（其中 10 位在美国）。 “这就像在一家美国公司工作，”台积电总裁唐纳德·布鲁克斯 (Donald Brooks) 说。

Interestingly, other entrepreneurial Asian technology companies seem to be taking the same tack as Acer. The networks of small specialist exporters that populate places like Hsinchu park and Bangalore (India's "Silicon plateau") tend to have the same pick-and-match attitude to Western and Asian management styles, probably because most of their founders once worked for Western companies. Another Hsinchu-park company, Microelectronics Technology Inc., a pioneer in satellite communication, was founded by Patrick Wang, an exile from Hewlett-Packard; Morris Chang, the founder of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corporation (TSMC), the world's biggest chip foundry, worked at Texas Instruments for 25 years. TSMC employs 50 engineers who have had more than 10 years' experience in the United States. Twenty-six of its managers have been to business school (10 of them in America). "It's like working for an American company," says Donald Brooks, TSMC's president.

世界在他们手中 Kowloon Rising

THE WORLD IN THEIR HANDS Kowloon Rising

这一切似乎都表明，如果你想在像高科技行业这样全球化的行业中生存，就必须接受一些西方的管理思想。 然而，我们在九龙的第二个昏暗的办公室表明，西方的管理理念也可以应用于中国最古老的家族企业——贸易公司。 结果再次是混合体。

All this seems to indicate that if you want to survive in a business as global as the high-technology industry, you have to embrace some Western management ideas. However, our second dingy office from Kowloon shows that Western management ideas can also be applied to that oldest of Chinese family businesses, the trading house. Once again the result is a hybrid.

本案中的办公室属于冯绍峰——公平地说，它比施的办公室稍微聪明一点。 最引以为豪的是冯在哈佛商学院上课的照片——他的兄弟维克多也曾就读于该机构。 70年代，他们离开学校后不久，当时他们都在美国工作，冯氏兄弟被担心父亲健康的母亲召回香港。 以最好的中国风，兄弟俩受命接管利丰公司，这是一家由他们的祖父冯伯流于 1906 年在广州创立的贸易公司。 贸易公司充当进口商和出口商的中间人，一路走来。

The office in this case belongs to William Fung—and to be fair, it is slightly smarter than Shih's. Pride of place is given to a picture of Fung's class at Harvard Business School—an institution his brother, Victor, also attended. It was shortly after they left the school in the 1970s, when they were both working in America, that the Fung brothers were summoned back to Hong Kong by their mother, who was worried about their father's health. In the best Chinese style, the brothers were ordered to take over the management of Li & Fung, a trading house founded in Canton in 1906 by their grandfather, Fung Pak-liu. Trading houses act as middlemen for importers and exporters, taking a cut along the way.

两兄弟首先审视他们的家族企业，就好像这是一个商学院的案例研究。 他们的前两个决定，他们的父亲都同意了，这两个决定是公司应该放弃雇用他们所有的表亲； 并且它应该在股票市场上市，与其说是为了筹集现金，不如说是为了引入外部顾问，并给堂兄弟们一个出售的机会。 这个想法是让业务尽可能透明。 冯氏兄弟还考虑引入另一种西方习俗——裁员以削减成本。 这一次，他们的父亲阻止了他们，并劝说他们说，这会让招聘其他员工变得困难。

The two brothers began by examining their family business as if it were a business school case study. Their first two decisions, both of which their father acceded to, were that the company should give up employing all their cousins; and that it should float on the stock market, not so much to raise cash as to bring in outside advisers and to give the cousins a chance to sell out. The idea was to make the business as transparent as possible. The Fung brothers also toyed with the idea of introducing another Western custom—sacking people to cut costs. This time, their father stopped them, persuading them that this would make recruiting other staff difficult.

利丰将交易员的角色重新定义为“网络经理”。 它专门从事劳动密集型行业，如玩具、鞋类和手袋。 在所有这些企业中，生产的组装部分往往会转移到人工成本最低的地方：过去在马来西亚缝制的包现在在中国制造，并可能有一天会转移到印度。 Fung 企业的另一个特点是许多组件在亚洲不同地区制造。 给威廉·冯 (William Fung) 看你的公文包，他会说皮革可能是在韩国鞣制的，金属饰钉（你以前从未注意到）来自日本，等等。 利丰自己什么都不做；

Li & Fung has redefined the role of a trader as "a network manager." It specializes in labor-intensive industries, such as toys, shoes, and handbags. In all these businesses the assembly part of production tends to move to wherever hands are cheapest: bags that used to be sewn together in Malaysia are now made in China and may one day move to India. The other characteristic of the Fung businesses is that many of the components are made in different parts of Asia. Show William Fung your briefcase, and he will say that the leather was probably tanned in Korea, the metal studs (that you had never noticed before) came from Japan, and so on. Li & Fung makes nothing itself;

亚洲新模式？

A New Model in Asia?

相反，正如 Fung 所说，它的核心竞争力是充当“价值链协调员”，将不同的部门联系在一起，设计产品，寻找客户，有时还为企业融资。

instead its core competence, as Fung puts it, is to act as a "value-chain coordinator," linking the different arms together, designing products, finding customers, and sometimes financing business ventures.

1995 年，利丰以 4.75 亿港元的价格收购了老牌英国公司 Inch-cape 的香港贸易部门——这笔交易使利丰的销售额翻了一番，达到 120 亿港元。 冯氏兄弟用绩效工资结构怂恿他们的经理； 鼓励员工批评他们的经理。 尽管如此，对于办公室墙上所有美国商学院的照片，利丰仍然是一家中国公司。 它靠做交易生存； 即使它不再作为家庭就业中心运营，它仍然由两个家庭成员经营，他们的话最终就是法律。

In 1995 Li & Fung bought the Hong Kong trading arm of Inch-cape, an old British company, for HK$475 million—a deal that doubled Li & Fung's sales to HK$12 billion. The Fung brothers egg on their managers with performance-pay structures; and staff are encouraged to criticize their managers. Nevertheless, for all the American business school pictures on the office walls, Li & Fung is still identifiably a Chinese company. It survives by doing deals; and even if it is no longer run as a family employment center, it is still run by two family members, whose word, in the end, is law.

造币到你附近的小镇

Coining to a Town near You

如果不出意外，我们对发展中亚洲管理的快速考察表明，管理理论仍然是一门活的科学：在西方许多事物具有似曾相识感的时代，发展中的亚洲发现了新问题，也许看到了新的曙光答案。 在接下来的十年里，西方管理学读者将会听到更多关于利丰和宏基等公司以及一般海外华人公司的信息。 海外华人面临的基本斗争——如何在组织和创业精神之间取得平衡——与大多数西方（和日本）大公司面临的问题完全相同，但有趣的区别在于，西方大公司正试图嫁接创业技能在组织方面，大多数发展中的亚洲公司正在做相反的事情。 正如本章所阐明的， 总的来说，海外华人要学的比他们要教的要多。 然而，也有一种强烈的“回到未来”的感觉。 当汤姆彼得斯命令疲惫的美国经理们摧毁眼前的每一个结构时，他设想的那种虚拟公司与那些在亚洲展示的公司并不相去甚远。

If nothing else, our quick look at management in developing Asia shows that management theory remains a living science: at a time when many things in the West have a sense of deja vu, developing Asia has uncovered new questions and seen perhaps the glimmer of new answers. Over the next decade, Western management readers will hear much more about companies such as Li & Fung and Acer, and about overseas-Chinese companies in general. The basic struggle that the overseas Chinese face—how to achieve a balance between organization and entrepreneurialism—is exactly the same one that most big Western (and Japanese) companies face, the intriguing difference is that whereas big Western firms are trying to graft entrepreneurial skills onto organizational ones, most developing Asian companies are doing the reverse. As this chapter has made clear, on balance the overseas Chinese have more to learn than they have to teach. Yet there is also a strong feeling of "Back to the Future." When Tom Peters orders tired American managers to obliterate every structure in sight, the sort of virtual company he envisages is not that far from those on display in Asia.

华侨模式有多重要？ 很难想象它会像精益生产和质量等“日本”理念那样席卷西方。 在不久的将来，随着亚洲经济略有放缓以及更多西方公司开始参与竞争，即使是在本土市场，海外的中国公司也将不得不做出改变。 研究与开发，

How important is the overseas-Chinese model? It is hard to imagine it sweeping across the West in the same way that "Japanese" ideas such as lean production and quality did. In the immediate future, even in their home markets overseas-Chinese companies will have to change as Asia's economy slows down a little and more Western companies begin to compete. Research and development,

他们手中的世界

THE WORLD IN THEIR HANDS

营销、品牌、指挥结构——换句话说，大多数人称之为管理的那些东西——都将变得更加重要。 另一方面，那里显然有东西。 海外华人企业不能仅仅被视为辛勤工作和人脉的偶然结合。 即使所谓的华侨模式最终被纳入所谓的西方模式，它仍然会带来一些东西。 正在出现的新混合体，如宏基和利丰，是两种传统的真正混合体。

marketing, branding, command structures—in other words, the sorts of things that most people refer to as management—will all become more important. On the other hand, there is plainly something there. Overseas-Chinese business cannot just be written off as a fortuitous mixture of hard work and connections. Even if what might be called the overseas-Chinese model ends up being subsumed into what might be called the Western one, it will still bring something with it. The new hybrids that are emerging, such as Acer and Li & Fung, are genuine mixtures of two traditions.

所有这一切都让“邓”，这位我们在本章开始时在中欧雄心勃勃的年轻学生，处于极其有利的位置。 如果北京的政客不干涉，他应该拥有世界上最好的东西：企业家的天性、建立关系的诀窍（记住那块金表）和对管理思想的掌握。 访问任何一家大型中国家族企业，您都会看到需要管理的组织。 这并不意味着邓小平需要重新设计他们中的所有人。 但毫无疑问，他们还有重组制造和建立组织结构的空间，让工人有更清晰的职业生涯。 在香港、上海或曼谷，“人力资源部”这个词听起来不再像对英语的可怕冒犯； 他们听起来像是进步。 邓将紧随其后。

All this leaves "Deng," the young ambitious student at CEIBS with whom we began this chapter, supremely well placed. Providing that Beijing's politicians do not interfere, he should have the best of all worlds: an entrepreneurial nature, a knack for making contacts (remember that gold watch), and a grasp of management ideas. Visit any big Chinese family company and you see organizations in need of management. That does not mean that Deng needs to reengineer the whole lot of them. But there is undoubtedly room to reorganize their manufacturing and to set up organizational structures that allow workers a clearer career. In Hong Kong, Shanghai, or Bangkok the words "Human Resources Department" no longer sound like a terrible offense to the English language; they sound like progress. Deng will follow in their wake.

第五部分

PART FIVE

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

第 13 章

CHAPTER 13

#^»

#^»

“当然，现在你必须成为一个高质量的组织——但这还不够。我们正在重新设计所有关键流程，并赋予一线人员权力，以便我们能够为客户服务。” 任何与 1994 年至 1996 年初纽约警察局 (NYPD) 局长威廉·布拉顿 (William Bratton) 坐下来共进午餐、希望讨论黑手党或海洛因走私真相的记者都会大失所望。 布拉顿在纽约警察局的任期既是对管理不善的打击，也是对犯罪的打击。 布拉顿可能是第一个明确将减少犯罪等同于利润、将城市人口等同于顾客的专员。 “我们已经从哈佛那里得到了一些关于案例研究的兴趣，”他曾热情地说。 在另一场会议上，他描述了通用电气的杰克韦尔奇和强生公司的拉尔夫拉森等高管前来与布拉顿的高管讨论管理问题的早餐会。 1个

"Of course you have to be a quality organization nowadays—but that's not enough. We are reengineering all the key processes and empowering the front-line people so that we can perform for our customers." Any journalist sitting down to lunch with William Bratton, the commissioner of the New York Police Department (NYPD) from 1994 to early 1996, who expected to discuss the truth about the Mafia or heroin smuggling was in for a disappointment. Bratton's tenure at the NYPD was as much a crusade against mismanagement as against crime. Bratton was probably the first commissioner ever to explicitly equate reduced crime with profits and the population of the city with customers. "We've already had some interest from Harvard about a case study," he said enthusiastically at one point; at another he described the executive breakfasts where the likes of Jack Welch of General Electric and Ralph Larsen of Johnson & Johnson came to discuss management with Bratton's officers. 1

布拉顿对管理理论的嗜好可以追溯到他之前在波士顿担任警察局长时，他经常去哈佛商学院听课。 当他于 1994 年 1 月接管纽约警察局的工作时，他大惊小怪地引进了大多数公司早已认为理所当然的基本办公计算机技术。 然而，他最大的改变与组织和问责制有关。

Bratton's penchant for management theory dates back to his previous position as police commissioner in Boston, where he used to pop in for lectures at the Harvard Business School. When he took over the NYPD job in January 1994, he made a great fuss about introducing the sort of basic office computer technology that most companies would have long since taken for granted. However, his biggest changes had to do with organization and accountability.

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

布拉顿将权力下放给他的 86 名分局指挥官，并设定了苛刻的绩效目标。 这本身就够不寻常的了。 但让此举特别值得注意的是他设定的绩效目标，这些目标都是围绕预防犯罪而不仅仅是对犯罪作出反应。 布拉顿明确表示，他对紧急呼叫的“响应时间”不太感兴趣，而不是首先拨打该呼叫的原因。 他寻求的“利润”是所有纽约人的总体福祉，他不仅根据犯罪率，还根据在该市设立的企业数量等指标来衡量。

Bratton devolved power to his 86 precinct commanders and set demanding performance targets. This was unusual enough in itself; but what made the move particularly noteworthy was the sort of performance targets he set, which all revolved around preventing crime rather than just reacting to it. Bratton made it clear that he was less interested in the "response time" to an emergency call than why the call had been made in the first place. The "profits" he sought were the general well-being of all New Yorkers, which he measured not just in terms of the crime rate but also in terms of things like the number of businesses setting up in the city.

每周，布拉顿都会召集他的高级官员参加清晨会议，并检查他的所有新计算机为每个辖区生成的统计数据。 在 1995 年的一次这样的会议上，迈克尔·加布里埃尔上尉受到了严密的审问，因为他所在的布鲁克林辖区的谋杀案上升了 62%，而该市其他地区的谋杀案则下降了 32%。 谋杀案的中心是一条街道，街道上有 44 家商店是毒品交易的前线。 加布里埃尔只设法关闭了 9。他被告知要施加更大的压力以确保获得法院命令。 2个

Every week, Bratton hauled in his top officers to an early morning meeting and examined the statistics that all his new computers were generating for each precinct. At one such meeting in 1995, Captain Michael Gabriel was questioned closely because murders in his Brooklyn precinct were up 62 percent when those in rest of the city was down 32 percent. The center of the murders was a single street in which 44 shops were fronts for drug dealing. Gabriel had only managed to close down 9. He was told to put more pressure on securing court orders. 2

在布拉顿执政的两年里，犯罪率急剧下降。 1995 年，被谋杀的纽约人比 1990 年减少了大约 1,000 人。布拉顿打击犯罪的努力引起了远在沙特阿拉伯和南非等国家/地区的政府官员的兴趣。 然而，许多纽约人认为，其他变化——比如 7,000 名新警察——一定也产生了影响。 他们还指出，布拉顿的再造计划在减少其部队内部的腐败方面收效甚微。 狡辩，也许。 真正暴露布拉顿言辞与现实之间差距的是与其他将管理理论付诸实践的尝试的比较。 按照大多数企业再造活动的标准，纽约警察局的经历非常温和，几乎不符合这个名称。 布拉顿没有改变选区的数量； 他也没有将纽约警察局的许多部分外包出去。 尽管布拉顿解雇了一些表现不佳的人，但他并没有用绩效工资来激励优秀的人。

In Bratton's two years in command, crime fell sharply. In 1995 some 1,000 fewer New Yorkers were murdered than in 1990. Bratton's crime-busting efforts attracted the interest of government officials from countries as far afield as Saudi Arabia and South Africa. Yet many New Yorkers argue that other changes—such as the 7,000 new cops on the force—must have had an effect too. They also point out that Bratton's reengineering exercise had much less success in reducing corruption within his force. Quibbles, perhaps. What really exposes the gap between Bratton's rhetoric and reality is a comparison with other attempts to put management theory into practice. By the standards of most corporate reengineering exercises, the NYPD's experience was so mild that it barely qualifies for the name. Bratton did not change the number of precincts; nor did he contract out many parts of the NYPD. Although Bratton sacked a few poor performers, he did not motivate the good ones with performance pay.

这与其说是对布拉顿的批评，不如说是对私营部门和公共部门之间差异的证明。 布拉顿的“失败”通常源于错综复杂的法律或城市政治。 例如，他不能聘请廉价的外部人员来做纽约警察局的文书工作，部分原因是

This is not so much a criticism of Bratton as a demonstration of the difference between the private sector and the public sector. Bratton's "failures" are the kind that usually stem from the intricacies of either the law or city politics. For instance, he could not bring in cheap outsiders to do the NYPD's paper work partly because there

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

对警察必须执行的工作有严格的规定。 布拉顿的真正客户也是纽约市长鲁迪·朱利安尼（人们普遍认为他在 1996 年迫使布拉顿下台），他不想冒犯该市强大的警察工会。 换句话说，对于布拉顿关于“利润”和“客户”的所有大胆讨论，管理理论就像裤子适合黑猩猩一样适合警察部门——几乎，但不完全是。

are strict rules about what work has to be carried out by police officers. Bratton's real customer was also Rudy Giuliani, the mayor of New York (who is widely believed to have forced Bratton from office in 1996), who has no wish to offend the city's powerful police unions. In other words, for all Bratton's bold talk about "profits" and "customers," management theory fit the police department like trousers fit a chimpanzee—almost, but not quite.

士兵的祈祷

A Soldier's Prayer

布拉顿并不是过去几年唯一爱上管理理论的公务员。 共和党在 1994 年 11 月的选举中获胜后，成为美国众议院议长后，纽特·金里奇 (Newt Gingrich) 向他的部下提供了一份阅读清单。 除了常见的嫌疑人，例如托克维尔的《美国的民主》，该名单还包括彼得·德鲁克、阿尔文和海蒂·托夫勒。 克林顿总统也不甘示弱，他和两位励志大师安东尼·罗宾斯 (Anthony Robbins) 和斯蒂芬·柯维 (Stephen Covey) 一起躲在戴维营度过了假期。 戈尔几乎张口不谈要重塑政府的某些部分。 从瑞典到新加坡，这种热情在世界范围内得到了复制，并得到了社会主义者和保守派的拥护。 1995 年 10 月，托尼·布莱尔，

Bratton is not the only public servant to have fallen in love with management theory in the past few years. On becoming Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives, following the Republicans' triumph in the November 1994 elections, Newt Gingrich supplied his troops with a reading list. As well as the usual suspects, such as Tocqueville's Democracy in America, the list included Peter Drucker and Alvin and Heidi Toffler. Not to be outdone, President Clinton spent his holiday holed up in Camp David with two motivational gurus, Anthony Robbins and Stephen Covey. Al Gore can barely open his mouth without talking about reinventing some part of government. This enthusiasm has been copied around the world, from Sweden to Singapore, and it has been embraced by socialists as well as conservatives. In October 1995 Tony Blair, the leader of Britain's Labour Party, sent his entire shadow cabinet to Templeton College, Oxford, to spend a weekend learning about management theory.

事实上，如今走在任何一条权力走廊上都很难不听到一种新的、可怕的语言——“按目标管理”、“外包非核心职能”、“协商绩效指标”等等。 甚至将军和海军上将也在“缩减人力资源”并“以竞争对手为基准”。 “当然，这个基准测试只是一个粗略的指南，”一位五角大楼官员承认。 “最终的基准测试是战争。”

Indeed, it is hard to walk down any corridor of power nowadays without hearing a new and hideous language—"managing by objectives," "outsourcing noncore functions," "negotiating performance measures," and the rest of it. Even generals and admirals are "downsizing their human resources" and "benchmarking their competitors." "Of course this benchmarking is only a rough guide," admits one Pentagon bureaucrat. "The ultimate benchmarking exercise is war."

半个世纪以来，彼得·德鲁克一直在争论，最需要管理理论的地方是公共部门。 在大多数情况下——纽约警察局就是一个很好的例子——甚至愤世嫉俗者也不得不承认管理理论几乎没有让公共部门变得更糟。 然而，对包括德鲁克在内的许多人来说，公共部门的管理理论令人失望。 许多最容易取得的胜利都来自公共部门的私有化部分

Peter Drucker has been arguing for half a century that the place where management theory is most needed is in the public sector. In most cases—the NYPD is a good example—even cynics have to admit that management theory has hardly made the public sector worse. Yet to many people—Drucker included—management theory in the public sector has proved a disappointment. Many of its easiest victories have come from privatizing parts of the public sector that

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

一开始就不应该公开。 当管理理论应用于必须保留在公共部门范围内的领域时——尤其是健康和教育——其结果往往是参差不齐的。 公共部门的特殊情况只会加剧私营部门管理理论的矛盾； 很少有好的、新的公共部门管理理论。 胜利已经赢得，但往往代价惨重。

should never have been public in the first place. When management theory has been applied to areas that have to remain within the public sector—notably health and education—its results have often been patchy. The peculiar circumstances of the public sector have only exaggerated the contradictions within private sector management theory; and there has been precious little good, new public sector management theory. Victories have been won, but they have often been a Pyrrhic one.

他们如何相识

How They Met

在美国，对管理理论的热爱始于基层官僚，他们对公共部门的拖沓行为越来越感到沮丧。 80 年代初，鲍勃·斯通 (Bob Stone) 是国防部负责设施建设的副助理部长，他对官僚法规给他的部队带来糟糕服务的方式感到愤怒。 对于斯通来说，汤姆·彼得斯和罗伯特·沃特曼合着的《追求卓越》(In Search of Excellence，1982 年)是一个启示。 斯通使用他仍然描述为“圣经”的书，试图摆脱所有阻止他与客户保持亲密关系的规则。 他将权力交给一线管理人员，将厚厚的五角大楼手册浓缩成一页页的任务说明，并将一个前哨基地变成一个“不受监管”的设施， 以他在追求卓越中读到的一家商店为蓝本。 他还邀请彼得斯给高级官员讲课。

In the United States the love affair with management theory started with lower-level bureaucrats who were increasingly frustrated by the foot-dragging of the public sector. In the early 1980s, Bob Stone was deputy assistant secretary for installations at the Department of Defense, and he was furious with the way that bureaucratic regulations were producing lousy services for his troops. For Stone, In Search of Excellence (1982) by Tom Peters and Robert Waterman was a revelation. Using the book that he still describes "as a bible," Stone tried to get rid of all the rules that kept him from staying close to his customer. He handed power to front-line managers, condensed thick Pentagon manuals into page-long mission statements and turned one outpost into a "regulation-free" installation, modelled on a store he had read about in In Search of Excellence. He also invited Peters to give lectures to the top brass.

大约在 Stone 发现卓越的同时，全面质量管理（这可能意味着从将工人重新组织到团队到关注客户的任何事情）成为地方政府官员的一种准宗教。 1980 年代最早加入该运动的全国知名人物之一是时任阿肯色州州长的比尔·克林顿 (Bill Clinton)，他开始发表演讲，赞扬戴明 (W. Edwards Deming) 和其他质量大师。 到 1992 年，Coopers & Lybrand 的顾问可以计算出美国地方政府的“质量举措”超过 200 项。

At roughly the same time that Stone was discovering excellence, total-quality management (which can mean anything from reorganizing workers into teams to paying attention to customers) became a quasi-religion among local government officials. One of the first nationally known figures to join the movement in the 1980s was Bill Clinton, then governor of Arkansas, who took to making speeches praising W. Edwards Deming and other quality gurus. By 1992 consultants at Coopers & Lybrand could count more than 200 local-government "quality initiatives" in the United States.

到 20 世纪 80 年代后期，联邦政府也开始转变——尽管是以它自己笨重的方式。 1988 年，第 12,637 号行政命令规定了政府范围内的全面质量管理计划，并在人事办公室设立了联邦质量计划

By the late 1980s the Federal government too had become a convert—albeit in its own ponderous way. In 1988 Executive Order 12,637 ordained a government-wide TQM program and established a Federal Quality Initiative housed in the Office of Personnel

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

管理。 四年后，一份 28 卷的联邦管理问题报告问世。 但是，1993 年 3 月，比尔·克林顿 (Bill Clinton) 在戈尔 (Al Gore) 的领导下建立了国家绩效评估机构，公共部门管理理论真正进入了超速发展阶段。 它的第一批雇员之一是卓越的弟子鲍勃·斯通。 克林顿政府还设立了相当于鲍德里奇质量奖的公共部门奖项。

Management. Four years later a 28-volume report on federal management problems appeared. But public sector management theory really went into overdrive in March 1993 when Bill Clinton established the National Performance Review under Al Gore's leadership. One of its first hires was Bob Stone, the disciple of Excellence. The Clinton administration has also established a public sector equivalent of the Baldridge Award for quality.

不管是谁首先发起的，管理思想现在已经成为世界范围内政府制度化的一部分。 在英国、澳大利亚、加拿大和斯堪的纳维亚，公共部门对管理理论的热爱始于高层。 例如，在英国，玛格丽特·撒切尔 (Margaret Thatcher) 和她的大臣们建立了一系列强大的机构，其中一些由商人和顾问组成，以改善公共部门的管理： )、财务管理股、国家审计署和审计委员会。 撒切尔还引入了范围广泛的“以市场为导向”的改革，包括私有化（这个词据说是彼得·德鲁克发明的）。 英国公务员可以因成功的员工建议等获得称为特许标志的奖项。 英国还设立了公共部门MBA，以确保公务员熟悉最新的管理思想。 甚至还有专门的互联网站点，各国公务员都可以登录，讨论“公务员全面质量管理”等主题。

Regardless of who first sponsored them, management ideas are now an institutionalized part of government worldwide. In Britain, Australasia, Canada, and Scandinavia, the public sector's love affair with management theory started at the top. In Britain, for example, Margaret Thatcher and her ministers set up a succession of powerful bodies, some of them staffed by businessmen and consultants, to improve the management of the public sector: the Efficiency Unit (under Lord Rayner, head of Marks and Spencer), the Financial Management Unit, the National Audit Office and the Audit Commission. Thatcher also introduced a wide range of "market-oriented" reforms, including privatization (a word that Peter Drucker supposedly invented). British civil servants can win awards called Charter Marks for things such as successful staff suggestions. Britain has also established a public sector MBA to ensure that civil servants are au fait with the latest in management thinking. There are even special Internet sites where civil servants of all nations can log on to discuss subjects such as "TQM for public servants."

所有这些都证明了管理咨询公司的财富。 在美国，公共部门已证明是一个有利可图的客户，以至于大多数大型咨询公司现在都有几个部门专门满足其需求：一家公司 CSC Index 甚至有一个专注于联邦客户的特殊中心，例如国防部和美国宇航局。 1995 年年中，约翰·梅杰政府在一系列议会提问中承认，它在管理顾问方面花费了至少 3.2 亿英镑——几乎肯定是实际数字的一小部分。 英国的咨询公司在公共部门之外做得很好，以至于他们开始聘请前委员会成员给他们提供建议：玛格丽特霍奇曾是臭名昭著的管理不善的伊斯灵顿委员会的负责人，在以工党身份重返政坛之前成为普华永道的顾问议会成员。

All this has proved a bonanza for management consultancies. In America the public sector has proved such a lucrative client that most big consultancies now have several departments devoted to its needs: one firm, CSC Index, even has a special center that concentrates on federal customers, such as the Department of Defense and NASA. In mid-1995 John Major's government admitted in a series of parliamentary questions that it had spent at least £320 million on management consultants—almost certainly a fraction of the real figure. British consultancies are doing so well out of the public sector that they have started hiring former council members to give them advice: Margaret Hodge, once head of the notoriously badly managed Islington Council, became a consultant to Price Waterhouse before returning to politics as a Labour member of Parliament.

新边疆致命吸引力

NEW FRONTIERS Fatal Attraction

在愤世嫉俗的人看来，这可能看起来像是美人计的确凿证据。 与许多顾问私下交谈，他们会承认政府为他们提供了一个绝好的机会来转售（昂贵地）他们已经抛售给私营部门的产品和理论。 然而他们也会坚持认为他们意识到它的潜力相对较晚：总体而言，对这件事的大部分热情来自公共部门，这表现出对管理理论的盲目喜爱，这在私营部门很少见.

To the cynical eye, this may look like conclusive proof of a honey-trap. Talk to many consultants privately and they will admit that governments have offered them a wonderful chance to resell (expensively) products and theories that they have already dished out to the private sector. Yet they will also insist that they were relatively late to realize its potential: on the whole, most of the enthusiasm for the affair has come from the public sector, which has shown a blind affection for management theory that is rarely seen in the private sector.

这种痴迷有三个根源。 首先是对公共部门的信心危机和对私营部门的信心复苏。 在美国，罗斯·佩罗 (Ross Perot) 是这场运动的典型代表，他认为只有像他这样的商人才能让联邦政府恢复理智，这一理念奠定了整个总统候选人的基础。 几乎不可能想象当今地方或国家政治职位的任何候选人（尤其是共和党候选人）不吹嘘他或她在私营部门的技能是担任公职的一种，有时是唯一的资格。 在 1994 年的选举中，包括心脏外科医生和房地产大亨在内的政治新手纷纷上任，承诺让政府像企业一样运作。 1995 年一位落选的共和党总统候选人拉马尔·亚历山大 (Lamar Alexander)，

That obsession has three roots. The first is a crisis in faith in the public sector and a resurgence of faith in the private. In the United States, Ross Perot, who founded an entire presidential candidacy on the notion that only a businessman such as himself could restore sanity to the federal government, is only the poster child for this movement. It is virtually impossible to imagine any candidate for local or national political office nowadays (particularly a Republican candidate) not touting his or her private sector skills as one, and sometimes the only, qualification for holding public office. The 1994 elections saw political neophytes, among them cardiac surgeons and real estate tycoons, sweep into office promising to make government run like a business. One unsuccessful Republican presidential candidate in 1995, Lamar Alexander, rooted his campaign in his private sector experience, downplaying as much as possible his terms as secretary of education under George Bush, and as governor of Tennessee.

在企业家崇拜方面，克林顿政府也毫不懈怠。 如果不出意外，希拉里克林顿对大宗商品交易和白水投资计划的兴趣表明，克林顿夫妇从不厌恶快钱。 克林顿家族一直与阿肯色州的企业有着密切的联系，尤其是沃尔玛、泰森食品和斯蒂芬斯金融帝国。 人们发现戈尔做了所有正确的事情——参观西南航空公司和通用汽车公司的土星工厂，并与哈雷戴维森公司董事长沃恩·比尔斯和通用电气公司的杰克·韦尔奇等商界名人举办研讨会。

Nor is the Clinton administration much of a slouch when it comes to entrepreneur worship. If nothing else, Hillary Clinton's appetite for commodity trading and the Whitewater investment scheme has shown that the Clintons have never frowned on the quick buck. The Clinton family has always had strong ties to Arkansas businesses, notably Wal-Mart, Tyson Foods, and the Stephens financial empire. Al Gore has been spotted doing all the right things—touring Southwest Airlines and General Motors's Saturn factory, and holding seminars with business luminaries such as Vaughan Beals, chairman of Harley-Davidson, and Jack Welch of General Electric.

对管理理论最有热情的往往是自由主义者，因为他们认为这将有助于将政府从公众的幻灭中拯救出来。 到 90 年代中期，只有 19% 的美国公众相信联邦政府会“做正确的事”，

It is often liberals who are most passionate about management theory because they think it will help salvage government from public disillusionment. By the mid-1990s only 19 percent of the American public trusted the federal government to "do the right thing,"

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

与 30 年前的 76% 相比。 戈尔 (Gore) 的首席政策顾问伊莱恩·卡马克 (Elaine Kamark) 将此归咎于公共部门对客户的态度仍停留在 20 世纪 50 年代：员工继续冷漠对待客户，而私营部门则越来越多地以“客户”为基础展开竞争。满意。”

compared with 76 percent 30 years ago. Elaine Kamark, Gore's chief policy adviser, blames this on the fact that the public sector is stuck with a 1950s' attitude to its customers: workers continue to treat customers with surly indifference, whereas the private sector is increasingly competing on the basis of "customer satisfaction."

各派政府都痴迷于管理理论的第二个原因是“少花钱多办事”的共同愿望：继续提供合理的公共服务，而不会将更高比例的 GDP 用于国家。 政客们注意到，公司一直在裁员，同时生产更多更好的产品。 英国审计委员会和美国管理与预算办公室等监管机构一再详细说明公共部门效率低下的问题。 政客们很自然地得出结论，他们可以通过更好地管理事情来推迟做出关于提高税收或削减服务的艰难决定。

The second reason that governments of all persuasions are obsessed with management theory is a common desire to do "more with less": to continue to provide reasonable public services without spending a higher proportion of GDP on the state. Politicians have noted that companies have been cutting their workforces while producing more and better products. Watchdogs like Britain's Audit Commission and the U.S. Office of Management and Budget have repeatedly detailed public sector inefficiencies. It is only natural for politicians to conclude that they can put off making hard decisions about raising taxes or cutting services by managing things better.

在美国，阿尔·戈尔曾表示，机构必须“证明为什么它们应该继续存在”。 1993-95 年民主党总统任期削减了 100,000 名联邦劳动力。 英国已将其公务员制度缩减为中央核心，并将其他一切外包给大约 100 个按短期合同运作的机构或私营部门。 在世界各地，地方政府是一个特定的目标。 “在每一个臃肿臃肿的地方当局内部，都有一个瘦弱的人正在努力摆脱困境，”撒切尔最喜欢的部长之一尼古拉斯·里德利 (Nicholas Ridley) 曾宣称。

In the United States, Al Gore has said that agencies will have to "justify why they should continue to exist at all." In 1993-95 a Democratic presidency cut the federal workforce by 100,000. Britain has slimmed its civil service to a central core and contracted out everything else to some 100 agencies, which operate on short-term contracts, or the private sector. Throughout the world, local government is a particular target. "Inside every fat and bloated local authority is a slim one struggling to get out," Nicholas Ridley, one of Thatcher's favorite ministers once proclaimed.

许多政治家，包括已故的里德利先生，都对加州的“合同城市”着迷，这些城市购买了大部分公共服务。 通常的模型是一个名为 Lakewood 的城市，该城市于 1954 年首次成立时，据说只需要三名员工来监督为其 70,000 名居民提供医院、警察等服务的承包商。 如今，莱克伍德的精简程度有所降低——它拥有 160 名员工，理事会必须每两周开会一次，而不是每年一次——但独立研究表明，合同城市的人均公共服务支出大约是城镇的一半地方当局自己提供服务的地方。 3个

Many politicians, including the late Mr. Ridley, have been fascinated by California's "contract cities," which buy in most of their public services. The usual model is a city called Lakewood, which, when it was first incorporated in 1954, supposedly needed only three employees to monitor the contractors who provided its 70,000 inhabitants with their hospitals, police, and so on. Nowadays Lake-wood is a little less streamlined—it employs 160 people and the council has to meet every two weeks, rather than once a year—but independent studies suggest that per capita spending on public services in contract cities is roughly half that in towns where the local authority provides the service itself. 3

政府转向管理理论的第三个原因是一种模糊的感觉，即无论是否需要削减预算，公共部门都必须与时俱进。 正如私营部门必须考虑到信息技术的传播和

The third reason that governments have turned to management theory is a vague feeling that, regardless of the need to cut budgets, the public sector must move with the times. Just as the private sector has to take account of the spread of information technology and the

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

出现了更加挑剔、注重价值的消费者，国家也必须如此。 阿尔·戈尔 (Al Gore) 曾抱怨说，美国人“在 Word Perfect 时代遭受了毛笔政府的折磨”。 华盛顿的许多高级官员在私营部门在 1980 年代扭转局面时拥有丰富的经验。 听纽特·金里奇 (Newt Gingrich) 谈论德鲁克 (Drucker) 或阿尔文·托夫勒 (Alvin Toffler)，即使是他最大的敌人也不得不承认，演讲者对公共部门变革的热情不仅仅是出于削减福利的愿望。

emergence of much fussier, value-conscious consumers, so must the state. Al Gore once complained that Americans suffered "from a quill-pen government in the age of Word Perfect." Many high-ranking officials in Washington have had extensive experience of the private sector as it turned itself around in the 1980s. Listen to Newt Gingrich talk about Drucker or Alvin Toffler, and even his worst enemy would have to admit that the speaker's enthusiasm for change in the public sector is motivated by more than just a desire to cut welfare.

有什么新想法吗？

Any New Ideas?

那么，顾问们所说的话有什么道理吗：总的来说，政客们的脚一直踩在加速器上，以至于管理行业通常很乐意被搭顺风车？ 这尤其适用于大师们，他们大体上未能提出适合公共部门的新想法。 汤姆·彼得斯 (Tom Peters) 在推销自己的想法时通常会保持警惕，但最初却忽略了它。 直到 1989 年，他才制作了一部关于“公共部门卓越”的电影。 所有的大师都口头上赞成德鲁克的观点，即公共部门迫切需要良好的管理，并且这些团体已经开始在他们的书中包含更多的公共部门案例研究。 但是，从德鲁克开始，他们的兴趣主要集中在大局上，

Is there something, then, in what the consultants say: that, by and large, the politicians' feet have been so firmly on the accelerator, that the management industry has usually been happy just to be taken along for the ride? This applies particularly to the gurus themselves who, by and large, have failed to produce new ideas tailored to the public sector. Tom Peters, usually on his toes when it comes to selling his ideas, initially ignored it. It was not until 1989 that he produced a film about "excellence in the public sector." All the gurus pay lip service to Drucker's idea that the public sector is crying out for good management, and the groups have begun to include a few more public sector case studies in their books. But, from Drucker onward, their interest has largely been in the big picture, rather than the niceties of how to run particular government organizations.

一个典型的例子是最明显地参与公共部门的大师：哈佛商学院的迈克尔波特。 他第一次对公共部门产生兴趣是在 1980 年代，当时罗纳德·里根 (Ronald Reagan) 邀请他担任总统工业竞争力委员会的成员。 4 当时，商业杂志认为贸易全球化使国家变得越来越不重要。 当时波特在哈佛的同事罗伯特·赖希 (Robert Reich) 在《国家的工作》(The Work of Nations, 1991) 中以最复杂的形式阐述了这一案例，认为教育和培训是国家竞争优势的唯一真正来源，因为劳动力是所有劳动力中流动性最低的生产要素。

A case in point is the guru who has most obviously involved himself in the public sector: Michael Porter of the Harvard Business School. He first became interested in the public sector in the 1980s when Ronald Reagan asked him to sit on the President's Commission on Industrial Competitiveness. 4 At the time business-magazine wisdom held that the globalization of trade was making nations less and less important. Robert Reich, then Porter's colleague at Harvard, put the case in its most sophisticated form in The Work of Nations (1991), arguing that education and training were the only real source of national competitive advantage, because labor is the least mobile of all the factors of production.

然而，随着委员会的审议，波特对民族国家和民族差异在决定公司成功方面所起的巨大作用印象深刻。 这种转变的结果是国家的竞争优势（1989 年）。 超过 800

As the commission deliberated, however, Porter became impressed by the huge role that nation-states and national differences play in determining the success of companies. The result of this conversion was The Competitive Advantage of Nations (1989). Over 800

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

页长； 用图表、集群地图等进行大量说明； 这本书充斥着有关英国饼干制造商和韩国钢琴公司的详细信息，是对国民经济成功的原因以及政府应如何采取行动提高国家竞争力的一般性调查。 这本书被世界各地有抱负的知识分子阅读（或至少购买），促使波特本人为许多政府做咨询工作，撰写有关新西兰、加拿大和葡萄牙竞争地位的报告。 在地方政府执行类似任务后，波特撰写了题为“马萨诸塞州的竞争优势”(1991) 和“内城竞争优势”(1995) 的报告。

pages long; lavishly illustrated with charts, cluster maps, and the like; littered with details about British biscuit makers and Korean piano companies—the book is a general inquiry into what makes national economies successful, and how governments should act to improve their country's competitiveness. The book, which was read (or at least bought) by aspiring intellectuals everywhere, led Porter himself to do consulting work for a large number of governments, writing reports on the competitive positions of New Zealand, Canada, and Portugal. Following similar assignments in local government, Porter produced reports entitled The Competitive Advantage of Massachusetts (1991) and The Competitive Advantage of the Inner Citg (1995).

The Competitive Advantage of Nations 的真正主题是全球化（见第 10 章）。 但它也说明了为什么商界人士和商界思想家担心国家的作用是合理的。 波特认为，国家环境在企业成功方面一直发挥着核心作用。 现在，随着全球化和自由贸易使公司面临越来越多的竞争者，国家特性对公司的影响越来越大，而不是越来越小。

The real subject of The Competitive Advantage of Nations is globalization (see Chapter 10). But it also shows why it is legitimate for business people and business thinkers to worry about the state's role. National environments have always played a central role in making firms successful, Porter argued. Now, as globalization and free trade expose firms to ever more competitors, the effect of national peculiarities on companies counts for more, not less.

波特在哈佛的一位同事罗莎贝丝·莫斯·坎特 (Rosabeth Moss Kanter) 最近从另一个角度研究了公共政策与某些人所谓的“商业社区”之间的关系。 随着跨国公司将业务从例如马萨诸塞州转移到马尼拉以寻找更好的员工，他们迫使（或应该迫使）政治家重新考虑公共政策。 世界级：在全球经济中蓬勃发展（1995 年）着眼于全球化对当地社区的影响。 她坚持认为，任何地区蓬勃发展的最佳方式是在以下三种活动之一中成为世界一流的企业：思考、制造或贸易。 莫斯·坎特认为，与全球化作斗争毫无意义。 本土主义非但没有保护当地社区，反而使他们解体。

A colleague of Porter's at Harvard, Rosabeth Moss Kanter, has recently examined the relationship between public policy and what some would call "the business community" from the other way around. As globe-spanning firms move operations from, say, Massachusetts to Manila in search of better workers, they force (or should force) politicians to rethink public policy. World Class: Thriving Locally in the Global Economy (1995) looks at the impact of globalization on local communities. She insists that the best way for any region to thrive is to become a world-class operation in one of three activities: thinking, manufacturing, or trading. According to Moss Kanter, it is pointless to fight globalization; far from preserving local communities, nativism condemns them to disintegration.

显然，管理理论和公共部门之间有很多共同点。 但是很难看出 Porter 和 Moss Kanter 对试图重新设计邮件服务的邮政局长有多大帮助。 波特和莫斯坎特似乎都对与一般经济学和政治哲学有关的问题比公共部门管理的本质问题更感兴趣。 同样的情况也适用于大前健一和他改革日本政治的运动，或者查尔斯·汉迪和他对英国公共生活质量的关注，或者任何其他的甲级联赛大师。

Clearly, there is a good deal of common ground between management theory and the public sector. But it is hard to see how Porter and Moss Kanter are much help to, say, a postmaster general trying to redesign the mail service. Both Porter and Moss Kanter seem fired up about issues that have more to do with general economics and political philosophy than the nitty gritty of public sector management. The same could be said for Kenichi Ohmae and his crusade to reform Japanese politics or Charles Handy and his concern for the quality of British public life, or for any other of the first-division gurus.

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

这种对细节的崇高蔑视为专攻公共部门的新一代管理大师留下了空间。 其中最有影响力的是公共政策顾问大卫·奥斯本和前城市经理泰德·盖布勒。 他们重塑政府：企业家精神如何改变公共部门（1992 年）登上了畅销书榜首，催生了一个有影响力的压力团体（政府重新设计联盟），并为克林顿政府提供了某种模式。 这本书原定名为《In Search of Excellence in Government》，以纪念彼得斯和沃特曼； 但最终他们决定以约翰·奈斯比特 (John Naisbitt) 的另一本管理著作《重塑公司》(Reinventing the Corporation, 1985) 的名字命名。

This lofty disdain for detail has left room for a new breed of management gurus who specialize in the public sector. The most influential of these are David Osborne, a public policy consultant, and Ted Gaebler, a former city manager. Their Reinventing Government: How the Entrepreneurial Spirit Is Transforming the Public Sector (1992) reached the top of the best-seller lists, spawned an influential pressure group (the Alliance for Redesigning Government), and provided the Clinton administration with something of a model. The book was originally going to be called In Search of Excellence in Government, in tribute to Peters and Waterman; but in the end they decided to name it after another management tome, Reinventing the Corporation (1985), by John Naisbitt.

正如他们对私营部门专家的迷恋所暗示的那样，奥斯本和盖布勒的书的问题在于，就所有细节而言，它实际上是关于回收旧思想而不是创造新思想。 重塑政府简单地解释了私营部门管理理论如何应用于公共部门。 在实践中，从公共部门涌现出来的真正“大师”是实践者——通常是实施他们认为管理理论应该是什么的政客。 阿尔·戈尔 (Al Gore) 关于重塑政府的报告也登上了《纽约时报》的畅销书榜单，读起来更像是一种自觉的尝试，即为公共部门做的事，就像 In Search of Excellence 为私人部门所做的那样：激励读者以政府为榜样美国最好的组织。 比尔克里奇，

As their fascination with private sector gurus hints, the problem with Osborne and Gaebler's book is that, for all the details, it is really about recycling old ideas rather than creating new ones. Reinventing Government simply explains how private sector management theory can be applied to the public sector. In practice, the real "gurus" to emerge from the public sector are the practitioners—usually politicians implementing what they think management theory should be. Al Gore's report on reinventing government, which also reached the New York Times best-seller list, reads rather like a self-conscious attempt to do for the public sector what In Search of Excellence did for the private: inspire readers to follow the example of America's best organizations. Bill Creech, a four-star general who made his name for his innovative approach to running Tactical Air Command, including condensing a 440-page rulebook into an 8-page guidebook, has become a guru in his own right, with his Five Pillars of TQM (1994).

一旦退休的将军们开始写关于全面质量管理的五个支柱的文章，明智的人就会做好迎接反弹的准备。 尽管如此，在公共部门进行原创性思考的通常都是这种朴实的人。 当大型零售商沃尔玛考虑引入药店时，该公司环顾四周，看看谁最擅长为大量顾客设计排队系统，并惊讶地发现答案是空中作战司令部。 美国陆军是让来自不同种族背景的受教育程度低的人一起工作的领导者之一。 1995 年，查尔斯·汉迪 (Charles Handy) 引用英国陆军作为一个“高度承诺”组织的例子，该组织自

As soon as retired generals start writing about the five pillars of TQM, sensible people brace themselves for a backlash. All the same, it is often such earthy types who do the original thinking in the public sector. When the giant retailer Wal-Mart was thinking of introducing pharmacies, the firm looked around to see who was best at designing queuing systems for large numbers of customers and found, to its surprise, that the answer was Air Combat Command. The U.S. Army is one of the leaders in getting poorly educated people from different ethnic backgrounds to work together. In 1995 Charles Handy cited the British Army as an example of a "high commitment" organization that has really reengineered itself since the

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

通过精简到 60,000 人的战斗力来进行战争——他指出，这个组织现在比皇家荷兰/壳牌还要小。 5个

war by slimming down to a fighting force of 60,000 men—an organization, he noted, that was now smaller than Royal Dutch/Shell. 5

战壕里的景色

The View from the Trenches

不过，总的来说，从公共部门涌现出“最佳实践”的案例并不多见。 一般而言，公共部门所做的只是向私营部门借鉴想法。 它通常看起来像是中国私语的官僚版本，一组人应用他们认为另一组人所说的内容。

On the whole, though, cases of "best practice" springing out of the public sector are rare. In general, all the public sector does is to borrow ideas from the private sector. It often seems like a bureaucratic version of Chinese Whispers, with one group of people applying what they think another group of people has said.

许多政府正在引入彼得·德鲁克 (Peter Drucker) 曾经称之为“目标管理”的方法：使命宣言（制定广泛的目标）、固定合同（规定员工应该做什么）和绩效衡量标准（衡量他们的表现如何）。 目前在公共部门流传的一个更为普遍的想法是“客户为王”的观念——这是西奥多·莱维特在 1960 年代向私营部门宣扬的，而汤姆·彼得斯在 1980 年代则谴责的。 现在，丹麦和加拿大政府正试图说服公务员像对待私营部门的客户一样对待他们的客户； 英国政府也是如此，其公民宪章倡议。 甚至中国政府也发出命令，指示其官僚不要对公民无礼。

Many governments are introducing what Peter Drucker once called "management by objectives": mission statements (laying out broad objectives), fixed contracts (specifying what employees are expected to do), and performance measures (measuring how well they were doing it). An even more common idea currently making the rounds of the public sector is the notion that "the customer is king"—something Theodore Levitt preached to the private sector in the 1960s and Tom Peters repreached in the 1980s. Now the Danish and Canadian governments are trying to persuade civil servants to treat their clients like private sector customers; so is the British government, with its Citizen's Charter initiative. Even the Chinese government has sent out orders instructing its bureaucrats not to be rude to its citizens.

一方面，这有点愚蠢。 在圣达菲的失业办公室，诸如“记住客户总是有选择”之类的短语没有多大意义，更不用说北京了。 但是，如果服务低于某个绩效指标，政府会向人们提供补偿，从而为这种言论增添一些实质内容。 甚至像美国国税局和伦敦地铁这样臭名昭著的敌视客户的组织也采用了“客户服务标准”。 而且，就像许多其他与管理理论有关的事情一样，仅仅走过场就可以揭示问题——即使主要属于好奇心价值的范畴。 白宫现在知道有一个“老鹰零件计划”的少数几个原因之一，

In one way, this is a little fatuous. Phrases such as "Remember that the customer always has a choice" do not make much sense in an unemployment office in Santa Fe, let alone Beijing. But governments are putting some substance to this rhetoric by offering people compensation if service falls below a certain performance measure. Even such notoriously customer-hostile organizations as the U.S. Internal Revenue Service and London's Underground have adopted "customer service standards." And, like many other things to do with management theory, merely going through the motions can be revealing—even if largely in the category of curiosity value. One of the few reasons that the White House now knows there is an "eagle parts program," which collects dead eagles partly to supply bits of them to Indians for ceremonial purposes, is that the practice was cited by managers in the Department of the Interior as an example of innovative, customer-driven government.

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

此外，仅仅因为一个想法是旧的并不一定意味着它是一个坏想法。 大多数公司将客户服务作为起点； 税务人员没有理由不这样做。 另一种“旧”管理技术也是如此：员工激励和绩效薪酬。 在英国、澳大利亚和新西兰，公务员部门负责人的任期有限，并部分根据他们的表现给予奖励。 在加利福尼亚州桑尼维尔，如果他们的机构超过商定的目标，城市管理者可以获得高达 10% 的奖金。

Moreover, just because an idea is old does not necessarily mean that it is a bad one. Most companies treat customer service as a starting point; there is no reason why the taxman should not do this too. The same goes for another "old" management technique: employee motivation and performance pay. In Britain, Australia, and New Zealand, the heads of civil service departments are appointed for limited terms and rewarded, in part, on the basis of their performance. In Sunnyvale, California, city managers can achieve bonuses of up to 10 percent if their agencies exceed agreed targets.

伦敦地铁现在发布有关各种地铁线路相对于目标以及相互之间的性能的信息。 俄勒冈州引入了 270 个基准，衡量从减少少女怀孕到清洁环境的一切，并转向基于绩效的预算编制。 告诉人们他们做得多好或多差会产生戏剧性的效果。 Southwark Council 传统上是英国最贫穷和最左翼的自治市镇之一，将其住房部门划分为 19 个社区办公室，然后缠着他们提供关于彼此和其他委员会的表现如何的信息。 该委员会还公开了所有比较数据。 到 1995 年，Southwark 处理住房福利的速度比除 Kensington 和 Chelsea 以外的任何其他伦敦议会都快， 一个富裕得多的地区 6个

London Underground now publishes information about the performance of various tube lines both against targets, and against each other. The state of Oregon has introduced 270 benchmarks, measuring everything from cutting teenage pregnancies to cleaning up the environment, and moved to performance-based budgeting. Telling people how well or badly they are doing can have a dramatic effect. Southwark Council, traditionally one of the poorest and most left-wing boroughs in Britain, divided its housing department into 19 neighborhood offices and then pestered them with information about how well they were doing, both with respect to each other and other councils. The council also made all the comparative data publicly available. By 1995 Southwark was processing housing benefits quicker than any other London council except Kensington and Chelsea, a far wealthier area. 6

所有这些客户服务都足够好，但从大多数公务员的角度来看，管理理论就是一件事的代名词：拖延。 除了 NYPD，再造在公共部门往往是残酷的。 英国财政部是其中一个受害者，它现在正在敦促其他部门遵守纪律。 戈尔最终希望美国联邦政府实现汤姆彼得斯的目标，即每 25-75 名员工配备一名经理。

All this customer service is fine enough, but from most civil servants' point of view, management theory is synonymous with one thing: delayering. The NYPD apart, reengineering has often been brutal in the public sector. One victim has been Britain's Treasury, which is now urging the discipline on other departments. Al Gore would eventually like the U.S. federal government to hit Tom Peters 's target of one manager for every 25-75 employees.

与私营部门一样，缩减规模和削减成本的计划越来越多地伴随着对更现代、“软”管理技术的需求。 一些美国政府官员随身携带金色的小名片，这些名片“赋予”他们做出决定的权力，而无需先去找上级。 一些部门甚至发放“宽恕券”，提前宽恕人们的错误，以鼓励他们对政府采取不那么拘泥于规则的做法。 位于俄勒冈州奥乔科国家公园的国家林务局的一个部门引入了

As in the private sector, downsizing and cost-cutting programs are increasingly accompanied by an appetite for more modern, "soft" management techniques. Some American government officials carry around small gold business cards that "empower" them to make decisions without first going to their superiors. Some departments are even giving out "forgiveness coupons," which forgive people in advance of their mistakes, in order to encourage them to adopt a less rule-bound approach to government. One division of the National Forest Service, at Ochoco National Park, Oregon, has introduced

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

“Grue Awards”，以员工的名字命名，员工可以互相赠送，以表彰对杰出工作的赞赏。

"Grue Awards," named after an employee, which employees can give to each other as a token of appreciation for outstanding work.

这种将硬管理理论和软管理理论结合起来的爱好直接进入了白宫。 当他不考虑精简政府的想法时，阿尔戈尔正在提出愿景，或者颁发“重塑英雄”奖。 No sooner had Bill Clinton been elected president than he organized a bonding weekend, designed to encourage more effective team building, at which two "facilitators" tried to get everybody to confess to some hidden secret. （国务卿沃伦克里斯托弗承认他喜欢爵士乐和钢琴酒吧。）

This affection for mixing hard and soft management theory reaches right into the White House. When he is not thinking up ideas for slimming government, Al Gore is coming up with visions, or handing out "heroes of reinvention" awards. No sooner had Bill Clinton been elected president than he organized a bonding weekend, designed to encourage more effective team building, at which two "facilitators" tried to get everybody to confess to some hidden secret. (Warren Christopher, the secretary of state, admitted that he enjoyed jazz and piano bars.)

虽然很难想象杰克韦尔奇或鲁珀特默多克会容忍这​​种事情，但克林顿的痴情在华盛顿环城公路内是相当正常的。 能源部长哈泽尔·奥利里 (Hazel O'Leary) 自称是斯蒂芬·柯维 (Stephen Covey) 的学生，她说，斯蒂芬·柯维 (Stephen Covey) 能让人们打破阻碍他们达到最佳表现的“恐惧之环”。 共和党人也不能幸免。 他们的领导人现在每年年初都会举行一次“管理务虚会”，以帮助他们制定议程。 纽特·金里奇 (Newt Gingrich) 争辩说，他的《与美国的合同》主要被设计为“一份在政治上有用的管理培训文件，而不仅仅是一份政治文件”。

Although it is hard to imagine Jack Welch or Rupert Murdoch tolerating this sort of thing, Clinton's infatuations are fairly normal inside the Washington Beltway. Hazel O'Leary, the energy secretary, proclaims herself a student of Stephen Covey, who, she says, allows people to break the "ring of fear" that prevents them from hitting their peak performance. Nor are the Republicans immune. Their leaders now hold a "management retreat" at the beginning of every year to help them set the agenda. Newt Gingrich argued that his Contract with America was primarily designed as "a management-training document that was politically useful, not simply as a political document."

反弹开始

The Backlash Begins

在管理学院 1995 年的会议上，亨利·明茨伯格 (Henry Mintzberg) 对与会者进行了一次关于管理理论对公共部门的影响的激烈攻击。 他认为，《哈佛商业评论》应该在封面上印上骷髅头和交叉骨头，并警告“公共部门不得使用”。

At the 1995 meeting of the Academy of Management, Henry Mintzberg treated the attendees to a coruscating attack on the influence of management theory on the public sector. The Harvard Business Review, he argued, should have a skull and cross bones stamped on the cover with the warning "not to be taken by the public sector."

同年，彼得·德鲁克为《大西洋月刊》写了一篇长文。 它首先嘲笑了阿尔戈尔重塑政府的部分内容，例如将亚特兰大福利办公室的“申请程序”整合为“一站式服务”（管理人员的说法是接听电话）和德鲁克干巴巴地指出，进出口银行的重塑“现在有望做它 60 年前成立的全部工作：帮助小企业获得出口融资。” 7

In the same year, Peter Drucker wrote a long article for the Atlantic Monthly. It began by ridiculing parts of Al Gore's reinventing-government crusade, such as the consolidation of "the application process" in welfare offices in Atlanta into a "one-stop shop" (which was management-speak for getting phone calls answered) and the reinvention of the Export-Import Bank, which Drucker dryly noted, "is now expected to do what it was set up to do all of 60 years ago: help small businesses get export financing." 7

和明茨伯格一样，德鲁克不明白为什么政府必须将人们视为客户才能做应该做的事情

Like Mintzberg, Drucker puzzled over why the government had to think of people as customers in order to do things that should

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

顺其自然。 但他的核心抱怨是，大多数公共部门管理理论都归结为两件事：要么无休止地修补服务，要么缩减规模——这两种策略在私营部门都已经行不通了。 更糟糕的是，这些补救措施被应用于自赫伯特胡佛以来几乎没有变化的僵化组织。 需要做的是“重新思考”公共部门，询问政府各部门的基本问题，例如“你的使命是什么？” “这还是正确的任务吗？” 等等。 德鲁克想知道，为什么退伍军人管理局自己经营 300 家医院，而不是将这项工作外包给私营部门？ 为什么农业在只为 3% 的人口提供工作时应该有自己的部门？ 德鲁克认为，重点是，

come naturally. But his core complaint was that most public sector management theory came down to two things: either endlessly patching up services or downsizing—both strategies that had already failed to work in the private sector. Worse, these remedies were being applied to fossilized organizations that had changed little since Herbert Hoover. What was needed was to "rethink" the public sector, to ask basic questions of each part of government such as "What is your mission?" "Is it still the right mission?" and so on. Why, wondered Drucker, did the Veterans Administration run 300 hospitals itself, instead of contracting out the job to the private sector? And why did agriculture deserve its own department when it provided work for only 3 percent of the population? The point, argued Drucker, was not to shrink government for the sake of shrinking it, but to make it more effective.

与那些受到政府“管理化”影响的人的愤怒相比，明茨伯格和德鲁克的挫败感微不足道。 在英国，这个管理理论可能在公共部门得到最热烈应用的国家，这个想法已经成为某种程度上的公众笑话，一种在电视或报纸专栏中引人发笑的简单方式。

Mintzberg and Drucker's frustration is nothing compared with the fury of those who have been affected by the "managementiza-tion" of government. In Britain, the country where management theory has probably been applied most enthusiastically in the public sector, the idea has become something of a public joke, an easy way to get a laugh on television or in a newspaper column.

公共部门管理理论的指控始于其费用。 花哨的新管理系统通常涉及复杂的计算机，以加快信息的流动，以及训练有素的管理人员，以处理额外的文书工作。 政府部门经常需要聘请昂贵的顾问来为“变革管理”和“人事管理”出谋划策，因为以前凭直觉做的一切现在都是根据“流程图”和“行动计划”来完成的。 在美国，城市通常将外包服务成本的 20% 用于管理合同。

The charge sheet against management theory in the public sector begins with its expense. Fancy new management systems usually involve sophisticated computers, to speed up the flow of information, and well-groomed managers, to handle the additional paper work.
