Government departments frequently have to hire expensive consultants to advise on "change management" and "personnel management," as everything that used to be done by instinct is now done on the basis of "flow charts" and "action plans." In the United States, cities often spend 20 percent of the cost of a contracted-out service on managing the contract.

公共部门的雇员和政治家在使用管理思想方面热情多于老练。 克林顿执政的第一个 100 天变成一场灾难的原因之一是，克林顿仓促地将他的工作人员“裁员”四分之一，而没有重新考虑留下来的人的工作。 政客们对时尚的痴迷程度不亚于他们的私营部门同僚——唯一的区别是公共部门的时尚似乎比私营部门的时尚滞后大约五年。

Public sector employees and politicians have been more enthusiastic than sophisticated in their use of management ideas. One of the reasons that the Clinton White House turned its first 100 days into a disaster was that Clinton hastily moved to "downsize" his staff by a quarter without rethinking the jobs of those who remained. Politicians are no less addicted to fads than their private sector equivalents—the only difference being that public sector fads seem to lag behind private sector fads by about five years.

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

同样，由于政治家和行政人员未能区分不同类型的管理理论，因此他们往往最容易受到其矛盾的影响。 三种最流行的公共部门时尚——裁员、再造和全面质量管理——在许多实质上是互不相容的。 裁员认为工人是可以消耗的； TQM 将它们视为宝贵的资源。 再造取决于撕毁组织并重新开始； TQM 是一种持续、渐进改进的学说。

Similarly, because politicians and administrators have failed to distinguish between the different sorts of management theory, they are often most exposed to its contradictions. The three most popular public sector fads—downsizing, reengineering, and total-quality management—are, on many points of substance, mutually incompatible. Downsizing argues that workers are expendable; TQM sees them as an invaluable resource. Reengineering depends on ripping up the organization and starting again; TQM is a doctrine of continuous, incremental improvement.

一个典型的公共部门管理改革是保留旧的部门结构，但希望用更少的人来做； 更糟糕的是，它以最粗略的方式引入了性能度量。 如今，学者可能会因为写了很多文章而得到晋升，尽管事实上他们都是胡说八道，而医生可能会因为太多的病人死亡而被降职，而没有考虑到一个典型的心脏外科医生看到的危重病人比典型的皮肤科医生。 大多数“正常”公司现在都在自治团队中完成大部分创造性工作，但公共部门在很大程度上忽略了这一点——因为它有网络等想法。 直到 1995 年 11 月，私营部门的成功出版商迈克尔·赫塞尔廷才说服约翰·梅杰的同事

A typical public sector management reform involves keeping the old departmental structure, but hoping to do it with fewer people; worse, it introduces a performance measure in the crudest possible way. These days academics may be promoted for writing a lot of articles despite the fact that they are all bunk, and doctors can be demoted because too many of their patients die, without accounting for the fact that a typical cardiac surgeon sees more critically ill patients than the typical dermatologist. Most "normal" companies now do much of their creative work in self-governing teams, but the public sector has largely ignored this—as it has ideas such as networking. It was not until November 1995 that Michael Heseltine, a successful publisher in the private sector, persuaded his colleagues in John Major's cabinet to welcome in Cab-e-net, an on-line information system.

然而，公共部门最明显忽视的是信任。 受共和党国会和白宫之间预算冲突的启发，政府关门的一个更有趣的事情是它揭示了联邦雇员的性格。 美国人习惯于将联邦官僚充其量视为民主自由运作的毒瘤； 懒惰、低效和冷漠。 然而，一旦政府停止了除基本业务以外的所有业务，媒体和公众惊讶地发现许多“无关紧要”的官僚在休假期间继续工作。 其他政府雇员雄辩地讲述了他们在雇主手中受到的卑鄙待遇，很明显，这些人并不是不关心自己的工作，

However, the idea that the public sector has ignored most conspicuously is trust. One of the more interesting things about the government shutdown inspired by the budget skirmishes between the Republican Congress and the White House was the light it shed on the character of federal employees. Americans are in the habit of regarding federal bureaucrats as, at best, a cancer on the free functioning of democracy; lazy, inefficient, and indifferent. Once the government ceased all but essential operations, however, the press and public were surprised to discover many "inessential" bureaucrats who continued to work despite the furlough. Other government employees spoke eloquently of the shabby treatment they were receiving at the hands of their employer, and it became clear that these were not people who did not care about their jobs, but instead were eager to do their best.

明茨伯格认为，对衡量和问责制的日益痴迷正在使政府与公共部门道德中的所有最佳做法发生冲突。 公务员专业有

Mintzberg argues that the growing obsession with measurement and accountability is bringing governments into conflict with all that is best in the public sector ethic. Civil service professions have

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

传统上通过长期培训灌输的共同价值观进行控制； 现在假设他们唯一的价值是财务。 （明茨伯格曾经听过一位业务经理非常严肃地宣称，“通过控制，我们可以防止人们爱上他们的业务。”）

traditionally exercised control through shared values, inculcated through long training; now it is assumed that their only values are financial. (Mintzberg once heard a business manager proclaim, in all seriousness, that "through control, we can prevent people from falling in love with their business.")

管理理论不仅被官僚误用。 私营部门经理在公共部门遭遇不寻常失败的例子比比皆是。 也许最近最著名的例子是希拉里·克林顿 (Hillary Clinton) 改革美国医疗保健系统的尝试。 为了帮助她，克林顿夫人聘请了管理咨询公司 Telesis 的负责人 Ira Magaziner，他曾担任美国数十家领先企业的顾问。 Magaziner 的行为就像莫里哀想象中的管理顾问，一心想制定出完美的计划，却对民主政治的要求视而不见。 他成立了由来自世界各地的数百名专家组成的庞大委员会来考虑这个问题。 他收集了来自全国各地的文件和报告。 当然，委员会的工作是在严格保密的情况下进行的，

Management theory has not merely been misapplied by bureaucrats. Examples of private sector managers meeting with unaccustomed failure in the public sector abound. Perhaps the most celebrated recent example was Hillary Clinton's attempt to reform America's health-care system. To help her, Mrs. Clinton hired Ira Magaziner, head of a management consultancy, Telesis, and erstwhile adviser to dozens of America's leading corporations. Magaziner acted like Moliere's vision of a management consultant, intent on producing a perfect plan and blind to the demands of democratic politics. He set up gigantic committees, composed of hundreds of experts from around the world, to consider the problem. He assembled documents and reports from around the country. The work of the committees, was, of course, conducted in strict secrecy, without bothering to include or even brief any of the members of the Congress who would eventually vote to adopt or reject the plan.

最后，Magaziner 为全新的医疗保健系统制定了宏伟的蓝图。 克林顿总统在工作日晚上黄金时段的全国电视讲话中公布了蓝图。 它与复杂的计算机电路图有着令人不安的相似之处。 参议院多数党领袖鲍勃·多尔 (Bob Dole) 不失时机地嘲笑美国最优秀的民主党头脑所设计的神秘制度。 该计划引发了前所未有的游说、幕后操纵、政治姿态、竞争计划和公众歇斯底里的洪流。 最后，国会投票反对该计划，赞成对这个被广泛认为是美国面临的最严重问题之一的问题无所作为。

In the end, Magaziner produced a gigantic blueprint for an entirely new health-care system. The blueprint was unveiled by President Clinton in a nationally televised address in prime time on a weekday evening. It bore a troubling resemblance to the diagram for a sophisticated computer circuit. Bob Dole, the Senate majority leader, lost no time in ridiculing the arcane system America's finest Democratic minds had devised. The plan unleashed an unprecedented torrent of lobbying, backroom maneuvering, political posturing, competing plans, and public hysteria. In the end, Congress voted against the plan in favor of doing nothing about a problem widely regarded as one of the gravest facing the United States.

或者以 Renato Riverso 和 Roberto Schisano 为例，他们分别是 IBM 和 Texas Instruments 的成功经理，他们在 1994 年受命扭转意大利航空公司 Alitalia 的局面。 他们提高了运营效率，并试图推动重组计划； 但他们未能在政治上掩饰自己的背影； 到 1996 年 3 月，在工会的大力游说下，他们两人都辞职了。 与 IBM 资深人士 Riverso 交谈时，给人的印象是他简直不敢相信其中的一些做法

Or take the example of Renato Riverso and Roberto Schisano, successful managers at, respectively, IBM and Texas Instruments, who in 1994 were given the job of turning around Alitalia, an Italian airline. They increased operational efficiency and tried to push through a restructuring plan; but they failed to cover their backs politically; by March 1996, after heavy lobbying by the unions, both of them had resigned. Speaking to Riverso, an IBM veteran, one got the impression that he simply could not believe some of the practices

292

292

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

他遇到过——比如意大利航空公司的机组人员拒绝让持有已确认已付机票的人登机，以便他们的朋友和亲戚（不用说便宜的旅行）可以有座位。 另一方面，他的批评者说他天真地期待任何不同。

he encountered—such as an Alitalia cabin crew refusing to let people with confirmed paid-for tickets on the aircraft so that their friends and relations (needless to say traveling cheaply) could have the seats. On the other hand, his critics say that he was naive to expect anything different.

这些灾难暗示了明茨伯格（尽管不是德鲁克）宣扬的一个更基本的论点：公共部门和私营部门之间存在如此根本的差异，以至于一方的管理理论永远不会适用于另一方。 例如，明茨伯格的出发点之一是，我们不是政府的客户，而是公民。 公民不能像选择商业契约那样选择退出社会契约。 以公共利益的名义，不情愿的公民可以被征召入伍。

Such disasters hint at a more fundamental argument preached by Mintzberg (though not by Drucker): that there are such fundamental differences between the public sector and the private sector that management theory from one will never be applicable to the other. One of Mintzberg's starting points, for instance, is that we are not customers of governments but citizens. A citizen cannot opt out of the social contract in the same way as he or she might a commercial one. In the name of the common good, reluctant citizens can be conscripted into the army.

换句话说，“政府”和“管理”不是可以互换的概念。 私营部门的管理人员如果逃避艰难的决定，就会面临破产的威胁； 政客们通常可以选择印钞或增税。 私营部门经理只对一个独裁者负责，即底线。 正如罗伯托·希萨诺 (Roberto Schisano) 和艾拉·马加齐纳 (Ira Magaziner) 痛苦地学到的那样，公共部门经理要对所有人负责，而不是对任何人负责。 正如伦敦商学院教授约翰·凯所指出的那样，“如果责任不明确，就没有真正的问责制。如果既没有问责制也没有责任，那就是效率低下和无能。” 8个

In other words, "government" and "management" are not interchangeable concepts. Private sector managers live under the threat of bankruptcy if they shirk tough decisions; politicians usually have the option of printing money or raising taxes. Private sector managers are answerable to just one dictator, the bottom line. The public sector manager, as Roberto Schisano and Ira Magaziner learned painfully, are answerable to everyone and no one. As John Kay, a professor at London Business School, has pointed out, "Where there is ambiguity about responsibility, there is no real accountability. And where there is neither accountability nor responsibility there is inefficiency and incompetence." 8

这种困境也不局限于昂贵的进口老板。 普通公务员必须为执政党服务，不能堕落为党的工作人员。 他们必须牢记，很多人没有投票给政府，而且政策和优先事项不同的反对党可能很快就会接任。 这就像经营一家拥有多套相互矛盾的账目并且处于敌意收购边缘的公司。

Nor are such dilemmas confined to expensively imported bosses. Normal civil servants have to serve the party in power without degenerating into party functionaries. They have to bear in mind that large numbers of people did not vote for the government, and that an opposition party, with different policies and priorities, may soon take over. It is rather like running a firm that has several sets of contradictory accounts and lives on the edge of a hostile takeover.

公共部门经理也生活在一个充满规章制度的世界中，这些规章制度限制了他们控制员工和预算的自由。 就业法意味着解雇公职人员代价高昂（因为高级职员必须获得昂贵的退休金）或适得其反（因为最先离职的是最年轻和最聪明的人）。 当美国内政部削减

Public sector managers also live in a world of rules and regulations that limit their freedom to control both their employees and their budgets. Employment laws mean that sacking public workers is expensive (because senior staff have to be given expensive retirement packages) or counterproductive (because the first to go are the youngest and brightest). When America's Department of Interior cut

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

例如，它的计算设施的员工减少了 20%，它被迫解雇了所有最年轻的员工——也就是那些真正了解现代计算机的员工。 当私营部门的管理人员受邀重新设计公共部门的这个或那个部分时，他们一再震惊地发现他们必须一丝不苟地遵守法律法规，并且他们要为自己的行为向立法机关负责。

the staff of its computing facility by 20 percent, for example, it was forced to dismiss all its youngest employees—that is, the ones who actually knew something about modern computers. When private sector managers are brought in to redesign this or reinvent that bit of the public sector, they are repeatedly shocked to find that they must meticulously obey laws and regulations, and that they are answerable to the legislature for their actions.

这些也不一定是坏事。 公共部门必须保护纳税人的钱不被滥用。 太多的“灵活性”很容易被媒体变成全国性的丑闻，迫使公务员重新引入严格的自上而下的控制。 我们可以“赋予”政府雇员多少权力是有限度的。 毕竟，“有权势”的人名单中不仅包括奥利弗·诺斯，还包括奥兰治县前首席财务官罗伯特·西特龙。

Nor are these necessarily bad things. The public sector must shield taxpayer money from abuse. Too much "flexibility" can easily be turned into a national scandal by the press, forcing civil servants to reintroduce rigorous top-down controls. There is a limit to how much we can "empower" government employees. After all, the list of "empowered" individuals includes not only Oliver North but also Robert Citron, the former chief financial officer of Orange County.

失望，不是错误

A Disappointment, Not a Mistake

公共部门管理的许多失望实际上只是对困扰各种政策制定的两个问题的可怕提醒。 首先是国家是一种非常钝的工具：它掌握一个想法并在不考虑上下文的​​情况下将其强加。 第二是政治家们对神奇解决方案的迫切渴望：管理理论有望恢复人们对政府的信心，让政府在不减少服务的情况下减税，并在其道路上绕过每一个圈子。

Many of the disappointments of public sector management are really just a horrible reminder of two problems that plague policy making of all kinds. The first is that the state is an incredibly blunt instrument: it gets hold of one idea and imposes it without any sensitivity to context. The second is the desperate craving of politicians for a magical solution: management theory is expected to restore people's faith in government, allow governments to cut taxes without reducing services, and square every circle in its path.

公共部门似乎认同这样一种观念，即只要管理好问题就可以解决问题。 再多的管理也无法理解美国的医疗保险计划或欧洲的共同农业政策。 德鲁克将这种短视归咎于自马基雅维利以来政治理论家们忽视了“政府的适当职能可能是什么”和“政府应该对什么负责”。 即使撇开德鲁克对历史的狭隘解读（黑格尔和约翰·斯图尔特·密尔对政府的适当限制和职能有一些广泛讨论的观点），认为这都是政治理论的错的观点看起来也像是在推卸责任。 管理理论对公司应该做什么和不应该做什么有非常强烈的看法，

The public sector seems to have subscribed to the notion that a problem can be fixed merely by managing it well. No amount of managing can make sense of America's medicare program or Europe's common agriculture policy. Drucker blames this shortsightedness on political theorists who since Machiavelli have neglected "what the proper functions of governments might be" and "what governments should be accountable for." Even leaving aside Drucker's narrow reading of history (Hegel and John Stuart Mill had certain widely discussed ideas about the proper limits and functions of government), the idea that it is all political theory's fault looks like passing the buck. Management theory has remarkably strong views about what companies should and should not do, and it should play a role in working out the core competencies of the state.

管理利维坦：公共部门家里有医生吗？！

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector Is There a Doctor in the House?!

谴责管理理论家在公共部门的失败是完全公平的。 但相应地：管理理论令人失望，而不是失败。 大多数批评者倾向于忽视理论家到来之前公共部门的状况。 例如，管理理论“摧毁”了员工士气的指责忘记了二战以来大多数国家每隔十年就会出现一次“公务员危机”。 （一本同名的书在 1960 年代在英国引起了广泛讨论——这个时期现在被传统主义者尊为黄金时代。）

It is perfectly fair to castigate management theorists for their failures in the public sector. But proportionately: management theory has been a disappointment, not a failure. Most of its critics tend to ignore the state of the public sector before the theorists arrived. For example, the charge that management theory has "destroyed" staff morale forgets that there has been a "crisis in the civil service" in most countries in every decade since the Second World War. (A book by that name was much discussed in Britain in the 1960s—a period now revered by the traditionalists as a golden age.)

管理理论改善公共部门最明显的例子是私有化。 看看从布宜诺斯艾利斯到伯明翰的任何私有化电话服务的表现，你会发现，尽管人们抱怨新所有者赚取的利润，但很少有人愿意回到（至少在布宜诺斯艾利斯）你拥有贿赂官员只是为了让你的电话接通。 美国公共部门管理出现问题的原因之一是地方政客（印第安纳波利斯市市长史蒂文戈德史密斯除外）一直对将服务转移到私营部门感到紧张。

The most obvious example of management theory improving the public sector is privatization. Look at the performance of any privatized telephone service from Buenos Aires to Birmingham and you discover that, although people moan about the profits being made by the new owners, few want to return to the days when (in Buenos Aires, at least) you had to bribe an official just to get your phone connected. One reason for the problems of public sector management in America is that local politicians (with a few notable exceptions such as Steven Goldsmith, the mayor of Indianapolis) have been nervous about moving services into the private sector.

那些仍然是公共部门的公共部门呢：学校、医院等等？ 正是在这一领域——公共部门的核心——令人失望的名单越来越长，公众的不满情绪最为明显。 一开始值得一提的是：管理理论的批评者往往对没有它会发生什么事视而不见。 总的来说，管理理论的介绍经常是出于错误的原因而被不恰当地介绍； 它还严重打击了有关组织的士气。 然而，总的来说，它带来了进步——也许没有达到它本来可以取得的进步，但肯定比之前混乱的世界要多。 它基本上赢得了政治争论，因为它的反对者希望调整它的改革而不是推翻它们。 作为支持本论文的案例研究，

What about those parts of the public sector that have remained public: schools, hospitals, and so on? It is in this area—the heart of the public sector—that the list of disappointments lengthens and public dissatisfaction is most obvious. It is worth saying one thing at the start: that critics of management theory are often heroically blind to what would have happened without it. In general, management theory has often been introduced ineptly and for the wrong reasons; it has also wreaked havoc with the morale of the organizations concerned. However, on balance, it has brought progress—perhaps not as much as it could have, but certainly more than in the muddled world that preceded it. It has basically won the political argument, in that its opponents want to adapt its reforms rather than reverse them. As a case study to support this thesis, we offer one that opponents of public sector management theory would probably also choose: the British National Health Service (NHS).

在外人看来，NHS 一直是英国福利国家皇冠上的明珠。 然而，对于内部人士来说，这是一场管理噩梦。 这部分是因为它的规模——在其历史的大部分时间里，它

To outsiders the NHS has been the jewel in the crown of Britain's welfare state. To insiders, however, it has been a managerial nightmare. This is partly because of its size—for most of its history, it has

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

是仅次于红军的欧洲第二大雇主——部分原因是它长期以来充满不满。 “NHS 最显着的特点之一，”1960-63 年的卫生部长伊诺克·鲍威尔 (Enoch Powell) 指出，“是持续不断、震耳欲聋的抱怨声从它的每个部分日夜升起，只有当有人时，合唱声才会中断表明完全不同的系统可能更可取。......它展示了一项事业的独特景象，它被参与其中的每个人都搞砸了。”

been the second largest employer in Europe after the Red Army—and partly because it has long seethed with discontent. "One of the most striking features of the NHS," noted Enoch Powell, minister for health in 1960-63, "is the continual, deafening chorus of complaint which rises day and night from every part of it, a chorus only interrupted when someone suggests that a different system altogether might be preferable. ... It presents what must be a unique spectacle of an undertaking that is run down by everyone engaged in it."

从理论上讲，一个不愉快的机构应该欢迎变革； NHS 从来没有。 工作人员相信，无论事情多么糟糕，多管闲事的政客只会让事情变得更糟。 员工（集中且可见）的权力与客户（无组织且分散）的利益之间存在危险的不匹配。 尽管如此，保守党最终还是在 1980 年代末决定改组国家医疗服务体系； 并且它决定按照一位管理理论家建议的方式这样做。

In theory an unhappy institution should welcome change; the NHS never has. The staff are convinced that, however bad things are, they will only be made worse by meddling politicians. And there is a dangerous mismatch between the power of the employees (who are concentrated and visible) and the interests of the customers (who are unorganized and dispersed). Nevertheless, the Conservative Party eventually decided to shake up the National Health Service in the late 1980s; and it decided to do so along lines suggested by a management theorist.

它的大师是阿兰·恩索芬，罗伯特·麦克纳马拉的美国弟子。 在国防部为他心目中的英雄工作后，他发现了健康经济学家的第二职业，在斯坦福大学担任主席，并成为杰克逊霍尔集团的关键人物，该集团由在怀俄明州度假胜地开会的医疗保健专家组成每年。 1985 年 6 月，在参观了英国国家医疗服务体系后，恩托芬为《经济学人》撰写了一篇文章，主张对 NHS 进行全面改革，该文章在保守党的激进右翼中广为流传，并成为最终改革的基础。 9

Its guru was Alain Enthoven, an American disciple of Robert McNamara. Having worked for his hero at the Defense Department, he discovered a second career as a health economist, holding a chair at Stanford University and becoming a key figure in the Jackson Hole Group, a collection of health-care specialists who meet at the Wyoming resort every year. In June 1985, after a tour of the English National Health Service, Enthoven wrote an article for The Economist arguing for a comprehensive reform of the NHS that was widely circulated amongst the radical right of the Conservative Party and was the basis for the eventual reforms. 9

Enthoven 认为，NHS 结构“缺乏对良好绩效的真正激励。它依赖于奉献和理想主义。它是由不同提供者群体的利益冲突推动的。但它提供了很少的积极激励来做得更好为病人。” Enthoven 的解决方案是一个内部市场，基于三大结构性变化。

Enthoven argued that the NHS structure "suffers from a lack of real incentives for good performance. It relies on dedication and idealism. It is propelled by the clash of the interests of different provider groups. But it offers few positive incentives to do a better job for patients." Enthoven's solution was an internal market, based around three big structural changes.

第一个是医疗保健的购买者（通常是卫生当局）和一系列竞争提供者（医院等）之间的分歧。 在老式的 NHS 中，医生做出了所有关于资源分配的最重要决定：结果是大量现金用于高科技手术和花生用于预防医学。 在以市场为基础的 NHS 中，购买者的工作是评估

The first was a division between the buyers of health care (usually health authorities) and a range of competing providers (hospitals and the like). In the old-fashioned NHS, doctors made all the most important decisions about allocating resources: the result was pots of cash for high-tech surgery and peanuts for preventative medicine. In the market-based NHS, the job of the buyers would be to assess the

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

人口的健康需求并尽可能有效地满足他们； 供应商将竞相提供服务和成本的最佳组合。

health needs of the population and to meet them as efficiently as possible; the providers would compete to produce the best combination of service and cost.

第二个变化是引入价格。 在老式的 NHS 中，资源是根据历史事故和行政命令分配的。 这意味着太多的钱流向了快速空无一人的内城（那里拥有古老的医院），而流向繁荣的郊区的钱太少了。 它还造成了效率陷阱。 成功的医院吸引了更多的病人，却没有吸引更多的资源； 不成功的医院在失去资源的同时失去了病人。 在新的 NHS 中，钱会跟着病人走。

The second change was to introduce prices. In the old-fashioned NHS, resources were allocated by historical accident and administrative fiat. This meant that too much money went to fast-emptying inner cities (which boasted ancient hospitals) and too little to the flourishing suburbs. It also created an efficiency trap. Successful hospitals attracted more patients without attracting more resources; unsuccessful hospitals lost patients without losing resources. In the new NHS money would follow patients.

第三个变化是将管理决策下放到尽可能低的级别。 老式 NHS 的问题在于，它几乎没有给医生提高效率的动力，但却给了他们游说更多资源的动力。 解决问题的最好方法是抱怨资金不足，希望能给你更多的钱。 恩托芬希望医院能够自我管理。

The third change was to devolve managerial decisions to the lowest possible level. The problem with the old-fashioned NHS was that it gave doctors few incentives to improve their efficiency but every incentive to lobby for more resources. The best way to solve a problem was to complain about underfunding in the hope that you might be given more money. Enthoven wanted hospitals to be self-managing.

这个想法似乎是为了吸引玛格丽特·撒切尔。 事实上，她的本能是远离她称之为 NHS 的“政治垃圾陷阱”。 她的政策是花更多的钱——1979 年到 1987 年间，实际的健康支出增加了 33%——而不是问基本问题。 1987 年的选举宣言，其中包括将水私有化等想法，除了对 NHS 的陈词滥调之外什么都没有。

This idea seemed calculated to appeal to Margaret Thatcher. In fact, her instinct was to stay well clear of the "political heffalump trap," as she called the NHS. Her policy was to spend more money— real expenditure on health increased by 33 percent between 1979 and 1987—rather than ask fundamental questions. The 1987 election manifesto, which included ideas like privatizing water, contained nothing but platitudes on the NHS.

这一切在 1987 年冬天发生了变化。撒切尔夫人刚赢得 1987 年大选，NHS 似乎就土崩瓦解了。 由于缺乏资金，全国各地的医院都关闭了病房。 报纸过多地报道了因一分钱一分货的撒切尔主义而杀害心有空洞的婴儿的故事。 撒切尔夫人再次试图购买和平：她给了 NHS 额外的 1 亿英镑。 但无济于事。 最终在一个名为“全景”的电视节目中，她被一位采访者激怒了，以至于她宣布了对 NHS 进行总理审查的计划，这让所有人都大吃一惊，包括公务员、部长，甚至她自己。

All this changed in the winter of 1987. No sooner had Mrs. Thatcher won the 1987 general election than the NHS seemed to fall apart. Hospitals up and down the country closed wards for lack of funds. Newspapers overdosed on stories of hole-in-the-heart babies killed by penny-pitching Thatcherism. Once again Thatcher tried to buy peace: she handed the NHS an extra £100 million. But to no avail. Eventually on a television program, "Panorama," she was so needled by an interviewer that she announced plans for a prime ministerial review of the NHS, taking everybody by surprise, civil servants, ministers, and even herself.

很难说源于恐慌的想法是长期规划的结果。 然而，在其他方面，NHS 评论代表了管理理论的胜利。 传统上，英国政府的审查更像是为伟人和善人创造就业机会的计划，解决模糊的问题并需要数年时间才能出现； 这

It is hard to claim that an idea born of panic was the result of long-term planning. Yet, in other ways, the NHS Review represented a triumph of management theory. Traditionally, British government reviews had been more like job-creation schemes for the great and the good, addressing vague problems and taking years to appear; the

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

NHS Review 更像是管理咨询公司可能会喜欢的东西。 审查会议秘密举行，仅由首相和四名内阁成员组成。

NHS Review was much more like something a management consultancy might be happy with. The review met in secret, and consisted only of the prime minister and four cabinet members.

Enthoven 的内部市场理念很快被采纳。 起初，一些右翼分子想鼓励人们“选择退出”NHS，并带走他们的税收贡献。 这个想法被新任卫生部长肯尼思·克拉克 (Kenneth Clarke) 粉碎了，他是一位令人生畏的政治家，他好战的态度掩盖了他对中间派、支持福利国家的同情。 Clarke 还根据英国的情况调整了 Enthoven 的内部市场，将更多权力交给全科医生，这是 NHS 中最受欢迎的部分。

Enthoven's idea of an internal market was rapidly adopted. At first some right-wingers wanted to encourage people to "opt out" of the NHS, taking their tax contributions with them. This idea was squashed by Kenneth Clarke, the new health secretary and a formidable politician whose belligerent manner obscured his centrist, pro-welfare state sympathies. Clarke also adapted Enthoven's internal market to British circumstances, handing more power to general practitioners, the most popular part of the NHS.

这是 1988 年作为白皮书出现的变革蓝图。但是，在政治上，制定计划是容易的部分； 卖掉它才是真正的挑战。 在私营部门，你需要做的就是说服首席执行官。 然后，他或她可以将重组强加给组织，并解雇所有不同意的人。 政客们不仅要面对有组织的反对派，他们还需要带动公众。

This was the blueprint for change that appeared as a White Paper in 1988. However, in politics, drawing up a plan is the easy part; selling it is the real challenge. In the private sector, all you need to do is persuade the chief executive. He or she can then impose the restructuring on the organization and fire all those who disagree. Politicians not only face an organized opposition, but they need to carry the public with them.

很快就清楚了，使 NHS 审查相对高效的两件事——速度和保密性——立即在公共关系中对它产生了不利影响。 既得利益者感到被冷落和威胁。 保守党未能解释 NHS 的问题所在：医院让病人等待稀缺的床位，却坐拥繁荣城市中心的大片土地； 卫生当局抱怨他们买不起昂贵的药物，但未能利用他们的购买力压低所有供应商的价格； 伦敦的资源集中使不断增长的省份的人们短缺。

It soon became clear that the two things that had made the NHS Review relatively efficient—speed and secrecy—immediately counted against it in public relations. The vested interests felt snubbed as well as threatened. And the Tories failed to explain what was wrong with the NHS: that hospitals kept patients waiting for scarce beds but sat on acres of land in the middle of booming cities; that health authorities complained that they could not afford expensive drugs but failed to use their buying power to drive down prices from all their suppliers; that the concentration of resources in London short-changed people in the growing provinces.

工党如饥似渴地抓住了它眼中的政治优势。 工党卫生发言人罗宾·库克 (Robin Cook) 说：“上帝保佑，政府要把它放在脖子上。” 在过去的十年里，保守党一直在私有化从天然气到水的一切。 为什么不健康？ 如果您不打算将医院推向私营部门，为什么要让医院自治？ 反复的民意调查显示，大多数选民认为托利党执意要将 NHS 私有化。

The Labour Party seized its perceived political advantage hungrily. "By God, the government is going to get it in the neck," said Labour's health spokesman, Robin Cook. The Tories had spent the last decade privatizing everything from gas to water. Why not health? Why make hospitals self-governing if you do not plan to push them into the private sector? Repeated opinion polls revealed that the majority of voters believed that the Tories were bent on privatizing the NHS.

比工党的运动更有效的是英国医学协会 (BMA) 的运动。 它的步兵，医生们，每天看诊成千上万的病人，把他们的

Even more effective than the Labour Party's campaign was that of the British Medical Association (BMA). Its footsoldiers, the doctors, who saw hundreds of thousands of patients a day, littered their

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

等候室里有 BMA 传单，并向任何愿意倾听的人表达他们的不满。 一位中层部长在例行拜访他的全科医生时，还没来得及脱掉衬衫，就被对改革的弊端进行了 25 分钟的长篇大论。

waiting-rooms with BMA leaflets and aired their grievances to anyone who would listen. One middle-ranking minister, on a routine visit to his general practitioner, was subjected, before he could get his shirt off, to a 25-minute harangue on the evils of the reforms.

由于超过四分之三的选民反对改革，玛格丽特·撒切尔 (Margaret Thatcher) 感到恐慌。 1990 年 5 月，就在 NHS 法案即将成为法律的前几周，她决定暂停医疗服务的重组，直到 1992 年大选之后。 相反，达成了妥协。 改革将继续进行，但不会有“大爆炸”。 内部市场由中央小心控制。 新的流行语是“软着陆”、“没有意外”和“平稳起飞”。

With more than three-quarters of voters opposing the reforms, Margaret Thatcher panicked. In May 1990, just a few weeks before the NHS bill was due to become law, she decided that the restructuring of the health service should be put on hold until after the 1992 election. Instead, a compromise was reached. The reforms were to go ahead, but there was to be no "big bang." The internal market was to be carefully controlled from the center. The new buzzwords were "soft landing," "no surprises," and "smooth take-off."

事实上，这种妥协证明了改革的挽救。 政府说服了很大一部分医学界人士选择参加新的改革，部分原因是提供了慷慨的参与激励措施。 1990 年 12 月，57 家医院成为自治信托，1991 年 4 月，306 家全科诊所，包括 1,700 名全科医生成为“基金持有人”。 但政府也一直踩着刹车。 新的医疗合同只不过是用新奇的语言重新描述了传统关系。 根据人口数量和健康需求为卫生当局提供资金的举措被放慢了，因此伦敦地区及其关系密切的教学医院享有比他们应得的更多的慷慨资源。

In fact this compromise proved the saving of the reforms. The government persuaded a surprisingly large section of the medical profession to opt into the new reforms, partly by offering generous incentives to participate. In December 1990, 57 hospitals became self-governing trusts, and in April 1991, 306 general practices, containing 1,700 GPs became "fundholders." But the government also kept its foot firmly on the brake. The new health contracts did little more than redescribe traditional relations in new-fangled language. The move to funding health authorities on the basis of the number and health needs of the population was slowed down so that the London regions, with their well-connected teaching hospitals, enjoyed more generous resources than they deserved.

但真正挽救改革的是约翰·梅杰取代玛格丽特·撒切尔。 选民从来没有想过 NHS 在一个女人的手中是安全的，她吹嘘自己使用私人医疗保健来为公共（医院）病房腾出更多空间； 在梅杰的领导下，工党关于政府将 NHS 私有化的说法听起来不那么令人信服。

But what really saved the reforms was the replacement of Margaret Thatcher with John Major. The voters never thought the NHS was safe in the hands of a woman who boasted that she used private health care to make more room in the public (hospital) wards; under Major, Labour's talk about the government privatizing the NHS sounded less convincing.

结果，NHS 改革在他们的第一次考验中跌跌撞撞，即 1992 年的选举，梅杰在所有预测中获胜。 从那以后，政府逐渐松开了刹车。 1992 年 4 月，卫生部又创建了 100 个信托基金和 300 个 GP 基金持有人。 这意味着三分之一的 GP 是基金持有人，信托占 NHS 总预算的三分之一以上。 卫生部也更接近于根据患者数量而不是仅仅根据传统提供资金（尽管伦敦一直是一个

As a result the NHS reforms stumbled through their first test, the 1992 election, which Major won against all predictions. Since then, the government has gradually taken its foot off the brake. In April 1992 the Department of Health created a hundred more trusts and 300 more GP fundholders. This meant that a third of GPs were fundholders and that trusts accounted for more than a third of the total NHS budget. The Department of Health also moved nearer to basing funding on patient numbers rather than just on tradition (although London was always something of an

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

例外）并指示购买者在谈判合同时货比三家，以最优惠的价格购买最好的护理产品。

exception) and instructed purchasers to shop around for the best care at the best prices in negotiating their contracts.

但这值得蜡烛吗？

But Was It Worth the Candle?

在引入 NHS 改革的过程中，肯定有很多次政府希望它从未听说过 Alain Enthoven 和他的“内部市场”。 政策制定者一直面临着对其努力的两种严厉批评。 首先是，改革远没有激励 NHS，反而使它士气低落。 正如已经指出的那样，NHS 从来都不是一艘特别快乐的船，但随着管理理论家的掌舵，士气直线下降。 改革首次实施六年后，医学界仍举棋不定——过度劳累的年轻医生、工资过低的护士、不顾当地压倒性支持而面临倒闭的老旧医院，以及官僚主义的泛滥。 政府可能预料到护士工会会遭遇艰难。 然而，

There must have been many times during the introduction of the NHS reforms when the government wished that it had never heard of Alain Enthoven and his "internal market." The policy makers have been constantly confronted by two serious criticisms of their efforts. The first is that, far from galvanizing the NHS, the reforms have demoralized it. As already pointed out, the NHS has never been a particularly happy ship, but with the management theorists at the helm morale plummeted. Six years after the reforms were first introduced, the medical profession was still up in arms—about overworked young doctors, underpaid nurses, ancient hospitals that faced closure despite overwhelming local support, and the proliferation of bureaucracy. The government might have expected a rough ride from nurses' unions. However, there were also plenty of doctors who would normally vote Conservative and who ought to have felt "empowered" by their new opportunities, who instead complained that the new system meant that they now had to waste their weekends doing paper work.

第二个批评是改革鼓励了最糟糕的管理主义。 NHS 管理人员的数量在 1989 年至 1994 年间猛增了 18,000 人，而同期护理人员的数量减少了 27,000 人。 1995 年，信托公司首席执行官（医院信托公司的负责人坚持自称）的平均年薪已增至 65,000 英镑（增长速度是护士的两倍）。 NHS 经理的总管理薪酬从 1989-90 年的 1.588 亿英镑增加到 1994-95 年的 7.233 亿英镑。 在改革之前，各种形式的行政管理占 NHS 总支出的 6% 左右。 根据公共服务监管机构审计委员会的数据，1996 年的总数约为 10.5%。

The second criticism has been that the reforms have encouraged the worst sort of managerialism. The number of NHS managers leapt by 18,000 between 1989 and 1994—a period in which the number of nursing staff fell by 27,000. The average annual pay of trust chief executives (as the heads of hospital trusts insisted on calling themselves) had risen to £65,000 in 1995 (and was growing at twice the rate of that of nurses). The total managerial pay bill for NHS managers rose from £158.8 million in 1989-90 to £723.3 million in 1994-95. Before the reforms, administration in all its guises took up around 6 percent of all NHS spending. In 1996 the total stood at about 10.5 percent, according to the Audit Commission, the public services watchdog.

不仅经理们的薪水似乎过高； 他们也很笨。 NHS“物有所值”部门负责为一件熟悉的医院设备制作一个 200 字的定义。 开头是：“床：一种可能用来让病人躺下的装置或装置”——并指出这个笑话是平的

Not only did the managers seem overpaid; they were also leaden-footed. The NHS "Value for Money" unit was responsible for producing a 200-word definition of a familiar piece of hospital equipment. It begins: "Bed: a device or arrangement that maybe used to permit a patient to lie down"—noting that the joke would be even

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

如果事实并非如此，那就更有趣了。 床也不是唯一值得关注的对象。 1996 年，卫生主管们收到了一份“紧急”的三页备忘录，处理不当使用椅子的问题。

funnier if it were not actually true. Nor were beds the only object of concern. In 1996 health chief executives received an "urgent" three-page memo dealing with the wrongful use of chairs.

在某种程度上，与士气和管理主义有关的问题都被证明是可以自我纠正的。 越来越多的各类卫生服务工作者无意或有意地致力于改革。 到 1996 年 4 月，当最后一波变革发生时，超过一半的医生已经获得了对自己预算的控制权，大多数医院也实现了自治。 政府也在尽最大努力打击新管理阶层的过激行为。 卫生大臣斯蒂芬·多雷尔 (Stephen Dorrell) 在 1995 年的保守党大会上宣布，他打算在明年削减 5% 的管理开支，赢得了热烈的掌声。

To some extent both the problems to do with morale and man-agerialism are proving self-correcting. A growing number of health-service workers of all sorts are, inadvertently or deliberately, committing themselves to the reforms. By April 1996, when the final wave of changes took place, more than half of all doctors had been given control of their own budgets and the majority of hospitals had become self-governing. The government was also doing its best to combat the excesses of the new managerial class. Stephen Dorrell, the secretary of state for health, won wild applause at the 1995 Conservative Party Conference when he announced that he intended to cut spending on management by 5 percent over the next year.

到 20 世纪 90 年代中期，冷静的观察家注意到，改革已经开始产生一些预期的组织结果。 其中一些成功是相当迅速的。 接种各种疾病疫苗的儿童比例从 1989-90 财政年度的 75% 上升到 1990-91 财政年度的 90%，这要归功于对执行注射的医生实行与绩效挂钩的薪酬要素。 到 20 世纪 90 年代中期，大多数效率统计指标都显示出显着改善。 例如，尽管接受治疗的人数有所增加，但等候名单却有所减少。 到 1995 年底，在医院等待预约超过一年的人数已从五年前的 20 万人减少到 2 万人。 1994 年国王基金会的研究，

By the mid-1990s, dispassionate observers noticed, the reforms had begun to produce some of the organizational results that were hoped for. A few of these successes had been fairly rapid. The proportion of children being immunized against various diseases rose from 75 percent in the fiscal year 1989-90 to 90 percent in 1990-91, thanks to the introduction of an element of performance-related pay for doctors who performed the injections. By the mid-1990s, most statistical measures of efficiency showed notable improvements. For instance, despite an increase in the number of people being treated, waiting lists had declined. By the end of 1995 the number of people waiting for more than a year for an appointment at a hospital had fallen to 20,000, down from 200,000 five years earlier. In 1994 studies by both the King's Fund, a think tank specializing in health care, and the London School of Economics found that resources were being more closely related to needs than ever before.

内部市场的两个最重要部分——新的独立信托医院和全科医生基金持有人——也被证明比广泛的民意调查所显示的更为成功。 1994 年对医院信托的一项调查发现，48% 的患者认为自从他们的医院成为信托后，服务得到了改善，60% 的患者认为他们得到了更准时的服务。 只有 7% 的人认为他们变得更糟了。 工作人员的意见更加有利。 1994 年，伦敦政治经济学院的朱利安·勒格兰德 (Julian Le Grande) 发现 NHS 员工对改革的支持程度令人吃惊：“如果被迫在新的准法律制度之间做出选择

The two most important parts of the internal market—the new independent trust hospitals and general practitioner fundholders— have also proved to be more of a success than broad opinion polls might suggest. In 1994 a survey of hospital trusts discovered that 48 percent of patients thought services had improved since their hospital had become a trust, and 60 percent thought they got more punctual service. Only 7 percent thought they had got worse. Opinion was even more favorable among staff. In 1994 the LSE's Julian Le Grande discovered a surprising amount of support for the reforms among NHS employees: "If forced to choose between the new quasi-legal

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

市场 NHS 和旧的计划经济 NHS，他们会毫不犹豫地选择新的。”10

market NHS and the old command economy NHS, they would unhesitatingly prefer the new." 10

与此同时，全科医生基金持有人在强迫医院治疗他们的病人方面表现得如此激进，以至于工党为此批评了他们。 1995 年一项针对基金持有人的调查发现，96% 的人认为他们提供的服务质量有所提高，81% 的人声称为患者引入了新的服务。 许多医生利用他们增加的自由来即兴发挥，在他们的实践中增加了物理治疗师和手足病医生。 这反映出 NHS 内部对预防而非治疗的更广泛关注——部分归功于改革引入的各种健康目标。

Meanwhile, GP fundholders have been so aggressive in forcing hospitals to treat their patients that Labour has criticized them for it. In 1995 one survey of fundholders found that 96 percent felt that the quality of the service they offered had improved, and 81 percent claimed to have introduced new services for patients. Many doctors have used their increased freedom to improvise, adding physiotherapists and chiropodists to their practices. This reflected a wider concern within the NHS with prevention rather than cure—thanks in part to the various health targets the reforms introduced.

这样的进步让NHS改革在国外赢得了相当多的仰慕者。 令外国观察家印象深刻的是，医疗改革设法将在其他地方证明不相容的两个要素结合起来。 一方面，NHS 继续由纳税人支付，并且在交付时（大部分）免费。 但在 NHS 内部，市场机制用于确保资源的快速和灵活分配。 经济合作与发展组织1995年的一份报告将英国制度作为如何利用市场机制提高公共服务效率的典范，希拉里克林顿未能从相反的出发点达到目标美国主要的私人医疗保健系统。 在整个欧洲和澳大拉西亚，各国政府都在努力将购买者和提供者之间的划分引入其医疗保健系统。 在英国的方向上走得最远的新西兰政府鼓励地区卫生当局从公立医院（重新命名为 Crown Health Enterprises）和私立医院购买医疗保健。

Such progress has won the NHS reforms a fair number of admirers abroad. What impresses foreign observers is that the health-care reforms have managed to combine two elements that elsewhere have proved incompatible. On the one hand, the NHS continues to be paid for by the taxpayer and to be (largely) free at the point of delivery. But within the NHS market mechanisms are used to ensure the swift and flexible distribution of resources. A report of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development in 1995 held up the British system as a model for how to use market mechanisms to improve the efficiency of a public service, the goal Hillary Clinton failed to reach from the opposite starting point of America's largely private health-care system. Throughout Europe and Australasia governments are trying to introduce a division between purchasers and providers into their health-care systems. The New Zealand government, which has gone furthest in the British direction, encourages regional health authorities to purchase health care from both public hospitals (rechristened Crown Health Enterprises) and private ones.

但是政治回报呢？ 要判断成功，所有公共部门管理理论都必须在投票箱中得到回报。 从这个角度来看，NHS 改革并未赢得选票。 另一方面，改革并没有完全证明人们所预料的自残。 在整个辩论过程中，工党一直处于尴尬的境地，不得不说出它会怎么做。 这方面的一个例子是 1992 年的选举。 是的，托利党遇到了一些问题：两个 NHS 信托机构——伦敦的盖伊医院和布拉德福德将军——在利用他们新获得的自由解雇了数百名过剩员工时造成了媒体的放荡。 但很明显，无论他们

But what about the political payoff? To be judged successful, all public sector management theory has to pay off at the ballot box. From this point of view, the NHS reforms have not been a vote winner. On the other hand, the reforms have not quite proven the self-inflicted wound that people have predicted. Throughout the whole debate the Labour Party has been put in the unenviable position of having to say what it would do instead. One example of this was the 1992 election. Yes, there were a few problems for the Tories: two NHS trusts—Guy's in London and Bradford General—created a media debauch when they used their new-found freedom to sack hundreds of surplus staff. But as it became clear that, whatever they

管理利维坦：公共部门

Managing Leviathan: The Public Sector

正在做，保守党并没有将 NHS 私有化，工党不得不提出自己的新政策。 在犹豫不决之后，工党发言人罗宾库克提出了保守党想法的弱化版本：没有引擎的内部市场。 他接受了买方-供应商的拆分。 但他拒绝接受 NHS 信托或 GP 预算持有人的案例（尽管两者都越来越成功）。 库克提出的唯一真正坚定的想法是引入最低工资和取消强制竞争性招标——换句话说，将资金交给公共部门工会。

were doing, the Tories were not privatizing the NHS, the Labour Party had to come up with a new policy of its own. After much dithering, the Labour spokesman, Robin Cook, came up with an enfeebled version of the Tory idea: an internal market without the engine. He accepted the purchaser-provider split. But he refused to accept the case for NHS trusts or GP budget holders (despite the growing success of both). The only really firm ideas Cook produced were about introducing minimum wages and getting rid of compulsory-competitive tendering—in other words handing money over to the public sector unions.

公共部门的管理理论显然没有达到其追随者夸大的要求。 政客们要求理论家完成各种不可能的壮举：在改善服务的同时削减开支，或者在裁员的同时提振士气。 更肆无忌惮的理论家通过过度销售他们的产品来玩弄这些自相矛盾的幻想。 然而，对于所有不可避免的失望，管理理论显然给公共部门带来的好处多于伤害。 多亏了大师们的想法，组织变得更精简，权力界限更清晰，目标也更明确。 未来在于进一步推动延迟和外包等想法，而不是回到无理论管理的旧世界。

Management theory in the public sector has clearly not lived up to the exaggerated claims of its acolytes. Politicians have demanded that the theorists achieve all sorts of impossible feats: cut expenditure while improving services, or boost morale while slashing workforces. The more unscrupulous theorists have played on these self-contradictory fantasies by overselling their products. Yet, for all the inevitable disappointments, management theory has clearly brought more good than harm to the public sector. Thanks to the gurus' ideas, organizations are leaner, lines of authority are clearer, and objectives more clearly defined. The future lies in pushing ideas like delayering and contracting out farther still, not in returning to the old world of theory-free administration.

第十四章

CHAPTER 14

在管理理论的中心地带，通常要么存在既定的争论，要么在翻阅文献后逐渐浮出水面。 然而，一旦你走向管理理论的前沿——它与自助、哲学、未来学或彻头彻尾的庸医混杂在一起的更荒凉的领域——这种结构就会消失。 像奥克兰一样，那里通常没有“那里”。 这些未映射的区域通常是创造最大财富的地方。 向您的出版商展示一篇论证充分的关于供应链管理的长篇论文，运气好的话，您也许可以建造一个新厨房。 剃掉你的头发，根据你上一个女朋友对你的吼叫或你读到的一篇关于人口趋势的文章，拼凑出一些想法，想出一个朗朗上口的标题（“Unhinge Your Soul”，“Supertrends 2010” )，并且，如果有一点运气和勇气，您应该能够购买自己的岛屿。 或者看起来是这样。

In the heartland of management theory there is usually either an established debate or one that gradually emerges after a slog through the literature. However, once you wander off toward the frontiers of management theory—the wilder areas where it mixes with self-help, philosophy, futurology, or downright quackery—this structure disappears. Like Oakland, there is often no "there" there. These unmapped regions are often where the greatest fortunes are to be made. Present your publisher with a long, well-argued treatise on supply-chain management and, with luck, you may be able to build a new kitchen. Shave off your hair, cobble together a few thoughts based on what your last girlfriend shouted at you or on an article you read about population trends, come up with a catchy title ("Unhinge Your Soul," "Supertrends 2010"), and, with a bit of luck and a lot of nerve, you should be able to buy your own island. Or so it seems.

本章简要介绍了居住在这片土地上的奇怪但令人讨厌的富有生物。 老实说，它有点像一个破布袋，从前英国橄榄球队长到阿尔文·托夫勒和比尔·盖茨，它一直在伸展。 难道也是流氓画廊？ 不是完全。 是的，在很多情况下营销比产品更有趣。 是的，这些思想家的吸引力在不同寻常的程度上取决于他们听众的恐惧或贪婪。 但是，偶尔有

This chapter is a brief survey of the strange but annoyingly wealthy creatures who are at home in this terrain. It is, to be honest, a bit of a rag bag, stretching as it does all the way from the former English rugby captain to Alvin Toffler and Bill Gates. Is it also a rogues' gallery? Not entirely. Yes, in many cases the marketing is more interesting than the product. Yes, the thinkers' appeal rests to an unusual extent on the fear or greed of their audience. But, there is occasionally

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

他们所说的有价值的东西。 此外，正统管理理论与其脆弱边缘之间的差距似乎正在缩小。 首先考虑一下通过混合美国三大迷恋：管理理论、宗教和自助而发家致富的人。

something of value in what they are saying. Moreover, the gap between orthodox management theory and its flakier fringe seems to be narrowing. Consider first the man who has made a fortune by mixing together America's three great obsessions: management theory, religion, and self-help.

一个非常有效的人

A Very Effective Person

1970 年代初期，罗伯特·雷德福从布奇·卡西迪和圣丹斯小子那里赚得盆满钵满，开始在盐湖城以北 50 英里的数百英亩高耸的岩壁、巨大的红杉和清澈的溪流中建造自己的一小块天堂. 雷德福仍然使用圣丹斯庄园的一部分作为自己的基地。 他的其余山区度假胜地已成为一个度假胜地，提供徒步旅行、骑马、滑雪、钓鱼——当然，还有自我提升。

In the early 1970s, flush with cash from Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, Robert Redford started to build his own small chunk of paradise 50 miles north of Salt Lake City amid several hundred acres of soaring rockfaces, giant redwoods, and ice-clear streams. Redford still uses one part of the Sundance estate as his own base; the rest of his mountain retreat has become a resort, offering trekking, riding, skiing, fishing—and, of course, self-improvement.

牧场最好的客户是柯维领导力中心，该组织由斯蒂芬·柯维创立，他是一位热心的秃头摩门教徒，曾任杨百翰大学管理学教授。 全年，雄心勃勃的高管、政治家和公务员涌入牧场参加为期一周的研讨会。 他们观看柏林墙倒塌的电影。 他们阅读“智慧文学”——柏拉图、孔子和本·富兰克林等人的著作。 他们讨论了阻碍他们的公司达到最佳绩效和他们的人际关系不顺畅的问题。 他们学习如何使用 Covey 的专利个人组织者来节省时间和安排他们的优先事项。 他们爬上山，从各种人为的灾难中拯救彼此。 最重要的是——因为这是美国，而这些是“

The ranch's best client is the Covey Leadership Center, an organization set up by Stephen Covey, an earnest bald-headed Mormon and sometime professor of management at Brigham Young University. Throughout the year high-flying executives, politicians, and public servants flock to the ranch to attend week-long seminars. They watch films of the Berlin Wall collapsing. They read "wisdom literature"— books by the likes of Plato, Confucius, and Ben Franklin. They discuss the problems that prevent their companies attaining peak performance and their personal relationships from going smoothly. They learn how to husband their time and order their priorities by using Covey's patented personal organizer. They climb the mountain and rescue each other from various contrived calamities. Above all— for this is America and these are "high-potential individuals"—they break down and weep.

领导力中心的大部分活动都在距离山下 20 分钟车程的普罗沃进行。 尽管以杨百翰大学 (Brigham Young University) 为代表的摩门教根深蒂固，但普罗沃现在是世界上最活跃的科技中心之一。 你遇到的几乎每个年轻人似乎都在为 Novell 或一些小型软件公司工作，或者为 Covey 工作。 人们可能会将该镇视为柯维主义小岛的群岛：在一座建筑物中，柯维的副手计划他在美国南部的竞选活动； 在另一个方面，他们想知道他将如何征服亚洲市场； 在另一个方面，他们生产书籍、杂志、录像带和个人组织者。 很快

Most of the Leadership Center's activities take place 20 minutes' drive down the mountain, in Provo. Despite its straight-laced Mormon roots, epitomized by Brigham Young University, Provo is now one of the world's liveliest technological centers. Almost every young person you meet seems to be working for Novell or for some small software house—or for Covey. One might well look at the town as an archipelago of small islands of Coveyism: in one building Covey's lieutenants plan his campaign in the American South; in another they wonder how he will conquer the Asian market; in yet another they produce books, magazines, videotapes, and personal organizers. Soon

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

所有这些业务都将集中在他们位于普罗沃郊区的全新“园区”中。

all these operations will be bundled together in their own brand new "campus" on the outskirts of Provo.

到 1996 年，Covey 的管理培训业务成立于 1985 年，只有两名员工，雇用了 700 名员工，收入接近 1 亿美元。 它的客户包括一半以上的财富 500 强公司，其中包括 AT&T、福特、施乐和默克。 该中心与 2,900 个学区合作，帮助其中 10 个学区，特别是底特律、达拉斯和布朗克斯，成为“以原则为中心的地方”。 柯维的想法也得到了爱达荷州最低安全监狱和奥奈达印第安民族等不同机构的支持，这些机构热衷于打破对合法赌博的经济依赖。

By 1996 Covey's management training business, founded in 1985 with a staff of two, employed 700 people and had revenues of close to $100 million. Its clients include more than half of the Fortune 500 companies—among them, AT&T, Ford, Xerox, and Merck. The center works with 2,900 school districts and was helping 10 of them, including, extraordinarily, Detroit, Dallas, and the Bronx, to become "principle-centered places." Covey's ideas have also been embraced by institutions as diverse as the Idaho Minimum Security Prison and the Oneida Indian Nation, which was keen to break its economic dependence on legalized gambling.

这一巨大业务的基石是一本管理书籍《高效能人士的七个习惯》，自 1989 年出版以来已售出约 500 万册。这本书的信息很简单：为了达到你的全部潜力，你必须建立“性格”。 与其他只为人们的失败提供一系列借口的自助信条不同，Coveyism 实际上是一种相当严格的纪律：人们必须为自己的行为负责，而不是将其归咎于他人。

The foundation stone of this gigantic business is a single management book, The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People, which has sold about five million copies since it was published in 1989. The message of the book is simple enough: in order to reach your full potential, you have to build "character." Unlike other self-help creeds that just provide a set of excuses for people's failings, Coveyism is actually quite a tough discipline: people have to take responsibility for their actions, not blame them on others.

不幸的是，这种严谨并没有延伸到本书的风格。 七个习惯的前六个字是：“致同仁，赋能赋能。” 更糟的还在后头。 柯维的七个习惯中的第一个是“积极主动”； 六是“协同”。 （在与科维的谈话中，“协同作用”与“范式转变”成为最喜欢的短语。）他永远指的是“情感银行账户”和“无条件爱的存款”。

Unfortunately, this rigor does not extend to the book's style. The first six words of The Seven Habits are: "To my colleagues, empowered and empowering." Worse is to come. The first of Covey's seven habits is "be proactive"; the sixth is "synergize." (In conversation with Covey, "synergy" vies with "paradigm shift" as a favorite phrase.) He is forever referring to "emotional bank accounts" and "deposits of unconditional love."

这是令人不安的领域。 你怎么能尊重一个人，他把伊索寓言中关于下金蛋的鹅重述为生产/生产能力的“P/P 平衡”？ 一个人一本正经地声称已经确定了“全人类的普世价值体系”，你真的能当真吗？ 任何愤世嫉俗的英国记者，或者任何银行账户（无论是财务上还是情感上）不如科维的人，本能的反应就是拿起批评的斧头。

This is disturbing territory. How can you respect a man who restates Aesop's fable about the goose that laid the golden egg as "the P/Pc Balance" for production/production capability? Can you really take seriously a man who claims, straight-faced, to have identified "the universal value system of all mankind"? The instinctive response of any cynical British journalist, or perhaps just anybody whose bank account (either financial or emotional) is a little less plentiful than Covey's, is to reach for the critical hatchet.

事实上，这种反应虽然完全可以原谅，但并不完全公平。 （首先，有很多人比科维更不靠谱——我们稍后会看到。）欣赏科维的最佳方式是仔细思考他为何如此成功。 首先

In fact, this reaction, while wholly excusable, is not entirely fair. (To begin with, there are plenty of people who are considerably flakier than Covey—as we shall see later.) The best way to appreciate Covey is to consider exactly why he has been so successful. The first

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

原因很简单：他是认真的。 无论其弱点是什么，Cov-eyism 对个人责任的强调是发自内心的。 柯维自己的摩门教是终生坚定不移的。 他在客厅的墙上贴着一份家庭使命宣言，他从不抽烟喝酒。 通过在英格兰和爱尔兰的五年传教工作，他培养了自己作为公共演说家的技能，以及通过教学让人们学习的习惯。 他是那种可以毫不尴尬或不自觉地说：“我们不是具有精神体验的人类。我们是具有人类体验的精神存在。”

reason is simple enough: he means it. Whatever its weaknesses, Cov-eyism's emphasis on personal responsibility comes from the heart. Covey's own Mormonism has been lifelong and unflinching. He keeps a family mission statement on the wall of his sitting room, and he has never smoked or drunk alcohol. He cultivated his skills as a public orator, and his habit of getting people to learn by teaching, through five years of missionary work in England and Ireland. He is the sort of man who can say without a hint of embarrassment or self-consciousness: "We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience."

柯维也不是来自大棒的锥形脑袋狂热分子。 在回到当地大学杨百翰大学之前，他曾在犹他大学和哈佛商学院学习商业。 在攻读博士学位时。 论文（“1776 年以来的美国成功文学”），柯维发现，在共和国的头 150 年里，大多数成功文学都集中在性格问题上。 但在第二次世界大战后不久，人们开始对外表和风格等肤浅的事物更感兴趣。 科维开始宣扬人们需要回到性格塑造的古老纪律。 很快，他在杨百翰的课程就吸引了数百名学生。 1985 年，他放弃了教授职位，将他所有的一切都赌在了柯维领导力中心。

Nor is Covey some cone-headed fanatic from the sticks. He studied business at both the University of Utah and Harvard Business School, before moving back to his local university, Brigham Young. While doing his Ph.D. thesis ("American Success Literature since 1776"), Covey discovered that, for the first 150 years of the Republic, most success literature concentrated on questions of character. But shortly after the Second World War people became more interested in superficial things such as appearance and style. Covey started to preach that people needed to get back to the ancient discipline of character building. Soon his classes at Brigham Young were attracting hundreds of students. In 1985 he gave up his professorship and gambled everything he had on the Covey Leadership Center.

柯维成功的第二个解释是他经营着一家极其高效的企业。 柯维毫不掩饰地希望将该中心变成世界上最大的跨国自助组织。 例如，在普罗沃，科维将自己从公司的日常运营中抽离出来，将权力交给了一群忠诚的副手，他们中的许多人都来自他自己的大家庭，以便让自己有更多时间专注于“高杠杆机会”——与公司老板打交道，通过卫星广播，与政客打交道。 与此同时，七个习惯在当地巧妙地催生了自己的销售队伍。 与其仅仅将这本书视为一种快速的情绪锻炼，还敦促读者将结构和系统落实到位，使这些改变成为永久的习惯。 将善意变成习惯的最好方法是开始教授您所学的知识。 结果是，科维的追随者在全国各地组织读书会，成为培训师，充当教练——并传播信息。

The second explanation for Covey's success is that he runs an extremely efficient business. Covey is unapologetic about wanting to turn the center into the world's biggest multinational self-help organization. In Provo, for instance, Covey has removed himself from the day-to-day operations of his company, handing power to a loyal cadre of lieutenants, many of them from his own huge family, so as to give himself more time to concentrate on "high-leverage opportunities"— dealing with company bosses, giving broadcasts by satellite, and mixing with politicians. Meanwhile, on the ground The Seven Habits has ingeniously spawned its own sales force. Rather than just treating the book as a quick emotional workout, readers are urged to put the structures and systems in place to make those changes into permanent habits. The best way to turn good intentions into habits is to start teaching what you have learned. The result is that all around the country Covey's acolytes are organizing reading groups, becoming trainers, acting as coaches—and spreading the word.

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

这条管道吸收的产品也不短缺。 该中心已经有了另一本畅销书，即以原则为中心的领导力（1992 年），并且在他兄弟的帮助下，柯维正在准备《高效能家庭的七个习惯》（旨在治愈美国家庭）。 它还在扩展其个人组织者业务，与微软合作生产软件版本。 （Covey 组织者与普通组织者不同的一点是，每周，它都会迫使您设置优先级并组织您的约会。）

Nor is there any shortage of products for this pipeline to suck up. The center already has another best-seller on its hands, Principle-Centered Leadership (1992), and, with the help of his brother, Covey is preparing The Seven Habits of Highly Effective Families (aimed at healing the American family). It is also expanding its personal-organizer business, teaming up with Microsoft to produce a software version. (The point of a Covey organizer as opposed to a normal one is that, each week, it forces you to set priorities as well as to organize your appointments.)

但科维决心将业务推向两个方向。 第一个是海外。 科维认为他的想法是美国特有的，更不用说摩门教了。 《七个习惯》有 28 种语言和 35 个国家/地区的版本：翻译成韩语后几乎立即售出 650,000 册，日本和中国的需求量都在增长。 第二次扩张将深入美国陷入困境的公共部门。 在这里，科维拥有强大的盟友。 能源部长哈泽尔·奥利里 (Hazel O'Leary) 在担任北方各州电力公司副总裁时发现了柯维的错误：现在她为政府第十大部门的所有员工提供七个习惯的培训。 比尔·克林顿（他在 1994 年的感恩节与柯维一起躲在戴维营）在一次关于美国工作场所未来的会议上说，如果人们只读《七个习惯》，美国的生产力将会飙升。 共和党人也不热衷于落后：柯维在纽特·金里奇 (Newt Gingrich) 关于美国文明的书中写了一个章节。

But Covey is determined to push the business in two directions. The first is overseas. Covey bridles at the thought that his ideas are peculiarly American, let alone Mormon. The Seven Habits is available in 28 languages and 35 countries: almost as soon as it was translated into Korean it sold 650,000 copies, and demand is swelling in both Japan and China. The second expansion will be deep into America's troubled public sector. Here Covey has powerful allies. Hazel O'Leary, the energy secretary, caught the Covey bug when she was vice-president of Northern States Power: now she offers training in the seven habits to all the employees of the government's tenth largest department. Bill Clinton (who spent Thanksgiving in 1994 holed up in Camp David with Covey) told a conference on the future of the American workplace that American productivity would soar if people would just read The Seven Habits. Nor are the Republicans keen to be left behind: Covey penned a chapter in Newt Gingrich's book on American civilization.

或许将管理、宗教和自助相结合可以保证拥有大量观众：毕竟科维正在实现美国梦——经济成功和精神救赎一气呵成。 当然，他的想法吸引了许多绝望的人，他们认为读一本书和买一个组织者可以将他们从浪费时间的懒汉转变为效率模型。 但柯维也说服了许多受人尊敬的公司也放弃了他们的资金。

Perhaps mixing management, religion and self-help guaranteed a gigantic audience: after all Covey is delivering the American dream— both economic success and spiritual salvation in one go. Certainly his ideas have attracted plenty of desperate people who think that reading a book and buying an organizer can transform them from time-wasting slobs into models of efficiency. But Covey has also persuaded many respectable companies to part with their money too.

换句话说，如果消息本身没有一些独特的卖点，仅仅意味着你所说的和知道如何销售它并没有多大意义。 柯维成功的第三个原因是，在所有关于赋能的可怕言论背后，他的想法实际上与主流管理理论有一定的关联。

Put another way, merely meaning what you say and knowing how to sell it does not mean much if the message itself does not have some unique selling point. The third reason that Covey has been successful is that, underneath all that frightful talk about enabling, his ideas actually have some relevance to mainstream management theory.

大多数管理思想家都沉迷于公司组织及其控制和奖励系统。 从弗雷德里克·泰勒

Most management thinkers are obsessed with corporate organization and its systems of control and reward. From Frederick Taylor

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

对再造工程师来说，将人视为阅兵场上的士兵的想法由来已久：理论家专注于尝试将他们置于最有效的模式中。 即使是“人际关系学派”——像道格拉斯麦格雷戈这样的思想家，他在科维在哈佛读书时对他产生了重大影响——也主要关注改善职业阶梯和让员工入股公司。 Coveyism 从个人开始 - 并在将他们安置到他们的位置之前着手改善他们。 柯维主义是对品格的全面管理，对灵魂的再造。

to the reengineers, there has been a long tradition of thinking about people as if they are soldiers on the parade ground: the theorists have concentrated on trying to put them into the most effective patterns. Even the "human relations school"—thinkers such as Douglas McGregor who had a big influence on Covey when he was a student at Harvard—has mostly been concerned with improving career ladders and giving workers a stake in the company. Coveyism starts with individuals—and sets out to improve them before slotting them into their place. Coveyism is total-quality management for the character, reengineering for the soul.

愤世嫉俗者认为，柯维满足了那些希望将应对工作动荡的责任转移给广大公民的公司的需求。 《工作的终结》一书的作者杰里米·里夫金批评柯维为“适时就业”创造了心理条件。 科维的学生没有在一份短期工作和另一份短期工作之间的时间里喝酒和去播种，而是这样做“磨快锯子”——他用这句话来改善他们的身心健康。 有趣的是，了解有多少与科维一起在山上奔波的 AT&T 经理后来在这家电话巨头的大规模重组中被裁员——更有趣的是，了解有多少人从普罗沃回来策划重组。

Cynics argue that Covey serves the needs of corporations that want to shift the responsibility for coping with job turbulence to the citizenry at large. Jeremy Rifkin, the author of The End of Work, has criticized Covey for creating the psychological conditions for "just-in-time employment." Instead of spending the time between one short-term job and another drinking and going to seed, Covey's pupils do so "sharpening the saw"—his phrase for improving their mental and physical health. It would be interesting to know how many of the AT&T managers who scampered around the mountains with Covey were later downsized in the telephone giant's huge restructuring—and even more interesting to know how many returned from Provo to plot that restructuring.

尽管如此，“性格”似乎确实是管理理论家讨论的有效话题。 科维的魅力之一在于，他试图从头脑简单的自助提供者（暗示你可以像改变内衣一样容易地改变性格）和社会服务机构（这通过将一切归咎于“系统”来忽略性格问题）。 与此同时，柯维的基本理念——企业应该考虑个人的感受以及他们工作所在的组织结构——正在取得进展。 见证公司现在派遣重新设计的员工参加激励课程； 或开设道德和领导力等软学科课程的商学院。

All the same, "character" does seem to be a valid topic for management theorists to discuss. One of the attractions of Covey is that he has tried to rescue "character" from both the simple-minded purveyors of self-help (who imply that you can change your character as easily as your underwear) and the social-service establishment (which ignores questions of character by blaming everything on "the system"). Meanwhile, Covey's basic idea—that businesses should think about how individuals feel as well as about the organizational structures in which they work—is gaining ground. Witness the firms now sending reengi-neered employees on motivational courses; or the business schools offering courses in such soft subjects as ethics and leadership.

提高自己

Improve Yourself

柯维赢得像 IBM 这样的组织的原因之一是，按照他管理理论领域的标准，他似乎非常合格。 想想他的主要竞争对手之一安东尼

One reason that Covey has won over organizations like IBM is that, by the standards of his area of management theory, he seems alarmingly well qualified. Consider one of his main rivals, Anthony

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

罗宾斯是一名学校看门人，后来成为“巅峰教练”，仅他的研讨会一年就赚了 5000 万美元（根据他自己的估计），他的客户包括比尔克林顿、安德烈阿加西和威尔士王妃。 “戴安娜钦佩他的干劲、活力和乐观，”她的传记作者安德鲁莫顿评论道，“而这位美国百万富翁讲师已经感觉到，在痛苦和悲伤之外潜伏着一个勇敢、坚强的女人。” 1个

Robbins, a school janitor turned "peak performance coach" who makes $50 million a year from his seminars alone (according to his own estimates) and whose clients include Bill Clinton, Andre Agassi, and the Princess of Wales. "Diana admires his drive, energy and optimism," commented her biographer, Andrew Morton, "while the American millionaire lecturer has sensed that beyond the suffering and sadness lurks a brave, strong woman." 1

罗宾斯比秃头的科维更引人注目——他将近 7 英尺高，是超人的绝配——而且在享受他的劳动成果时，他没有表现出对手的自我克制。 他将时间分配在他位于加利福尼亚州圣地亚哥的城堡和他在斐济的岛屿之间，城堡配有直升机停机坪。 罗宾斯在《唤醒内心的巨人》（1991 年）和《无限的力量》（1987 年）等书中所传达的信息的精髓是，只要采取正确的态度，您就可以实现任何想要的目标：只要思考，它就会实现你的。 为了使他的案例深入人心，他结合了朴素的智慧、积极的思维技巧、令人振奋的案例研究和不折不扣的表演技巧。

Robbins is an even more arresting sight than the spectacularly bald Covey—he is almost 7 feet tall and a dead ringer for Superman—and he shows none of his rival's self-restraint when it comes to enjoying the fruits of his labors. He divides his time between his castle in San Diego, California, which comes complete with a helicopter pad, and his island in Fiji. The essence of Robbins's message, laid down in books such as Awaken the Giant Within (1991) and Unlimited Power (1987), is that you can achieve anything you want just so long as you adopt the right attitude: just think and it will be yours. To drive home his case he uses a blend of homespun wisdom, positive thinking techniques, uplifting case studies and out-and-out showmanship.

罗宾斯认为，冥想和吟唱可以用来释放“右脑”的创造力。 然而，释放个人力量的主要方式似乎是掏腰包参加罗宾斯举办的“释放内心力量”研讨会。 这些吸引了成千上万的人，是福音布道和魔法盛会之间的交叉。 当一些观众赤脚走过数以千计的燃烧的煤炭时，达到了高潮，除了积极思考的力量外别无他物。 （不知道克林顿还是戴安娜王妃是否完成了这一壮举；他们的权力是私下释放的。）

Meditation and chanting, argues Robbins, can be used to unlock the creative capacities of the "right brain." However the main way to unleash one's power seems to be opening one's wallet to attend an Unleash the Power Within seminar, given by Robbins. These attract thousands of people and are a cross between an evangelical sermon and a magical extravaganza. The high point comes when some members of the audience walk barefoot across thousands of burning coals, protected by nothing other than the power of positive thinking. (It is not known whether Clinton or Princess Diana completed this feat; their power was unleashed in private.)

如果罗宾斯与更广阔的管理理论世界有任何关联，那么不幸的是，它与我们擦肩而过。 然而，罗宾斯方案（就此而言，柯维方案也一样）的一个吸引力在于它们都是自我提升的一站式商店。 这使他们比自助行业的同行更具优势，后者通常只提供改善我们绩效的一个方面。 市场已经无可救药地细分了。 例如，Morris Shechtman，一位“企业心理治疗师”（也是 Newt Gingrich 的另一位仰慕者），专门研究减少企业重组造成的“创伤和痛苦”（他去过国会大厦

If Robbins has any relevance to the wider world of management theory, it has unfortunately passed us by. However, one attraction of the Robbins package (and, for that matter, of the Covey package too) is that they are both one-stop shops for self-improvement. This gives them an edge over their peers in the self-help industry who usually offer to improve just one aspect of our performance. The market has become hopelessly segmented. For instance, Morris Shechtman, a "corporate psychotherapist" (and another of Newt Gingrich's admirees), specializes in reducing the "trauma and distress" caused by corporate restructuring (he has been to the Capitol

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

帮助共和党人理解“悲伤过程对公共政策的影响”）——管理行业的另一部分声称，只要妥善整理你的办公桌，你就可以从根本上提高你的工作效率——美国有一个全国专业组织者协会来证明它。

to help Republicans understand "the impact of grieving process on public policy")- Another part of the management industry claims that you can radically improve your productivity simply by organizing your desk properly—and the United States has a National Association of Professional Organizers to prove it.

最肥沃的部分之一可能被描述为心理体操。 在这里，无冕之王是横向思维之父Edward de Bono。 德博诺并不缺乏自信：他的一本书的副标题是“从苏格拉底到德博诺思想”。 德博诺的书中充满了巧妙的谜题，旨在让你意识到解决问题的最佳方法往往是从侧面：“思想必须摇摆才能跳跃，”德博诺说。 尽管如此，现代柏拉图最值得注意的一点是，在其他人出于无聊而摇摇晃晃地进入不同的牧场之后很久，他就有能力耕种一条犁沟。 自 1967 年以来，德博诺一直在撰写有关横向思维的书籍并举办研讨会。尽管横向思维经常被学术界蔑视， 它为德博诺提供了财富和影响力。 在他位于威尼斯的私人岛屿上，他向委内瑞拉、新加坡和保加利亚的大公司和教育官僚机构提供建议。

One of the most fertile segments might be described as mental gymnastics. Here, the uncrowned king is Edward de Bono, the father of lateral thinking. De Bono is not short on self-confidence: the subtitle of one of his books is From Socratic to de Bono Thinking. De Bono's books are full of clever puzzles designed to make you realize that the best way to approach a problem is often from the side: "the mind must wobble before it can leap," argues De Bono. Nevertheless, the most notable thing about the modern Plato is his ability to plow a single furrow long after lesser men would have wobbled into a different pasture out of sheer boredom. De Bono has been writing books and giving seminars on lateral thinking since 1967. Though lateral thinking has often been treated with disdain by academics, it has provided de Bono with both wealth and influence. From his private island in Venice he dispenses advice to giant corporations and the educational bureaucracies of Venezuela, Singapore, and Bulgaria.

当今最普遍的自我完善哲学属于新时代主题。 New Agers 在技术问题上意见不一，无休止地争论手牵手、冥想或诵经是否是生活中最好的方式； 但他们似乎都同意所谓的“牛顿范式”的可怕性。 艾萨克·牛顿 (Isaac Newton) 因将原子论方法合法化而受到谴责，因为在这个世界中，事物可以被孤立地看待。 新时代者——包括 Peter Senge（见第 6 章）在内的一个类别——对量子物理学、控制网、混沌理论、认知科学、东西方精神传统或任何揭示万物相互关联的事物印象更深：你不能在不影响另一个的情况下改变世界的一点。

Today's most pervasive self-improvement philosophy comes under the New Age rubric. New Agers disagree about technical questions, endlessly debating whether hand-holding, meditation, or chanting are the best ways to get on in life; but they all seem to agree on the awful-ness of something called "the Newtonian paradigm." Isaac Newton is condemned for legitimizing an atomistic approach to the world where things can be looked at in isolation. New Agers—a category that includes Peter Senge (see Chapter 6)—are much more impressed by quantum physics, cybernets, chaos theory, cognitive science, Eastern and Western spiritual traditions—or indeed anything that reveals that everything is interconnected with everything else: that you cannot change one bit of the world without affecting another.

这一切似乎都离管理很远。 但兜售新时代万灵药的管理咨询公司似乎生意兴隆。 一些咨询公司通过说服经理跳舞来帮助他们阐明他们的“商业愿景”； 其他人则将他们打扮成德鲁伊和女巫，让他们踏上对“龙与地下城”的神秘探索。 位于加利福尼亚州大苏尔的 Esalen Institute 帮助人们做

This may all seem a long way away from management. But management consultancies peddling New Age cure-alls of one kind or another seem to be doing flourishing business. Some consultancies help managers clarify their "business visions" by persuading them to dance; others by dressing them up as druids and witches and setting them off on the mythical quest for "Dungeons and Dragons." The Esalen Institute, located at Big Sur in California, helps people do

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

从减轻压力到提高创造力的一切。 一家名为 Decision Development 的英国公司使用美国印第安医学轮来帮助管理者发现他们的内在自我。 在日本，另一个智库，东京的 Mukta Institute，帮助公司进入佛教思维模式。 不出所料，Maharishi 基金会已经建立了一所管理学院，专门通过冥想和悬浮“培训管理人员为他们的公司带来持续的成功和持续的进步”。

everything from reducing their stress to enhancing their creativity. A British company, Decision Development, uses the American Indian Medicine Wheel to help managers discover their inner selves. In Japan an alternative think tank, the Mukta Institute in Tokyo, helps companies tap into Buddhist modes of thought. Predictably enough, the Maharishi Foundation has set up a school of management that specializes in "training managers to bring unfailing success and continuing progress to their companies" through meditation and levitation.

这些大师都宣扬同样诱人的信息：我们取得的成就远远低于我们能够取得的成就； 如果我们了解自己，设定适当的目标，消除内心的障碍，并将恐惧转化为力量，我们就可以缩小承诺与成就之间的差距。 他们也以或多或少相同的方式传播他们的信息。 他们永远在拟定清单。 柯维有“七个习惯”； 罗宾斯有“通往财富和幸福的五把钥匙”和 365 堂自学课程，其中第 364 课是“记住期待奇迹……因为你就是其中之一。” 他们还沉迷于隐喻，他们在自己的作品中不断重复这些隐喻，并详尽地阐述这些细节。 科维喜欢来自自然界的隐喻； 有时，他看起来像钱西·加德纳（Chancy Gardiner），令人担忧，

These gurus all preach the same seductive message: that we achieve far less than we are capable of achieving; and that we can close the gap between promise and achievement if we understand ourselves, set appropriate goals, remove inner blockages, and transform fear into strength. They also preach their message in more or less the same ways. They are forever drawing up lists. Covey has "seven habits"; Robbins has "five keys to wealth and happiness" and 365 lessons in self-mastery, of which the 364th is "remember to expect miracles . . . because you are one." They are also addicted to metaphors, which they repeat throughout their writings and dwell on in loving detail. Covey likes metaphors from the natural world; at times, he seems worryingly like Chancy Gardiner, the character played by Peter Sellers in the film Being There: "The sequential leadership development can be likened to a tree."

冲浪

Surfing the Wave

释放所有这些隐藏的力量并不是什么好事，除非你知道你想用它去哪里。 如前所述，大师们最看重的能力之一就是预见未来的能力。 大多数主流管理理论家都专注于为公司找出应对不断变化的世界的最佳方法（见第 7 章），而不是试图预测会发生什么。 然而，也有一个边缘学派的未来学家。

Unleashing all this hidden power is not much good unless you know where you wish to ride with it. As already noted, one of the most highly prized abilities among the gurus is the ability to see into the future. Most mainstream management theorists have concentrated on trying to work out the best ways for companies to cope with a changing world (see Chapter 7) rather than trying to predict what will happen. However, there is also a fringe school of futurologists.

几乎所有的未来学家都是技术决定论者，他们坚信历史的动力在于蒸汽机和计算机芯片。 未来学充满了关于从大型机社会向 PC 社会过渡的激动人心的讨论，伴随而来的是巨型官僚机构的崩溃和小型灵活组织的胜利。 总的来说，这种类型是无可挽回的悲观：有很多人谈论工人不可避免地被排挤

Nearly all the futurologists are technological determinists, convinced that the motor of history lies in steam engines and computer chips. Futurology is full of excited talk about the transition from a mainframe society to a PC society, with the attendant collapse of giant bureaucracies and triumph of small, nimble organizations. On the whole, the genre is irredeemably pessimistic: there is a lot of talk about the inevitability of workers being pushed out of the way by

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

机器（我们在第 9 章中讨论过）。 每场灾难的未到来并没有扼杀这种流派，正如世界末日未到来并没有扼杀宣扬它的邪教一样。

machines (which we have dealt with in Chapter 9). The nonarrival of each disaster does no more to kill the genre than the nonarrival of the end of the world kills cults that preach it.

尽管如此，值得注意的是，往往是更乐观的作者做得最好。 例如，已售出 800 万册的 Megatrends（1983 年）和包括 Megatrends Asia（1995 年）在内的各种衍生作品的作者约翰·奈斯比特承认，未来可能会遇到问题——尤其是政府将被技术变革步伐加快； 但总的来说，他说未来会让我们所有人过得更好。 这种活泼的乐观主义使他成为“世界顶级社会预测家之一”。 然而，读他的书，人们很难想到其中有什么以前没有说过的——或者任何没有建立起来的智慧。 即使是短暂的访问，比如说，曼谷也应该足以展示亚洲的大趋势：“

All the same, it is noticeable that it is often the more optimistic authors who do best. For instance, John Naisbitt, author of Megatrends (1983), which has sold eight million copies, and sundry spinoffs, including Megatrends Asia (1995), admits that the future may have its problems—governments in particular will be left in the dust by the quickening pace of technological change; but, in general, he says the future will make us all a good deal better off. This jaunty optimism has helped turn him into "one of the world's top social forecasters." Reading his books, however, one is hard-pressed to think of anything in them that has not been said before—or anything that is not already established wisdom. Even a fleeting visit to, say, Bangkok should be enough to show the Asian megatrend: "people moving from the villages to megacities." Similarly, a quick dinner with any Asian economist could have unearthed the megatrend that many Asian industries are changing from "labor-intensive to high technology."

奈斯比特的主要技能是包装工，而阿尔文·托夫勒则更大胆一些。 他的第一本书《未来冲击》（Future Shock，1970 年）以大胆的声明开篇：“从现在到 21 世纪的短短三年时间里，数百万心理正常的普通人将面临与未来的突然碰撞。” 在托夫勒的案例中，这种冲突表现为巨额资金涌入他的银行账户。 这本书售出数百万，并使托夫勒（和他的妻子海蒂）成为国际巡回演讲的常客。 它还为两个后续行动铺平了道路，第三次浪潮（1980 年）和 Powershift（1990 年）。

While Naisbitt's chief skill is as a packager, Alvin Toffler is a little more daring. His first book, Future Shock (1970), opened with a bold statement: "In the three short decades between now and the twenty-first century, millions of ordinary, psychologically normal people will face an abrupt collision with the future." In Toffler's case, this collision took the form of gigantic amounts of money pouring into his bank account. The book sold in its millions and turned Toffler (and his wife, Heidi) into a regular feature on the international lecture circuit. It also paved the way for two follow-ups, The Third Wave (1980) and Powershift (1990).

托夫勒的吸引力在于给人的印象是他了解广泛的历史。 他以马克思主义者的身份开始了生活（对任何技术决定论者来说都是一个合适的开始）； 他在南方组织了民权抗议活动，并在一家汽车厂工作了多年。 如今，他受到自由至上主义右翼的崇拜：他被罗纳德里根和乔治布什邀请到白宫共进晚餐，在共和党州长会议上发表主旨演讲，并且（不可避免地）受到纽特金里奇的崇拜。

Toffler's appeal lies in the impression that he understands the broad sweep of history. He started life as a Marxist (an appropriate beginning for any technological determinist); he organized civil rights protests in the South and worked for years in a car factory. Nowadays he is worshipped by the libertarian right: he was invited to dinner in the White House by both Ronald Reagan and George Bush, has given a keynote address to a meeting of Republican governors, and (inevitably) is worshiped by Newt Gingrich.

托夫勒将历史分为三个阶段（或浪潮）：农业时期，持续到 18 世纪； 工业的，一直延续到现在； 现在是信息时代。 信息时代是

Toffler divides history into three stages (or waves): the agricultural, lasting to the eighteenth century; the industrial, lasting to the present; and, now, the information age. The information age is

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

结束了工业时代一些最熟悉的特征——大众化（大规模生产、大众市场、大众政党、大众媒体）、从众（公司男人和他的 Stepford 妻子）——并迎来了一个截然不同的世界。 计算机芯片同时带来了全球化（通过将我们都排在队伍的末端来消除距离）和去大众化（将人群分解为微小的利益集团）。 托夫勒对商业的未来形态非常感兴趣（他遵循德鲁克关于知识工作者和虚拟公司重要性的观点）。 但他更原始的想法往往是政治性的。 例如，他建议多数人统治应该被“以少数人为基础的二十一世纪的民主”所取代，这种民主更少地依赖选举产生的议会，而更多地依赖电子公民投票，

bringing the end of some of the most familiar features of the industrial age—massification (mass production, mass markets, mass political parties, mass media), conformity (company man and his Stepford wife)—and is ushering in a very different world. The computer chip is simultaneously bringing globalization (killing distance by putting us all at the end of the line) and demassification (dissolving crowds into tiny interest groups). Toffler is quite interesting about the future shape of commerce (he follows Drucker's line on the importance of knowledge workers and virtual companies). But his more original thoughts tend to be political. For instance, he suggests that majority rule should be replaced with a "minority-based, twenty-first-century democracy," relying less on elected assemblies than on electronic referendums, and less on central than on local government.

适当地，到 20 世纪 90 年代中期，技术决定论者被技术专家——一群新的“数字大师”推到一边。 这些人中的大多数人似乎天生手上就有一台电脑。 经典的数字大师是 Nicholas Negro-ponte，他是麻省理工学院媒体实验室的多媒体大祭司。 但该小组还包括数字人士的党刊《连线》的执行主编凯文凯利和经济学家乔治吉尔德，他似乎比硅谷的大多数人更了解计算机。 数字大师们全神贯注于研究微芯片、个人电脑和互联网对我们其他人意味着什么。 他们的吸引力在于，他们比托夫勒和奈斯比特等人更接近前沿——因此也更具原创性。 以吉尔德为例， 是最早意识到计算机网络重要性的人之一。 然而，这种对技术的喜爱也可能是一种弱点：他们似乎常常认为它不会带来任何不良后果。

Appropriately, by the mid-1990s the technological determinists were being pushed to one side by the technologists—a new group of "digital gurus." Most of these people seemed to have been born with a computer in their hands. The classical digital guru is Nicholas Negro-ponte, the high priest of multimedia who works at MIT's Media lab. But the group also includes Kevin Kelly, the executive editor of Wired, the party organ of the digerati, and George Gilder, an economist who seems to know more about computers than most people in Silicon Valley. The digital gurus are preoccupied by working out what the microchip, PC, and Internet mean for the rest of us. Their attraction is that they are much closer to the cutting edge than people like Toffler and Naisbitt—and consequently far more original. Gilder, for instance, was one of the first people to realize the importance of computer networks. Yet this affection for technology can also be a weakness: they often seem to believe that nothing ill can come of it.

这种丝毫没有减弱的乐观情绪肯定比沉闷的“工作结束”人群的低语更有说服力。 但技术专家们似乎无法抑制地乐观——尤其是他们最近招募的比尔·盖茨 (Bill Gates)。 The Road Ahead 是盖茨的信息高速公路指南（他非常不喜欢这个词）。 尽管他针对特定人群提出了一些问题，但他的语气是乐观的。 是的，网络上的“无摩擦资本主义”将使许多中介机构（如旅行社和零售商）破产。 但消费者会受益——不同类型的旅行社和零售商将会出现。 是的，更多有钱人将在国内工作，

This unabated optimism is certainly more convincing than the murmurings of the dreary "End-of-Work" crowd. But the technologists can seem irrepressibly upbeat—none more so than their most recent recruit, Bill Gates. The Road Ahead is Gates's guide to the information highway (a phrase he rightly dislikes). Although he spells out a few problems for particular groups of people, his tone is optimistic. Yes, "friction-free capitalism" on the net will put many intermediaries, such as travel agents and retailers, out of business. But the consumer will gain—and different sorts of travel agents and retailers will arise. Yes, more rich people will work at home in the country,

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

但这并不一定意味着贫民窟将不复存在。 当盖茨谈到可以让我们的生活更轻松的小发明时，这本书变得最生动，例如可以用作电话、钱包和日记的小型计算机。

but that does not necessarily mean that ghettoes will cease to be. The book comes most alive when Gates talks about gizmos that will make our lives easier, such as small computers that will act as phones, wallets, and diaries.

但是与管理理论有什么联系吗？ 并不真地。 盖茨做出了一个有趣的预测，尽管到目前为止，计算机革命通过将以前只有大公司才能获得的信息触手可及来帮助小公司，但计算机革命的下一个网络阶段可能会通过提供一种方法来帮助大公司把很多人聚集在一起； 但他并没有真正跟进。 诸如《未来之路》之类的书籍往往属于与管理理论平行但从未完全符合的类别。 猜测未来会怎样是一个非常有利可图（且有趣）的游戏。 但管理涉及当下的决策。 即使你知道未来会怎样，你也只赢了一半。 然后你必须组建一个组织来利用它。

But is there any link with management theory? Not really. Gates makes the interesting prediction that, although the computer revolution has generally helped small companies so far by putting at their fingertips information that was previously only available to larger companies, the next networking phase of the computer revolution may help big ones by providing a way to bring a large number of people together; but he does not really follow it up. Books such as The Road Ahead tend to fall into a category that runs parallel to management theory but never quite meets it. Guessing what the future will be is a very profitable (and entertaining) game. But management involves decisions in the present. Even if you know what the future will be, you have only won half the battle. You then have to put together an organization to take advantage of it.

下来吧

Come on Down

在两个方面，盖茨不是典型的新大师：他不需要钱，而且他知道如何经营一家公司。 在过去的几年里，管理理论已经开始像一座淘金热中的小镇：你不仅被贪婪的恶臭淹没，还遇到了最不平凡的人。 走进一家书店，在德鲁克的《公司的概念》旁边，您会找到诸如《耶稣 CEO：运用古老的智慧实现有远见的领导力》和《让它成为现实：下一代星际迷航的领导力课程》等书籍，更不用说一大堆带有标题的书籍了就像与鲨鱼一起游泳和与狮子一起咆哮。

In two respects Gates is not a typical new guru: he has no need of money and he knows how to run a company. Over the past few years, management theory has begun to resemble a town in the middle of the gold rush: not only are you overwhelmed by the stench of greed, you also run into the most extraordinary people. Walk into a bookshop and alongside Drucker's The Concept of the Corporation you can find titles such as Jesus CEO: Using Ancient Wisdom for Visionary Leadership and Make It So: Leadership Lessons from Star Trek the Next Generation, not to mention a menagerie of books with titles like Swim with the Sharks and Roaring with the Lions.

一个清晰可辨的群体是哲学家。 由于对腐败、污染和老板薪水不断上涨的担忧，最近伦理学研究的热潮促使商学院邀请哲学家参加当天的活动，以推测他们的贸易与管理之间的联系。 现在他们正在离开他们的象牙塔（低工资和恶毒的政治）并更直接地出售他们的技能。 欧洲拥有一百多个“哲学实践”，由来自学术界的难民组成，他们愿意就广泛的主题提供建议，从不断变化的自然

One clearly discernible group are the philosophers. The recent boom in studying ethics, fueled by worries about corruption, pollution, and the escalating salaries of bosses, has encouraged business schools to invite philosophers across for the day to speculate about the link between their trade and management. Now they are leaving their ivory towers (with their low pay and bitchy politics) and selling their skills more directly. Europe boasts more than a hundred "philosophic practices," staffed by refugees from academia willing to offer advice on a wide range of subjects, ranging from the changing nature

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

懒惰的权利。 2 第一个此类实践于 1989 年在德国开设，但最喜欢这种方法的国家是荷兰，有 20 个。哲学家的故乡法国只有 3 个。

of work to the right to be lazy. 2 The first such practice was opened in Germany in 1989, but the country that has the greatest affinity for the approach is the Netherlands, with 20. France, the home of the philoscphes, has only 3.
