第二组（真的应该更了解）是最初的“未被承认的人类立法者”：诗人。 一些现代吟游诗人感受到了公司支票簿的召唤。 现居西雅图的约克郡人戴维·怀特 (David Whyte) 撰写了《唤醒的心：美国企业中的诗歌与灵魂保护》一书。 他对公司的“演讲”包括朗诵诗歌和民间故事，旨在激发经理们的创造力。 他曾为 AT&T、波音和 Dana 提供咨询服务。 诗人加入了小说家的行列。 Elie Gol-dratt 的《目标》（1989 年）是过去几年最畅销的管理书籍之一，它讲述了生产经理如何应对全面质量管理的复杂性。

The second group (which really ought to know better) is the original "unacknowledged legislators of mankind": poets. A few modern bards have felt the calling of the corporate check book. David Whyte, a Yorkshireman now based in Seattle, has written The Heart Aroused: Poetry and the Preservation of the Soul in Corporate America. His "lectures" to corporations consist of recitals of poems and folk-tales, intended to stir managers' creative juices. He has consulted for AT&T, Boeing, and Dana. Poets have been joined by novelists. One of the best-selling management books of the last few years is Elie Gol-dratt's, The Goal (1989), which tells of how a production manager grapples with the complexities of total-quality management.

第三个更大的群体由体育人士组成。 考虑到经理们对体育的热情和管理作家对体育类比的喜爱，这种思想的碰撞或许是不可避免的。 但最新的管理时尚，强调教练和团队建设，已经公开邀请年迈的体育明星将自己变成管理大师。 不用说，特别需要教练。 1996 年 3 月，纽约时报请几位普通的管理作家评估最近两本畅销书的内容，即 Pat Riley（洛杉矶湖人队）的 The Winner Within: A Life Plan for Team Players (1993) 和 Sacred Hoops ( 1995) 菲尔·杰克逊。 3 审计的一般结论相当不足为奇：

A third and much bigger group is composed of sports people. Perhaps this meeting of minds was inevitable, given the enthusiasm of managers for sport and the fondness of management writers for sporting analogies. But the latest management fads, with their emphasis on coaching and team-building, have been an open invitation for aging sports figures to turn themselves into management gurus. Needless to say, coaches are in particular demand. In March 1996, The New York Times asked several normal management writers to assess the content of two recent best-sellers, The Winner Within: A Life Plan for Team Players (1993) by Pat Riley (of the LA Lakers) and Sacred Hoops (1995) by Phil Jackson. 3 The general conclusion of the audit was fairly unsurprising: that most of what the coaches were saying about the importance of goals and teamwork was familiar motivational stuff but that the coaches had an undoubted talent for getting their message across through memorable examples.

第四组管理闯入者可能被描述为知识交易者——从其他学科批发思想的人。 例如，混沌理论（它已经从物理学转向金融经济学——取得了不同程度的成功）也时不时地出现在管理理论中：一些人认为公司不应该再试图形成战略，因为战略是一种人工制品线性思维，而我们现在生活在一个非线性的世界中，微小的事件可以导致巨大的胜利或

The fourth group of management interlopers might be described as intellectual traders—people who import ideas wholesale from other disciplines. For instance, chaos theory (which has already migrated from physics to financial economics—with mixed success) pops up from time to time in management theory too: some people argue that companies should no longer try to form strategies, because strategies are an artefact of linear thinking, and we now live in a non-linear world, where tiny events can cause gigantic triumphs or

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

灾难。 然而最近，生物学而不是物理学似乎方兴未艾。

disasters. Recently, however, biology rather than physics seems to be in the ascendant.

该领域最杰出的思想家是 Ichak Adizes。 他认为，公司和个人一样，都有生命周期，要忍受每个发展阶段的正常困难，并冒着婴儿死亡和早衰等人类疾病的风险。 年轻时他们灵活但过于情绪化； 年老时，他们可以控制自己的情绪，但往往会固步自封； 理想是正值盛年。 尽管这似乎不是一个特别令人吃惊的洞察力，但 Adizes 通过数十本书、录音带、时事通讯、位于贝莱尔的 Adizes 研究所以及遍布全球的“经过认证的 Adizes 专业人员”网络，以惊人的方式推销它。

The most prominent thinker in this field is Ichak Adizes. He argues that companies have life cycles, just like individuals, enduring the normal difficulties of each stage of development and running the risk of such human ills as infant death and premature ageing. When young they are flexible but overemotional; when old they have their emotions under control but tend to be set in their ways; the ideal is to be in their prime. Although this does not seem like a particularly startling insight, Adizes sells it with astonishing panache, through dozens of books, tapes, newsletters, an Adizes Institute in Bel Air, and a network of "certified Adizes Professionals" all round the world.

我这一代

My Generation

有人可能会争辩说，像柯维、罗宾斯或阿迪兹这样的人并没有什么新鲜事。 半个世纪前，拿破仑·希尔 (Napoleon Hill) 凭借一本名为《思考致富》(Think and Grow Rich, 1937) 的书发了大财。 希尔赚钱的能力只等于他赔钱的能力。 尽管如此，他还制定了在他位于卡茨基尔的牧场上建立“世界上第一所大学规模的成功学校”的计划，并担任大公司的顾问。 他的影响超越了坟墓：纽特·金里奇 (Newt Gingrich) 将《思考致富》列为对他影响最大的一本书。

One could argue that there is nothing new about the likes of Covey, Robbins, or Adizes. Half a century ago, Napoleon Hill made a fortune out of a book entitled Think and Grow Rich (1937). Hill's capacity to make money was only equaled by his ability to lose it. Still, he also drew up plans to found "the world's first university-sized success school" on his ranch in the Catskills and acted as a consultant to major companies. And his influence reaches beyond the grave: Newt Gingrich lists Think and Grow Rich as one of the books that most influenced him.

不同的是，近来现代拿破仑希尔斯与受人尊敬的商业理论家之间的差距似乎已经缩小。 以 Gemini 为例，这是一家知名的咨询公司，其客户中有一些世界上最大的公司。 1995 年，公司的两位主要顾问弗朗西斯·古亚尔 (Francis Gouillart) 和詹姆斯·凯利 (James Kelly) 出版了一本书，旨在展示公司的知识资历。 然而，没有人在选择组织转型时会因为其论点的严谨性而重新振作起来； 相反，你会觉得自己穿越时空回到了伍德斯托克的帐篷：

The difference is that these days the gap between the latter-day Napoleon Hills and respectable business theorists seems to have narrowed. Take for instance, Gemini, a well-known consultancy that lists some of the world's biggest companies among its clients. In 1995 two of its leading consultants, Francis Gouillart and James Kelly, produced a book intended to demonstrate the firm's intellectual credentials. However, no one picking up Transforming the Organization comes away reinvigorated by the rigor of its arguments; rather, you feel as if you have wandered back through time to a tent at Woodstock:

现在是时候用更有机的观点取代我们对商业的机械观点，并赋予我们公司最近发现的生物本质以一种新的灵性，这种灵性承认个体人类生命的神圣性和对个人的同情。 4个

It is time to replace our mechanistic view of business with a more organic one, and to endow the recently discovered biological nature of our corporations with a new spirituality that recognizes the sanctity of individual human life and has compassion for individuals. 4

新领域

NEW FRONTIERS

作者敦促公司忘记支配地位和卓越地位，成为“受人喜爱和尊重的机构”。 但通往这一理想目标的道路并不容易，他们建议道：“就像人一样，当公司同时拥抱自己内心的英雄和反派，包括他们的灵魂和影子时，他们就会变得更加完整和可信。” 5 他们谈论突破“不情愿和否认的墙”——他们希望借助一种叫做生物再工程的东西来完成这一壮举。 6个

The authors urge companies to forget about dominance and preeminence, and become "loved and respected institutions." But the path to this desirable end is not easy, they advise: "Like people, corporations become more whole and more credible when they embrace both the hero and the villain within themselves, both their soul and its shadow." 5 They talk about breaking through "walls of reluctance and denial"—a feat that they hope to accomplish with the help of something called bio-reengineering. 6

挑剔双子座的男人有点不公平。 各种传统的管理思想家越来越多地关注敏感的主题，在这些主题中，即使你愿意，也很难做到严谨。 1990 年代大师们宣扬的许多想法可能是海特·阿什伯里 (Haight Ashbury) 发明的：从命令和控制转向扁平化组织； 将权力交给工人； 梦想愿景而不是规划战略； 放眼全球，而不仅仅是国内。 此外，思想家只对他们的市场做出反应。 公司觉得他们已经“从他们的组织中重新塑造了灵魂——他们需要通过派遣员工进行精神探索来恢复这种灵魂。

Picking on the men from Gemini is a little unfair. Conventional management thinkers of all kinds are increasingly looking at touchy-feely themes where it is difficult to be intellectually rigorous, even if you want to be. Many of the ideas preached by the gurus of the 1990s might have been invented in Haight Ashbury: shifting from command and control to flat organizations; handing power down to workers; dreaming up visions rather than planning strategies; thinking globally rather than just nationally. Besides, the thinkers are only responding to their market. Companies feel that they have "reengi-neered the soul out of their organizations—and that they need to restore that soul by sending their workers off on a spiritual quest.

看到过去几年中一些最赚钱的公司明显具有“新时代”的味道，“放手一搏”的诱惑就更大了。 “放松……感受你的幸福，”位于英格兰苏塞克斯海岸利特尔汉普顿的 Body Shop 接待区的一个大标语恳求道。 工人们穿着印有“绝种永存”字样的 T 恤在这个地方闲逛。 Body Shop 卡车的标语是“练习随意的善意和毫无意义的美丽行为”。 员工参加“价值观会议”，他们会在会上讨论是什么让公司对他们来说特别。 内部电话列表按名字的字母顺序排列：是安妮塔，而不是罗迪克夫人。

The temptation to "let it all go" is all the greater seeing that some of the most profitable companies of the last few years have had a decidedly "new age" flavor. "Lighten up . . . feel your bliss," implores a large sign in the reception area of the Body Shop in Littlehampton, on England's Sussex coast. Workers stroll around the place wearing T-shirts proclaiming "extinct is forever." Body Shop trucks bear slogans like "practice random kindness and senseless acts of beauty." Employees attend "values meetings," where they discuss what makes the company special to them. The in-house phone list is alphabetized by first names: it is Anita, not Mrs. Roddick.

对这种方法的兴趣正在蔓延到边缘之外。 在美国，新时代智库 Global Business Network 由 AT&T、沃尔沃和日产等公司承保。 Procter & Gamble 和 Du Pont 正在为他们的员工提供“个人成长体验”，以鼓励他们更有创造力，并让他们对公司成果有更深的“主人翁感”。 AT&T 已派出数百名中层管理人员参加位于马萨诸塞州沃本市的一家公司 Transpective Business Consulting 的课程，每人收费 1,650 美元，通过以下方式帮助人们成为更好的领导者

Interest in this approach is spreading beyond the fringe. In the United States, a New Age think tank, Global Business Network, is underwritten by companies such as AT&T, Volvo, and Nissan. Procter & Gamble and Du Pont are offering their employees "personal growth experiences," to encourage them to be more creative and give them a deeper sense of "ownership" of company results. AT&T has sent hundreds of middle managers on courses at Transpective Business Consulting, a company in Woburn, Massachusetts, which, for $1,650 a person, offers to help people become better leaders by

野外漫步

A Walk on the Wild Side

让他们适应自己。 IBM 的“适应未来”研讨会向员工介绍了中国的神谕易经。 Lotus Development Corporation 有一个“灵魂委员会”，确保公司不辜负其价值观。 就连老“中子”杰克韦尔奇也喋喋不休地说要人们“在口袋和灵魂上”得到回报。

getting them to tune in to themselves. IBM's "fit for the future" seminars introduce employees to I Ching, a Chinese oracle. Lotus Development Corporation has a "soul committee" that makes sure the company lives up to its values. Even old "Neutron" Jack Welch babbles about wanting people to be rewarded "in both the pocket and the soul."

1991年，英国早餐电视台Tv-am在被拍卖时采取了新时代战略，力图夺回特许经营权。 该公司澳大利亚董事长布鲁斯·金格尔 (Bruce Gyngell) 为其员工安排了一次“个人成长研讨会和发展研讨会”，邀请他们集中精神能量和内心平静，以期不仅更新他们自己，还更新他们的特许经营权。 不幸的是，专营权去了别处。 如此高调的玩笑也不局限于私营部门。 美国陆军当前的口号“尽你所能”是从人类潜能运动中借用的。 每个星期三，在华盛顿的世界银行，一群银行员工围成半圆形坐着，试图“联系”。

In 1991, Tv-am, a British breakfast television station, adopted a new age strategy in its effort to regain its franchise when it was auctioned. Bruce Gyngell, the company's Australian chairman, arranged a "personal growth seminar and development workshop" for his staff, at which they were invited to focus their spiritual energy and inner peace, with a view to renewing not just themselves but their franchise. Unfortunately, the franchise went elsewhere. Nor are such high jinks confined to the private sector. The U.S. Army's current slogan, "Be all that you can be," is borrowed from the human potential movement. Every Wednesday, at the World Bank in Washington, a group of bank employees sits in a semicircle and tries to "connect."

在某种程度上，边缘与主流之间的差距正在缩小，因为在 1960 年代，蒂莫西·利里 (Timothy Leary) 被认为是一位严肃的思想家，这一代人正在进入商业、咨询和学术界的高级职位。 与愤世嫉俗（或明智）的前辈相比，这一代人对古怪想法的接受程度要高得多。 他们也已经达到了人生的一个阶段，他们已经建立了成功的事业，有了几个孩子，并开始寻找生活的更深层意义：即使是希拉里克林顿，作为律师兼政治家，你可能会这样冷酷在任何地方都能找到，已经开始谈论“意义的政治”，这是另一个 50 多岁的迈克尔勒纳发明的概念。

In part, the gap between the fringe and the mainstream is narrowing because the generation that came of age in the 1960s, when Timothy Leary was regarded as a serious thinker, is moving into senior positions in business, consultancy, and academia. Members of this generation are much more open to wacky ideas than their more cynical (or sensible) seniors. They have also reached a stage in their lives when they have built up successful careers, had several children, and started looking for the deeper meaning of life: even Hillary Clinton, as hard-faced a lawyer-cum-politician as you are likely to find anywhere, has taken to talking about the "politics of meaning," a concept invented by another 50-something, Michael Lerner.

这一切都很好——除了两件事。 首先（如 Gemini 书所示），当管理理论漫游到这些新领域时，它似乎失去了它最初拥有的任何结构和连贯性。 其次，这些边缘地区更加依赖营销而不是内容。 边缘人物在他们唤起的恐惧和他们承诺满足的希望中更加无拘无束。 Covey、Robbins、Toffler 和 Adizes 等人的标志是营销上的炫耀。 从来没有人指责斯蒂芬·柯维买下他自己的书，以便将它们推到畅销书榜首。 他没有必要。

This is all very well—except for two things. First (as the Gemini book shows), when management theory wanders off into these new territories, it seems to lose whatever structure and coherence it had in the first place. And, second, these fringe areas rely even more extravagantly on marketing rather than content. The fringe figures are far more unrestrained in the fears they conjure up and the hopes they promise to satisfy. The hallmark of men such as Covey, Robbins, Toffler, and Adizes is marketing panache. Nobody has ever accused Stephen Covey of buying up copies of his own books in order to propel them to the top of the best-seller list. He has no need to.

结论：一门不成熟的学科

Conclusion: An Immature Discipline

最狂热的经理们不会去普通的假期，而是通过参观世界上经营最好的公司来放松一下。 经验丰富的游客已经参观过日本的丰田市，观看精益生产的实际应用，或参观过佛罗里达州的迪斯尼乐园，学习已故的沃尔特叔叔的“精灵尘”管理人员的方法。 现在，他们队伍中顽固的背包客渴望更多异国情调的吸引力，例如 Springfield ReManufacturing，一家向员工展示其所有财务数据的柴油发动机制造商，以及另一家美国公司 Johnsonville，这次是一家以其能力而闻名的香肠制造商团队建设。

Instead of going on ordinary holidays, the most fanatical managers relax by taking tours of the world's best-run companies. Experienced tourists have already visited Toyota City in Japan to see lean manufacturing in action or Disney World in Florida to learn the late Uncle Walt's "pixie dust" formula for managing people. Now the hardened backpackers in their ranks crave ever more exotic attractions such as Springfield ReManufacturing, a maker of diesel-engines that shows its employees all its financial figures, and Johnsonville, another American company, this time a sausage-maker renowned for its ability in team building.

我们自己的管理理论家之行是一次奇异的经历。 拜访哈佛商学院的 Michael Porter 或 Michael Jensen，您会发现这位理论家是一位受人尊敬的学者，他们为学术期刊撰写文章，争论计量经济学的要点，甚至做一些常规的评分工作他们的学生论文。 参观史蒂芬·柯维的领导力中心，您可以将理论家视为治疗师，鼓励他的客户谈论他们内心深处的感受。 在任何 Tom Peters 研讨会上买个座位，观察理论家作为布道者，告诉他的听众最新的流行语可能意味着破产和难以想象的财富之间的区别。

Our own tour of management theorists has been a bizarre experience. Drop in on Michael Porter or Michael Jensen at the Harvard Business School and you catch sight of the theorist as a respectable academic, churning out articles for learned journals, arguing over the finer points of econometrics, and even doing the regular grunt-work of marking their students' papers. Visit Stephen Covey's leadership center, and you can see the theorist as therapist, encouraging his clients to talk about their innermost feelings. Buy a seat at any Tom Peters seminar to observe the theorist as preacher, telling his audience that the latest buzzword can mean the difference between bankruptcy and unimaginable riches.

结论

Conclusion

在其他学科中，很少有个人过失发挥如此大的作用。 在撰写有关管理的文章时，许多大师只是在写他们自己——以及他们明显不正常的生活。 如果像 Charles Handy 一样，您已经是投资组合员工，那么相信投资组合员工会容易得多。 想象未来属于那些具有全球“安克雷奇心态”的人很容易想到双语日本人，例如 Kenichi Ohmae。 如果汤姆·彼得斯 (Tom Peters) 最终选择了鲁尔谷而不是硅谷，那么这个世界可能会以 Thriving on Order 告终。

In few other academic disciplines do personal peccadilloes play such a large part. In writing about management, many of the gurus are simply writing about themselves—and their decidedly abnormal lives. Believing in portfolio workers is so much easier if, like Charles Handy, you are one already. Imagining that the future belongs to those with a global "Anchorage mentality" comes easily to a bilingual Japanese, such as Kenichi Ohmae. If Tom Peters had ended up in the Ruhr Valley rather than Silicon Valley, the world might have ended up with Thriving on Order.

即使与管理理论世界的短暂接触也会留下两个直接印象。 首先是巨大的商业成功。 哈佛大学的教授们在不照顾学生的时候，就会飞去参加会议或为大公司提供建议。 Covey's Leadership Center 与领先的软件公司竞争，成为 Provo 最成功的企业。 像彼得斯这样有才干的演讲者，举办一天的研讨会赚的钱相当于许多中层管理人员一年赚的钱。 作者与一位最著名的大师之间就谁是最贪婪的理论家这一主题进行的一次随意谈话产生了太多的嫌疑人，无法一一列举。

Even a brief encounter with the world of management theory leaves two immediate impressions. The first is of enormous commercial success. When not ministering to their students, the Harvard professors are jetting off to conferences or offering advice to giant companies. Covey's Leadership Center vies with leading software companies as the most successful enterprise in Provo. Speakers of the caliber of Peters can earn as much giving a seminar for a day as many middle managers earn in a year. One casual conversation between the authors and one of the best-known gurus on the subject of who was the greediest theorist produced too many suspects to name.

第二个印象是管理理论是大杂烩。 终身教授的书与地地道道的江湖骗子的书在书脊上擦肩而过。 管理咨询公司可以在一些有价值的研究上花一大笔钱，然后通过不必要的推销行为来贬低自己。 在谈话中，每一位大师都可以从真正的洞察力或学识转瞬即逝，转而变得非常平庸。

The second impression is that management theory is a mishmash. The books of tenured professors rub spines with those of out-and-out charlatans. Management consultancies can spend a small fortune on some worthy piece of research and then demean themselves with an exhibition of needless hucksterism. In conversation, every guru can move in a flash from a point of genuine insight or scholarship to one of extraordinary banality.

大师们巨大的商业成功与他们产出的多变性息息相关。 迄今为止，管理理论最多产生了一位“伟大”的思想家：彼得·德鲁克。 然而，即使是德鲁克也发现不可能年复一年地提出突破性的想法，因为现在行业要求他这样做。 小作家面临着更艰巨的任务。 许多人投机取巧地跳到其他学科的管理理论。 他们的第一或第二本书可能包含一个真正的见解。 现在，被他们交易的附属品——他们自己的咨询、巡回演讲、图书合同、第三套房子的抵押贷款——所包围，他们不得不大量生产材料，希望能偶然发现下一个伟大的想法。 即使他们能够找到另一种见解（

The gurus' enormous commercial success and the variability of their output are linked. So far, management theory has produced, at most, one "great" thinker: Peter Drucker. However, even Drucker has found it impossible to come up with breakthrough ideas year after year, as the industry now demands that he should. Lesser writers face an even harder task. Many jumped opportunistically to management theory from other academic disciplines. Their first or second book included perhaps one genuine insight. Now, surrounded by the paraphernalia of their trade—their own consultancy, the speaking tours, the book contract, the mortgage payments on their third home—they are obliged to churn out material, hoping to stumble across the next big idea. Even if they were capable of finding another insight (which

结论

CONCLUSION

在许多情况下看起来不太可能），他们不太可能以这种方式偶然发现它。

in many cases looks unlikely), they are unlikely to stumble across it this way.

大师的案例

The Case for the Gurus

可以理解的是，这么多垃圾的存在导致许多人对管理理论锁、库存和桶不屑一顾。 在写这本书的过程中，我们多次遇到同样的反应：你怎么能把时间浪费在这种垃圾上？ 我们听到了一长串关于管理理论的抱怨，这些抱怨往往带有惊人的尖酸刻薄：它是对学术学科的道歉，在方法论上草率，是时尚的奴隶； 说服公司进行永续革命，对公司造成巨大伤害； 它的从业者是最糟糕的江湖骗子，收取巨额费用只是为了将常识转化为荒诞不经的行话。

The existence of so much junk has understandably led many people to dismiss management theory lock, stock, and barrel. In writing this book we have repeatedly come across the same reaction: how can you waste your time on such rubbish? We have listened to a long list of complaints, often delivered with striking vitriol, about management theory: that it is an apology for an academic subject, methodologically sloppy and a slave to fashion; that it causes huge harm to companies by persuading them to engage in perpetual revolution; and that its practitioners are charlatans of the worst sort, charging gargantuan fees for nothing more useful than translating common sense into grotesque jargon.

我们希望在本书中提出的第一点是，有一门学科值得称为管理理论：可以从公司的行为中提取一般经验教训，并可以用来帮助其他公司更好地运营。 成功的管理理念不仅仅是一些当地知识，受文化和环境的影响。 它们可以旅行，并且经过适当修改后，可以用于在其他地方——其他国家和行业——复制这种成功。 例如，日本人采纳了美国人关于质量控制的理念，并用它们来创造精益生产； 美国人随后重新引入精益生产，并用它来振兴摇摇欲坠的汽车工业。 公共部门借鉴了私营部门的想法； 优秀的公司借鉴了摩托罗拉、丰田和麦当劳等管理领跑者的理念。

The first point we hope to have made in this book is that there is a discipline worth calling management theory: that general lessons can be extracted from what companies do and can be used to help other companies operate better. Successful management ideas are not just bits of local knowledge, fixed by culture and circumstances. They can travel and, suitably modified, can be used to reproduce that success elsewhere—in other countries and industries. The Japanese, for one, took American ideas about quality control and used them to create lean production; the Americans then reimported lean production and used it to galvanize their faltering car industry. The public sector has borrowed ideas from the private sector; good companies have borrowed ideas from management pacemakers, such as Motorola, Toyota, and McDonald's. And in most cases they have improved the institutions concerned.

第二点，管理理论并非完全没有知识含量。 最优秀的理论家研究的是影响我们生活的重大课题，从全球化到如何节约智力资本。 事实上，如果“正常”的人更好地掌握管理理论，政治争论和大众辩论可能会得到改善。

The second point is that management theory is not entirely devoid of intellectual content. The best theorists tackle big subjects that touch all our lives, from globalization to how to husband intellectual capital. Indeed, political argument and popular debate might be improved if "normal" people had a better grasp of management theory.

第三，到目前为止，管理理论不断试验的实验室得出的结果总体上是积极的。 摩托罗拉、默克和 3M（仅以“M”开头的美国公司名称）等行业领导者都强调采取

Third, so far the results coming back from management theory's continuously experimenting laboratory are broadly positive. Industry leaders such as Motorola, Merck, and 3M (just to name American firms beginning with "M") have all made a point of taking

结论

Conclusion

严肃的管理理论：并非所有的想法都有效，但那些有效的想法，例如摩托罗拉案例中的质量，往往会给他们带来优势。 微软正表现出效仿的迹象。 在欧洲、日本和亚洲，每个国家最受尊敬的公司——无论是台湾的宏碁、日本的丰田还是英国的玛莎百货——通常都是管理理论的先驱。 对比业务大致相同的两家公司——例如美国的通用电气和西屋，或者花旗银行和大通曼哈顿——你会经常发现领先的公司——通用电气和花旗银行——是管理狂。

management theory seriously: not all the ideas work, but those that do, such as quality in Motorola's case, tend to give them an advantage. Microsoft is showing every sign of following suit. In Europe, Japan, and Asia the most admired company in each country—be it Acer in Taiwan, Toyota in Japan, or Marks and Spencer in Britain— is frequently a pioneer in management theory. Contrast two companies in broadly the same business—such as America's General Electric and Westinghouse or Citibank and Chase Manhattan—and you will often find that the company that has pulled ahead—General Electric and Citibank—is the management junkie.

国家也可能如此。 日本崛起为经济强国的原因有很多，当然，其中之一肯定是其公司研究和调整管理理念的方式。 管理理论在解释美国和德国工业的相对状况方面至少起着很小的作用。 在 20 世纪 80 年代，美国企业进行了激烈的重组，试图跟上核心竞争力和外包等最新时尚。 德国商界人士傲慢地远离这些“时尚”，认为良好的技术和工艺可以帮助他们渡过难关。 到 20 世纪 90 年代中期，德国人明显感到落伍了。 他们现在接受了他们早先拒绝的想法。

This may even be true of countries too. There are many reasons for Japan's emergence as an economic power, of course, but one of them was surely the way that its companies studied and adapted management ideas. Management theory plays at least a small role in explaining the relative states of American and German industry. During the 1980s, American business restructured furiously, trying to keep up with the latest fashions like core competencies and outsourcing. German business people stood arrogantly aloof from such "fads," believing that good technology and craftsmanship would see them through. By the mid-1990s, the Germans felt conspicuously outdated. They have now embraced the ideas they earlier rejected.

青少年焦虑

Teenage Angst

那么，为什么一门包含如此多意义的学科也包含如此多的废话呢？ 一个答案是管理理论是一门年轻的学科，其中的规范文本和定义方法仍在开发中。 正如我们在引言中解释的那样，管理理论感觉好像比经济学等学科年轻 100 年左右。 这个青少年时期可能会持续一段时间——如果只是因为巨大的经济成功和该学科的影响力在大师周围创造了一个茧。

So why does a discipline that contains so much sense contain so much nonsense as well? One answer is that management theory is a young discipline, in which the canonical texts and defining methodologies are still being developed. As we explained in the introduction, management theory feels as if it is around 100 years younger than disciplines such as economics. This teenage period is likely to go on for some time—if only because the enormous financial success and influence of the discipline have created a cocoon around the gurus.

与其为管理理论的过激行为而烦恼，也许我们应该庆幸它的青春期没有风雨飘摇。 糟糕的管理理论使人们失去了工作； 他们有破产的公司； 他们甚至可能（谁知道呢？）对英国国民健康服务和阿根廷电话系统等公共组织造成无法弥补的损害。 但是放在旁边

Rather than fretting about management theory's excesses, perhaps we should be grateful that its adolescence has not been stormier. Poor management theories have cost people their jobs; they have bankrupted companies; they may even (who really knows?) be doing irreparable damage to public organizations such as Britain's National Health Service and Argentina's telephone system. But set alongside

结论

CONCLUSION

共产主义经济学造成的混乱和苦难，管理理论的青春期遭遇似乎相对温和。

the chaos and suffering caused by communist economics, management theory's encounter with puberty seems relatively benign.

第二种解释是管理理论的听众需要即时的解决方案。 焦虑的管理者将管理文献视为解决所有担忧的灵丹妙药。 许多公司只有在走投无路时才求助于管理理论。 他们的头脑被恐慌笼罩，他们开始时抱有过高的期望，将理论付诸实践几个月，当没有结果时开始绝望，然后转向新的理论。 两年和 20 个理论之后，该企业很可能会破产。 但谁应该受到指责：未能挽救公司的理论家还是首先让公司陷入困境的经理们？

A second explanation is that management theory's audience demands instant solutions. Anxious managers grasp at management literature as a panacea for all their worries. Many firms turn to management theory only when they are desperate. Their minds clouded by panic, they start out with exaggerated expectations, put the theory into practice for a few months, start to despair when it fails to produce results, and then turn to a new theory. Two years and 20 theories later, the business may well be bankrupt. But who is to blame: the theorists who failed to save the firm or the managers who got it into trouble in the first place?

第三种解释不那么仁慈：这门学科和占星术一样，对江湖骗子具有吸引力。 成功的大师们可以创造的财富是巨大的，而且几乎没有进入壁垒。 甚至那些不是彻头彻尾的骗子的人似乎也有各种各样的问题，从不会写英语到被迫加入最新的潮流。

The third explanation is less charitable: the discipline, no less than astrology, is a magnet for charlatans. The fortunes that can be made by the successful gurus are gigantic, and there are virtually no barriers to entry. And even people who are not out-and-out frauds seem to suffer from all sorts of problems, from an inability to write English to a compulsion to jump on the latest bandwagon.

如何选择巫医

How to Choose a Witch Doctor

我们如何区分江湖骗子和其他人？ 有一些初始的经验法则需要遵循。 首先，任何你怀疑是胡说八道的事情几乎都肯定是胡说八道。 同样，要提防所有将学术荣誉印在书的封面上或完全通过类比进行论证的作者。

How can we distinguish between the charlatans and the rest? There are a few initial rules-of-thumb to follow. The first is that anything that you suspect is bunk almost certainly is. Similarly, beware of all authors who emblazon the covers of their books with their academic honors, or who argue entirely by analogy.

如果能列出一份经过认可的优秀大师名单会很好，但是，正如我们已经表明的那样，即使是最好的理论家也往往会受到打击和错过，即使是最差的理论家有时也会有话要说。 本书涵盖的大部分观点都属于更广泛的“优秀”管理理论范畴——每位管理者都应该思考的概念。 这仍然留下了管理者应该实施哪些的问题。

It would have been nice to come up with an approved list of good gurus, but, as we have shown, even the best theorists tend to be hit and miss, and even the worst ones sometimes have something to say. Most of the ideas covered in this book fall into the broader category of "good" management theory—concepts that every manager should think about. That still leaves the question of which ones a manager should implement.

老套但真实的答案是：有选择性。 没有什么比一种魔药可以治愈所有疾病的建议更巫医的了。 无论如何，重新设计你的分配系统； 但请三思而后行。 一定要赋予你的员工权力，但要想想你赋予他们的权力是什么。 AT&T 多次尝试改造其 NCR 计算机的尝试之一

The trite but truthful answer is: be selective. Nothing is more witch-doctorish than the suggestion that one magic potion will cure all ills. By all means, reengineer your distribution system; but think twice about your research-and-development arm. By all means, empower your workers, but think what you are giving them power over. One of AT&T's many attempts to turn around its NCR computer

结论

Conclusion

子公司涉及“授权”销售人员批准合同； 这仅意味着急于增加配额的销售人员开始承接 NCR 通常会拒绝的低利润业务。 永远记住，治愈方法可能比疾病本身更糟。 裁员一小部分员工的短期收益很可能会因对士气的长期影响而消失； 您出色的新“全球”产品可能会节省包装和广告费用，但可能不会吸引客户。

subsidiary involved "empowering" salespeople to approve contracts; this only meant that the salespeople, eager to add to their quota, started taking on low-margin business that NCR would normally have rejected. And always remember that the cure can be worse than the disease. The short-term gain from axing a small percentage of your workforce may well be eradicated by the long-term effect on morale; your wonderful new "global" product may save money on packaging and advertising, but it may not appeal to the customers.

在不同的药物之间做出选择并不容易，尤其是当很少有巫医产品带有任何类型的健康警告时。 正如我们已经提到的，管理理论行业特别缺乏自我批评。 正式宣布我们的既得利益，我们想指出这方面的一线希望是商业媒体。 尽管许多媒体帝国对提拔大师们的经济利益越来越大，但似乎仍有足够数量的记者保留了他们的批判能力。 《商业周刊》揭露了CSC Index 操纵市场领导者纪律的销售。 它还撰写了一些令人钦佩的严厉书评，咨询公司在其中投入了大量的信誉，尤其是凯利和古亚特的《组织转型》。 一般来说，

Choosing between the different medicines is not easy, particularly when so few of the witch doctors' products come with any kind of health warning. As we have already mentioned, the management theory industry is peculiarly devoid of self-criticism. Duly declaring our vested interest, we would like to point out that one glimmer of hope in this respect is the business press. Even though many media empires have a growing financial interest in promoting the gurus, a sufficient number of journalists seem to have kept their critical faculties. Business Week exposed CSC Index's manipulation of the sales of The Discipline of Market Leaders. It has also written some admirably tough reviews of books in which consultancies have invested a good deal of their credibility, notably Kelly and Gouillart's Transforming the Organization. In general, the reviews of management books are finally beginning to reflect the frustrations of readers.

有迹象表明，这种更为挑剔的态度正在蔓延到该行业的其他领域。 过去，管理咨询公司能够在缺乏透明度的情况下逃脱惩罚，这在几乎任何其他行业都是不可能的。 现在，客户在聘请咨询公司之前要对他们进行更深入的审讯。 他们还迫使他们分担重大重组的风险，根据绩效支付报酬。 由于现在出现在《商业周刊》等杂志上的排名，商学院对学生、校友和雇主的批评也变得更加敏感。

There are signs that this more critical attitude is spreading to other areas of the industry. Management consultancies used to be able to get away with a lack of transparency that would have been impossible in almost any other profession. Now clients are subjecting consultancies to much more probing interrogations before taking them on. They are also forcing them to share in the risks of major restructurings by paying them according to performance. Business schools have also become much more sensitive to criticisms from students, alumni, and employers, thanks to the rankings that now appear in magazines such as Business Week.

矛盾与焦虑

Contradictions and Anxieties

这种更挑剔的态度值得称道。 但有许多问题似乎正在变得更糟。 第一个，在本书中一再出现，是管理理论倾向于使当今矛盾的公司更加

This more critical attitude is commendable. But there are a number of problems that seem, if anything, to be getting worse. The first, which has come up time and again in this book, is the tendency of management theory to make today's contradictory corporation more

结论

CONCLUSION

还是矛盾的 随着全球商业步伐的加快，理论家们正在将公司拉向不同的方向，要么放弃一种灵丹妙药，要么鼓吹完全矛盾的事情。 除了试图迫使组织变得更加灵活（通过解雇人员）同时教导信任的美德是不合逻辑的之外，这种时尚冲浪对公司文化也有影响。

contradictory still. As the pace of business increases around the world, the theorists are pulling companies in different directions, either by abandoning one nostrum for its opposite or by preaching completely contradictory things. Quite apart from the illogicality of trying, say, to force an organization to be more flexible (by sacking people) while at the same time teaching the virtues of trust, such fad surfing has an effect on companies' culture.

在任何时候，来来回回对任何类型的组织都没有好处。 在任何老板再次开始重塑他（或她）的公司之前，他应该解雇下午的顾问，拔掉电话插头，锁上门，研究盖乌斯·彼得罗尼乌斯 (Gaius Petro-nius) 对罗马帝国快速变化时期的描述：

To be thrown to and fro has never been good for organizations of any sort at any time. Before any boss starts reinventing his (or her) company one more time, he should dismiss the consultants for the afternoon, unplug his telephone, lock the door, and study Gaius Petro-nius's description of a period of rapid change in the Roman Empire:

我们努力训练以迎接挑战，但似乎每次我们开始组建团队时，我们都会重新组织起来。 我在后来的生活中了解到，我们倾向于通过重组来应对任何新情况； 它可以是一种很好的方法，可以在制造混乱、低效和士气低落的同时创造进步的幻觉。 1个

We trained hard to meet our challenges but it seemed as if every time we were beginning to form into teams we would be re-organized. I was to learn later in life that we tend to meet any new situation by reorganizing; and a wonderful method it can be for creating the illusion of progress while producing confusion, ineffectiveness and demoralization. 1

第二个日益严重的问题是管理理论对语言的不敏感。 很难想象一个主题中草率的写作如此普遍。 一般的管理书籍读起来就像是从德语翻译过来的，名词用作动词，句子曲折地来来往往。 像“再造”这样的词有一种伪科学的味道，意思是说公司是机器，可以由聪明的技术官僚重新调整。 管理理论的特殊文盲很重要。 世界各地的机构越来越多地由在商学院接受过培训的人管理。 正如罗莎贝丝·莫斯·兰特 (Rosabeth Moss Ranter) 所称的新精英，“全球世界主义者”的语言是管理学。 在历史的终结（1992）中，弗朗西斯·福山指出，所有关于政治和经济的大争论都被民主和自由市场赢得了胜利。 这可能有点夸张； 但是越来越多的争论都是关于某种管理的。 如果进行这些辩论的语言发生变形，那可不是一件小事。 一个想法沟通不畅，或者以只有选民能理解的方式传达，往往是经过深思熟虑的，或者急于隐藏它的实际含义。

The second growing problem is management theory's insensitiv-ity to language. It is hard to think of a subject in which sloppy writing is so prevalent. The average management book reads as if it had been translated from German, with nouns used as verbs and sentences that meander this way and that. Words like "reengineering" have a pseudoscientific air, meant to suggest that companies are machines, which can be retuned by clever technocrats. The peculiar illiteracy of management theory matters. Increasingly, institutions around the world are being run by people who have been trained in business schools. And the language of the "global cosmopolitans," as Rosabeth Moss Ranter dubs the new elite, is managementese. In The End of History (1992) Francis Fukuyama pointed out that all the big arguments about politics and economics have been won by democracy and free markets. That may be something of an exaggeration; but a growing number of arguments are all about management of one sort or another. It is no small thing if the language in which these debates are conducted is deformed. An idea communicated poorly, or in ways only the elect can understand, is more often than not poorly thought out, or eager to hide what it is actually about.

结论

Conclusion

第三个问题是管理理论对其思想的更广泛影响不敏感。 早在 1940 年代，彼得·德鲁克 (Peter Drucker) 在通用汽车公司的开创性工作就将该公司视为一个社会组织。 如今只有少数思想家看到了大局。 查尔斯·汉迪 (Charles Handy) 越来越关注公司是政治共同体的观点，而看待它们的最佳方式是通过政治理论的棱镜。 社会学家出身的罗莎贝丝·莫斯·坎特 (Rosabeth Moss Kanter) 对公司的社会动态有着敏锐的洞察力。 工程师出身的 Jay Forrester 也是如此。 但大多数专家对企业是社会和政治共同体这一事实不敏感，它们具有独特的习俗、权力斗争和社会动态。

The third problem is management theory's insensitivity to the wider effects of its ideas. Back in the 1940s, Peter Drucker's pioneering work on General Motors treated the company as a social organization. Nowadays only a few thinkers see the big picture. Charles Handy is increasingly preoccupied with the idea that companies are political communities, and that the best way to look at them is through the prism of political theory. Rosabeth Moss Kanter, a sociologist by training, has an acute eye for the social dynamics of companies. So, too, does Jay Forrester, an engineer by training. But most gurus are insensitive to the fact that businesses are social and political communities, with their distinctive mores, power struggles, and social dynamics.

快速浏览一下这个更广泛的社会背景，就会发现许多令人不快的教训。 三十年前，大多数美国人——尤其是管理阶层——预计未来会带来更多的闲暇和确定性。 总的来说，管理理论迫使公司和公共部门机构变得越来越精简。 数百万人被裁员； 数百万人更加努力地工作。 这些可能是不可避免的事情，但它们通常以一种含糊不清的方式呈现，以至于很少有任何类型的工人理解正在发生的事情。 毫不奇怪，随着矛盾的公司将自己拉向相反的方向，越来越少的美国人信任他们的雇主或政客。 像所有最好的巫医一样，管理大师们预测了一个只有他们才明白的混乱和不确定的未来，

A quick look at this wider social context brings home a number of unpleasant lessons. Thirty years ago most Americans—particularly the managerial class—expected the future to bring increased leisure and certainty. On the whole, management theory has forced companies and public sector institutions to become ever leaner. Millions have been downsized out of jobs; millions more work harder. These may be unavoidable things, but they often have been presented in such an inarticulate way that few workers of any description understand what is going on. It is hardly surprising that as the contradictory corporation pulls itself in opposing directions, fewer and fewer Americans trust either their employers or their politicians. Like all the best witch doctors, management gurus have predicted a future of chaos and uncertainty that only they understand, and that their own work has only made more likely.

这并不是说我们加入了支持股权的流行呼声。 股东资本主义使公司有可能做出艰难但必要的调整，而这些调整是其股东兄弟捏造的； 对一家公司进行裁员、裁员和再造，总比让它死于肥胖要好。 但管理者应该记住，公司的存在依赖于所在社区的容忍。 裁员可能是必要的——但在解雇数千名工人的同时提高董事长的薪水是危险的。 再造可能是必不可少的——但同样重要的是要认识到，无论公司的引擎多么强大，除非得到公司员工热情的推动，否则它不会运转。

This is not to say that we are joining the popular clamor in favor of stakeholding. Shareholder capitalism makes it possible for companies to make difficult but necessary adjustments that its stakeholder brother fudges; downsizing, delayering, and reengineering a company is better than allowing it to die of obesity. But managers should remember that firms exist on the sufferance of their host communities. Downsizing may be necessary—but it is dangerous to raise the chairman's salary at the same time as you are laying off thousands of workers. Reengineering may be essential—but it is essential, too, to realize that, however powerful, the company's engine will not work unless it is fueled by the enthusiasm of the company's employees. The alternative is a popular backlash against big business (of the sort Pat Buchanan has tried to unleash in the United States)

结论

CONCLUSION

这可能导致管理层的管理自由受到严厉限制。 一个好的管理理论家也是一个政治理论家。

that could lead to draconian restrictions on management's freedom to manage. A good management theorist is something of a political theorist too.

涨涨客场

Up, Up, and Away

无论该学科存在什么问题，毫无疑问它会越来越强大。 看看咨询公司的收入、管理书籍的销量，或者商学院的录取——所有的趋势都在上升。 西方的大多数管理者已经意识到，在一个新产品可以被即时复制、工资很容易被削减的世界里，唯一持久的优势来源是卓越的管理。 这种认识也在向东方传播。 香港和新加坡等地的商业帝国创始人或许可以依靠人脉和政治影响力来建立自己的帝国。 但他们的继任者需要更正式的管理技能，以防止这些帝国分崩离析或停滞不前。

Whatever the discipline's problems, there is no doubt that it will go from strength to strength. Look at the income of the consultancies, the sales of management books, or the intake of business schools—all the trends are up. Most managers in the West have realized that, in a world in which new products can be copied instantaneously and wages can easily be undercut, the only lasting source of advantage is superior management. This realization is spreading to the East too. The founders of business empires in places like Hong Kong and Singapore might have been able to rely on personal connections and political influence to build their empires. But their successors need more formal management skills to prevent those empires from falling apart or stagnating.

但还有一个更重要的原因，为什么巫医会享受到对他们服务的不断扩大的需求。 即使管理者确实学会了如何在混乱中茁壮成长或控制自己的命运，他们仍将面临所有问题中最棘手的问题：人性的顽固。 经理们不断采用有望控制其工作核心不确定性的技术，并且当他们的下属拒绝按要求行事时，他们不得不不断采用新技术。 在审视管理者的命运和他们对神奇疗法的可怜偏爱时，我们想起了大卫·休谟的洞察力：“随着任何人的生命历程受到偶然性的支配，我们总是发现他越来越迷信。”

But there is an even more important reason why the witch doctors will enjoy an ever-expanding demand for their services. Even if managers do learn how to thrive on chaos or control their destiny, they will still be confronted by that most intractable of all problems: the cussedness of human nature. Managers are constantly embracing techniques that promise to control the uncertainty at the heart of their jobs—and constantly having to embrace new techniques when their charges refuse to do as they are bid. In looking at the fate of managers and their pitiful predilection for magic cures, we are reminded of David Hume's insight: "In proportion as any man's course of life is governed by accident, we always find that he increases in superstition."

笔记

Notes

第二章：管理理论产业

Chapter 2: The Management Theory Industry

1 来自 Management Consultant International 的数据，引自《金融时报》（伦敦）管理咨询调查，1995 年 9 月 12 日。

1 Figures from Management Consultant International, quoted in Financial Times (London) survey of management consulting, 12 September 1995.

2 John Kotter，新规则：如何在后企业世界取得成功（纽约，1995 年）。

2 John Kotter, The New Rules: How to Succeed in the Post Corporate World (New York, 1995).

3 Ronald Yeaple，MBA 优势：Whg It Rags to Get an MBA（波士顿，1994 年）。 折扣数据来自“The MBA Cost-Benefit Analysis”，经济学家，1994 年 8 月 6 日。

3 Ronald Yeaple, The MBA Advantage: Whg It Rags to Get an MBA (Boston, 1994). The discounted figures are from "The MBA Cost-Benefit Analysis," Economist, 6 August 1994.

第 9 章：工作的未来

Zedong, Mao, 14, 137 Zeneca, 99 Zenith, 154 Zuboff, Shoshana, 123 Zurich, 216

369

369

（接前翻盖）

(continued from front flap)

管理行业。 作者介绍了彼得德鲁克和汤姆彼得斯，帮助您确定自由大师可以教给您什么以及他们不能教给您什么。 他们继续深入研究当今管理者和员工面临的每一个主要难题对社会和企业的影响。 通过对知识、学习和创新、战略和愿景、工作场所的未来、股东与利益相关者资本主义、全球化和日本管理的公正且经常是反向的调查，Micklethwait 和 Wooldridge 告诉您什么有效，什么失败，以及未来可能适用于行动者和等待者。 两个开创性的章节审视了管理理论在公共部门取得的进展，以及亚洲管理者在世界经济中开辟的意想不到的道路。

management industry. The authors profile Peter Drucker and Tom Peters, helping you decide what the liber-gurus can teach you and what they can't. They proceed to look deeply into the social and corporate implications of every major conundrum managers and workers face today. Through unbiased, often contrarian investigations of knowledge, learning, and innovation, strategy and vision, the future of the workplace, shareholder versus stakeholder capitalism, globalization, and Japanese management, Micklethwait and Wooldridge tell you what works, what fails, and what the future may hold for those who act and those who wait. Two groundbreaking chapters examine the inroads management theory is making in the public sector, and the unexpected paths Asian managers are blazing through the world economy.

John Micklethwait（左）是《经济学人》的商业编辑，也是洛杉矶西海岸分社社长。 他曾获得金融新闻领域的温科特奖。 他出现在 NPR 和 BBC 上，并为洛杉矶时报和波士顿环球报撰稿。

John Micklethwait (left) is the business editor of The Economist and was its West Coast bureau chief in Los Angeles. He has won a Wincott Award for financial journalism. He has appeared on NPR and the BBC, and has written for the Los Angeles Times and The Boston Globe.

Adrian Wooldridge（右）是《经济学人》的管理通讯员，他是前一本书的作者，曾为《华尔街日报》《新共和国》和《伦敦时报》撰稿。 他出现在 NPR 和 BBC 上。

Adrian Wooldridge (right), The Economist's management correspondent, is the author of one previous book, and has written for The Wall Street Journal The New Republic, and the Times of London. He has appeared on NPR and the BBC.
